original: @1b # // bcom ldan 'das kyis /üîΩji ltar byis pas rnam brtags ltar //
analyzed: @1b # // bcom ldan 'das kyis / ji ltar byis pas rnam brtags ltar //
translated: The Bhagavat has said:

original: phyi rol don ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: phyi rol don ni yod ma yin //
translated: External objects do not existüîΩAs the child perceives them.

original: bag chags kyis ni dkrugs pa'i sems //üîΩdon du snang ba rab tu dbye //
analyzed: bag chags kyis ni dkrugs pa'i sems // don du snang ba rab tu dbye //
translated: The mind disturbed by the latent impressions

original: zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: zhes gsungs so ;
translated: Appears as an object.

original: / de la rnam par brtags pa'i rang bzhin mtha' dag gis bden pa rang nyid yongs su gsal ba yin yang /
analyzed: / de la rnam par brtags pa'i rang bzhin mtha' dag gis bden pa rang nyid yongs su gsal ba yin yang /
translated: Although the nature of reality is completely evident to those who have investigated it,

original: kha cig gis sngon po la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi don yon tan dang bya ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can bems po rnam pa med pa'i shes pas gzung bar bya ba nyid dang / bdag dang bde ba la sogs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: kha cig gis sngon po la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi don yon tan dang bya ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can bems po rnam pa med pa'i shes pas gzung bar bya ba nyid dang / bdag dang bde ba la sogs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: some think that blue and so forth are external objects, which have the nature of qualities, actions, and so forth, are insentient, and are apprehended by a cognition that is devoid of aspects, and that they are not the self, pleasure, and so forth.

original: gzhan ni sngon po la sogs pa nyid bems po rdul phra rab 'dus pa tsam yin la /
analyzed: gzhan ni sngon po la sogs pa nyid bems po rdul phra rab 'dus pa tsam yin la /
translated: Others say that blue and so forth are simply insentient aggregations of subtle particles,

original: bde ba la sogs pa ni rig pa nyid do zhes so //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni rig pa nyid do zhes so //
translated: while pleasure and so forth are awareness itself.

original: gzhan dag na ni sngon po shes pa yang blo nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan dag na ni sngon po shes pa yang blo nyid de /
translated: Others say that the cognition of blue is itself the mind,

original: de'i rnam pa can gyi blos rig par bya ba'i phyi rol du /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can gyi blos rig par bya ba'i phyi rol du /
translated: The external object, which is the object of the cognition having that form,

original: gzhan nyid de rtag tu lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhes so //
analyzed: gzhan nyid de rtag tu lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhes so //
translated: is always hidden, and is different from the cognition.

original: de la phyi rol gzhan ni ma yin gyi /üîΩ'on kyang sngon po la sogs pa de nyid gcig tu phyi rol ma yin la /
analyzed: de la phyi rol gzhan ni ma yin gyi / 'on kyang sngon po la sogs pa de nyid gcig tu phyi rol ma yin la /
translated: The external object is not different from the cognition,üîΩbut that blue, etc., is not external in one part and internal in another part.üîΩThe external object is neither external nor internal.

original: gcig tu nang kho na yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i gos can no //
analyzed: gcig tu nang kho na yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i gos can no //
translated: This is the opinion of the ƒÄkƒÅ√ßƒÅmbara.

original: shes pa nyid yin te @2a # //üîΩrtag pa khyab pa gcig pu dang / ma rig pa'i nus pa dang 'brel ba las mi bden pa'i rnam pa'i tshogs kyis zin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rig byed pa'i'o //
analyzed: shes pa nyid yin te @2a # // rtag pa khyab pa gcig pu dang / ma rig pa'i nus pa dang 'brel ba las mi bden pa'i rnam pa'i tshogs kyis zin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rig byed pa'i'o //
translated: The cognition itself is the object,üîΩbecause it is related to the potency of ignorance, and is grasped by the collection of unreal forms. This is the opinion of the Vij√±ƒÅnavƒÅdin.

original: 'di 'dra ba nyid mi rtag pa dang ma khyab pa dang / du ma gsal ba tsam gyi rang bzhin du yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam pa med par smra ba'i'o //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba nyid mi rtag pa dang ma khyab pa dang / du ma gsal ba tsam gyi rang bzhin du yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam pa med par smra ba'i'o //
translated: The object is just the manifestation of impermanence, non-pervasiveness, and multiplicity. This is the opinion of the NirƒÅkƒÅravƒÅdin.

original: sna tshogs gsal ba las ma gtogs pa gang la dngos por mngon par zhen pa 'am rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du dpyad par bya ba gsal ba tsam zhes bya ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs gsal ba las ma gtogs pa gang la dngos por mngon par zhen pa 'am rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du dpyad par bya ba gsal ba tsam zhes bya ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Apart from the manifestation of the variety, there is nothing else that can be investigated as to its nature, whether it be as an entity or as permanent or impermanent, etc.

original: sna tshogs kyang mi bden pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyang mi bden pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The fact that the variety is also unreal is the special teaching of the Madhyamikas.

original: gzhan ni phung po lnga yang kun rdzob tu yin no zhes 'di ni che long ji lta ba bzhin nye bar bkod pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni phung po lnga yang kun rdzob tu yin no zhes 'di ni che long ji lta ba bzhin nye bar bkod pa yin te /
translated: The other aggregates are also conventional. This is the arrangement according to the gross.

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pas bsdus pas rang gi rang bzhin mi gsal bar byed pa'i log par rtog pa'i ni grangs med do //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pas bsdus pas rang gi rang bzhin mi gsal bar byed pa'i log par rtog pa'i ni grangs med do //
translated: The enumerations of misconceptions that obscure the nature of things are innumerable, since they are included in the categories of reification and repudiation.

original: de dag la ni mngon par 'dod pa'i rang gi don 'grub pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag la ni mngon par 'dod pa'i rang gi don 'grub pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: They do not exist for the accomplishment of one‚Äôs own aim, which is the desired goal.

original: des na sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa dgag pa'i don du chos tsam gyis mdor bsdus te /
analyzed: des na sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa dgag pa'i don du chos tsam gyis mdor bsdus te /
translated: Therefore, in order to refute reification and repudiation, the Lord has summarized the Dharma in the following way:

original: yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: The characteristic of existence and non-existence is stated:

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal exists.

original: de la gnyis po yod ma yin //
analyzed: de la gnyis po yod ma yin //
translated: The duality does not exist therein.

original: stong pa nyid ni de la yod //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni de la yod //
translated: Emptiness exists therein.

original: de la yang ni @2b de la yod //
analyzed: de la yang ni @2b de la yod //
translated: And also that exists therein.

original: ces bya ba dang / yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni //üîΩsems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //
analyzed: ces bya ba dang / yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni // sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //
translated: And also: The imagination of what is unreal

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Is mind and mental factors of the three realms.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis /
translated: What is unreal is the duality of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: rjes la skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i sgo nas 'di la'am 'dis yongs su rtog pa'i phyir na yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rjes la skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i sgo nas 'di la'am 'dis yongs su rtog pa'i phyir na yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa'o //
translated: It is the imagination of what is unreal because it imagines that as this or as existing in that way.

original: de nyid ni gzhan dbang gi rang bzhin du mdo las gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid ni gzhan dbang gi rang bzhin du mdo las gsungs so //
translated: That is said in the s≈´tra to be the dependent nature.

original: yod ces bya ba 'di ni de la skur ba 'debs pa bkag cing /
analyzed: yod ces bya ba 'di ni de la skur ba 'debs pa bkag cing /
translated: The word ‚Äúexists‚Äù refutes the denial of that,

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skye bar 'gyur ba'i tha snyad du bya ba'i sa bon bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skye bar 'gyur ba'i tha snyad du bya ba'i sa bon bstan pa yin no //
translated: and indicates the seed of the conventional birth of the enjoyment body.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu brtags pa'i sgras ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dus la ltos nas sna tshogs su snang ba'i shes pa nye bar mtshon pa lhur len pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu brtags pa'i sgras ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dus la ltos nas sna tshogs su snang ba'i shes pa nye bar mtshon pa lhur len pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúimagined‚Äù refers to the consciousness that appears as a variety in dependence upon the time of affliction.

original: gzhan gyi dbang du zhes bya ba'i snang ba de la snang ba ma yin pa mu stegs pa'i tshogs ma lus pa dang rang gi phyogs pa dag gis gang cung zad sgro btags pa ni kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin du brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang du zhes bya ba'i snang ba de la snang ba ma yin pa mu stegs pa'i tshogs ma lus pa dang rang gi phyogs pa dag gis gang cung zad sgro btags pa ni kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin du brjod do //
translated: The other-dependent is not the appearance in that appearance, because it is the imagined nature that is imagined by all the tƒ´rthikas and our own schools.

original: sgro btags pa'i tshogs 'di yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis kyis phal cher bsdus so //
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i tshogs 'di yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis kyis phal cher bsdus so //
translated: This collection of imaginations is mostly included in the two characteristics of grasped and grasper.

original: mdor bsdu na sgro btags pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na sgro btags pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In brief, imagination is twofold:

original: chos can las sam chos tsam las so //
analyzed: chos can las sam chos tsam las so //
translated: from the basis of characteristics or from mere characteristics.

original: de la re zhig gang gi tshe gsal ba ma yin pa rdzas su yod pa yan lag can dang bdag la tha dad par btags pa de'i tshe ni de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de la re zhig gang gi tshe gsal ba ma yin pa rdzas su yod pa yan lag can dang bdag la tha dad par btags pa de'i tshe ni de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: First, when the non-manifest substantial entity is imputed as different from the possessor of parts and the self, at that time it is the nature of the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: yang gang gi tshe snang bzhin pa nyid la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i cha gnyis su rtog pa de'i tshe yang nye bar bstan pa dngos po gtso bor gyur pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe snang bzhin pa nyid la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i cha gnyis su rtog pa de'i tshe yang nye bar bstan pa dngos po gtso bor gyur pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Again, when the manifest itself is imagined as having two parts, the apprehended object and apprehending subject, at that time, because the entity that is the principal object of reference is the manifest,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid du rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid du rig par bya'o ;
translated: it should be understood as the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: / yang gang gi tshe shes pa des gsal ba ma yin pa nyid rig pa zhes gnas pa de'i tshe na gzung bar bya ba la /
analyzed: / yang gang gi tshe shes pa des gsal ba ma yin pa nyid rig pa zhes gnas pa de'i tshe na gzung bar bya ba la /
translated: Again, when that cognition is not manifest itself, but is known as abiding, at that time, in the object to be apprehended,

original: chos can dang 'dzin par byed pa la chos su brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: chos can dang 'dzin par byed pa la chos su brtags pa yin no //
translated: the possessor of attributes is imputed as the apprehending subject.

original: yang gang gi tshe shes pa de nyid shes pa gzhan gyis rig pa yin no zhes sgro 'dogs pa de'i tshe yang /
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe shes pa de nyid shes pa gzhan gyis rig pa yin no zhes sgro 'dogs pa de'i tshe yang /
translated: Again, when that cognition itself is known by another cognition, at that time,

original: 'dzin par byed pa'i chos can dang gzung bar bya ba'i chos so zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa'i chos can dang gzung bar bya ba'i chos so zhes bya bar ro //
translated: The subject that apprehends and the object that is apprehended.

original: mtha' gcig ma yin par smra ba la yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i sgro 'dogs pa yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: mtha' gcig ma yin par smra ba la yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i sgro 'dogs pa yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Even if one does not speak in terms of one extreme or the other, there is still the reification of the apprehended object and the apprehending subject.

original: des na tshig rkang gnyis pas ni de 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: des na tshig rkang gnyis pas ni de 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the second line refutes that.

original: gnyis po ni kun brtags pa nye bar mtshon pa lhur len @3a * //
analyzed: gnyis po ni kun brtags pa nye bar mtshon pa lhur len @3a * //
translated: The two are the reification of the imagined.

original: pa'o ; / des na rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos dang gzung ba 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i bems po dang / rang gi rgyud la yod kyang nyams su myong bar bya ba ma yin pa gsal btsam la sogs pa'i tha dad ldan pa 'gag pa 'grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; / des na rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos dang gzung ba 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i bems po dang / rang gi rgyud la yod kyang nyams su myong bar bya ba ma yin pa gsal btsam la sogs pa'i tha dad ldan pa 'gag pa 'grub pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the refutation of the existence of the object that is imagined as permanent and so on, as matter that is not of the nature of the apprehended object and the apprehending subject, and as the mere manifestation that is not experienced even though it exists in one‚Äôs continuum is established by the difference of possession and nonpossession.

original: gnyis pa'i sgo nas brtags pa de thams cad kyis stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni de la yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i sgo nas brtags pa de thams cad kyis stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni de la yod pa yin no //
translated: That which is empty of all that which is imagined in terms of duality exists in it.

original: gtsor byas pa 'dis kyang chos kyi sku rnam par gnas pa'i sa bon bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gtsor byas pa 'dis kyang chos kyi sku rnam par gnas pa'i sa bon bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the main point, and it also shows the seed of the abiding reality of the Dharma body.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And so it is said:

original: mdo sde rgyan las /
analyzed: mdo sde rgyan las /
translated: In the Ornament of the Sutras:

original: sgyu ma ji ltar de bzhin du //
analyzed: sgyu ma ji ltar de bzhin du //
translated: Like an illusion, so is said

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog brjod //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog brjod //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal.

original: sgyu mas byas pa de bzhin du //
analyzed: sgyu mas byas pa de bzhin du //
translated: Like what is done by an illusion,

original: de bzhin gnyis ni 'khrul bar brjod //
analyzed: de bzhin gnyis ni 'khrul bar brjod //
translated: So is the error of the duality.

original: ji ltar de la de med pa //
analyzed: ji ltar de la de med pa //
translated: And just as it does not exist there,

original: de bzhin don dam yin par 'dod //
analyzed: de bzhin don dam yin par 'dod //
translated: So is the ultimate reality accepted.

original: ji ltar de dag dmigs pa bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar de dag dmigs pa bzhin //
translated: And just as it is perceived,

original: kun rdzob kyi ni bden pa nyid //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi ni bden pa nyid //
translated: So is the conventional reality.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par bshad pa yin no //
translated: And so on at length.

original: gnyis po stong pa de nyid mdo dag las yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: gnyis po stong pa de nyid mdo dag las yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin du bshad do //
translated: The emptiness of the duality is explained in the scriptures as the perfected nature.

original: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las /üîΩde bzhin nyid dang yang dag mtha' //
analyzed: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las / de bzhin nyid dang yang dag mtha' //
translated: In the Differentiation of the Middle and the Extremes:üîΩReality, the final object,

original: mtshan ma med dang don dam nyid //
analyzed: mtshan ma med dang don dam nyid //
translated: The absence of characteristics, the ultimate itself,

original: chos kyi dbyings dang stong nyid de //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang stong nyid de //
translated: The expanse of reality, and emptiness

original: rnam grangs nyid ni mdor bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs nyid ni mdor bsdus pa'o //
translated: Are its synonyms in brief.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gang zhig mngon sum byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi longs spyod pa las /
analyzed: gang zhig mngon sum byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi longs spyod pa las /
translated: From the enjoyment of the characteristic of direct realization,

original: mtshan ma la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa /
translated: endowed with the collection of aspects of signs, etc.,

original: rnam par byang ba'i rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i rnam par dag pa /
translated: the purity of purification,üîΩfree from unreal imagination, etc.,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa dang bral ba la sogs par bsnyad pas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur brjod pa ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa dang bral ba la sogs par bsnyad pas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur brjod pa ni /
translated: is called the ‚Äúenjoyment body.‚Äù

original: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa brjod de /
analyzed: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa brjod de /
translated: This is the statement of the perfection of one‚Äôs own goal.

original: mdo sde rgyan las /
analyzed: mdo sde rgyan las /
translated: The Ornament of the MahƒÅyƒÅna S≈´tras says:

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The enjoyment body is the characteristic of the perfection of one‚Äôs own goal.

original: de la yang ni de yod do snyam zhes bya ba ni /üîΩchos can yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa zhes bya ba'i 'bad pa 'di ni tshad mas gnod pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: de la yang ni de yod do snyam zhes bya ba ni / chos can yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa zhes bya ba'i 'bad pa 'di ni tshad mas gnod pa nyid kyis na /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand it is thought that it exists there‚ÄùüîΩis the effort to establish the subject, called ‚Äúunreal imagination.‚Äù

original: 'di ni mi bden pa yin no snyam pa'i dogs par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni mi bden pa yin no snyam pa'i dogs par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is to prevent the doubt that this is not real because it is contradicted by valid knowledge.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As said:üîΩüîΩ

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las /
translated: As it is said in the Ornament of Realization:

original: btags pa nyid kyi chos bdag med par ci nas kyang 'gyur bar bya ba'i don du /
analyzed: btags pa nyid kyi chos bdag med par ci nas kyang 'gyur bar bya ba'i don du /
translated: In order to make it certain that the imputed reality is without any self-nature,

original: 'di la bsal bya ci yang med //
analyzed: 'di la bsal bya ci yang med //
translated: There is nothing here to be removed

original: bsnan par bya ba'ang cung zad med //
analyzed: bsnan par bya ba'ang cung zad med //
translated: And not the slightest thing to be added.

original: yang dag nyid la yang dag lta //
analyzed: yang dag nyid la yang dag lta //
translated: The real is seen as real

original: yang dag mthong @3b na rnam par grol //üîΩzhes gsungs so //üîΩtheg pa chen po rgyud bla ma las kyang /
analyzed: yang dag mthong @3b na rnam par grol // zhes gsungs so // theg pa chen po rgyud bla ma las kyang /
translated: And when it is seen, one is liberated.üîΩAnd in the Uttaratantra-shastra,

original: stong pa nyid kyi don gzhan gsal nas tshigs su bcad pa 'di nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi don gzhan gsal nas tshigs su bcad pa 'di nyid gsungs so //
translated: which is part of the Mahayana, the meaning of emptiness is clearly explained, and the same verse is quoted.

original: 'dis ni rnam pa'i chas dang thams cad la mi bden pa nyid du smra ba bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam pa'i chas dang thams cad la mi bden pa nyid du smra ba bsal ba yin no //
translated: This verse shows that the Chittamatrins are wrong to say that the aspect is not real and that everything is unreal.

original: le'u'i cha 'dir yang mi bden par smra ba rnam par shes pa rnam par med par smra ba dang / rig byed kyi mtha' bar smra ba'i rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du bsgrub pas bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: le'u'i cha 'dir yang mi bden par smra ba rnam par shes pa rnam par med par smra ba dang / rig byed kyi mtha' bar smra ba'i rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du bsgrub pas bsal ba yin no //
translated: In this chapter, the Chittamatrins are refuted by the demonstration that the self-knowing consciousness is not a real entity, and the Vedantins are refuted by the demonstration that consciousness is not the self.

original: thams cad mi bden par smra ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad mi bden par smra ba ni /
translated: The Vedantins say that everything is unreal.

original: 'di ni dngos stobs 'ongs pa yin //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos stobs 'ongs pa yin //
translated: This is the power of fact.

original: zhes bya bas bslangs nas rang rig pa'i stobs la brten pa sna tshogs gnyis med kyi rgyas 'debs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bas bslangs nas rang rig pa'i stobs la brten pa sna tshogs gnyis med kyi rgyas 'debs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having been inspired by this, one will seal the non-duality of the diversity in dependence on the power of self-awareness.

original: de'i phyir gnyis kyis stong gang yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis kyis stong gang yin //
translated: Therefore, that which is empty of duality

original: de ni de'i yang mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: de ni de'i yang mtshan nyid yin //
translated: is the characteristic of that.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: By this,

original: sku nye bar mtshon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sku nye bar mtshon par 'gyur ro //
translated: the body is illustrated.

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa bsgrub pa'i gzhung gis ni gzhan gyi dbang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa bsgrub pa'i gzhung gis ni gzhan gyi dbang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The treatise that proves cognition with aspects explains the other-dependent.

original: dang po la sogs pa lhag ma thams cad kyis ni rang dang gzhan gyi phyogs pa dag gis kun du brtags pa'i dngos po'i tshogs ma lus pa rang gi ngo bo nyid yin pa sel ba yin no //
analyzed: dang po la sogs pa lhag ma thams cad kyis ni rang dang gzhan gyi phyogs pa dag gis kun du brtags pa'i dngos po'i tshogs ma lus pa rang gi ngo bo nyid yin pa sel ba yin no //
translated: All the remaining verses beginning with the first one eliminate the entire collection of imagined entities imagined by our own and other groups, which are not real in terms of their nature.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ni spyir bsal ba tsam yod par smra bas bsal ba ma yin pa'i gnyis med pa'i yang bkag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ni spyir bsal ba tsam yod par smra bas bsal ba ma yin pa'i gnyis med pa'i yang bkag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The non-duality that is not eliminated is the negation of the duality that has the characteristic of apprehended and apprehender, which is said to exist as mere elimination and exclusion.

original: mdor bsdus nas le'u'i bsdus pa'i don to /
analyzed: mdor bsdus nas le'u'i bsdus pa'i don to /
translated: In brief, this is the summary of the chapter.

original: // / gal te 'di gsung rab kyi rnam grol yin no zhes brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: // / gal te 'di gsung rab kyi rnam grol yin no zhes brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: If it is said that this is the scripture of the Victor,

original: de ji ltar na rgyal tshab kyi gsungs dang sbyar zhe na /üîΩde ni ma yin te gsung chen po las rim pa bzhin btud de brjod pa ni gsung rab nyid do ;
analyzed: de ji ltar na rgyal tshab kyi gsungs dang sbyar zhe na / de ni ma yin te gsung chen po las rim pa bzhin btud de brjod pa ni gsung rab nyid do ;
translated: how is it related to the teachings of the regent?üîΩThat is not so. The teachings of the great being are the scriptures themselves,

original: / slob dpon gzhan gyi ngag bzhin du /
analyzed: / slob dpon gzhan gyi ngag bzhin du /
translated: as they are respectfully expressed in the stages of the great being's teachings.

original: mdo sde'i gsung yang khungs tsam du ni brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mdo sde'i gsung yang khungs tsam du ni brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The teachings of the sutras cannot be expressed merely as sources,üîΩlike the words of other masters.üîΩAs the meaning is extensively presented elsewhere through the perfection system,üîΩthe overcoming of apparent contradictions with scriptures and so forth,

original: ji ltar don ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul gyis rab tu dbye ba gzhan du rgyas par gnas pa dang / lung la sogs pa dang 'gal bar snang ba spang ba dang / dbu ma dang rnam pa med pa shes pa stobs che chung ni mthar thug pa ji tsam pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar don ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul gyis rab tu dbye ba gzhan du rgyas par gnas pa dang / lung la sogs pa dang 'gal bar snang ba spang ba dang / dbu ma dang rnam pa med pa shes pa stobs che chung ni mthar thug pa ji tsam pa dang /
translated: the greater and lesser strength of understanding the middle way and the absence of features,

original: zhar la byung ba gang yin pa /
analyzed: zhar la byung ba gang yin pa /
translated: and whatever else arises incidentally,

original: de thams cad ni gsung de dang 'chad pa na gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de thams cad ni gsung de dang 'chad pa na gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: all of that will become clear when explaining those teachings.

original: skabs su bab pa thams cad ni rgyu dang 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pas tshad ma yang dag pa nyid kyi bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa thams cad ni rgyu dang 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pas tshad ma yang dag pa nyid kyi bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Blessed One is a valid cognizer because he is endowed with perfect cause and effect.

original: rab tu bsgrub par gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: rab tu bsgrub par gsal ba yin no //
translated: This is clearly established.

original: 'dis @4a * //
analyzed: 'dis @4a * //
translated: Here,

original: spros pas 'jigs pa'i phyir nang du na /
analyzed: spros pas 'jigs pa'i phyir nang du na /
translated: because of fear of verbosity,

original: le'u gnyis pa 'jug pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: le'u gnyis pa 'jug pa brjod pa ni /
translated: the second chapter, the introduction,

original: de ltar spyi'i mtshan nyid brjod nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar spyi'i mtshan nyid brjod nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: having stated the general characteristics,

original: le'u gnyis kyis brjod pa rgyu'i gnas skabs gnyi ga'i bdag nyid can yang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa dang thun mong yin pa'i phyir na spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: le'u gnyis kyis brjod pa rgyu'i gnas skabs gnyi ga'i bdag nyid can yang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa dang thun mong yin pa'i phyir na spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: the two chapters express the causal state, which is common to the bodhisattva and others, and thus is the general characteristic.

original: da ni rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i bdag nyid can 'bras bu'i gnas skabs can thos pa la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir na khyad par gyi mtshan nyid du gyur pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: da ni rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i bdag nyid can 'bras bu'i gnas skabs can thos pa la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir na khyad par gyi mtshan nyid du gyur pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Now, in order to express the distinctive characteristic, which is the resultant state, endowed with the perfection of one's own and others' goals, and uncommon to learning and so on, it is said that it should be expressed.

original: gang / tshad ma slu ba med can gyi //
analyzed: gang / tshad ma slu ba med can gyi //
translated: What is it? It is the means of valid knowledge that is undeceiving.

original: zhes bya ba ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin la ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin la ;
translated: This is the general definition.

original: mngon sum rtogs dang bral ba can //
analyzed: mngon sum rtogs dang bral ba can //
translated: Direct perception is that which is free from conceptualization.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khyad par gyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba des kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'bras bu'i gnas skabs mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khyad par gyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba des kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'bras bu'i gnas skabs mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This and the rest are the specific definitions. Thus, the Blessed One has taught that the state of fruition is endowed with characteristics.

original: 'o na chos bdag med pa de ji ltar rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: 'o na chos bdag med pa de ji ltar rtogs par bya ste /
translated: But how is that selflessness of phenomena to be realized?

original: gzhal bya rtogs pa ni tshad ma la rag las pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhal bya rtogs pa ni tshad ma la rag las pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that the realization of the object of valid knowledge depends on the means of valid knowledge.

original: gzhal bya rtogs pa yang sgrub pa dang dgag pas rnam pa gnyis yin yang rjes su dpag pas dmigs par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhal bya rtogs pa yang sgrub pa dang dgag pas rnam pa gnyis yin yang rjes su dpag pas dmigs par byas pa yin no //
translated: And the realization of the object of valid knowledge is twofold: affirmation and negation. But it is done by inference.

original: mngon sum gyi dmigs pa yang mtshan nyid dang spyod yul dang 'bras bu dpyad pas mngon sum gyis le'u bsgrub par bya ba yin no//
analyzed: mngon sum gyi dmigs pa yang mtshan nyid dang spyod yul dang 'bras bu dpyad pas mngon sum gyis le'u bsgrub par bya ba yin no//
translated: And the object of direct perception is also established by direct perception through the analysis of its characteristics, domain, and result.

original: de la gal te tshad ma gzhan gyi dmigs par 'gyur na nyes pa ci 'dra ba zhig yod snyam na /
analyzed: de la gal te tshad ma gzhan gyi dmigs par 'gyur na nyes pa ci 'dra ba zhig yod snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúWhat is the fault if it is the object of another valid cognition?‚ÄùüîΩIn order to enter into the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å ava Ô¨Årst one should understand the

original: dang por rnam 'grel la 'jug pa'i don du zhe la gnas pa'i skabs 'byed pa ni /
analyzed: dang por rnam 'grel la 'jug pa'i don du zhe la gnas pa'i skabs 'byed pa ni /
translated: context:üîΩPerception and inference

original: mngon sum dang ni rjes dpag dag / tshad ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang ni rjes dpag dag / tshad ma zhes bya ba'o //
translated: are the two valid cognitions.üîΩThe Bhagavan has stated that perception and inference are the only two

original: rgyu ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i gnas skabs nyid brjod de /
analyzed: rgyu ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i gnas skabs nyid brjod de /
translated: valid cognitions because they are the causes of the attainment of the twoüîΩgoals of human life.

original: gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa'i tshad ma'i gnas skabs su ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa'i tshad ma'i gnas skabs su ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: He did not say that there are other valid cognitions.

original: dang por rnam 'grel la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dang por rnam 'grel la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to enter into the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å ava,üîΩPerception and inference

original: mngon sum dang ni rjes su dpag / ces gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon sum dang ni rjes su dpag / ces gsungs so //
translated: are the two valid cognitions.üîΩThe word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is stated in order to show that there are only two valid

original: dag ces bya ba ni rnam gnyis kho na tshad ma yin zhes bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: dag ces bya ba ni rnam gnyis kho na tshad ma yin zhes bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: cognitions.

original: de lta ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin pa ni /
translated: Otherwise,üîΩthere would be the possibility of the error of thinking that there are other

original: mngon sum dang ni rjes dpag dag / tshad ma zhes mi ldan pa'i rnam par yang dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum dang ni rjes dpag dag / tshad ma zhes mi ldan pa'i rnam par yang dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: valid cognitions, such as perception and inference.

original: rnam pa gnyis su nges par gzung pa yang /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su nges par gzung pa yang /
translated: The restriction to two types is for the purpose of preventing the number from being increased,

original: brda sprod pa bzhin du mngon sum dang lung gnyis kho nas grangs nges par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i don du /
analyzed: brda sprod pa bzhin du mngon sum dang lung gnyis kho nas grangs nges par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i don du /
translated: just as in grammar, by the two, perception and verbal testimony.

original: mngon sum dang ni rjes su dpag gsungs @4b so ;
analyzed: mngon sum dang ni rjes su dpag gsungs @4b so ;
translated: He says, ‚ÄúPerception and inference are the two types of valid cognition.‚Äù

original: / gal te ji ltar de gnyis kho na tshad ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: / gal te ji ltar de gnyis kho na tshad ma yin snyam na /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúWhy are only those two valid cognitions?‚Äù

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid dran par byed pa ni tshad ma de yang mi slu ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid dran par byed pa ni tshad ma de yang mi slu ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause they are non-deceptive with regard to the general characteristic of the object.‚Äù

original: mi slu ba ni don la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi slu ba ni don la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-deceptive means not mistaken with regard to the object.

original: don la mi 'khrul pa yang don la skyes pas so zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩ'dis ni 'di gnyis kho na de las skyes pa'i phyir tshad ma'i tha snyad du bya ba yin gyi gzhan du ma yin te /
analyzed: don la mi 'khrul pa yang don la skyes pas so zhes bya ba'i don to // 'dis ni 'di gnyis kho na de las skyes pa'i phyir tshad ma'i tha snyad du bya ba yin gyi gzhan du ma yin te /
translated: Not mistaken with regard to the object means arising with regard to the object.

original: de med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This means that only these two are conventionally called valid cognitions because they arise from that, but not others, because they do not exist.

original: 'di la phyir bzlog pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la phyir bzlog pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is, ‚ÄúIf you say that . . . ‚Äù

original: mngon sum dang zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDirect perception‚Äù is the philosophical theory.

original: 'di nyid 'grel pa ni mngon sum yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'grel pa ni mngon sum yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The commentary explains this: because of being direct perception.

original: gal te mi 'khrul pa nyid spong ba la tshad ma yin par lan 'debs pa ji ltar yin snyam na /
analyzed: gal te mi 'khrul pa nyid spong ba la tshad ma yin par lan 'debs pa ji ltar yin snyam na /
translated: If you reply that non-deception is the definition of valid cognition, how is that?

original: don de kho nar ni 'di gnyis gcig yin pa'i phyir na 'di ni phan tshun nye bar mtshon pa lhur byed pa yin no //
analyzed: don de kho nar ni 'di gnyis gcig yin pa'i phyir na 'di ni phan tshun nye bar mtshon pa lhur byed pa yin no //
translated: Since these two are the same in meaning, this is a mutual definition.

original: de ltar na yang gtan tshigs 'di dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang gtan tshigs 'di dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin te /
translated: Even so, this reason is one part of the meaning of the thesis.

original: mngon sum dang ni rjes su dpag pa dag ni tshad ma yin te mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum dang ni rjes su dpag pa dag ni tshad ma yin te mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Direct perception and inference are valid cognitions because they are direct perception and inference.

original: sgra las byung ba dang nye bar 'jal ba la sogs pa ni tshad ma ma yin te /üîΩsgra las byung ba la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar ro zhe na /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba dang nye bar 'jal ba la sogs pa ni tshad ma ma yin te / sgra las byung ba la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar ro zhe na /
translated: Testimony, analogy, and so on are not valid cognitions because they are testimony and so on.

original: de lta ma yin te tha snyad sgrub par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te tha snyad sgrub par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because we assert that they establish conventions.

original: 'di ltar mngon sum la ni dngos su don gyi rang bzhin snang ba'i phyir dang / med na mi 'byung ba'i rtags kyi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i rjes su dpag pa la ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum la ni dngos su don gyi rang bzhin snang ba'i phyir dang / med na mi 'byung ba'i rtags kyi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i rjes su dpag pa la ni /
translated: Thus, perception is non-deceptive because it is generated by the power of a reason that is a necessary condition for the appearance of the nature of the object,

original: mi snang bar don dang 'brel ba'i phyir mi slu ba bsgrub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mi snang bar don dang 'brel ba'i phyir mi slu ba bsgrub pa yin gyi /
translated: and because it is related to the object without the appearance of the object.

original: sgra las byung ba la sogs pa rnams ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba la sogs pa rnams ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: But that is not the case with verbal testimony and the rest.

original: 'di la gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi ;
analyzed: 'di la gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi ;
translated: Here, if it is asked, etc. is the opponent's position.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: Thus, etc. is the conclusion.

original: gzhal bya yod na 'khrul pa med pas bsam par bya ba yang yin te /
analyzed: gzhal bya yod na 'khrul pa med pas bsam par bya ba yang yin te /
translated: If the object of comprehension exists, it is non-deceptive, and so it is conceivable.

original: ri bong gi rva la ni gzhal bya la mi 'khrul pa bsam pa'i skabs yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la ni gzhal bya la mi 'khrul pa bsam pa'i skabs yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But in the case of the horn of a rabbit, the object of comprehension is not conceivable, because it is non-existent.

original: gang bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi slob dpon gyis so //
analyzed: gang bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi slob dpon gyis so //
translated: This is what has been explained is by the former masters.

original: 'o na ni gzhal bya gnyis po gnyis la /
analyzed: 'o na ni gzhal bya gnyis po gnyis la /
translated: But if the object of comprehension is twofold,

original: res 'ga' ni mngon sum ma ma rjes su dpag pa'am /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni mngon sum ma ma rjes su dpag pa'am /
translated: Sometimes it is inference that is the mother and direct perception the child.üîΩüîΩ

original: res 'ga' ni de skye ba'i tshogs pa dang bral ba na tshad ma gzhan du 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam na /üîΩrang gi mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni de skye ba'i tshogs pa dang bral ba na tshad ma gzhan du 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam na / rang gi mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Sometimes, it is inference that is the means of valid knowledge, and sometimes, it is another means of valid knowledge that is the means of valid knowledge when the collection that produces it is absent.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: mngon sum gyi don ni re zhig rang nyid shes pa @5a * //üîΩla gsal bzhin ba la brjod do //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi don ni re zhig rang nyid shes pa @5a * // la gsal bzhin ba la brjod do //
translated: The meaning of direct perception is that the object is clear to consciousness itself.

original: gang la de ltar gsal ba de nyid ni mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: gang la de ltar gsal ba de nyid ni mngon sum yin no //
translated: That which is clear in that way is direct perception.

original: rang gi ngo bos mi gsal ba ni gal te med na ni mi 'byung ba'i sgo nas kyang mi rtog na ni mi rtog pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos mi gsal ba ni gal te med na ni mi 'byung ba'i sgo nas kyang mi rtog na ni mi rtog pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that which is not clear by way of its own entity is not ascertained by way of the fact that it does not occur if the other is absent, then it is not ascertained at all.

original: med na mi 'byung ba ma yin pa las kyang rtog na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba ma yin pa las kyang rtog na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is ascertained even though it is not ascertained by way of the fact that it does not occur if the other is absent, then there is the fault of overextension.

original: des na med na mi 'byung ba'i don mthong ba las med na mi 'byung ba nyid rtogs pas 'ga' zhig tu lkog tu gyur pa 'ga' zhig rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: des na med na mi 'byung ba'i don mthong ba las med na mi 'byung ba nyid rtogs pas 'ga' zhig tu lkog tu gyur pa 'ga' zhig rtogs pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, since the fact that it does not occur if the other is absent is understood from seeing the object that does not occur if the other is absent, sometimes a hidden object is understood from that.

original: de nyid ni rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: That is inference.

original: des na gal te mngon sum dang rjes su dpag par bya ba las don gzhan yod par bsnyon par bya ba ma yin par lta yang tshad ma'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: des na gal te mngon sum dang rjes su dpag par bya ba las don gzhan yod par bsnyon par bya ba ma yin par lta yang tshad ma'i yul ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, if it is not denied that something else exists apart from the object of direct perception and inference, then it is not the object of a means of valid knowledge.

original: des na de 'dra ba nyid ni the tshom za ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de 'dra ba nyid ni the tshom za ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not doubted that it is like that.

original: des na gzhal bya med ces brjod kyi /
analyzed: des na gzhal bya med ces brjod kyi /
translated: Therefore, we say that the object of knowledge does not exist,

original: don gzhan med do zhes ni mi brjod do //
analyzed: don gzhan med do zhes ni mi brjod do //
translated: but we do not say that something else does not exist.

original: de la yang ji srid ma shes pa de srid du ni the tshom kho na'o //
analyzed: de la yang ji srid ma shes pa de srid du ni the tshom kho na'o //
translated: And as long as it is not known, it is only doubted.

original: 'di yang mdun du rgyas par 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yang mdun du rgyas par 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained extensively later.

original: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni kho bo cag gis mdor bsdus te bshad pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni kho bo cag gis mdor bsdus te bshad pa nyid do //
translated: This very means of knowledge is what we have explained in brief.

original: rig par byed pa'i tshad ma gnyis te yul gzhal bya gnyis phyir ro //
analyzed: rig par byed pa'i tshad ma gnyis te yul gzhal bya gnyis phyir ro //
translated: There are two means of knowledge that bring about understanding, because there are two objects of knowledge.

original: ci ltar gnyis yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar gnyis yin zhe na /
translated: How are there two?

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don byed par dngos su nus pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don byed par dngos su nus pa ste /
translated: The object that is characterized by consciousness is directly able to perform a function.

original: gsal bar snang ba gang yin pa dang / gzhan brgyud pas nus pa nyid ni mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba gang yin pa dang / gzhan brgyud pas nus pa nyid ni mi nus pa ste /
translated: That which appears clearly and that which is not capable of being otherwise through the influence of something else,

original: dper na rjes su dpag pa la ltos nas yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rjes su dpag pa la ltos nas yin pa bzhin no //
translated: like, for example, the object of inference.

original: 'di nyid ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid do zhes rim gyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid do zhes rim gyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the specific and the general characteristic, respectively, as will be explained later.

original: 'dis ni phung po gzhan med par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni phung po gzhan med par bstan to //
translated: This shows that there is no other aggregate of valid cognitions.

original: des na tshad ma gzhan gyi ni skabs yod pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na tshad ma gzhan gyi ni skabs yod pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no occasion for another valid cognition, he thinks.

original: gal te gsal bar snang ba rang gi mtshan nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te gsal bar snang ba rang gi mtshan nyid yin na /
translated: If that which appears clearly is the specific characteristic,

original: rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro snyam na bshad pa /
analyzed: rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro snyam na bshad pa /
translated: then it follows that the hair and so on perceived by one with an eye disease would be specific characteristics.

original: skra shad la sogs don med do //
analyzed: skra shad la sogs don med do //
translated: The hair and so on are not real objects.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin te //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin te //
translated: They are not specific characteristics.

original: tha snyad du ni byed pa rnams don du mos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad du ni byed pa rnams don du mos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, conventionally, they are not accepted as objects.

original: mngon sum dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDirect perception‚Äù and so on is the commentary.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i khyad par med pa ni'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i khyad par med pa ni'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means that there would be no difference between direct perception and inference.

original: ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúWould be taught‚Äù is in the line

original: de ni rang gzhan ngo bo yis //
analyzed: de ni rang gzhan ngo bo yis //
translated: ‚ÄúBy itself or by another.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'i nang du'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i nang du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherein‚Äù refers to the lineüîΩ‚ÄúBy itself or by another.‚Äù

original: de la 'di snyam du gzhal bya gnyis phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du gzhal bya gnyis phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni /
translated: If you think that the reason ‚Äúbecause there are two objects of comprehension‚Äù

original: gzhi dang 'brel par ma grub @5b pa yin te /üîΩbsgrub par bya ba ni tshad ma gnyis su bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gzhi dang 'brel par ma grub @5b pa yin te / bsgrub par bya ba ni tshad ma gnyis su bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
translated: is not established as related to the subject,üîΩthen the object of comprehension is established by the two valid cognitions,

original: de las gzhan gzhal bya gnyis ni gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
analyzed: de las gzhan gzhal bya gnyis ni gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
translated: and the other two objects of comprehension are the reason.

original: bshad pa mngon sum nyid rjes su dpag par bya ba'i rnam pa las gzhan pa'i rtog pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa mngon sum nyid rjes su dpag par bya ba'i rnam pa las gzhan pa'i rtog pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The explanation is that apart from the aspect of the object of comprehension by inference, there is no conception that is direct perception.

original: rgyu de'i phyir na gzhal bya gnyis po de las gzhan pa'i tshad mar mngon par 'dod pa mchog tu gyur pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir na gzhal bya gnyis po de las gzhan pa'i tshad mar mngon par 'dod pa mchog tu gyur pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: For that reason, there is no other valid cognition that is accepted as supreme apart from those two objects of valid cognition.

original: tshad ma la ston pa gzhan med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshad ma la ston pa gzhan med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that there is no other teacher of valid cognition.

original: de nyid rnam par 'grel ba ni mngon sum dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par 'grel ba ni mngon sum dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: He explains just that, beginning with ‚Äúdirect perception,‚Äù and so on.

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The thought is this:

original: gzhal bya la gnas pa'i chos nyid bzung nas gtan tshigs su len pa ma yin gyi /üîΩ'on kyang mngon sum gyi rnam pa'am /
analyzed: gzhal bya la gnas pa'i chos nyid bzung nas gtan tshigs su len pa ma yin gyi / 'on kyang mngon sum gyi rnam pa'am /
translated: One does not apprehend the reality that resides in the object of valid cognition and take it as the reason.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i rnam par rtog par 'jug pa shes pa la gnas par chos gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i rnam par rtog par 'jug pa shes pa la gnas par chos gang yin pa'o //
translated: However, it is any phenomenon that resides in the consciousness that engages in the aspect of direct perception or the aspect of what is to be inferred.

original: des ni 'dzin pa khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni 'dzin pa khyab pa yin no //
translated: That pervades the apprehender.

original: des na tshad ma gzhan dug la 'gyur snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na tshad ma gzhan dug la 'gyur snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is thought that there is no other valid cognition.

original: gal te de lta na yang 'di nyams su myong ba dang 'gal ba ma yin nam don 'ga' zhig kyang mngon sum la 'ba' zhig gam /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang 'di nyams su myong ba dang 'gal ba ma yin nam don 'ga' zhig kyang mngon sum la 'ba' zhig gam /
translated: If that is so, is it not the case that this contradicts experience?

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba kho na yin par ni mthong ba med do snyam na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba kho na yin par ni mthong ba med do snyam na /
translated: But it is not seen that it is an object of inference alone.

original: yul gcig nyid kyang zhes gsungs so //üîΩmngon sum la sogs pa rang bzhin gyi yul tha dad pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang gcig nyid res 'ga' ni dngos su snang ba yin la /
analyzed: yul gcig nyid kyang zhes gsungs so // mngon sum la sogs pa rang bzhin gyi yul tha dad pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang gcig nyid res 'ga' ni dngos su snang ba yin la /
translated: The response to that is, ‚ÄúEven a single object . . .‚Äù

original: res 'ga' ni rnam pa gzhan du yin te /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni rnam pa gzhan du yin te /
translated: Direct perception and so on do not have different objects by nature. However, a single object sometimes appears directly and sometimes in a different aspect.

original: des na nyams su myong bas grub bas rtog pa'i tshul tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na nyams su myong bas grub bas rtog pa'i tshul tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, since it is established by experience, it is posited as a different mode of conception. This is the meaning.

original: 'o na 'di rtog pa'i dbye ba kho nar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: 'o na 'di rtog pa'i dbye ba kho nar 'gyur mod /
translated: Well, it would be a mere difference in conception.

original: yul gyi dbyer bar rnam par gzhag par go ji ltar byed snyam na /
analyzed: yul gyi dbyer bar rnam par gzhag par go ji ltar byed snyam na /
translated: How is it to be understood that it is posited as a difference in objects?

original: rtog pa'i dbye ba yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rtog pa'i dbye ba yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The response to that is, ‚ÄúEven a difference in conception . . .‚Äù

original: gal te yul gyi dbye ba brjod par rtsom pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te yul gyi dbye ba brjod par rtsom pa ma yin nam /
translated: If it is not a composition that describes a difference in objects,

original: tshad ma'i dbye ba nye bar bstan pa yang tshad ma'i dbye bar grub pa'i don du yin na /
analyzed: tshad ma'i dbye ba nye bar bstan pa yang tshad ma'i dbye bar grub pa'i don du yin na /
translated: then the presentation of a difference in valid knowledge is established as a difference in valid knowledge.

original: gal te de na grub par yang tshad ma'i dbye ba grub na ni gzhal bya'i dbye ba la ston pa don med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te de na grub par yang tshad ma'i dbye ba grub na ni gzhal bya'i dbye ba la ston pa don med par 'gyur la /
translated: If the classification of valid cognitions were established there, then it would be pointless to teach the classification of objects of comprehension.

original: phan tshun don med nyes pas 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: phan tshun don med nyes pas 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If you think that there would be the fault of mutual dependence,

original: de nyid ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: then he says, ‚ÄúThat is precisely . . . ‚Äù

original: tshad ma'i dbye ba nyid yul gyi dbye ba yin pa'i phyir rtsod pa'i dang po med do //
analyzed: tshad ma'i dbye ba nyid yul gyi dbye ba yin pa'i phyir rtsod pa'i dang po med do //
translated: Because the classification of valid cognitions is itself the classification of objects, the first objection does not arise.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf . . . ‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: de ni bden te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de ni bden te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is true . . . ‚Äù is the conclusion.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: rnam pa thams cad du gzhan tha dad pa gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du gzhan tha dad pa gzhan gyi'o //
translated: In every way, difference in other is difference in the other.

original: @6a * // gzhan tha dad pas khyab pa ni ma yin te 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @6a * // gzhan tha dad pas khyab pa ni ma yin te 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But difference in the other does not entail difference in the object, because there is no relation.

original: shes pa dang shes bya dag ni ma 'brel pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya dag ni ma 'brel pa ma yin no //
translated: Cognition and the object of cognition are not unrelated.

original: gcig tha dad pa na gzhan tha dad par sgrub par byed pa'i 'brel pa de nyid ston pa ni shes pa dang shes bya dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gcig tha dad pa na gzhan tha dad par sgrub par byed pa'i 'brel pa de nyid ston pa ni shes pa dang shes bya dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The relation that establishes difference in the other when there is difference in the one is shown by ‚ÄúCognition and the object of cognition . . . ‚Äù

original: nges pa zhes bya ba ni de kho na ltar yin no zhes bya bar mos pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa zhes bya ba ni de kho na ltar yin no zhes bya bar mos pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAscertainment‚Äù is the conviction that it is just as it appears.

original: 'di ga las yin snyam na shes pa gzhan las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ga las yin snyam na shes pa gzhan las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom another cognition‚Äù means: from where does it come?

original: gang la'ang ngo bo snang gi med pa'i don gzhan nyid du ste spyi'i rnam pa can lkog tu gyur pa nyid du shes par byed do //
analyzed: gang la'ang ngo bo snang gi med pa'i don gzhan nyid du ste spyi'i rnam pa can lkog tu gyur pa nyid du shes par byed do //
translated: It is known that the object is not the same as the appearance of its form, but is something else, something hidden, having a universal aspect.

original: des na shes pa'i tshul tha dad pa las yul tha dad pa rnam par gzhag go zhes rigs te /
analyzed: des na shes pa'i tshul tha dad pa las yul tha dad pa rnam par gzhag go zhes rigs te /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to posit a difference in objects on the basis of a difference in the mode of cognition.

original: bems po'i bdag nyid can don gyi rnam par gzhag pa ni de la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bems po'i bdag nyid can don gyi rnam par gzhag pa ni de la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The positing of an object, which is of the nature of an inert thing, depends on that.

original: 'dis ni mngon sum tshad ma gnyis grub par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni mngon sum tshad ma gnyis grub par brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the establishment of the two kinds of valid cognition, perception and inference.

original: 'on kyang don rtogs pa ji snyed pa de snyed ni rnam pa gnyis kyis yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang don rtogs pa ji snyed pa de snyed ni rnam pa gnyis kyis yin te /
translated: However, all the objects that are cognized are so by means of two kinds of valid cognition.

original: mngon sum snang ba dang spyi'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum snang ba dang spyi'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Perception is the appearance of the object, and inference is the universal aspect.

original: tshad ma 'di ji snyed pa dang ci 'dra ba zhig yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma 'di ji snyed pa dang ci 'dra ba zhig yin pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no valid cognition other than these two, nor is there any object that is cognized in any other way.

original: des ni 'di ni gzhal bya gnyis kyis rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: des ni 'di ni gzhal bya gnyis kyis rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the object of comprehension is established as twofold.

original: de grub pa na yang gang zhig dngos su byed pas shes pa de ni mngon sum nyid la yin la /
analyzed: de grub pa na yang gang zhig dngos su byed pas shes pa de ni mngon sum nyid la yin la /
translated: And when that is established, that which is the direct object of the cognition is perception,

original: gzhan ni rjes su dpag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni rjes su dpag pa nyid yin no //
translated: while the other is inference.

original: des na tshad ma yang rnam pa gnyis yin par tha snyad grub pa yin no //
analyzed: des na tshad ma yang rnam pa gnyis yin par tha snyad grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the means of valid cognition is also established as twofold.

original: de na mtha' yongs su dgag pa la ltos nas tshad ma'i dbye ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de na mtha' yongs su dgag pa la ltos nas tshad ma'i dbye ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the division of the means of valid cognition is in terms of the exclusion of the extremes.

original: phyis kyi rtsom pa la ltos te de ni shes pa la rag las pa yin te /
analyzed: phyis kyi rtsom pa la ltos te de ni shes pa la rag las pa yin te /
translated: In terms of the later composition, it depends on cognition.

original: des rtsad gcod pa gnyis pa yang med do //
analyzed: des rtsad gcod pa gnyis pa yang med do //
translated: There is no second investigation by that.

original: phan tshun bstan pa yang ma yin te /üîΩtshad ma gnyis dang por grub par brjod par mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun bstan pa yang ma yin te / tshad ma gnyis dang por grub par brjod par mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it mutual indication,üîΩbecause it is not asserted that the two means of valid cognition are established first.

original: shes bya'i don rnams la gnyis zhes bya ba tsam gyis yul rnam pa gnyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya'i don rnams la gnyis zhes bya ba tsam gyis yul rnam pa gnyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the two aspects of the object are established merely by the two called perception and inference with regard to objects of cognition.

original: gal te de lta na shes bya'i don rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba tsam gyis tshad ma gnyis su brjod par bya'i de'i sgo nas yul rnam pa gnyis yin zhing de las kyang tshad ma rnam pa gnyis yin no zhes bya ba'i brgyud pa la don ci yod
analyzed: gal te de lta na shes bya'i don rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba tsam gyis tshad ma gnyis su brjod par bya'i de'i sgo nas yul rnam pa gnyis yin zhing de las kyang tshad ma rnam pa gnyis yin no zhes bya ba'i brgyud pa la don ci yod
translated: If that is so, then it is merely said that there are two types of objects of knowledge, but what is the point of the process of saying that there are two types of objects and therefore two types of valid knowledge?

original: snyam na / bden te yul gyi dbye ba ma bstan na ni de nyid rnam pa gnyis kyis rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir tshad ma gcig nyid du 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snyam na / bden te yul gyi dbye ba ma bstan na ni de nyid rnam pa gnyis kyis rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir tshad ma gcig nyid du 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is true that if the division of objects is not taught, then valid knowledge would be held to be just one, because it is known by two types of objects.

original: mig gnyis kyis 'dzin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mig gnyis kyis 'dzin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the apprehension by two eyes.

original: 'on te mig gnyis kyis bzung ba dang chos mi mthun par gcig nyid rnam pa gzhan du snang ba'i phyir @6b na tshad ma tha dad pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te mig gnyis kyis bzung ba dang chos mi mthun par gcig nyid rnam pa gzhan du snang ba'i phyir @6b na tshad ma tha dad pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If it is thought that valid knowledge is different because it appears in a different way, although it is not similar to the apprehension by two eyes,

original: de lta na ni 'o na snang bzhin pa yul gyi rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir tshad ma tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na snang bzhin pa yul gyi rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir tshad ma tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: then in that case, because the different aspects of the object appear, valid knowledge would be different.

original: tshad ma'i dbye ba ni yul gyi dbye ba nyid kyis bya bar 'gyur ba yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma'i dbye ba ni yul gyi dbye ba nyid kyis bya bar 'gyur ba yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The division of valid cognitions is to be made by the division of their objects.

original: don byed nus dang mi nus phyir //
analyzed: don byed nus dang mi nus phyir //
translated: Because of being able to or not being able to perform a function,

original: zhes bya ba bshad pa'i phyir gang gi tshe zhes pa bskyed pa la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bshad pa'i phyir gang gi tshe zhes pa bskyed pa la zhes gsungs so //
translated: in order to explain this, he says, ‚ÄúWhen . . . ‚Äù and ‚Äúin the production . . . ‚Äù

original: gang gis don byed pa la zhes spyir bstan pa khyad par 'di yang ga las yin te /
analyzed: gang gis don byed pa la zhes spyir bstan pa khyad par 'di yang ga las yin te /
translated: Since it is taught in general that ‚Äúthat which performs a function . . . ‚Äù what is the basis for this distinction?

original: 'di skad du 'grel pa byed pas rnam pa gang zhig gis don bya bas 'ga' zhig la nus pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid la /
analyzed: 'di skad du 'grel pa byed pas rnam pa gang zhig gis don bya bas 'ga' zhig la nus pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid la /
translated: The commentator explains this as follows: ‚ÄúThat which is able to perform a function for some in a certain way is a specific characteristic.

original: nus pa thams cad dang bral ba ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: nus pa thams cad dang bral ba ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: That which is devoid of all ability is a general characteristic.‚Äù

original: de nyid ni rigs par yang mthong ngo snyam na /
analyzed: de nyid ni rigs par yang mthong ngo snyam na /
translated: If you think that this is also seen to be reasonable,

original: 'di bzlog pa'i phyir na ma yin par 'jug pas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di bzlog pa'i phyir na ma yin par 'jug pas zhes gsungs so //
translated: in order to refute this he says, ‚Äúbecause of engaging in nonexistence.

original: 'di la bsam pa ni gang gi phyir tshad ma'i yul dpyad pa'i skabs yin la /
analyzed: 'di la bsam pa ni gang gi phyir tshad ma'i yul dpyad pa'i skabs yin la /
translated: ‚Äù The thought here is this: Since this is the section on the analysis of the object of valid knowledge,

original: tshad ma yang don bya ba'i yul can nyid dpyad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma yang don bya ba'i yul can nyid dpyad par bya ba yin te /
translated: Valid knowledge is also to be analyzed as to whether it has a functioning object.

original: don byed nus pa ma yin la ;
analyzed: don byed nus pa ma yin la ;
translated: If it is not able to perform a function,

original: / de 'dod brtags pas ci zhig bya //üîΩma ning gzugs bzang mi bzang zhes //
analyzed: / de 'dod brtags pas ci zhig bya // ma ning gzugs bzang mi bzang zhes //
translated: what is the use of asserting it?üîΩWhat is the use of a lustful woman

original: 'dod ldan mas ni brtags ci phan //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod ldan mas ni brtags ci phan // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: analyzing whether a neuter is handsome or ugly?

original: mi dmigs pa yang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi rnam pa nyid yin pas dngos po'i yul can las 'das pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa yang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi rnam pa nyid yin pas dngos po'i yul can las 'das pa ma yin no //
translated: Nonapprehension is also a type of natural reasoning, so it is not beyond having a thing as its object.

original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul mngon sum spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can ni rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes dgongs na sa yul gnyis rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul mngon sum spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can ni rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes dgongs na sa yul gnyis rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: If it is intended that direct perception has a particular as its object and inference has a universal as its object, then the two objects are posited.

original: gal te spyi'i mtshan nyid don byed nus pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te spyi'i mtshan nyid don byed nus pa ma yin na /
translated: If a universal is not able to perform a function,

original: de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa tshad ma las nyams pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa tshad ma las nyams pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then inference would be undermined as a valid means of knowledge.

original: lhag par zhen pa'i yul la ltos nas tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: lhag par zhen pa'i yul la ltos nas tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: It is a valid means of knowledge in dependence on the object of adherence.

original: gzung ba'i yul la ltos nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba'i yul la ltos nas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in relation to the object that is apprehended.

original: 'on te de'i yul can tshad ma 'gag pa yod pa ma yin mod /
analyzed: 'on te de'i yul can tshad ma 'gag pa yod pa ma yin mod /
translated: If you say that the valid cognition that has that as its object does not exist,

original: de lta na yang spyi'i mtshan nyid brjod pa yin na /
analyzed: de lta na yang spyi'i mtshan nyid brjod pa yin na /
translated: then even so, if you are stating the definition of the universal,

original: de lta na yang skabs ma yin pa brjod pa nyid nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang skabs ma yin pa brjod pa nyid nyes pa yin no //
translated: then even so, it is still a fault to state what is not relevant.

original: gzhan yang gal te don bya ba mi nus pa nyid spyi'i mtshan nyid yin par brjod na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te don bya ba mi nus pa nyid spyi'i mtshan nyid yin par brjod na /
translated: Moreover, if the definition of the universal is the inability to perform a function,

original: de'i tshe sgra la sogs pa yang spyi'i 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe sgra la sogs pa yang spyi'i 'gyur ro //
translated: then sound and so on would also be universals.

original: gsal bar snang ba dang 'gar yang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir na spyi'i nang du 'du ba ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba dang 'gar yang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir na spyi'i nang du 'du ba ma yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that they are not included within the universal because they appear as discrete and they do not pervade anywhere else,

original: de lta na yang khyad par gzhan la ltos nas mtshan nyid yin par nye ba chen po yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang khyad par gzhan la ltos nas mtshan nyid yin par nye ba chen po yin no //
translated: then even so, it is still very close to being a definition in reliance on another attribute.

original: des na yul gsum @7a * //
analyzed: des na yul gsum @7a * //
translated: Therefore, the three objects

original: par dogs pa na /
analyzed: par dogs pa na /
translated: are suspected to be universals.

original: skra shad la sogs pa don min te zhes bya bas 'jug par byed pa yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa don min te zhes bya bas 'jug par byed pa yang mi 'thad de /
translated: It is also untenable to engage in the statement, ‚ÄúThe object of the visual consciousness that appears as a hair and so on is not a real object,‚Äù

original: spyi nyid kyi nang du 'du ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi nyid kyi nang du 'du ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is included within the universal.

original: de bas na shes pa'i snang ba'i dbye bas yul rnam pa gnyis su brjod pa'i skabs yin te /
analyzed: de bas na shes pa'i snang ba'i dbye bas yul rnam pa gnyis su brjod pa'i skabs yin te /
translated: Therefore, in the context of the division of the appearance of consciousness, the object is said to be of two kinds.

original: nges na skabs las sam nye ba las brgyud nas shes pa skyed par nus pa nyid don byed mi nus par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: nges na skabs las sam nye ba las brgyud nas shes pa skyed par nus pa nyid don byed mi nus par brjod pa yin no //
translated: If so, then the context or the proximity of the object is the capacity to generate consciousness, and that is said to be the performance of a function.

original: gzhung ni rtogs par sla ba nyid do //üîΩgal te gsal bar snang ba dag gis dngos sam brgyud las nus pa nyid du rnam par gzhag na sgra la sogs par snang ba dang / sgra las byung ba yang sogs pa'i snang ba yang de ltar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhung ni rtogs par sla ba nyid do // gal te gsal bar snang ba dag gis dngos sam brgyud las nus pa nyid du rnam par gzhag na sgra la sogs par snang ba dang / sgra las byung ba yang sogs pa'i snang ba yang de ltar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: The text is easy to understand.

original: go rims bzhin du gsal ba dang mi gsal ba dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du gsal ba dang mi gsal ba dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the appearance of the clear object is posited as the capacity either directly or indirectly, then the appearance of sound and so on and the appearance of what arises from sound would also be like that, because they are clear and unclear, respectively.üîΩTherefore, it would follow that the consciousness that has that as its object would be valid knowledge.

original: des na de'i yul can gyi shes pa tshad mar thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa bsu nas rab rib can gyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na de'i yul can gyi shes pa tshad mar thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa bsu nas rab rib can gyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: In response to this qualm, he says, ‚ÄúOne with eye disease,‚Äù and so on.

original: don 'di yin pa yang ste gang dang gang du gsal ba dang mi gsal bar snang ba yod pa de dang der de lhag par zhes byas pa dngos sam brgyud pas nus pa ni ma yin gyi /üîΩ'on kyang gang la don bya bar nus pa yod pa der /
analyzed: don 'di yin pa yang ste gang dang gang du gsal ba dang mi gsal bar snang ba yod pa de dang der de lhag par zhes byas pa dngos sam brgyud pas nus pa ni ma yin gyi / 'on kyang gang la don bya bar nus pa yod pa der /
translated: This is the meaning: wherever there is the appearance of clarity or unclarity, there is the appearance of the object, either directly or indirectly.

original: dngos sam brgyud pas yin te /
analyzed: dngos sam brgyud pas yin te /
translated: But where there is the capacity to perform a function, there is the appearance of the object, either directly or indirectly.

original: rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang du dngos su nus pa der ni gsal bar snang ba yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro // gang du dngos su nus pa der ni gsal bar snang ba yin la /
translated: There is no other way.üîΩWhere there is direct capacity, there is the appearance of clarity.

original: gang du brgyud nas nus pa yod pa der ni gsal bar snang ba yin no //üîΩdes na gang gis de'i yul can tshad mar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang du brgyud nas nus pa yod pa der ni gsal bar snang ba yin no // des na gang gis de'i yul can tshad mar 'gyur ba /
translated: Where there is indirect capacity, there is the appearance of unclarity.

original: skra la sogs pa nus par ji ltar thal /
analyzed: skra la sogs pa nus par ji ltar thal /
translated: Therefore, how could the capacity of hair and so on follow from the fact that it is a valid cognition whose object is that?

original: rab rib can gyis dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa nyid du lhag par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: rab rib can gyis dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa nyid du lhag par zhen pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúapprehended by one with diseased vision‚Äù means that the object is conceived to exist.

original: de bzhin du skra las byung ba la sogs pas dmigs pa la yang don nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du skra las byung ba la sogs pas dmigs pa la yang don nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, the object that arises from hair and so on does not exist as an object.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang nus pa ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang nus pa ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because both are possible, except for the power.

original: / ci'i phyir zhe na don du mos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / ci'i phyir zhe na don du mos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because of the intention to perceive the object.

original: ji ltar bden pa'i skra la sogs pa'i snang ba'i shes pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar bden pa'i skra la sogs pa'i snang ba'i shes pa'am /
translated: For example, the cognition of the appearance of hair, etc., in the eye disease of blurred vision,

original: me la sogs pa'i rjes su dpag pa la snang ba las bla lhag tu gyur pa /
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i rjes su dpag pa la snang ba las bla lhag tu gyur pa /
translated: or the inference of fire from smoke, are more powerful than the appearance.

original: 'ching ba dang bud shing bsregs pa la sogs don bya ba byed pa'i stobs kyis logs shig tu don du mos pas des na snang ba 'di ni des byas pa yin no zhes rnam par 'jog pa de bzhin du 'dir ni rnam par gzhag par mi nus te
analyzed: 'ching ba dang bud shing bsregs pa la sogs don bya ba byed pa'i stobs kyis logs shig tu don du mos pas des na snang ba 'di ni des byas pa yin no zhes rnam par 'jog pa de bzhin du 'dir ni rnam par gzhag par mi nus te
translated: The appearance is posited as produced by that, because of the intention to perceive the object separately by the power of the object's function, such as burning fuel. But that cannot be posited here,

original: / byed pa tha dad pa med pa'i phyir dang / sgra las byung ba la sogs par ni nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / byed pa tha dad pa med pa'i phyir dang / sgra las byung ba la sogs par ni nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference in function and because there is no certainty in the case of what arises from sound, etc.

original: mos pa'i sgras ni 'di skad du brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: mos pa'i sgras ni 'di skad du brjod pa yin te /
