translated: The word intention is expressed in this way:

original: yod par mngon par 'dod kyang de ni mos pa tsam @7b du zad pa yin la /
analyzed: yod par mngon par 'dod kyang de ni mos pa tsam @7b du zad pa yin la /
translated: Even though one desires the existence of the object, it is merely an intention.

original: skra la sogs pa la ni de yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: skra la sogs pa la ni de yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: But that is not the case with regard to hair and so on.

original: 'di la yang gtan tshigs bshad pa ni mos pa med pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang gtan tshigs bshad pa ni mos pa med pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reason for this is stated in the words ‚ÄúNor is there any interest in it.‚Äù

original: 'di yang lhag par zhen par bya ba'i yul la ltos pa kho nas sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang lhag par zhen par bya ba'i yul la ltos pa kho nas sbyar ba yin no //
translated: This is also applied only in dependence on the object of attachment.

original: yang gang gi tshe 'brel pa byed pa'i dbang gis /
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe 'brel pa byed pa'i dbang gis /
translated: Moreover, when this analysis is applied to what is related by virtue of the power of the relation,

original: snang bzhin pa nyid la dpyad pa 'di yin pa de'i skra la sogs pa dang skra las byung ba la sogs pa'i snang ba don min te /
analyzed: snang bzhin pa nyid la dpyad pa 'di yin pa de'i skra la sogs pa dang skra las byung ba la sogs pa'i snang ba don min te /
translated: the appearance of hair and so on and the appearance of the beholder of hair and so on are not objects.

original: dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po ma yin te /
translated: They are not things.

original: der snang ba'i shes pa la rnam pa gnyis ka ltar yang nus pa rtogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: der snang ba'i shes pa la rnam pa gnyis ka ltar yang nus pa rtogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because the cognition that appears as them is not perceived to have the capacity for either of the two.

original: tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: This is because they are not different.

original: rang gi bdag nyid la nus pa yod pa ni 'ga' la'ang mi srid do //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la nus pa yod pa ni 'ga' la'ang mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible for anything to have the capacity for itself.

original: de lta na yang ci'i phyir dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang ci'i phyir dngos po ma yin te /
translated: Even so, why are they not things?

original: nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because they are empty of all capacities.

original: de ni ma grub bo //
analyzed: de ni ma grub bo //
translated: That is not established.

original: bdag gis sgra la sogs pa dmigs so snyam du lhag par zhen pa dang / des byas pa 'jug pa nges pa la sogs pa la go rims bzhin du dngos dang brgyud pas nus pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gis sgra la sogs pa dmigs so snyam du lhag par zhen pa dang / des byas pa 'jug pa nges pa la sogs pa la go rims bzhin du dngos dang brgyud pas nus pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the capacity is established in the case of sound, etc., by direct perception and by inference, respectively, in the case of the self, since one conceives of the self as the experiencer of sound, etc., and since the capacity is established in the case of the self‚Äôs activity, such as the determination to engage, etc., directly and indirectly.

original: de la ni lhag par zhen par byas pa'i 'ching ba'i nus pa nyid med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la ni lhag par zhen par byas pa'i 'ching ba'i nus pa nyid med pa yin gyi /
translated: In this case, there is no capacity for the bondage of the conceiver.

original: rnam pa thams cad du de'i 'bras bu la de'i nus pa med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du de'i 'bras bu la de'i nus pa med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that the capacity for its effect is completely absent.

original: des ji ltar dngos po ma yin snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: des ji ltar dngos po ma yin snyam du dogs na /
translated: How can it be that it is not a real entity?

original: don du mos pa med pa'i phyir te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don du mos pa med pa'i phyir te zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because there is no interest in the object.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: de kho nar ni don med pa ma yin mod kyi tha dad pa rnams lhag par mos pa med pas ni don ma yin par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de kho nar ni don med pa ma yin mod kyi tha dad pa rnams lhag par mos pa med pas ni don ma yin par brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is not that it is not a real entity in reality, but it is said to be unreal because there is no interest in the different aspects.

original: de'i don bya ba don du gnyer ba de dag ni de la 'jug par bya ba'i don du /
analyzed: de'i don bya ba don du gnyer ba de dag ni de la 'jug par bya ba'i don du /
translated: Those who seek the object‚Äôs function, for the sake of engaging in that,

original: der lhag par zhen pa la yang ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: der lhag par zhen pa la yang ltos pa yin no //
translated: and it is also dependent on the adherence to that.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i don bya ba med na ni lhag par zhen pas kyang dogs pa cung zad med do //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i don bya ba med na ni lhag par zhen pas kyang dogs pa cung zad med do //
translated: If there is no purpose in the object of adherence, then there is not the slightest doubt that it is adhered to as purposeless.

original: des na don med pa nyid du lhag par mos pa yin no //
analyzed: des na don med pa nyid du lhag par mos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is adhered to as purposeless.

original: 'dis ni gang 'ga' zhig tu don med pa snang bar brjod pa der ni 'jig rten gyi ngor yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni gang 'ga' zhig tu don med pa snang bar brjod pa der ni 'jig rten gyi ngor yin gyi /
translated: This shows that when something appears as purposeless in some cases, it is in terms of the world,

original: de kho nas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de kho nas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: but not in terms of reality.

original: 'o na tha snyad byed pa po rnams kyang don med par mos par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na tha snyad byed pa po rnams kyang don med par mos par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: Well, how can those who engage in conventions come to adhere to the purposelessness of things,

original: mthong ba dang lhag par zhen pa dang 'jug pa rnams ni de la yang yod pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
analyzed: mthong ba dang lhag par zhen pa dang 'jug pa rnams ni de la yang yod pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
translated: since they see, adhere to, and engage in things?

original: mos pa med pa yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mos pa med pa yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúEven without adherence.‚Äù

original: yang na snang ba'i rnam pa la yang de kho nar don med pa yang ma yin pa ci ste med snyam na /
analyzed: yang na snang ba'i rnam pa la yang de kho nar don med pa yang ma yin pa ci ste med snyam na /
translated: Or, if one thinks that even in the aspect of appearance, how can there be no reality,

original: mos pa med pa yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mos pa med pa yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: the response is, ‚ÄúEven without adherence.‚Äù

original: snang ba la ni gnod par byed pa yod pa ma yin no snyam du dogs pa'o //üîΩgnod @8a * //
analyzed: snang ba la ni gnod par byed pa yod pa ma yin no snyam du dogs pa'o // gnod @8a * //
translated: There is no contradiction in the appearance.

original: byed ni rjes su dpag pa las gzhan med pa la /
analyzed: byed ni rjes su dpag pa las gzhan med pa la /
translated: The contradiction is not something other than inference.

original: snang ba'i rang bzhin ni rang rig pa'i mngon sum du 'dus pa'i phyir gnod pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: snang ba'i rang bzhin ni rang rig pa'i mngon sum du 'dus pa'i phyir gnod pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: The nature of appearance is included in the direct perception of self-awareness, so there is no contradiction at all.

original: gang gi tshe don gyi sgra yul gyi don la 'jug pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe don gyi sgra yul gyi don la 'jug pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the sound of the object enters the object of the field,

original: tha snyad 'dogs pa po rnams yul nyid du lhag par mos pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: tha snyad 'dogs pa po rnams yul nyid du lhag par mos pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: at that time, the designators do not have the conviction of the object itself. This is the meaning.

original: / de la gal te yul tsam zhig brjod par 'dod na de'i tshe ni de mos pa grub pa kho na ste /
analyzed: / de la gal te yul tsam zhig brjod par 'dod na de'i tshe ni de mos pa grub pa kho na ste /
translated: If one wishes to express only the object, at that time, the conviction is established.

original: bdag la skra la sogs pa snang ngo zhes mos pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la skra la sogs pa snang ngo zhes mos pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is the conviction, I see hair, etc.

original: brdzun pa'i khyad par can du nges kyang de'i yul tsam zhig snyam du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brdzun pa'i khyad par can du nges kyang de'i yul tsam zhig snyam du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if it is ascertained as false, there is no thought of just the object.

original: de'i phyir khyad par can gyi yul nyid ni bden pa'i khyad par can du brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par can gyi yul nyid ni bden pa'i khyad par can du brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the special object is to be called a special truth.

original: bden pa nyid la rgal ba dang / lan gdab par rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: bden pa nyid la rgal ba dang / lan gdab par rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is proper to debate and reply about truth itself.

original: des de ltar dngos sam brgyud pas nus pa tha dad pa na yul rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag nas /
analyzed: des de ltar dngos sam brgyud pas nus pa tha dad pa na yul rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag nas /
translated: Having thus established the two kinds of objects by way of their different capacities, whether direct or indirect,

original: gzhan rnam pa gsum gyi sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan rnam pa gsum gyi sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir brjod pa ni /
translated: in order to teach them by way of another threefold classification, he says,

original: 'di las kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di las kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso, from this . . .‚Äù

original: gang zhig dpe dang 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa de la ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig dpe dang 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa de la ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: That which is understood as having a nature similar to an example is a universal.

original: gang zhig thams cad las ldog pa nyid du rtogs pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig thams cad las ldog pa nyid du rtogs pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: That which is understood as the mere exclusion of everything else is a particular.

original: de bzhin du gang zhig sgra'i yul nyid du rtogs pa da ni spyi yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang zhig sgra'i yul nyid du rtogs pa da ni spyi yin la /
translated: Similarly, that which is understood as the mere object of a word is a universal.

original: gzhan ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The other is a particular.

original: de bzhin gang la yul las gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan rnams yod pa po yod pa de ni spyi yin la gang la med pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni rnam 'grel gyi sde ba sbyor tsam yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gang la yul las gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan rnams yod pa po yod pa de ni spyi yin la gang la med pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni rnam 'grel gyi sde ba sbyor tsam yin no //
translated: Likewise, that which has a reason that is other than the object is a universal, and that which does not have that is a specifically characterized phenomenon.

original: rnam pa dang po la ha cang khyad par dogs pa bsu ba ni /üîΩgal te zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa dang po la ha cang khyad par dogs pa bsu ba ni / gal te zhes bya'o //
translated: The first type of object is a specifically characterized phenomenon.üîΩThe second type of object is a universal.üîΩThe third type of object is a non-associated compositional factor.üîΩThe fourth type of object is a non-thing.üîΩThe fifth type of object is a permanent phenomenon.

original: de las kyang cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las kyang cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: The sixth type of object is a non-analytical cessation.üîΩThe seventh type of object is a permanent phenomenon that is a non-analytical cessation.üîΩThe eighth type of object is a non-analytical cessation that is a permanent phenomenon.

original: brjod pa la gal te khra bo la sogs pa dang 'dra ba la ser skya la sogs par rtogs pa spyi yin na /
analyzed: brjod pa la gal te khra bo la sogs pa dang 'dra ba la ser skya la sogs par rtogs pa spyi yin na /
translated: The ninth type of object is a permanent phenomenon that is a non-analytical cessation.üîΩThe tenth type of object is a non-analytical cessation that is a permanent phenomenon.üîΩThe eleventh type of object is a permanent phenomenon that is a non-analytical cessation.

original: de'i tshe rang gi mtshan nyid kyang spyir 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i tshe rang gi mtshan nyid kyang spyir 'gyur la /
translated: The twelfth type of object is a non-analytical cessation that is a permanent phenomenon.üîΩThe thirteenth type of object is a permanent phenomenon that is a non-analytical cessation.üîΩThe fourteenth type of object is a non-analytical cessation that is a permanent phenomenon.üîΩThe fifteenth type of object is a permanent phenomenon that is a non-analytical cessation.üîΩThe sixteenth type of object is a non-analytical cessation that is a permanent phenomenon.

original: spyi yang rang gi mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi yang rang gi mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The seventeenth type of object is a permanent phenomenon that is a non-analytical cessation.üîΩThe eighteenth type of object is a non-analytical cessation that is a permanent phenomenon.üîΩThe nineteenth type of object is a permanent phenomenon that is a non-analytical cessation.üîΩThe twentieth type of object is a non-analytical cessation that is a permanent phenomenon.üîΩThe twenty-first type of object is a permanent phenomenon that is a non-analytical cessation.üîΩThe twenty-second type of object is a non-analytical cessation that is a permanent phenomenon.üîΩThe twenty-third type of object is a permanent phenomenon that is a non-analytical cessation.

original: des na tshad ma gnyis yul gcig la mi 'jug par ma nges par 'gyur la de lta yin yang ji ltar yul gcig la gnyis 'jug pa de bzhin du gsum pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na tshad ma gnyis yul gcig la mi 'jug par ma nges par 'gyur la de lta yin yang ji ltar yul gcig la gnyis 'jug pa de bzhin du gsum pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The twenty-fourth type of object is a non-analytical cessation that is a permanent phenomenon.üîΩThe twenty-fifth type of object is a permanent phenomenon that is a non-analytical cessation.üîΩThe twenty-sixth type of object is a non-analytical cessation that is a permanent phenomenon.

original: yul gyi rang bzhin ma 'chol ba la ni nyes pa 'dir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul gyi rang bzhin ma 'chol ba la ni nyes pa 'dir mi 'gyur te /
translated: But this fault does not arise in the case of a non-erroneous cognition of the nature of the object,

original: yul gnyis la tshad ma gnyis kyis 'jug pa nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gnyis la tshad ma gnyis kyis 'jug pa nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the two valid cognitions engage the two objects and ascertain them.

original: de yang 'thad pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'thad pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: And that is not tenable, we reply.

original: de'i yul can 'dra bar rtogs pa yang tshad ma gzhan du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i yul can 'dra bar rtogs pa yang tshad ma gzhan du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: And the cognition of similarity that has that as its object would be a different valid cognition,

original: rtags las ma @8b skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags las ma @8b skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not produced from a logical reason.üîΩJust like that, etc.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par brjod pa dang / 'brel ba'i rtogs pa ni nye bar 'jal ba yin no zhes bya ba rig pa can gyi nye bar 'jal ba ston pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par brjod pa dang / 'brel ba'i rtogs pa ni nye bar 'jal ba yin no zhes bya ba rig pa can gyi nye bar 'jal ba ston pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe cognition of a connection is a presumption‚Äù teaches the presumption of the NaiyƒÅyikas.

original: 'di ltar ba men ni ba lang dang 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba nye bar ston pa'i ngag gis 'du byed bskyed pa can ni ba men mthong ba las de bsad pa na ba men gyi sgra brjod par bya ba de ni 'di yin no snyam du
analyzed: 'di ltar ba men ni ba lang dang 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba nye bar ston pa'i ngag gis 'du byed bskyed pa can ni ba men mthong ba las de bsad pa na ba men gyi sgra brjod par bya ba de ni 'di yin no snyam du
translated: For example, the statement ‚ÄúA gayal is like a cow‚Äù produces a mental factor. When one sees a gayal, the expression ‚ÄúThat is the one called a gayal‚Äù produces a mental factor. The cognition that thinks,

original: rtogs pa ni nye bar 'jal ba yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni nye bar 'jal ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is the one I was told about‚Äù is a presumption.

original: de'i yul yang spyi'i mtshan nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: de'i yul yang spyi'i mtshan nyid yin na ni /
translated: If the object of that is a universal,

original: nye bar 'jal ba yang rjes su dpag pa'i yul nyid de /
analyzed: nye bar 'jal ba yang rjes su dpag pa'i yul nyid de /
translated: then even a proximate perception is the object of inference.üîΩIt follows that it would be another valid cognition with respect to the collection of causes of arising.üîΩThe meaning of the dispute is this:

original: skye ba'i tshogs pa dang bral ba la tshad ma gzhan yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i don la yang gang zhig 'dra ba'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do zhes ni nges par mi 'dzin no zhes brjod pa
analyzed: skye ba'i tshogs pa dang bral ba la tshad ma gzhan yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i don la yang gang zhig 'dra ba'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do zhes ni nges par mi 'dzin no zhes brjod pa
translated: One does not ascertain that whatever is understood to have a similar nature is a universal.

original: ni / 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid du ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ni / 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid du ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the nature of similarity‚Äù means

original: 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid du zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi ngo bo ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid du zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi ngo bo ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: that it is not in the nature of a particular.

original: 'dir ni ngo bo zhes bya ba ni khyad par yang rig pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni ngo bo zhes bya ba ni khyad par yang rig pa yod pa yin te /
translated: Here, the term ‚Äúnature‚Äù also refers to a particular.

original: des na spyi'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba'i go skabs med do //
analyzed: des na spyi'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba'i go skabs med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no opportunity for it to be a universal.

original: 'o na rang bzhin gnyis ka yul du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa'ang gzhal bya des na kha dog gi rtags ni rtogs mi 'gyur zhes bya ba de'i skabs su spangs bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na rang bzhin gnyis ka yul du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa'ang gzhal bya des na kha dog gi rtags ni rtogs mi 'gyur zhes bya ba de'i skabs su spangs bar bya ba'o //
translated: The objection, ‚ÄúBut then both natures would be objects,‚Äù is to be rejected in the context of the statement, ‚ÄúThe sign of color is not cognized.‚Äù

original: 'o na 'grel par yang gi sgra ci ste mi ston snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na 'grel par yang gi sgra ci ste mi ston snyam na /
translated: But why does the Commentary not explain the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù?

original: de kho na ni 'dra bar rtogs pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de kho na ni 'dra bar rtogs pa med pa nyid de /
translated: That is not the case, because there is no cognition of similarity.

original: 'on kyang de'i 'dod pa'i rjes su 'brang nas gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yod kyang ci'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba'i go skabs med do zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i 'dod pa'i rjes su 'brang nas gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yod kyang ci'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba'i go skabs med do zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: However, following the opponent‚Äôs belief, it is said that even if both natures exist, there is no opportunity for the definition of similarity.

original: 'di gzhan gyis gal te 'dra ba'i zhes smra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di gzhan gyis gal te 'dra ba'i zhes smra ba'o //
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs statement, ‚ÄúIf there were similarity . . .‚Äù

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa 'gog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù means that the cognition of similarity is rejected.

original: mdun na gnas pa'i rang bzhin las tha dad par 'dra bar de'i ngo bo rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: mdun na gnas pa'i rang bzhin las tha dad par 'dra bar de'i ngo bo rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The reason is, ‚ÄúBecause there is no cognition of the nature of similarity apart from the nature that is present in front of one.‚Äù

original: 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa la bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa la bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The point of the argument ‚ÄúHow then?‚Äù is as follows.

original: 'dra ba zhes bya ba spyi las don gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang cha shas mang po rnams kyang spyi nyid la 'dra ba zhes tha snyad byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba zhes bya ba spyi las don gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang cha shas mang po rnams kyang spyi nyid la 'dra ba zhes tha snyad byed pa yin no //
translated: It is not that what is called ‚Äúsimilarity‚Äù is something different from the universal; rather, many parts are themselves the universal, and the expression ‚Äúsimilarity‚Äù is used.

original: spyi med par ni spyi'i blo dang sgra 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi med par ni spyi'i blo dang sgra 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: And a cognition and a word for a universal do not occur without a universal.

original: de bas na 'di 'dra ba'o snyam pa'i rtogs pas ni /
analyzed: de bas na 'di 'dra ba'o snyam pa'i rtogs pas ni /
translated: Therefore, the cognition ‚ÄúThis is similar‚Äù

original: rang gi rgyu mtshan 'dra ba nyid nye bar 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu mtshan 'dra ba nyid nye bar 'jog pa yin no //
translated: posits the mere similarity of its own cause.

original: yang na 'di 'dra'o snyam pa'i zhen pas ni gong du las tha dad pa'i 'dra bar rigs par nyams su myong ba yin pa'i phyir ji ltar /
analyzed: yang na 'di 'dra'o snyam pa'i zhen pas ni gong du las tha dad pa'i 'dra bar rigs par nyams su myong ba yin pa'i phyir ji ltar /
translated: Or else, since the experience of similarity that is different from the action is known by the conception ‚ÄúThis is similar,‚Äù

original: 'dra ba ma rtogs yin zhe na //üîΩlhag par zhen kyang zhes bya ba @9a * //
analyzed: 'dra ba ma rtogs yin zhe na // lhag par zhen kyang zhes bya ba @9a * //
translated: how can it be that similarity is not cognized?

original: la sogs pa grub pa'i mtha'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: la sogs pa grub pa'i mtha'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning of the philosophical position is stated in the lines beginning ‚ÄúEven if one conceives of it as superior.‚Äù

original: gal te lhag par zhen pa yod du chug mod de lta na yang 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i dngos po de'i chos nyid 'dod pa /
analyzed: gal te lhag par zhen pa yod du chug mod de lta na yang 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i dngos po de'i chos nyid 'dod pa /
translated: Even if there were a special adherence, still, the nature of that thing called ‚Äúsimilarity‚Äù

original: kha dog dang rnam pa dang yi ges stong pa ni tha dad pa dbang po'i blo la snang ba med do //
analyzed: kha dog dang rnam pa dang yi ges stong pa ni tha dad pa dbang po'i blo la snang ba med do //
translated: is empty of color, shape, and letters, and it does not appear to the different sense consciousnesses.

original: tha dad par mthong ba med na yang de khas blangs pa'i skabs yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad par mthong ba med na yang de khas blangs pa'i skabs yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And if there is no seeing of difference, then there is no occasion for accepting it.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po de nyid gnyis med shes pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po de nyid gnyis med shes pa yin te /
translated: The thing that is the own characteristic is the nondual consciousness.

original: spyi dang khyad par gyi rnam pa med pa'i khyad par gyi shes pa 'di la yod pa ste /
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par gyi rnam pa med pa'i khyad par gyi shes pa 'di la yod pa ste /
translated: This consciousness, which is without the aspects of universal and particular, exists.

original: des na spyi zhes bya ba gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na spyi zhes bya ba gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no other thing called ‚Äúuniversal.‚Äù

original: dbang po'i shes pas 'dzin pa lta zhog ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pas 'dzin pa lta zhog ste /
translated: Not only is it not apprehended by sense consciousness,

original: 'dra bar lhag par zhen pa dang lhan cig pas kyang 'dra ba tha dad par rtogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dra bar lhag par zhen pa dang lhan cig pas kyang 'dra ba tha dad par rtogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but also, even when it is together with the special adherence to similarity, there is no apprehension of difference in similarity. This is the meaning.

original: 'di nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa ni 'di 'dra ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa ni 'di 'dra ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The commentary on this is as follows: ‚ÄúIt is like this.‚Äù

original: gal te lhag par zhen pa nyid 'dra ba 'dzin par byed pa yin no zhes brjod zin ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lhag par zhen pa nyid 'dra ba 'dzin par byed pa yin no zhes brjod zin ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But has it not already been said that the grasping of similarity is the same as the grasping of superimposition?

original: de la yang bzhi por lhag par zhen pa la yang dngos po'i rang bzhin las logs shig tu ni 'dra ba 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la yang bzhi por lhag par zhen pa la yang dngos po'i rang bzhin las logs shig tu ni 'dra ba 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In that case, the grasping of similarity is not separate from the nature of things, even in the case of the four superimpositions.

original: lhag par zhen pas kyang 'dra ba 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhag par zhen pas kyang 'dra ba 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the grasping of similarity is not the grasping of superimposition.

original: des na so sor rtogs pa yod min pa /
analyzed: des na so sor rtogs pa yod min pa /
translated: Therefore, there is no discernment.

original: de nyid rang gi mtshan nyid 'ba' zhig yin no //
analyzed: de nyid rang gi mtshan nyid 'ba' zhig yin no //
translated: It is only the intrinsic identity.

original: 'grel par ni rtogs pas ni zhes bya ba byed pa po'i gsum par byas so //
analyzed: 'grel par ni rtogs pas ni zhes bya ba byed pa po'i gsum par byas so //
translated: In the commentary, ‚Äúby the realization‚Äù is made the third case, the dative.

original: 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang rnam pa dang yi ges stong pa'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang rnam pa dang yi ges stong pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSimilarity‚Äù is empty of color, form, and letters.

original: 'dra ba ni dngos po'i chos su 'dod pa yin la dbang po'i rnam par shes pa de 'dzin par byed pa la ni snang ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dra ba ni dngos po'i chos su 'dod pa yin la dbang po'i rnam par shes pa de 'dzin par byed pa la ni snang ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Similarity means that it is asserted to be a real phenomenon. It is not a manifestation that apprehends the sense consciousness.

original: des na bag chags tsam las 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa la snang ba yin yang /
analyzed: des na bag chags tsam las 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa la snang ba yin yang /
translated: Therefore, although it appears in the conceptual consciousness that arises from mere latent propensities,

original: yod pa nyams su myong bar ji ltar 'gyur te //
analyzed: yod pa nyams su myong bar ji ltar 'gyur te //
translated: how can it be the experience of an existent?

original: nya phyis la dngul bzhin no //üîΩgang gi phyir dbang po'i byed pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid dam /
analyzed: nya phyis la dngul bzhin no // gang gi phyir dbang po'i byed pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid dam /
translated: It is like silver in a shell.üîΩBecause it is the same as the sense faculty in terms of subsequent activity,

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid du mtshungs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid du mtshungs pa kho na'o //
translated: or it is the same in terms of producing the sense consciousness.

original: gnod par byed pa las khyad par yod pa ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa las khyad par yod pa ma yin no snyam na /
translated: There is no difference in terms of being a harm.

original: gal te 'jug pa tshad ma gzhan gyis bsal ba'i phyir gnod pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'jug pa tshad ma gzhan gyis bsal ba'i phyir gnod pa yin na /
translated: If it is a harm because the engagement is eliminated by another valid knowledge,

original: de'i tshe nyid khyad par dang bral ba'i don rtogs par byed pa'i dbang po'i rnam par shes par byed pa nyid gnod par byed pa ci ste ma yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe nyid khyad par dang bral ba'i don rtogs par byed pa'i dbang po'i rnam par shes par byed pa nyid gnod par byed pa ci ste ma yin /
translated: then at that time, why is the sense consciousness that realizes an object devoid of difference not a harm?

original: dngul bzhin du slu ba dang ldan pa'i lhag par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dngul bzhin du slu ba dang ldan pa'i lhag par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is not attached to the object as if it were a deceptive coin.

original: 'o na ji ltar skye bo nya phyis dngos po gzhan du rtog par @9b rlom pa de bzhin du 'di 'dra ba'o snyam par rtogs la /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar skye bo nya phyis dngos po gzhan du rtog par @9b rlom pa de bzhin du 'di 'dra ba'o snyam par rtogs la /
translated: But just as the oyster conceives of the object as something else, so too does the mind conceive of it as such.

original: yang dngos po gzhan 'dzin par rlom pa ni med do //
analyzed: yang dngos po gzhan 'dzin par rlom pa ni med do //
translated: And it does not conceive of it as something else, as an object grasped.

original: 'on kyang gsal bas 'dzin pa kho na rlom pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gsal bas 'dzin pa kho na rlom pa yin te /
translated: But it conceives of it as a clear object grasped.

original: de na mi slu ba dang ldan par rtogs par ga la thal /
analyzed: de na mi slu ba dang ldan par rtogs par ga la thal /
translated: How then could it follow that it is conceived as nondeceptive?

original: de kho na sems par byed pa ni rnam par rtog pa la dngos po snang bar ma mthong ba dang / dngos po snang ba la yang brtag pa'i rnam par sgro mi 'dogs pa na /
analyzed: de kho na sems par byed pa ni rnam par rtog pa la dngos po snang bar ma mthong ba dang / dngos po snang ba la yang brtag pa'i rnam par sgro mi 'dogs pa na /
translated: When one reflects on reality, one does not see the appearance of an object in conceptual thought, and one does not superimpose the form of an object on the appearance of an object.

original: 'di ni shes pa'i rnam pa tsam mam brdzun pa snang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i blor 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ni shes pa'i rnam pa tsam mam brdzun pa snang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i blor 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: One simply has the idea that it is the mere aspect of consciousness or a false appearance.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i byed pa de nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i byed pa de nyid ston pa ni /
translated: The same text explains the function of the sense consciousnesses:

original: mdun du gnas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩgal te yang lhag par zhen pa'i dbang gis spyi nges pa yin no zhes brjod pa de la yang lhag par zhen kyang ste /
analyzed: mdun du gnas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // gal te yang lhag par zhen pa'i dbang gis spyi nges pa yin no zhes brjod pa de la yang lhag par zhen kyang ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe universal is ascertained through the power of the superimposition of a non-existent universal.‚Äù

original: lhag par zhen pa sgrub par byed pa yin yang logs shig tu 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: lhag par zhen pa sgrub par byed pa yin yang logs shig tu 'dra ba ste /
translated: Even if one says that the universal is ascertained through the power of superimposition, the superimposition is not established, because the cognition of similarity is not separate from the cognition of the individual.

original: spyi rtogs pa nges pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi rtogs pa nges pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if there is superimposition, the cognition of similarity does not ascertain the universal,

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ni 'dra ba'i rdzas gcig pu'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ni 'dra ba'i rdzas gcig pu'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the pervasion and the counter-pervasion have as their object the single substance of similarity.

original: de ltar ma yin na du ba yang me'i rgyu can du mi 'gyur ro //üîΩdes na / so sor rtog pa yod min pa /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na du ba yang me'i rgyu can du mi 'gyur ro // des na / so sor rtog pa yod min pa /
translated: Otherwise, smoke would not be the effect of fire.

original: zhes byed pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes byed pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, it is said, ‚ÄúThere is no discernment of the individual.‚Äù

original: snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood as before.

original: gal te spyi med par mtshungs pa'i blo 'gyur na rta la yang ba lang gi blor ci ste mi 'gyur snyam na 'o na ni chu la yang du ba ci ste med ces mtshungs so //
analyzed: gal te spyi med par mtshungs pa'i blo 'gyur na rta la yang ba lang gi blor ci ste mi 'gyur snyam na 'o na ni chu la yang du ba ci ste med ces mtshungs so //
translated: If the cognition of similarity occurs without a universal, why does a cognition of cow not occur with regard to a horse? Well then, why does a cognition of smoke not occur with regard to water? It is the same.

original: 'o na de la yang me nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa yin no snyam na de lta na ni 'o na mthong ba'i me ni bsnyon la ma mthong ba'i me nyid kyi sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa chenüîΩpo yin no //
analyzed: 'o na de la yang me nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa yin no snyam na de lta na ni 'o na mthong ba'i me ni bsnyon la ma mthong ba'i me nyid kyi sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa chen po yin no //
translated: But if you think that fire itself follows after and reverses, then it is a great error for those who think that fire is seen to be refuted and fire itself is imagined to be unseen.

original: me yang rgyur 'gyur la rag go zhe na /
analyzed: me yang rgyur 'gyur la rag go zhe na /
translated: If you say that fire is the cause,

original: de nyid kyis 'grub pa'i phyir gzhan gyis ci bya /üîΩme nyid med na mer ji ltar 'gyur te de lta ma yin na chu yang me ci'i phyir ma yin snyam na me nyid kyang me nyid med par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis 'grub pa'i phyir gzhan gyis ci bya / me nyid med na mer ji ltar 'gyur te de lta ma yin na chu yang me ci'i phyir ma yin snyam na me nyid kyang me nyid med par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: then since it is established by that, what is the use of another?üîΩIf fire itself does not exist, how could it be fire? If it were not so, why would water not be fire?

original: de lta ma yin na chu yang me nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro zhes mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na chu yang me nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro zhes mtshungs pa'o //
translated: But how could fire itself be fire if fire itself does not exist? If it were not so, it would follow that water would be fire.

original: de'i phyir rang gi rgyu brgyud pas byas pa'i nus pa can gyi dngos po ni 'ga' zhig nyid rnam pa de lta bu'i don byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'dra ba'i blo yang 'dra ba'i rgyus bskyed pa'i dngos po'i khyad nyams su myong ba las byung ba yin mod
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi rgyu brgyud pas byas pa'i nus pa can gyi dngos po ni 'ga' zhig nyid rnam pa de lta bu'i don byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'dra ba'i blo yang 'dra ba'i rgyus bskyed pa'i dngos po'i khyad nyams su myong ba las byung ba yin mod
translated: Therefore, some things that are endowed with the capacity created by their own causal continuum perform a function in that way. Therefore, the cognition of similarity arises from the experience of the particular thing that is produced by a similar cause.

original: kyi / de nas shugs kyis 'dra ba mi 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: kyi / de nas shugs kyis 'dra ba mi 'grub pa'o //
translated: But similarity is not established by implication.

original: da'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: da'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù concludes the argument.

original: don gzhan rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba'i rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gzhan rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba'i rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Because there is no cognition of a different object‚Äù means because there is no cognition of similarity.

original: rigs pa can gyi 'dra ba @10a * //üîΩlas rtogs pa gang yin pa'i nye bar 'jal ba de ni dmigs pa med pa yin te //
analyzed: rigs pa can gyi 'dra ba @10a * // las rtogs pa gang yin pa'i nye bar 'jal ba de ni dmigs pa med pa yin te //
translated: The NaiyƒÅyikas‚Äô cognition of similarityüîΩis a presumption that is without a basis.

original: tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not a valid cognition. This is the meaning.

original: gal te 'dra ba med du chug mod //
analyzed: gal te 'dra ba med du chug mod //
translated: Even if similarity does not exist,

original: der zhen pa ni re zhig yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: der zhen pa ni re zhig yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: the conception of it does exist.

original: des byas pa ming dang 'brel pa'i rtogs pa go ci ste tshad ma ma yin /
analyzed: des byas pa ming dang 'brel pa'i rtogs pa go ci ste tshad ma ma yin /
translated: Why is the cognition that is related to the name not a valid cognition?

original: 'on te tshad ma yin pa'i zhes pas byas pa tshad mar ji ltar 'gyur zhes brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te tshad ma yin pa'i zhes pas byas pa tshad mar ji ltar 'gyur zhes brjod na /
translated: If it is said that it is a valid cognition, how can the production of a valid cognition be a valid cognition?

original: ji ltar tshad ma yin pas skyed pa rtog pa med pa'i mngon sum tshad ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar tshad ma yin pas skyed pa rtog pa med pa'i mngon sum tshad ma yin /
translated: Since it is a valid cognition, the production of a non-conceptual direct perception is a valid cognition.

original: des na rgyu tshad ma yin pas ni ci yang byar med do zhe na /
analyzed: des na rgyu tshad ma yin pas ni ci yang byar med do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since the cause is a valid cognition, there is nothing to be done.

original: gal te 'dra bar brtags na ming dang ming can gyi 'brel ba zhes bya ba ni brda tsam la rag las pa nyid kyi dngos po pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gal te 'dra bar brtags na ming dang ming can gyi 'brel ba zhes bya ba ni brda tsam la rag las pa nyid kyi dngos po pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: If it is examined as similar, the so-called relation between the name and the named is dependent only on mere convention, and is not real at all.

original: de bas na de'i rgyu tshul can gyi rtog pa yang dmigs pa med pa nyid do phyogs 'di la ni 'dra ba'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'i bsdu bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na de'i rgyu tshul can gyi rtog pa yang dmigs pa med pa nyid do phyogs 'di la ni 'dra ba'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'i bsdu bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the cognition that has the nature of its cause is also without an object. In this position, what is called a similar cognition is included in the fifth case,

original: 'dra ba las rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dra ba las rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: meaning a cognition from similarity.

original: spyi'i shes pa zhes drug pa'i bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: spyi'i shes pa zhes drug pa'i bsdu ba ni /
translated: The inclusion in the sixth case, as a general cognition,üîΩis as follows.

original: bram ze'i nye bar 'jal ba yang bzung ngo //
analyzed: bram ze'i nye bar 'jal ba yang bzung ngo //
translated: The Brahmanical theory of upamƒÅna is also accepted.

original: ji skad du ;
analyzed: ji skad du ;
translated: As it is said:

original: gang zhig de las 'dra ba yis //
analyzed: gang zhig de las 'dra ba yis //
translated: That which is similar to it

original: khyad par can nam der brten pa'i //
analyzed: khyad par can nam der brten pa'i //
translated: is distinguished by it or is based on it,

original: 'dra ba nyid du dran 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid du dran 'gyur te //
translated: and is remembered as similar to it;

original: nye bar 'jal ba'i gzhal bya yin //
analyzed: nye bar 'jal ba'i gzhal bya yin //
translated: it is the object of upamƒÅna.

original: zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: 'dis ni ba lang mthong nas ba min mthong ba na /
analyzed: 'dis ni ba lang mthong nas ba min mthong ba na /
translated: When one sees a cow and then sees a non-cow,

original: 'di dang 'dra ba de ni ba lang gi sgras brjod par bya ba yin no zhe'am de'i 'di dang 'dra ba nyid ni ba lang gi sgras brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bya bar chos can dang chos kyi rtogs pa'i yul nyid kyis rtogs pa'i rnam pa
analyzed: 'di dang 'dra ba de ni ba lang gi sgras brjod par bya ba yin no zhe'am de'i 'di dang 'dra ba nyid ni ba lang gi sgras brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bya bar chos can dang chos kyi rtogs pa'i yul nyid kyis rtogs pa'i rnam pa
translated: one thinks, ‚ÄúThat which is similar to this is denoted by the word ‚Äòcow,‚Äô‚Äù or ‚ÄúIts similarity to that is denoted by the word ‚Äòcow.‚Äô‚Äù Thus, by the object of the cognition of the property and the property possessor,

original: gnyis nye bar 'jal pa yin yang brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis nye bar 'jal pa yin yang brjod pa yin no //
translated: the two are compared and expressed.

original: de la 'dra bar rtogs pa'i rang bzhin yul med par bstan pas de'i khyad par can 'dra ba can du rtogs pa'i rang bzhin yang sun phyung bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dra bar rtogs pa'i rang bzhin yul med par bstan pas de'i khyad par can 'dra ba can du rtogs pa'i rang bzhin yang sun phyung bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: In that case, by showing that the nature of cognizing similarity does not have an object, it should be understood that the nature of cognizing the possessor of similarity as similar is also refuted.

original: gang yang ba lang dang 'dra ba ba min yin no zhes brjod pa las ba min gyi ba lang dang 'dra ba nyid rtogs pa yin no zhes gna' rabs dag zer ba de yang 'di nyid kyis bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: gang yang ba lang dang 'dra ba ba min yin no zhes brjod pa las ba min gyi ba lang dang 'dra ba nyid rtogs pa yin no zhes gna' rabs dag zer ba de yang 'di nyid kyis bsal ba yin no //
translated: But this is refuted by the above argument.

original: gal te 'dra ba nyid med pa'i phyir 'dra bar rtogs pa dmigs pa med pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'dra ba nyid med pa'i phyir 'dra bar rtogs pa dmigs pa med pa nyid yin na /
translated: If, because there is no similarity, the cognition of similarity is not a perception,

original: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma 'dra ba'i yul can du 'dod snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma 'dra ba'i yul can du 'dod snyam na /
translated: then how can inference be accepted as having a similar object?

original: rjes su dpag pa'i rtog pa la ni zhes gsungs so //üîΩdbang po rnam par shes pas ma mthong ba'i 'dra ba nyid dam de'i khyad par can gyi 'dra ba nges par byed pa ni rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin gyi 'on kyang dpe la mthong ba'i rang bzhin nyid lhag par sgro @10b btags te 'dra bar
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i rtog pa la ni zhes gsungs so // dbang po rnam par shes pas ma mthong ba'i 'dra ba nyid dam de'i khyad par can gyi 'dra ba nges par byed pa ni rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin gyi 'on kyang dpe la mthong ba'i rang bzhin nyid lhag par sgro @10b btags te 'dra bar
translated: The response to this is, ‚ÄúThe thought of inference . . .‚ÄùüîΩInference is not a valid cognition that ascertains similarity that is not seen by the consciousness of the sense faculties or similarity that is qualified by that.

original: shes pa'o zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'o zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: However, it is said that it is a cognition that superimposes the nature of what is seen in the example onto the object of inference.

original: 'di ltar ri zhol na gnas pa'i me ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa ma yin la de nyid ni rtogs pa yang min no //
analyzed: 'di ltar ri zhol na gnas pa'i me ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa ma yin la de nyid ni rtogs pa yang min no //
translated: Thus, the fire that exists in the mountain is not a conceptual cognition of its own characteristic, nor is it a realization.

original: de yang dpe la mthong ba med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang dpe la mthong ba med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: And it is not the case that there is no seeing of an example.

original: des na de dang 'dra bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de dang 'dra bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be like that.

original: 'dra ba gzhan med kyang de yin pa las bzlog pas 'di ni 'dra ba'i tha snyad tsam yin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan med kyang de yin pa las bzlog pas 'di ni 'dra ba'i tha snyad tsam yin no //
translated: Even though there is no other similarity, it is merely a conventional similarity because it is the opposite of that.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma ni dngos yul can yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma ni dngos yul can yin te /
translated: Inference is a valid cognition that has a real object,

original: mngon par bsam pa las mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par bsam pa las mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is nondeceptive with regard to what is directly intended.

original: gzhan gyi nye bar 'jal ba ni dngos por gyur pa'i 'dra ba'i yul can dang / de rtogs par byas pa ming dang ming can gyi 'brel pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir nyes par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi nye bar 'jal ba ni dngos por gyur pa'i 'dra ba'i yul can dang / de rtogs par byas pa ming dang ming can gyi 'brel pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir nyes par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: The other, comparison, has as its object a real similarity, and it has as its object the relation between a word and the entity that is the referent of the word that is being learned.

original: gal te de lta na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gal te de lta na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: If that is so, this is the opponent's response.

original: brda'i dus su mthong ba nyid dus gzhan sgra las dran pa yin no //
analyzed: brda'i dus su mthong ba nyid dus gzhan sgra las dran pa yin no //
translated: At the time of the convention, it is seeing itself that is remembered at another time from the word.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni gzhan du mthong ba'i mtshan mo za ba 'ga' zhig tu don gyis go bas dran pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni gzhan du mthong ba'i mtshan mo za ba 'ga' zhig tu don gyis go bas dran pa'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù are understood to mean that some other things are remembered by implication, such as the eating of the owl at night.

original: 'di la zhes pa ni lan no //
analyzed: 'di la zhes pa ni lan no //
translated: ‚Äú In this case‚Äù is the reply.

original: skra shad la sogs don min te //
analyzed: skra shad la sogs don min te //
translated: ‚Äú The hairs and so on are not objects‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba 'dis 'di lta bu thams cad bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis 'di lta bu thams cad bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that all such things are explained.

original: de bzhin du gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú In the same way, in other cases‚Äù

original: gang dang gang du slu bar mos pa'am /
analyzed: gang dang gang du slu bar mos pa'am /
translated: means that in whatever cases one is deceived,

original: bsgrub par bya ba de bzhin du 'byung bar nges mi nus par te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba de bzhin du 'byung bar nges mi nus par te /
translated: one cannot be certain that the object will appear in the same way,

original: dper na gzugs brnyan dang gtan tshigs ltar snang bas bskyed pa'i shes pa la sogs pa rnams la'o ;
analyzed: dper na gzugs brnyan dang gtan tshigs ltar snang bas bskyed pa'i shes pa la sogs pa rnams la'o ;
translated: just as in the case of the consciousness produced by a reflection or a fallacious reason.

original: / sgra yi yul dang yul min phyir //
analyzed: / sgra yi yul dang yul min phyir //
translated: ‚Äú Because the object of a word is not an object‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: is explained by the words ‚Äúbecause the object of a word is not an object. ‚Äù

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the words ‚Äúif‚Äù and so on is as follows.

original: 'dir ni tshad ma'i yul nyid gyur pa'i spyi dpyad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni tshad ma'i yul nyid gyur pa'i spyi dpyad par bya ba yin te /
translated: Here, the universal that is the object of a valid cognition is to be examined.

original: des na de'i yul can gyi shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir yang tshad mar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no ;
analyzed: des na de'i yul can gyi shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir yang tshad mar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no ;
translated: Therefore, because it is the cause of the consciousness that has it as its object, it is valid knowledge.

original: /'on te shes pa nyid tshad mar 'dod de zhes brjod na /
analyzed: /'on te shes pa nyid tshad mar 'dod de zhes brjod na /
translated: But if you say that consciousness itself is asserted to be valid knowledge,

original: 'di la zhen pa med do //
analyzed: 'di la zhen pa med do //
translated: then there is no attachment to this.

original: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa nyid tshang mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa nyid tshang mar 'gyur ro //
translated: Consciousness itself that arises from sound would be valid knowledge.

original: des na mi 'dod pa mi ldog go zhe na /
analyzed: des na mi 'dod pa mi ldog go zhe na /
translated: Therefore, what is not accepted would not be averted.

original: lan smras pa'i bsam pa ni gal te sgra tsam gyi dbang du byas nas de skad brjod pa ni de'i tshe de la spyi'i yul can nyid yod pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: lan smras pa'i bsam pa ni gal te sgra tsam gyi dbang du byas nas de skad brjod pa ni de'i tshe de la spyi'i yul can nyid yod pa ma yin te ;
translated: The intention of the answer is this: If you say that in terms of mere sound, then at that time it does not have a universal as its object,

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: because the definition of a universal is a specific characteristic.

original: sgra tsam gyi brjod par bya ba ni yod par ma nges pas na de rang gi mtshan nyid ga la yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra tsam gyi brjod par bya ba ni yod par ma nges pas na de rang gi mtshan nyid ga la yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since what is to be expressed by mere sound is not ascertained to exist, how can it be a specific characteristic?

original: gal te sgra rnams spyi'i yul can du 'dod pa nyid ma yin nam snyam na /
analyzed: gal te sgra rnams spyi'i yul can du 'dod pa nyid ma yin nam snyam na /
translated: If you think that it is not asserted that sound itself has a universal as its object,üîΩthen how could it be valid knowledge?

original: ma yin te sel ba yul can du 'dod pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: ma yin te sel ba yul can du 'dod pa'i phyir ro//
translated: No, because it is asserted that exclusion is the object of the mind.

original: @11a * // rjes su 'gro bar snang ba'i dbang gis de nyid la spyi'i tha snyad tsam du byas par zad do //
analyzed: @11a * // rjes su 'gro bar snang ba'i dbang gis de nyid la spyi'i tha snyad tsam du byas par zad do //
translated: By the power of appearing to follow, it is merely designated as a universal in that.

original: 'dis ni gal te sel ba thams cad la spyi'i tha snyad yin pa de lta na yang gang la lhag par zhen par byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni gal te sel ba thams cad la spyi'i tha snyad yin pa de lta na yang gang la lhag par zhen par byas pa'o //
translated: This means that even if the term universal is used for all exclusions, it is only in relation to what is conceived of as special.

original: dngos po yod par zhen pa der de kho nar spyi nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: dngos po yod par zhen pa der de kho nar spyi nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: When there is conception of an existent thing, the universal is posited as such in reality.

original: gzhan du ni tha snyad tsam mo zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni tha snyad tsam mo zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Otherwise, it is merely a convention.

original: des na gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid kyi sgra nyid spyi'i yul can yin pa'i phyir na tshad mar rigs so //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid kyi sgra nyid spyi'i yul can yin pa'i phyir na tshad mar rigs so //
translated: Thus, the term itself, which is the nature of inference for the sake of others, is a valid cognition because it has a universal as its object.

original: gal te sgra ni nye bar btags pa'i tshad ma ma yin /
analyzed: gal te sgra ni nye bar btags pa'i tshad ma ma yin /
translated: If a term is not a valid cognition that is applied,

original: spyi'i yul can nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: spyi'i yul can nyid yin na ni /
translated: and it has a universal as its object,

original: dngos kyi tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ro snyam /
analyzed: dngos kyi tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ro snyam /
translated: then it would be a direct valid cognition.

original: de lta ma yin te gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la spyi'i yul can nyid du nye bar btags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la spyi'i yul can nyid du nye bar btags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not so, because it is figuratively designated as having a universal for its object in the inference for the sake of another.

original: spyi'i yul can ni sgra brtan pa tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyis bskyed pa'i rjes su dpag pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i yul can ni sgra brtan pa tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyis bskyed pa'i rjes su dpag pa kho na yin no //
translated: An inference that has a universal for its object is only that which is generated by a sign that is the property of the counterpositive of the probandum.

original: gal te sgra bsgrub par bya ba'i yul can nyid kyis spyi'i yul can ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te sgra bsgrub par bya ba'i yul can nyid kyis spyi'i yul can ma yin no //
translated: If it is not one that has a universal for its object because it has sound for its object of affirmation,

original: sgrub par byed pa tshul gsum pa'i yul can nyid kyis spyi'i yul can yin par 'gyur te /üîΩdes bstan par bya ba ni /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa tshul gsum pa'i yul can nyid kyis spyi'i yul can yin par 'gyur te / des bstan par bya ba ni /
translated: then it would be one that has a universal for its object because it has the property of the counterpositive of the probandum for its object of affirmation.

original: de yin pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
analyzed: de yin pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
translated: Because that is what is indicated by it.

original: ma yin te de la yang des bstan pa tsam byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te de la yang des bstan pa tsam byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because it is merely indicated by it.

original: tshul gsum nges pa ni tshad ma gsum kho na las yin no //
analyzed: tshul gsum nges pa ni tshad ma gsum kho na las yin no //
translated: The ascertainment of the trimodal condition is only from the three valid cognitions.

original: 'o na spyi'i lus can gyi sgra gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na spyi'i lus can gyi sgra gang yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is a sound that has a universal for its body?

original: de kho nar ni 'gal yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de kho nar ni 'gal yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not contradictory that it is just that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sgra ni 'ga' yang tshad ma nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sgra ni 'ga' yang tshad ma nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, no verbal testimony whatsoever is a validating cognition.

original: tshad mas mi slu ba'i dngos po ston par byed pa na /
analyzed: tshad mas mi slu ba'i dngos po ston par byed pa na /
translated: When verbal testimony presents a non-deceptive entity,

original: ji ltar sgra gzhan la ltos nas gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa dang gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa 'phen par byed pa skad cig ma la sogs pa ston par byed pa'i ngag la mi slu ba nyid du lhag par zhen pa de bzhin
analyzed: ji ltar sgra gzhan la ltos nas gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa dang gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa 'phen par byed pa skad cig ma la sogs pa ston par byed pa'i ngag la mi slu ba nyid du lhag par zhen pa de bzhin
translated: just as one infers the meaning for another in dependence on another, and just as one infers the meaning for another by the statement that projects the inference of momentariness, etc., one is convinced of the non-deceptiveness of the statement.

original: du tshad ma'i tha snyad kyang yin no //
analyzed: du tshad ma'i tha snyad kyang yin no //
translated: In the same way, there is the convention of validating cognition.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de nyid sgra'i yul yin gyi /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de nyid sgra'i yul yin gyi /
translated: Whatever is the universal characteristic is the object of verbal testimony,

original: gzhan sgra'i yul ma yin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan sgra'i yul ma yin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but nothing else is the object of verbal testimony.

original: mi 'dod pa'i nges par gzung ba dgag pa brjod pa ni sgra'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa'i nges par gzung ba dgag pa brjod pa ni sgra'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The negation of the exclusion of the undesirable is stated in the phrase ‚Äúthe object of verbal testimony,‚Äù etc.

original: des na me'i sbyin sreg mtho ris sgrub par byed pa la sogs pa'i ngag tshad mar ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na me'i sbyin sreg mtho ris sgrub par byed pa la sogs pa'i ngag tshad mar ga la 'gyur te /
translated: How can statements such as ‚ÄúThe fire sacrifice accomplishes heaven,‚Äù etc., be validating cognitions?

original: de'i yul dngos po nyid yin par the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul dngos po nyid yin par the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is doubt about whether the object of that is a real thing.

original: tshad ma drug sngon du 'gro ba can don gyis go ba'i tshogs la yang mdor na gang la med na mi 'byung ba'i dngos po'i stobs kyis 'ga' zhig tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa de ni rjes su @11b dpag pa nyid tshad ma yin la gang
analyzed: tshad ma drug sngon du 'gro ba can don gyis go ba'i tshogs la yang mdor na gang la med na mi 'byung ba'i dngos po'i stobs kyis 'ga' zhig tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa de ni rjes su @11b dpag pa nyid tshad ma yin la gang
translated: In brief, with regard to the collection of inferences that are preceded by the six valid knowledges, that which is an inference is a valid knowledge in that it is a cognition of a hidden object by the power of a real thing that is a pervasion.

original: du tshul gsum las gang yang rung ba zhig med dam the tshom za ba de ni bsgrub bya nges pa me dpa'i phyir na spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par gnas pa ma yin la /
analyzed: du tshul gsum las gang yang rung ba zhig med dam the tshom za ba de ni bsgrub bya nges pa me dpa'i phyir na spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par gnas pa ma yin la /
translated: In that case, if any of the three modes is not established or there is doubt, then because the predicate is not ascertained, the general definition is not established.

original: de'i yul can gyi shes pa yang tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi shes pa yang tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: And the consciousness that is the subject of that is a valid knowledge.

original: dngos po med pa'i tshad ma yang tsha ma grub pa'i le'u nyid du sun phyung pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i tshad ma yang tsha ma grub pa'i le'u nyid du sun phyung pa yin no //
translated: Also, the valid knowledge of nonthings is refuted in the chapter on the establishment of valid knowledge.

original: ji skad du sgra'i yul ma yin pa rang gi mtshan nyid yin no zhes brjod pa der yang gang zhig sgra'i yul ma yin pa de thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid yin zhes brjod pa der yang gang zhig sgra'i yul ma yin pa de thams cad rang gi
analyzed: ji skad du sgra'i yul ma yin pa rang gi mtshan nyid yin no zhes brjod pa der yang gang zhig sgra'i yul ma yin pa de thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid yin zhes brjod pa der yang gang zhig sgra'i yul ma yin pa de thams cad rang gi
translated: Just as it is said, ‚ÄúThe object of a term is not the intrinsic identity,‚Äù so too it should be understood that ‚Äúwhatever is not the object of a term is its intrinsic identity.‚Äù

original: mtshan nyid yin no zhes rtogs par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid yin no zhes rtogs par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir na /
translated: To prevent the error that whatever is not the object of a term is its intrinsic identity,

original: yul ma yin par yang zhes bya ba'i /üîΩdes na 'di la skyon med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yul ma yin par yang zhes bya ba'i / des na 'di la skyon med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the phrase ‚Äúnot the object of a term‚Äù is stated.üîΩThus, this is faultless.

original: phyin ci log tu nges par bzung bas byas te /üîΩsgra tshad mar thal ba'am /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu nges par bzung bas byas te / sgra tshad mar thal ba'am /
translated: This is said to be the error of misapprehending the object.üîΩIt follows that sound is a valid cognition,üîΩor it follows that the object illustrated by sound is intrinsic identity.

original: des nye bar mtshon pa'i sgra la sogs pa'i bsrung ba yang rang gi mtshan nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa gang yin pa ste de gnyi ga yang skyon gyi sgras bsgos pa yin no //
analyzed: des nye bar mtshon pa'i sgra la sogs pa'i bsrung ba yang rang gi mtshan nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa gang yin pa ste de gnyi ga yang skyon gyi sgras bsgos pa yin no //
translated: Both of these are errors that are imputed by the term fault.

original: des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthus, this is faultless‚Äù concludes the section.

original: 'ga' zhig ni spyi yin la zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni spyi yin la zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul lo //
translated: Some are universals, i.e., the objects of inference.

original: 'ga' zhig ni don med pa zhes bya ba ni sgra dang gtan tshigs ltar snang la sogs pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni don med pa zhes bya ba ni sgra dang gtan tshigs ltar snang la sogs pa'i yul lo //
translated: Some are unreal, i.e., the objects of fallacious verbal and inferential cognition.

original: gcig ni rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mngon sum gyi yul lo ;
analyzed: gcig ni rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mngon sum gyi yul lo ;
translated: One is a particular, i.e., the object of perception.

original: / don med pa zhes bya ba ni skra shad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / don med pa zhes bya ba ni skra shad la sogs pa'o //
translated: An unreal object is a non-existent object such as a sky-flower or a double moon.

original: ji ltar shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi don yin yang don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba de ltar ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi don yin yang don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba de ltar ni bshad zin to //
translated: Although it is an object of cognition, it is unreal.

original: mtshan nyid gzhan 'chad pa ni rgyu mtshan gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan 'chad pa ni rgyu mtshan gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: A different reason is a different cause.

original: 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan gzhan yod pa ni gang la blo yod par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan gzhan yod pa ni gang la blo yod par 'gyur ba /
translated: Here, as before, it should be said that the existence of a different reason is the existence of a cause of the cognition of a universal.

original: de ni spyi nyid do zhes ni nges par mi bzung ste /
analyzed: de ni spyi nyid do zhes ni nges par mi bzung ste /
translated: But it is not ascertained that that is a universal.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang de ltar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang de ltar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that a rabbit‚Äôs horns, etc., are also that.

original: 'on kyang rgyu mtshan gzhan yod na rung ba'i yul na gnas pa la mi ltos par dngos por mngon par 'dod gang la blo yod pa de kho na spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu mtshan gzhan yod na rung ba'i yul na gnas pa la mi ltos par dngos por mngon par 'dod gang la blo yod pa de kho na spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: But if there is another reason, then the existence of cognition is the universal characteristic of only that which has cognition, without regard to the presence of a suitable object.

original: 'dis ni gal te rung ba'i yul na de gnas par na blo yod na de'i tshe spyi la ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni gal te rung ba'i yul na de gnas par na blo yod na de'i tshe spyi la ma yin te /
translated: This means that if cognition exists when there is a suitable object, then it is not a universal,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: but rather a particular characteristic.

original: yang na zhes bya ba ni bshad pa gzhan gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba ni bshad pa gzhan gsungs pa'o //
translated: Or, the phrase ‚Äúor else‚Äù indicates another explanation.

original: phyogs snga ma la ni rgyu mtshan gzhan zhes bya bas lta dang rtsol ba la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma la ni rgyu mtshan gzhan zhes bya bas lta dang rtsol ba la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: In the opponent‚Äôs view, ‚Äúanother reason‚Äù refers to seeing, effort, etc.

original: de lta na ni yul 'dzin bar /üîΩblo'i @12a * //
analyzed: de lta na ni yul 'dzin bar / blo'i @12a * //
translated: In that case, the existence of cognition is the universal characteristic of only that which has cognition, without regard to the presence of a suitable object.

original: yul rung ba'i yul na gnas pa la ltos nas rgyu mtshan gzhan mig la sogs pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: yul rung ba'i yul na gnas pa la ltos nas rgyu mtshan gzhan mig la sogs pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: The existence of cognition is the universal characteristic of only that which has cognition, without regard to the presence of a suitable object.

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa yod kyang rung ba'i yul na gnas pa med pa'i phyir na gang la de 'dzin ba'i blo skye ba med pa de ni'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa yod kyang rung ba'i yul na gnas pa med pa'i phyir na gang la de 'dzin ba'i blo skye ba med pa de ni'o //
translated: The other reason is that even if the eye, etc. exist, the object does not exist in the field. Therefore, the cognition that apprehends it does not arise.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: That itself is stated by ‚Äúby its own nature,‚Äù etc.

original: dal rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni skabs don bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: dal rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni skabs don bsdus pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy its own nature,‚Äù etc. is the summary of the topic.

original: 'di la gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtsod do //
analyzed: 'di la gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtsod do //
translated: Here, the objection is stated by ‚ÄúIf, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te yang rtogs pa'i rnam pa tha dad pas na yul rnam pa gnyis su brjod pa de lta na yang tshad ma'i khyad par gyi bshad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang rtogs pa'i rnam pa tha dad pas na yul rnam pa gnyis su brjod pa de lta na yang tshad ma'i khyad par gyi bshad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Even if the object is said to be twofold by the difference in the aspects of cognition, still, the explanation of the difference of valid cognition is not so.

original: lde byed pa yang ni nyes pa ma mthong nas rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: lde byed pa yang ni nyes pa ma mthong nas rtsod pa'o //
translated: The opponent argues without seeing the fault.

original: rnam par rtog pa tham la tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis 'gal ba brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa tham la tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis 'gal ba brjod pa yin no //
translated: In one verse, the contradiction is stated to the conception.

original: 'di snyam du tshad ma gnyis su med pa'i phyir gzhal bya gnyis su 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni 'on te tshad ma gnyis kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di snyam du tshad ma gnyis su med pa'i phyir gzhal bya gnyis su 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni 'on te tshad ma gnyis kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Anticipating the qualm, ‚ÄúSince there are two valid cognitions, there are two objects of comprehension,‚Äù he says, ‚ÄúBut if you say that two valid cognitions are established by two objects of comprehension.‚Äù

original: yul gnyis kyis tshad ma gnyis yin la ;
analyzed: yul gnyis kyis tshad ma gnyis yin la ;
translated: Two valid cognitions are established by two objects.

original: tshad ma gnyis kyis kyang yul gnyis yin pa'i phyir phan tshun bsten pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma gnyis kyis kyang yul gnyis yin pa'i phyir phan tshun bsten pa yin no //
translated: And two objects are established by two valid cognitions. Therefore they are mutually dependent.

original: 'dis ni ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not unestablished.

original: ci ste tshad ma gnyis la ltos nas gzhal bya gnyis su brjod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ci ste tshad ma gnyis la ltos nas gzhal bya gnyis su brjod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: But if you say that the two objects of comprehension are not stated in dependence on two valid cognitions,

original: 'on kyang rtogs pa'i gzhal bya gnyis nyid kyis tshad ma gnyis sgrub par byed pa yin pa des na phan tshun bsten pa ma yin no snyam na tshad ma gsum la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rtogs pa'i gzhal bya gnyis nyid kyis tshad ma gnyis sgrub par byed pa yin pa des na phan tshun bsten pa ma yin no snyam na tshad ma gsum la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: but rather that the two valid cognitions are established by the two objects of comprehension that are to be realized, and therefore they are not mutually dependent, then there would be the fallacy of infinite regress.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The point is this.

original: ji ltar mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ni mngon sum yin la rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa de bzhin du rig byed kyis rtogs pa ni nye bar bstan par bya ba nye bar 'jal bas ni nye bar gzhal bar
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ni mngon sum yin la rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa de bzhin du rig byed kyis rtogs pa ni nye bar bstan par bya ba nye bar 'jal bas ni nye bar gzhal bar
translated: Just as what is understood by perception is the object of perception, and what is understood by inference is the object of inference, in the same way, what is understood by verbal testimony is the object of verbal testimony, what is understood by analogy is the object of analogy, and what is understood by presumption is the object of presumption.

original: bya ba don gyis go ba la sogs pas ni don gyis go ba'i yul bsgrub par bya ba min pa'i phyir blar 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: bya ba don gyis go ba la sogs pas ni don gyis go ba'i yul bsgrub par bya ba min pa'i phyir blar 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: But since the object of implication, etc., is not to be established, they are not valid cognitions, because they are contradictory.

original: 'di ltar gzhal bya de yul gyi nye ba gang yin pa de ni tshad ma'i dbye ba 'jug pas grub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhal bya de yul gyi nye ba gang yin pa de ni tshad ma'i dbye ba 'jug pas grub par byed pa yin no //
translated: The object to be understood is established by the application of the divisions of valid cognition to the object that is to be understood.

original: des na ji ltar mngon sum las tha dad pa'i rjes su dpag pas rjes su dpag par bya ba'i yul nye bar 'jog pa de bzhin du sgra la sgo pas kyang rang rang gi yul nye bar 'jog par byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na ji ltar mngon sum las tha dad pa'i rjes su dpag pas rjes su dpag par bya ba'i yul nye bar 'jog pa de bzhin du sgra la sgo pas kyang rang rang gi yul nye bar 'jog par byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, just as inference, which is different from perception, establishes the object of inference, in the same way, verbal testimony, etc., would establish their own objects. This is the meaning.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i dbang du byas te brjod pa ni lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i dbang du byas te brjod pa ni lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second alternative is stated in the words, ‚ÄúNor is it the case that it is not hidden.‚Äù

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows:

original: re zhig rjes su dpag pas mngon @12b sum gyi yul 'grub pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: re zhig rjes su dpag pas mngon @12b sum gyi yul 'grub pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Inference does not establish the object of perception.

original: khas blangs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: khas blangs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it the case that it is accepted.

original: gal te des lkog tu gyur pa yang rtogs par mi nus na ni de'i tshe rjes su dpag par yul rnam pa gnyis grub par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te des lkog tu gyur pa yang rtogs par mi nus na ni de'i tshe rjes su dpag par yul rnam pa gnyis grub par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If it is not possible for it to understand what is hidden, then how can inference be established as having two objects?

original: gtan tshigs brjod pa ni lkog la 'jug na yang rjes su dpag pa don med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs brjod pa ni lkog la 'jug na yang rjes su dpag pa don med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The statement of the reason, ‚ÄúBecause it is useless to infer what is already known,‚Äù and so on, is easily understood.

original: mig med mthong ba zhes bya ba bzhin zhes bya ba la ji ltar zhes bya ba bsnan par bya'o //
analyzed: mig med mthong ba zhes bya ba bzhin zhes bya ba la ji ltar zhes bya ba bsnan par bya'o //
translated: The words, ‚ÄúIt is like saying ‚ÄòThe blind man sees,‚Äô‚Äù should be supplied with the word ‚Äúnot.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdus ba'i thabs kyis rnam par rtog pa dang po yang bsal bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdus ba'i thabs kyis rnam par rtog pa dang po yang bsal bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: The words ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù indicate that the first alternative is also rejected by the method of conclusion.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te //
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te //
translated: The reply to this is as follows:

original: mngon sum ni yul gcig kho na la byed pa la 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum ni yul gcig kho na la byed pa la 'jug pa yin la /
translated: Direct perception operates on a single object alone;üîΩinference does not operate on a single object.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni gcig la yang ma yin des na gang ltar tshad ma gnyis na gang las tshad ma gnyis su 'gyur ba gzhal bya gnyis su ji ltar sgrub ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni gcig la yang ma yin des na gang ltar tshad ma gnyis na gang las tshad ma gnyis su 'gyur ba gzhal bya gnyis su ji ltar sgrub ces bya ba yin no //
translated: How can the establishment of two valid cognitions be accomplished from a single object of cognition?

original: 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe tshad ma gnyis kyis gzhal bya gnyis 'grub pa na'o //
