analyzed: 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe tshad ma gnyis kyis gzhal bya gnyis 'grub pa na'o //
translated: ‚Äú Contradictory‚Äù means that when two valid cognitions establish two objects.

original: ma nges pa nyid du yang brjod pa la gal te yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid du yang brjod pa la gal te yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Uncertain‚Äù means that even though it is said, ‚ÄúIf there is another valid cognition,‚Äù

original: yul gcig la yang tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa mi 'gal ba'i phyir na gzhal bya gnyis las tshad ma gnyis kyis ma khyab pa'o zhes ston pa ni 'brel pa grub pa med par ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul gcig la yang tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa mi 'gal ba'i phyir na gzhal bya gnyis las tshad ma gnyis kyis ma khyab pa'o zhes ston pa ni 'brel pa grub pa med par ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is shown that the engagement of another valid cognition on a single object is not contradictory, so that the two valid cognitions are not necessarily established from two objects of cognition. ‚Äú Without establishing a connection‚Äù means that

original: mngon sum ni khyab pa grub par byed pa nyid du nye bar bstan pa cung zad kyang mi nus so //
analyzed: mngon sum ni khyab pa grub par byed pa nyid du nye bar bstan pa cung zad kyang mi nus so //
translated: direct perception cannot be shown to be the producer of the pervasion at all.

original: de ni spyi'i yul na du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni spyi'i yul na du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that it is many in a single object.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang gsal ma thag pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang gsal ma thag pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Inference is also just as has been stated.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: Thus, etc. is a summary.

original: grub pa'i mtha' ni rtog pa dang po khas blangs pa yin no //üîΩgal te yul gnyis mngon sum gyis grub na /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ni rtog pa dang po khas blangs pa yin no // gal te yul gnyis mngon sum gyis grub na /
translated: The conclusion is the acceptance of the first hypothesis.

original: rjes su dpag pas ci bya ba'i rtsod pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas ci bya ba'i rtsod pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If the two objects are established by direct perception, then there is no dispute about what inference does.

original: 'di ltar mngon sum gyis ni yul gyi gnyis nyid grub kyi yul gnyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum gyis ni yul gyi gnyis nyid grub kyi yul gnyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, direct perception establishes the duality of the object, but not the two objects.

original: gal te de lta na yang chos can mngon sum gyis ma grub pa la chos ni grub po zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar yin te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang chos can mngon sum gyis ma grub pa la chos ni grub po zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar yin te /
translated: Even if that is so, how could it be that the property is established when the basis of the property is not established by direct perception?üîΩBecause the realization of the property is not without the realization of the basis of the property.

original: chos rtogs pa ni chos can rtogs pa med na med pa'i phyir ro zhe na bshad pa 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba nyid 'dra ba nyid du rtogs pa ni bya ba'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: chos rtogs pa ni chos can rtogs pa med na med pa'i phyir ro zhe na bshad pa 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba nyid 'dra ba nyid du rtogs pa ni bya ba'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: The response is that the realization of similarity and dissimilarity is the nature of the action.

original: des na rtogs par bya ba 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba nyid mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rtogs par bya ba 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba nyid mtshon pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the similarity and dissimilarity of the object to be cognized are indicated.

original: gnag gi phyir 'dar ba nyid du rtogs pa /
analyzed: gnag gi phyir 'dar ba nyid du rtogs pa /
translated: The trembling of the cow is cognized because of the shaking of the hand.

original: rtogs par bya ba 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba nyid mtshon par byed pa de ni /
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba nyid mtshon par byed pa de ni /
translated: The similarity and dissimilarity of the object to be cognized are indicated.

original: shes pa'i rnam pa la brten pa yin pa'i phyir shes pa nyid @13a * //
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa la brten pa yin pa'i phyir shes pa nyid @13a * //
translated: This is based on the aspect of consciousness, therefore, consciousness

original: de rtogs pa nyid kyi chos yin gyi yul gyi ni ma yin no zhes 'dis ni yul ma rtogs pa'i sa bon bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de rtogs pa nyid kyi chos yin gyi yul gyi ni ma yin no zhes 'dis ni yul ma rtogs pa'i sa bon bstan pa yin no //
translated: is the dharma that cognizes that, not the object. Thus, this shows that the seed of non-cognizing the object exists.

original: yul ma reg par de ji ltar 'grub pa de ston pa ni /
analyzed: yul ma reg par de ji ltar 'grub pa de ston pa ni /
translated: How is that established without contacting the object?

original: de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is also shown by

original: yul la rang rig pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: yul la rang rig pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because the self-awareness of the object does not engage,

original: rje su dpag pa don med par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rje su dpag pa don med par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: how can the postulation of it be meaningless?

original: 'on ji ltar yul ma reg pa de bzhin du de'i 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba yang mi rtogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on ji ltar yul ma reg pa de bzhin du de'i 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba yang mi rtogs par 'gyur la /
translated: If so, then just as the object is not contacted, its similarity and dissimilarity would not be cognized either.

original: rtog pa gang yin pa de yang shes pa'i rnam par gyur pa kho na yin ter /
analyzed: rtog pa gang yin pa de yang shes pa'i rnam par gyur pa kho na yin ter /
translated: And whatever thought there is, that is only a transformation of consciousness.

original: das na yul gnyis su 'grub par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: das na yul gnyis su 'grub par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: So how can there be the establishment of two objects?

original: 'on te rang gi rnam pa nyid la phyi rol tu lhag par zhen pa'i phyir na de la gnas pa'i rnam pa gnyis nyid rtogs par brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te rang gi rnam pa nyid la phyi rol tu lhag par zhen pa'i phyir na de la gnas pa'i rnam pa gnyis nyid rtogs par brjod na /
translated: But if you say that it is because of the excessive adherence to the external that the two aspects that are present in that are said to be perceived,

original: de lta na ni 'o na rang gi rnam par rtog pa nyid phyi rol rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa don med pa so na 'dug go snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na rang gi rnam par rtog pa nyid phyi rol rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa don med pa so na 'dug go snyam na /
translated: then in that case, since it is the very aspect of the thought that is the perception of the external, inference is pointless.

original: de la ni snying po med de /
analyzed: de la ni snying po med de /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa nyid la de ltar nges par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa nyid la de ltar nges par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is ascertained in that way with regard to the aspect of the thought of inference.

original: mngon sum gyi ni lkog tu gyur pa mngon du byed pa mi srid do //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi ni lkog tu gyur pa mngon du byed pa mi srid do //
translated: But it is impossible for direct perception to make manifest what is hidden.

original: de la yang gal te yang rjes su dpag pa'i rang gi rnam pa rig pa nyid kyis phyi rol rig par rnam par gzhag pa de lta na yang phyi rol la ltos nas ni de rjes su dpag pa nyid du tha snyad 'dogs pa yin gyi rang rig
analyzed: de la yang gal te yang rjes su dpag pa'i rang gi rnam pa rig pa nyid kyis phyi rol rig par rnam par gzhag pa de lta na yang phyi rol la ltos nas ni de rjes su dpag pa nyid du tha snyad 'dogs pa yin gyi rang rig
translated: If you posit that the aspect of the inference itself is aware of itself and that on that basis it is aware of external objects, then it is only in dependence on external objects that you impute the term inference.üîΩ

original: pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If you posit that the aspect of the inference itself is aware of itself, and on that basis you posit that it is aware of external objects, then it is only in dependence on external objects that you can call it an inference; it is not a case of reflexive awareness.

original: dbang po'i mngon sum bzhin du rtogs pa 'chol ba bkag pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i mngon sum bzhin du rtogs pa 'chol ba bkag pa'i don du'o //
translated: The point of the refutation is that it would be a random cognition, like a sense consciousness.

original: rtogs par bya ba'i phyi rol gyi don de yang rjes su dpag pa'i dus na 'dra ba'i rnam pa nyid du rtogs la /
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba'i phyi rol gyi don de yang rjes su dpag pa'i dus na 'dra ba'i rnam pa nyid du rtogs la /
translated: The external object that is to be cognized is cognized in the form of a likeness at the time of the inference.

original: de yang rjes su dpag pa nyid kyi byed pa po yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rjes su dpag pa nyid kyi byed pa po yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But that likeness is not the creator of the inference.

original: me bzhin du rnam pa de yang lkog tu gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: me bzhin du rnam pa de yang lkog tu gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And unlike fire, that likeness is not hidden.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i phyogs la ni rang gi snang ba ltar rung bas khyab la sems kyi chos 'ga' yang rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i phyogs la ni rang gi snang ba ltar rung bas khyab la sems kyi chos 'ga' yang rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: In the case of hidden objects, it is not possible to cognize any mental phenomenon in the way it appears.

original: de bas na rang gis rig pa'i rang gi rnam pa'i sgo nas 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba nyid du rnam par 'jog pa na /
analyzed: de bas na rang gis rig pa'i rang gi rnam pa'i sgo nas 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba nyid du rnam par 'jog pa na /
translated: Therefore, when one posits something as being similar or dissimilar by way of the aspect of its own awareness,

original: yul la brten pa yang rig pa nyid kyis grub par brjod pa yin la rjes su dpag pa don med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yul la brten pa yang rig pa nyid kyis grub par brjod pa yin la rjes su dpag pa don med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: it is said that the object is established by awareness itself, and inference is not meaningless.

original: gal te khyod kyi ltar na rna par rtog pa thams cad 'khrul pa nyid ma yin nam des na /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi ltar na rna par rtog pa thams cad 'khrul pa nyid ma yin nam des na /
translated: If, according to you, all conceptualizations are not mistaken,

original: de'i snang ba la yang ji ltar 'dra ba nyid du nges na /
analyzed: de'i snang ba la yang ji ltar 'dra ba nyid du nges na /
translated: then how is it that one is certain about the similarity of its appearance?

original: gang zhig phyi rol gyi don du ltag par zhen pa na yul gnyis su grub par 'gyur snyam na /üîΩshes pa'i rang gi ngo bo la //
analyzed: gang zhig phyi rol gyi don du ltag par zhen pa na yul gnyis su grub par 'gyur snyam na / shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo la //
translated: If one thinks that when one is attached to external objects, the object becomes established as two,üîΩit is said:üîΩIn the nature of consciousness

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.üîΩüîΩ

original: @13b ci 'di rgyal po'i bka' 'am snyam na de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: @13b ci 'di rgyal po'i bka' 'am snyam na de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: If one thinks that this is like the king‚Äôs command, then ‚Äúin that case‚Äù and so on is stated.

original: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This clarifies that:

original: brjod par bya ba'i khyad par gyi yid kyi 'gyur ba nyams su myong la /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba'i khyad par gyi yid kyi 'gyur ba nyams su myong la /
translated: Thus, one experiences the transformation of the mind that is the specific object of expression.

original: de dang rjes su mthun par gnas pa dang byed pa phrad pa'i 'thad pa 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun par gnas pa dang byed pa phrad pa'i 'thad pa 'byung ba yin te /
translated: And in accordance with that, it is tenable that the abiding and the activity meet.

original: de lta ma yin na gzhan gyi yid bzhin du nyams su ma myong ngam /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gzhan gyi yid bzhin du nyams su ma myong ngam /
translated: If it were not so, then would it not be a contradiction to say that one does not experience the other‚Äôs mind as one wishes,

original: nyams su myong ba la yid ma ches na /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba la yid ma ches na /
translated: or that one does not believe the experience?

original: bsnyon pa yin pa tshig ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: bsnyon pa yin pa tshig ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: And why would it not be a contradiction to say that the mind is not the object of the mind?

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'brel med rten la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'brel med rten la zhes gsungs so //
translated: That is why it says, ‚ÄúThe unrelated support . . . ‚Äù

original: brjod pa'i rten ni bsam pa ma yin la de yang rnam pa gnyi ga ltar yang 'di'i rgyu nyid du 'brel pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: brjod pa'i rten ni bsam pa ma yin la de yang rnam pa gnyi ga ltar yang 'di'i rgyu nyid du 'brel pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: The support of the expression is not the thought, and that is not related to this as cause, in either way.

original: / de bas na gzhal bya gnyis ni rang rig par grub pa yin no zhes bya ba la gnod pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / de bas na gzhal bya gnyis ni rang rig par grub pa yin no zhes bya ba la gnod pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no refutation of the claim that the two objects are established by reflexive awareness.

original: 'o na yul nyid tha dad par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: 'o na yul nyid tha dad par 'gyur mod /
translated: Well, then, the objects themselves would be different,

original: tshad ma go ji ltar tha dang pa /
analyzed: tshad ma go ji ltar tha dang pa /
translated: but how could the valid cognitions be different?

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i gtso bo ni de nyid yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu nas tshad ma'i dbye ba ni de tsam nyid yis 'grub pa yin no snyam du dgongs nas dngos gzhan dag gi zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i gtso bo ni de nyid yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu nas tshad ma'i dbye ba ni de tsam nyid yis 'grub pa yin no snyam du dgongs nas dngos gzhan dag gi zhes gsungs so //
translated: Anticipating the qualm that the primary thing to be established is that very [object], [Dharmakƒ´rti] thinks that the classification of valid cognition is established by just that much, and so he says, other entities.

original: dngos gzhan dag gi ni shes pa las tha dad pa dag gi'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhan dag gi ni shes pa las tha dad pa dag gi'o //
translated: Other entities are those that are different from cognition.

original: shes pa tha dad pa de nyid kyi ngo bo gang la yod pa de ni de'i ngo bor 'gyur ba'i tshad ma'i dbye ba ste de cis mi grub /
analyzed: shes pa tha dad pa de nyid kyi ngo bo gang la yod pa de ni de'i ngo bor 'gyur ba'i tshad ma'i dbye ba ste de cis mi grub /
translated: That which has the nature of that very difference of cognition is the classification of valid cognition, whose nature is that. Why is that not established?

original: de'i phyir rtogs pa'i dbye ba dang gzhal bya'i dbye ba 'di gnyis ni phan tshun khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtogs pa'i dbye ba dang gzhal bya'i dbye ba 'di gnyis ni phan tshun khyab pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, these two, the classification of realizations and the classification of objects of comprehension, are mutually inclusive.

original: gang gi tshe gcig la the tshom zhugs pa de'i tshe gzhan gyis tha snyad byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gcig la the tshom zhugs pa de'i tshe gzhan gyis tha snyad byed pa yin no //
translated: When one engages in doubt about one, at that time the other is engaged in convention.

original: de lta na yang tshad ma gnyis su the tshom za ba la gzhal bya gnyis nye bar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang tshad ma gnyis su the tshom za ba la gzhal bya gnyis nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: Even so, when there is doubt about two valid cognitions, two objects of comprehension are presented.

original: de la the tshom zhugs pa la rtogs pa'i dbye ba las skyabs gzhan med do //
analyzed: de la the tshom zhugs pa la rtogs pa'i dbye ba las skyabs gzhan med do //
translated: Therefore, one who has doubts about that has no other refuge than the analysis of knowledge.

original: tshad ma'i dbye ba grub pa yang de nyid yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma'i dbye ba grub pa yang de nyid yin no //
translated: And that is the proof of the analysis of valid cognition.

original: 'di la gzhan dag rmongs nas smras pa ni rtogs pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la gzhan dag rmongs nas smras pa ni rtogs pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, others, confused, say, ‚ÄúKnowledge itself . . .‚Äù

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra ba ni bzod nas min nam zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra ba ni bzod nas min nam zhes gsungs so //
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt it accepted?‚Äù

original: 'di ltar ci'i tshad ma rtogs pa las gzhan nyid yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ltar ci'i tshad ma rtogs pa las gzhan nyid yin nam /
translated: Thus, is valid cognition something other than knowledge?

original: 'on te rtogs pa tsam ni tshad ma yin gyi 'on kyang khyad par can kho na zhig yin zhes khyed 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te rtogs pa tsam ni tshad ma yin gyi 'on kyang khyad par can kho na zhig yin zhes khyed 'dod /
translated: Or do you assert that it is just knowledge, but only when it has a special feature?

original: de la phyogs dang po ni ma grub la /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po ni ma grub la /
translated: The first position is not established.

original: gnyis pa ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: The second is an establishment of what is already established.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sgra las byung ba la sogs pa ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sgra las byung ba la sogs pa ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which arises from hearing and so on is not valid cognition.

original: 'di yang sngar bshad pa'i //üîΩtshad ma slu ba med can gyi //
analyzed: 'di yang sngar bshad pa'i // tshad ma slu ba med can gyi //
translated: This is also established by the earlier explanation.

original: shes pa zhes bya ba nyid las 'grub ste /
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba nyid las 'grub ste /
translated: It is established by the statement, ‚ÄúValid cognition is nondeceptive knowledge.‚Äù

original: shes pa'i sgras shes pa ma @14a * //
analyzed: shes pa'i sgras shes pa ma @14a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúknowledge‚Äù refers to knowledge that isüîΩnondeceptive.

original: yin pa dang / slu ba med pa'i sgras ni rtogs pa tsam rnam par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin pa dang / slu ba med pa'i sgras ni rtogs pa tsam rnam par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the term ‚Äúnon-deceptive‚Äù is explained as mere knowledge.

original: yang na rtogs pa nyid ni tha dad 'gyur //
analyzed: yang na rtogs pa nyid ni tha dad 'gyur //
translated: Or else, the form of knowledge itself would be different.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i rnam pa nyid tha dad par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i rnam pa nyid tha dad par 'gyur mod /
translated: This means that the form of valid knowledge itself would be different.

original: tshad ma'i dbye bas zhes bya ba mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid tshad ma khyad par can du ji ltar yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma'i dbye bas zhes bya ba mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid tshad ma khyad par can du ji ltar yin te /
translated: But how could the classification of valid knowledge be a special characteristic of valid knowledge, such as direct perception and inference?

original: ci gzhan yang tshad ma nyid ma yin nam zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci gzhan yang tshad ma nyid ma yin nam zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is the meaning of ‚ÄúIs there another valid knowledge?‚Äù

original: ji ltar thun mongs ma yin pa'i rnam can las /üîΩthun mong gi rnam pa can las /
analyzed: ji ltar thun mongs ma yin pa'i rnam can las / thun mong gi rnam pa can las /
translated: Just as a cognition with a non-common formüîΩis different from a cognition with a common form,

original: thun mong gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa tha dad pa de bzhin du thun mong gi rnam pa la yang sgra dang nye bar gzhal ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba yod pa kho na'o /
analyzed: thun mong gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa tha dad pa de bzhin du thun mong gi rnam pa la yang sgra dang nye bar gzhal ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba yod pa kho na'o /
translated: so too, even with a common form, there is a distinction of sound, contact, etc.

original: des na yul tha dad pa nyid las tshad ma gzhan yang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na yul tha dad pa nyid las tshad ma gzhan yang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, due to the difference in objects, there would be another valid knowledge.

original: 'on te lkog tu gyur pa thams cad ni thun mong gi rnam pa can nyid kyis gcig nyid yin na de'i tshe mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa dag kyang dngos po nyid du gcig pa'i phyir tshad ma gnyis su yang mi 'gyur ro zhe na 'dir grub
analyzed: 'on te lkog tu gyur pa thams cad ni thun mong gi rnam pa can nyid kyis gcig nyid yin na de'i tshe mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa dag kyang dngos po nyid du gcig pa'i phyir tshad ma gnyis su yang mi 'gyur ro zhe na 'dir grub
translated: But if all hidden objects are the same in being hidden, then at that time, since direct perception and hidden objects are the same in being things, there would not be two valid cognitions.

original: pa'i mtha' ni mngon sum du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i mtha' ni mngon sum du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, the established conclusion is that direct perception is direct perception, and so on.

original: lkog tu gyur pa la ni rjes su dpag pa las gzhan mi slu ba ma nges pa nyid las tshad ma yin pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa la ni rjes su dpag pa las gzhan mi slu ba ma nges pa nyid las tshad ma yin pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: As for hidden objects, it is certain that there is no valid cognition other than inference.

original: des na thos pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis rtogs pa tha dad pa yin yang gzhal bya yod par nges par mi byed pas ji ltar tshad ma yin snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na thos pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis rtogs pa tha dad pa yin yang gzhal bya yod par nges par mi byed pas ji ltar tshad ma yin snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, even though the realizations of the nature of what is heard and so on are different, since they do not ascertain the existence of the object of comprehension, how can they be valid cognitions?

original: gal te sngar 'di mtshan nyid kyis spangs zin pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te sngar 'di mtshan nyid kyis spangs zin pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that this was already refuted by the defining characteristics above?

original: da ltar ci zhig sgrub ce na /
analyzed: da ltar ci zhig sgrub ce na /
translated: What is being established now?

original: bshad pa mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa de nyid kyis tha dad de rigs mi 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: bshad pa mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa de nyid kyis tha dad de rigs mi 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: The explanation is that direct perception and inference are different, that is, of different types.

original: de yang rang rig pas grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang rang rig pas grub pa'i phyir /
translated: And that is established by reflexive awareness.

original: tha snyad nyid tsam po 'di da ltar bsgrub byar byed pa yin no ;
analyzed: tha snyad nyid tsam po 'di da ltar bsgrub byar byed pa yin no ;
translated: Therefore, this mere convention is what is to be established.

original: / gal te 'di'i tha snyad kyang grub pa zin pa nyid ma yin nam mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas grub pa'i ma gnyis la rjes su dpag pa dang mngon sum gyis grub par ni gzhan yang mi sems so snyam na /
analyzed: / gal te 'di'i tha snyad kyang grub pa zin pa nyid ma yin nam mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas grub pa'i ma gnyis la rjes su dpag pa dang mngon sum gyis grub par ni gzhan yang mi sems so snyam na /
translated: If you think that even this convention is not established, since direct perception and inference are not established, and you do not think that there is anything else that is established by direct perception and inference,

original: bstan bcos byed pa rnams kyis yang 'khrul pa'i yul nyid du dper brjod pa ni 'di me zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pa rnams kyis yang 'khrul pa'i yul nyid du dper brjod pa ni 'di me zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: then the authors of the treatises give this example of the object of error: ‚ÄúThis is fire.‚Äù

original: /'di la pha rol po dag / lta ba'i shes pa'i de ma thag tu /
analyzed: /'di la pha rol po dag / lta ba'i shes pa'i de ma thag tu /
translated: With regard to that, the opponent thinks,

original: rigs la sogs pas khyad par can gyi don gsal bar snang ba rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa gcig nyid ni /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pas khyad par can gyi don gsal bar snang ba rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa gcig nyid ni /
translated: ‚ÄúImmediately after the visual consciousness, there is a single conceptual consciousness that clearly perceives an object qualified by a class and so on.

original: dbang po la sogs pa'i bdag pos bskyed pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa'i bdag pos bskyed pa'i phyir na /
translated: because it is produced by a dominant condition, such as a sense faculty.

original: mngon sum gzhan nyid yin no zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: mngon sum gzhan nyid yin no zhes 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, it is a different kind of perception.

original: @14b 'di zhes bya ba ni mngon sum nyid du snang ba'o //
analyzed: @14b 'di zhes bya ba ni mngon sum nyid du snang ba'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúthis‚Äù and ‚Äúfire‚Äù refer to the appearance of perception.

original: me zhes bya ni me nyid kyi rigs so //
analyzed: me zhes bya ni me nyid kyi rigs so //
translated: The words ‚Äúthe nature of fire‚Äù refer to the class of fire.

original: de la rig pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de la rig pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe cognition of that‚Äù refers to

original: gsal la 'bar ba'i rnam pa can gyi ngo bo tsam 'dzi pa dang / gsal bar snang ba rnam par rtog pa med pa ni gzhan gyi yin la /
analyzed: gsal la 'bar ba'i rnam pa can gyi ngo bo tsam 'dzi pa dang / gsal bar snang ba rnam par rtog pa med pa ni gzhan gyi yin la /
translated: the cognition that grasps the mere entity that has the aspect of being bright and hot. The cognition that appears as bright and hot without conceptualization is a different kind of perception.

original: btso ba dang bsreg pa la sogs pa bsgrub pa la yang de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa gzhan kho na yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: btso ba dang bsreg pa la sogs pa bsgrub pa la yang de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa gzhan kho na yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The inference that has the nature of that is a different kind of inference that establishes the accomplishment of cooking, burning, and so on.

original: 'on btso ba la sogs par nus pa smos pas ci zhig bya rigs tsam rtogs pa nyid las tshad mar 'gyur mod ces kha cig zer ba de la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'on btso ba la sogs par nus pa smos pas ci zhig bya rigs tsam rtogs pa nyid las tshad mar 'gyur mod ces kha cig zer ba de la brjod pa ni /
translated: Someone might say, ‚ÄúWhat is the point of mentioning the ability to cook and so on? It is sufficient to understand the mere class. That is a valid cognition.‚ÄùüîΩIn response to that, it is said:

original: de ltar / nus pa gzung ba med par ni //
analyzed: de ltar / nus pa gzung ba med par ni //
translated: Without apprehending the ability,

original: 'jug pa med do su zhe na /
analyzed: 'jug pa med do su zhe na /
translated: there is no engagement.

original: dgos pa'i don sgrub pa'i don te /
analyzed: dgos pa'i don sgrub pa'i don te /
translated: The purpose is the accomplishment of the purpose.

original: dngos po don gnyer ba'i ngang tshul can rtogs par 'dod pa de bsnyon pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po don gnyer ba'i ngang tshul can rtogs par 'dod pa de bsnyon pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnot denied‚Äù is that the desire to understand, which is the state of seeking a thing, is not denied.

original: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo las lhag par sngon myong ba'i don bya ba 'jal ba na rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa 'di ste rang gi ngo bo tsam snang ba'i mngon sum las tha dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo las lhag par sngon myong ba'i don bya ba 'jal ba na rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa 'di ste rang gi ngo bo tsam snang ba'i mngon sum las tha dad pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, when the object of prior experience is judged to be more than its own nature, this conceptual cognition is different from the direct perception in which only its own nature appears.

original: rigs zhes bya ba tha dad pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang bshad zin to //
analyzed: rigs zhes bya ba tha dad pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang bshad zin to //
translated: It has also been explained that the difference called ‚Äútype‚Äù does not exist.

original: gal te tshad ma slu ba med can gyi shes pa zhes bya ba spyi'i mtshan nyid yin na mi de yang gang las nges she na /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma slu ba med can gyi shes pa zhes bya ba spyi'i mtshan nyid yin na mi de yang gang las nges she na /
translated: If the definition of a valid cognition is a non-deceptive cognition, how is that ascertained?

original: 'di la yang sngar bshad pa'i tha snyad las ni tshad ma nyid ces bya ba dran par byed pa ni 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang sngar bshad pa'i tha snyad las ni tshad ma nyid ces bya ba dran par byed pa ni 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the definition of a valid cognition is recalled from the previously explained convention, which is the definition of engagement and disengagement.

original: le'u dang por zhes bya bar ni rang gis bshad par bya ba ltos pa'i'o //
analyzed: le'u dang por zhes bya bar ni rang gis bshad par bya ba ltos pa'i'o //
translated: In the first chapter, it is explained by the author himself, depending on the context.

original: gang du gang la rnam pa gnag gi snyam na /
analyzed: gang du gang la rnam pa gnag gi snyam na /
translated: Where and in what way is there a difference?

original: de la zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pas shes pa'i dus la'o /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pas shes pa'i dus la'o /
translated: In the passage ‚Äúin the state of cognition,‚Äù the word ‚Äúthere‚Äù refers to the time of cognition with conceptualization.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //üîΩ'o na de rnam pa gnyis su ga las 'grub snyam na rtogs pa'i rnam pa tha dad pas ni zhes gsungs so //üîΩba lang mthong ba ltar rnam par rtog pa'i dus bzhin du gtsig ni brjod pa med par gsal ba dang / brjod pa dang 'dres pa ma gsal ba ni gzhan nyid nyams su myong ba kho na'o //üîΩrtog pa de'i ngo bor gyur pa'i tshad ma lta ci smos ;
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o // 'o na de rnam pa gnyis su ga las 'grub snyam na rtogs pa'i rnam pa tha dad pas ni zhes gsungs so // ba lang mthong ba ltar rnam par rtog pa'i dus bzhin du gtsig ni brjod pa med par gsal ba dang / brjod pa dang 'dres pa ma gsal ba ni gzhan nyid nyams su myong ba kho na'o // rtog pa de'i ngo bor gyur pa'i tshad ma lta ci smos ;
translated: The rest is easy to understand.üîΩHow is it established as twofold? It is said, ‚Äúby the difference in the aspects of the object.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du 'di yang yin no zhes bya bar don bya ba'i nus pa 'dra ba nyid ni rjes su dpag pa kho na'i yul yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di yang yin no zhes bya bar don bya ba'i nus pa 'dra ba nyid ni rjes su dpag pa kho na'i yul yin no //
translated: The mere similarity of the capacity for effective action is the object of inference alone.

original: 'on te @15a * //
analyzed: 'on te @15a * //
translated: But ifüîΩhe raises the objection of his own school with ‚ÄúBut if . . .üîΩ. . .

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rang gi phyogs pa'i rtsod pa slong ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rang gi phyogs pa'i rtsod pa slong ba'o //
translated: This and the rest of the passage is a raising of objections from our own group.üîΩ

original: bram ze aa tsa ta ma gtogs pa /üîΩgzhan dag ni don bya ba grub pa'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa mngon sum las gzhan yin mod /
analyzed: bram ze aa tsa ta ma gtogs pa / gzhan dag ni don bya ba grub pa'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa mngon sum las gzhan yin mod /
translated: Except for the brahman Acarya,üîΩothers assert that the conceptual consciousness that has as its object the accomplishment of an object is different from direct perception.üîΩ

original: de tshad ma ni ma yin zhes bya bar sems so //
analyzed: de tshad ma ni ma yin zhes bya bar sems so //
translated: I think that is not a valid cognition.üîΩ

original: de nyid gzhung 'jug pa ni de dang ldan cig yod do cog ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gzhung 'jug pa ni de dang ldan cig yod do cog ces bya ba'o //
translated: The entry into the treatise is the statement, ‚ÄúThe one who possesses that.‚Äù

original: gal te lus la sogs pa ni bems po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni shes pa nyid yin pa la ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te lus la sogs pa ni bems po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni shes pa nyid yin pa la ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you reply, ‚ÄúBecause the body and so on are inanimate,‚Äù it is because consciousness itself is purposeless.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin mngon sum gyis bzung ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin mngon sum gyis bzung ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no /
translated: For, the nature of things is apprehended by direct perception.üîΩ

original: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù refers to the refutation.

original: gal te nye bar mkho ba tsam ni lus la sogs pa yang nyams pa med /
analyzed: gal te nye bar mkho ba tsam ni lus la sogs pa yang nyams pa med /
translated: If it is only the useful that is not impaired, then the body, etc. are not impaired.

original: des na shes pa nyid kyi khyad par du byas pa yin //
analyzed: des na shes pa nyid kyi khyad par du byas pa yin //
translated: Therefore, it is the cognition that is distinguished.

original: de la ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa la ltos te /
analyzed: de la ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa la ltos te /
translated: In that case, in relation to nonconceptual cognition,

original: nye bar mkho ba med pa nyid brjod zin pa nyid do snyam na /
analyzed: nye bar mkho ba med pa nyid brjod zin pa nyid do snyam na /
translated: the uselessness has already been stated.

original: de nyid la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste ;
analyzed: de nyid la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste ;
translated: In response to that, this is said:

original: gal te mngon sum la ltos na rnam par rtog pa nye bar mkho ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te mngon sum la ltos na rnam par rtog pa nye bar mkho ba med pa yin no //
translated: If it is in relation to perception, then conceptual cognition is useless.

original: de med par yang mngon sum 'jug par byed par ji ltar mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de med par yang mngon sum 'jug par byed par ji ltar mi 'gyur //
translated: How could it not be the case that perception operates without it?

original: ji srid don bya bar byed pa de srid du ni mthong ba'i dngos po la yang 'jug pa su yang med de /
analyzed: ji srid don bya bar byed pa de srid du ni mthong ba'i dngos po la yang 'jug pa su yang med de /
translated: As long as it performs a function, there is no engagement with a visible object,

original: 'gro ba na rtsa lo rag pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes so //
analyzed: 'gro ba na rtsa lo rag pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes so //
translated: just as when walking on grass, thorns, etc.

original: ci ste zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni 'jug par byed pa ma yin no zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni 'jug par byed pa ma yin no zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of the passage is this: Inference is not a means of knowing, because it is not a means of knowing in the way that perception is.

original: ji ltar bu zhig ces 'dra ba 'dzin pa gang yin te nges par byed pa de'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar bu zhig ces 'dra ba 'dzin pa gang yin te nges par byed pa de'i rang bzhin te /
translated: What is it like? It is like a memory, which is a determiner, and it is of the nature of that,

original: de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that is, of the nature of a memory. This is the meaning of the phrase ‚Äúinference is of the nature of memory.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar nus pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni yod kyang mngon sum tsam las skyes pa yin gyi de'i rang bzhin gyi rtags la brten pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar nus pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni yod kyang mngon sum tsam las skyes pa yin gyi de'i rang bzhin gyi rtags la brten pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Even though the conception of the object‚Äôs capacity is produced from mere perception, it is not based on a reason that is of the nature of memory.

original: 'di ltar mod kho nar mngon sum tsam las skye bar nyams su myong ba de'i rang bzhin gyi phyir 'di ni dran pa tsam yin gyi tshad ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mod kho nar mngon sum tsam las skye bar nyams su myong ba de'i rang bzhin gyi phyir 'di ni dran pa tsam yin gyi tshad ma ni ma yin no //
translated: This is because it is experienced that it is produced from mere perception, and it is of the nature of memory. Therefore, it is mere memory, but it is not a means of knowing.

original: de yang mi bden te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de yang mi bden te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: This is not correct. This is the philosophical position.

original: don ni 'di yin te gal te yang goms pa'i gnas skabs na rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos po lhag par zhen par mtshor bar de lta na yang /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te gal te yang goms pa'i gnas skabs na rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos po lhag par zhen par mtshor bar de lta na yang /
translated: The point is this: Even though, in the case of the one who is habituated to it, the relation between the reason and the property to be proven is conceived of as real,

original: dang po'i 'jug pa la ni de'i rang bzhin gyis rjes su dpag pa med na mod kho nar lhag par zhen pa de nyid rnam pa thams cad du srid pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin @15b no ;
analyzed: dang po'i 'jug pa la ni de'i rang bzhin gyis rjes su dpag pa med na mod kho nar lhag par zhen pa de nyid rnam pa thams cad du srid pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin @15b no ;
translated: If there is no inference of its nature at the time of the first engagement, then that very adherence to the superimposition is not possible in any way.

original: / gzhan dag bsam pa mi rig nas /
analyzed: / gzhan dag bsam pa mi rig nas /
translated: Others, not understanding the thought,

original: rnam pa thams cad du mngon sum 'jug par byed pa nyid yin pa 'gog pa yin no snyam pas dad po ma yin yang zhes so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mngon sum 'jug par byed pa nyid yin pa 'gog pa yin no snyam pas dad po ma yin yang zhes so //
translated: think that it is a refutation of the very engagement of direct perception in any way.

original: 'di glen pa'i gtam dang 'dra bar bya nas bzhad gang du byed pa ni 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di glen pa'i gtam dang 'dra bar bya nas bzhad gang du byed pa ni 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the ‚Äúthis‚Äù in ‚Äúthis is laughable.‚Äù

original: de nyid ston pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To show that, he says, ‚ÄúIf . . . ‚Äù

original: gal te dus gnyi gar yang mngon sum gyis 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la 'gal ba ci 'dra ba zhig yod snyam na /
analyzed: gal te dus gnyi gar yang mngon sum gyis 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la 'gal ba ci 'dra ba zhig yod snyam na /
translated: If it is the case that it engages in both times by means of direct perception, what kind of contradiction is there?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thinking this, he says, ‚ÄúIn that case . . . ‚Äù

original: mngon sum mi gsal ba las ni de'i rang bzhin las /
analyzed: mngon sum mi gsal ba las ni de'i rang bzhin las /
translated: From a non-clear direct perception, one infers its nature.

original: dmigs pa med par yang dang po 'jug pa nyid med pa'i phyir na goms pa med la ;
analyzed: dmigs pa med par yang dang po 'jug pa nyid med pa'i phyir na goms pa med la ;
translated: And because there is no engagement in the beginning, there is no cultivation.

original: de med pa'i phyir na phyis shin tu gsal ba mngon sum skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir na phyis shin tu gsal ba mngon sum skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And because there is no cultivation, later on, a very clear perception will not arise.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jug bsdu ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause of the engagement.‚Äù

original: 'jug par byed pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi ldan pa rna par gcod pa brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi ldan pa rna par gcod pa brjod pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is the engagement‚Äù means that it is not a non-possession.

original: goms pa'i gnas skabs na yang de'i rang bzhin can gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid 'jug bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: goms pa'i gnas skabs na yang de'i rang bzhin can gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid 'jug bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúEven at the time of cultivation, it is not that inference, which has that nature, is the engagement.‚Äù

original: gzhan mkho ba med ces te gzhan tshe'i mkho ba med pa yin zhes de ma thag kho nar 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan mkho ba med ces te gzhan tshe'i mkho ba med pa yin zhes de ma thag kho nar 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt does not need anything else‚Äù means ‚Äúit does not need anything else at the time of its operation.‚Äù

original: t'i k'a mdzad pa de ni tshe yang mngon sum kho nar 'jug par byed pa yin gyi de'i rang zin can rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin no snyam du dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: t'i k'a mdzad pa de ni tshe yang mngon sum kho nar 'jug par byed pa yin gyi de'i rang zin can rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin no snyam du dogs pa yin no //
translated: The author of the Tƒ´kƒÅ says, ‚ÄúIt is perception itself that is the engagement, and it is not inference that has that nature.‚Äù

original: gal te yang goms pa'i gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas pa nyid kyis sngon gyi rang bzhin dang chos mtshungs pa las de ltar rtogs pa rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin te don lkog tu ma gyur pa'i phyir nor bu dang dngul la sogs pa'i gzugs rtogs
analyzed: gal te yang goms pa'i gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas pa nyid kyis sngon gyi rang bzhin dang chos mtshungs pa las de ltar rtogs pa rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin te don lkog tu ma gyur pa'i phyir nor bu dang dngul la sogs pa'i gzugs rtogs
translated: If it is argued that the inference of that is not from the similarity of the prior nature in terms of the state of habituation, then it is like the understanding of the form of a jewel, silver, etc., because the meaning is not hidden.

original: pa bzhin no zhes gsungs pa de lta na yang phyis the tshom za ba'i mngon sum pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa bzhin no zhes gsungs pa de lta na yang phyis the tshom za ba'i mngon sum pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even so, it is the occasion of the direct perception that later doubts.

original: mngon sum med na yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mngon sum med na yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for even without direct perception,

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i me'i yul can med par ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i me'i yul can med par ro //
translated: it is without the object of the fire that is to be inferred.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni mngon sum yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni mngon sum yang ngo //
translated: And that means direct perception as well.

original: rjes su dpag pa las 'jug pa'i dus na ni de'i yul can gyi mngon sum yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las 'jug pa'i dus na ni de'i yul can gyi mngon sum yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At the time of engaging in inference, the direct perception that has it as its object does not exist. That is the meaning.

original: ci ste yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: ci ste yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: As for if it is argued that, and so on, it is the opponent's position.

original: de med par ni rjes su dpag pa med par ro //
analyzed: de med par ni rjes su dpag pa med par ro //
translated: Without that is without inference.

original: de med par yang zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa med par yang ngo //
analyzed: de med par yang zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa med par yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout that‚Äù means without inference.

original: de grub pa ni mngon sum gyis 'grub pa'o //üîΩrjes su dpag pa ni gdon mi za bar phyogs kyi chos la sogs @16a * //
analyzed: de grub pa ni mngon sum gyis 'grub pa'o // rjes su dpag pa ni gdon mi za bar phyogs kyi chos la sogs @16a * //
translated: ‚ÄúIts establishment‚Äù means the establishment of perception.

original: pa'i rgyu mtshan du mngon sum la ltos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: pa'i rgyu mtshan du mngon sum la ltos pa yin gyi /
translated: The point is that inference necessarily depends on perception as a reason, such as the property of the position, etc.

original: goms pas skyed pa'i mngon sum ni de la ltos pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dgos pa'i don to //
analyzed: goms pas skyed pa'i mngon sum ni de la ltos pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dgos pa'i don to //
translated: But the perception that is produced by habituation does not depend on that.

original: 'dir yang rnam pa thams cad du rjes su dpag pa la skur pa'am /
analyzed: 'dir yang rnam pa thams cad du rjes su dpag pa la skur pa'am /
translated: Here, the point is that one should not completely deny inference,

original: mngon sum gtso bor 'grub par 'gyur grang /
analyzed: mngon sum gtso bor 'grub par 'gyur grang /
translated: or else one should not accept perception as primary.

original: de la sngar brjod pa dran par byed pas phyed snga mas phyogs dang po 'gog la gnyis pa ni phyed phyi mas so //
analyzed: de la sngar brjod pa dran par byed pas phyed snga mas phyogs dang po 'gog la gnyis pa ni phyed phyi mas so //
translated: Here, the first half of the verse rejects the first position, and the second half rejects the second position, reminding one of what was said earlier.

original: de phyir bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i drin gyis mngon sum gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩda nyid gsal bar byed pa ni gzhan tshe zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de phyir bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i drin gyis mngon sum gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ro // da nyid gsal bar byed pa ni gzhan tshe zhes bya ste /
translated: The point is that the function of perception is to clarify, by the kindness of inference.üîΩ‚ÄúNow‚Äù means at this time.

original: gsal ba'i gnas skabs kyi tshe'o //
analyzed: gsal ba'i gnas skabs kyi tshe'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe time of clarity‚Äù is the time of the state of clarity.

original: gzhan tshe zhes bya ba ni ma goms pa'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: gzhan tshe zhes bya ba ni ma goms pa'i tshe na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAt other times‚Äù means when one is not familiar with it.

original: 'on te de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa mi dgos pa nyid do snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa mi dgos pa nyid do snyam na /
translated: But if you think that at that time there is no need for inference,

original: goms pa med par zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: goms pa med par zhes gsungs so //
translated: then the text says, ‚Äúwithout familiarity.‚Äù

original: 'on te nye bar mkho ba med kyang don du nye bar 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te nye bar mkho ba med kyang don du nye bar 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if you think that even though it is not needed, it will be useful,

original: mkho ba med na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mkho ba med na zhes gsungs so //
translated: then the text says, ‚Äúif it is not needed.‚Äù

original: 'on te don du gnyer ba'i yul gyi rjes su dpag pa yang nye bar mi mkho ba nyid do snyam na ;
analyzed: 'on te don du gnyer ba'i yul gyi rjes su dpag pa yang nye bar mi mkho ba nyid do snyam na ;
translated: But if you think that even inference, which is the object of desire, is not needed,

original: dngos po don du gnyer ba'i yul zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dngos po don du gnyer ba'i yul zhes gsungs so //
translated: then the text says, ‚Äúthe object of desire.‚Äù

original: 'di ni bram ze aa tsas kyang de'i rang bzhin can gyi rjes su dpag pa ni ma goms pa'i gnas skabs kho nar yin no zhes khyad par brjod par rigs so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni bram ze aa tsas kyang de'i rang bzhin can gyi rjes su dpag pa ni ma goms pa'i gnas skabs kho nar yin no zhes khyad par brjod par rigs so zhes bstan to //
translated: This is what the Brahmin Acyuta also said: ‚ÄúInference of that kind is only for those who are not familiar with it.‚Äù It is proper to make this distinction.

original: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúif‚Äù and so on is as follows.

original: gal te yang rjes su dpag pa nye bar mkho ba de lta na yang der mngon sum nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir de nyid gtso bo yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te yang rjes su dpag pa nye bar mkho ba de lta na yang der mngon sum nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir de nyid gtso bo yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even if inference is required, since direct perception is what is to be established in that case, it is the primary factor.

original: phyed phyi mas ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi mas ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The second half of the verse is about the philosophical tenet.

original: bsgrub par bya ba gzhan gyi khyad par du gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyi tshul 'di nyid las te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba gzhan gyi khyad par du gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyi tshul 'di nyid las te /
translated: This very method of the definition that is the distinguishing feature of the probandum,

original: rim pa 'di nyid las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rim pa 'di nyid las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: does not go beyond this very process.

original: gang du zhe na yul rtags la'o //
analyzed: gang du zhe na yul rtags la'o //
translated: Where? In the object, the reason.

original: tshul gsum pa nyid kyi nges pa 'jug pa'i don du'o zhes bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa nyid kyi nges pa 'jug pa'i don du'o zhes bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: For the purpose of engaging in the ascertainment of the trimodal nature.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa de yang mngon sum skye ba nyid kyi 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin nam nges na gal te mngon sum 'ga' zhig rjes su dpag pa skyed pa'i yan lag yin du chug pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa de yang mngon sum skye ba nyid kyi 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin nam nges na gal te mngon sum 'ga' zhig rjes su dpag pa skyed pa'i yan lag yin du chug pa de lta na yang /
translated: If that inference also does not have the effect of generating direct perception, then even if some direct perception is allowed to be a limb that generates inference,

original: slar de nyid kyi mthar thug pa yin te /
analyzed: slar de nyid kyi mthar thug pa yin te /
translated: in that case, it would be the ultimate of that.

original: rjes su dpag pa mngon sum byas na yang rjes su dpag pa don du gnyer ba yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa mngon sum byas na yang rjes su dpag pa don du gnyer ba yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: If inference is made evident, then there is no need for inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa la ni gdon mi za bar mngon sum don du gnyer ba yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la ni gdon mi za bar mngon sum don du gnyer ba yin te /
translated: But if one is to infer, one must have recourse to perception.

original: de lta ma yin na rjes su dpag pas ci bya /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rjes su dpag pas ci bya /
translated: Otherwise, what would be the use of inference?

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pa thams cad ni mngon sum du bya ba ma yin @16b no zhe na ;
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pa thams cad ni mngon sum du bya ba ma yin @16b no zhe na ;
translated: But if you say that no inference is to be made evident,

original: /'on ni rjes su dpag pa ste gal te 'bras bu 'ga' zhig gi dbang du byas nas bton na de'i tshe de thob ba nyid kyis de 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: /'on ni rjes su dpag pa ste gal te 'bras bu 'ga' zhig gi dbang du byas nas bton na de'i tshe de thob ba nyid kyis de 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur la /
translated: then if one were to infer in order to achieve some result, then at that time, having attained that result, it would be endowed with a result.

original: thob pa yang mngon sum gyi rang bzhin kho na'o //üîΩ'dod rgyal du thob pa'am /
analyzed: thob pa yang mngon sum gyi rang bzhin kho na'o // 'dod rgyal du thob pa'am /
translated: And attainment is only of the nature of perception.üîΩBut it is not proper to attain something at random,

original: bsnyon pas 'jug pa ni blang bar bya ba ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: bsnyon pas 'jug pa ni blang bar bya ba ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: or to engage in it by way of deception.

original: de la ji ltar 'jug par byed pa'i mngon sum du bya ba snang ba'i mngon sum gyi 'bras bu dang bcas pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa yang mngon sum gyis yin no //
analyzed: de la ji ltar 'jug par byed pa'i mngon sum du bya ba snang ba'i mngon sum gyi 'bras bu dang bcas pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa yang mngon sum gyis yin no //
translated: Just as direct perception is the result of the appearance that engages the object, so too is inference the result of the appearance that engages the object.

original: de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba yin pas na mngon sum ni gtso bo yin la rjes su dpag pa ni sgrub par byed pa nyid kyis na yan lag yin no zhes bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba yin pas na mngon sum ni gtso bo yin la rjes su dpag pa ni sgrub par byed pa nyid kyis na yan lag yin no zhes bya bar rigs so //
translated: Therefore, since it is the object to be established, direct perception is primary, and since inference is the means of establishing it, it is a part.

original: de lta yin dang rgyu'i gnas skabs ni rjes su dpag pa yin la 'bras bu'i gnas skabs ni mngon sum yin no zhes bya ba grub pa'i mtha' yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang rgyu'i gnas skabs ni rjes su dpag pa yin la 'bras bu'i gnas skabs ni mngon sum yin no zhes bya ba grub pa'i mtha' yin te /
translated: If that is so, the theory that the causal state is inference and the resultant state is direct perception is established.

original: des na gnyi ga mtshungs par ji ltar 'gyur zhes dgongs pa la 'jug pa bsdu ba'i tshul gyis sel ba brjod pa ni /
analyzed: des na gnyi ga mtshungs par ji ltar 'gyur zhes dgongs pa la 'jug pa bsdu ba'i tshul gyis sel ba brjod pa ni /
translated: Therefore, how can they be similar? The response that eliminates this objection by the method of collecting the intended meaning is:

original: de'i phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis yang tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis yang tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, both direct perception and inference are valid knowledge.

original: dgos pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgos pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the purpose.

original: dngos po pa'i gtso bo dang phal pa'i dngos po dpyod pa'i skabs ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang tshad ma'o //
analyzed: dngos po pa'i gtso bo dang phal pa'i dngos po dpyod pa'i skabs ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang tshad ma'o //
translated: It is not the case that the occasion is for investigating the principal and secondary things.üîΩBut it is a valid cognition.

original: de la ni gnyi ga yang don rtogs pa dang 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de la ni gnyi ga yang don rtogs pa dang 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: In that case, both are causes for the realization and engagement of the object.

original: gzhan skye ba la yan lag yin no //
analyzed: gzhan skye ba la yan lag yin no //
translated: In the case of arising from another, it is a part.

original: tshad ma ni gtso bo dang phal ba'i dngos po cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: tshad ma ni gtso bo dang phal ba'i dngos po cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is not the slightest principal or secondary thing in a valid cognition.

original: yan lag nyid du mtshungs pa ni de tsam zhig rtogs par bya ba la brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yan lag nyid du mtshungs pa ni de tsam zhig rtogs par bya ba la brjod pa yin no //
translated: The similarity in being a part is stated in the mere realization of that.

original: gal te tshad ma la yang khyad par yod pa nyid de 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum yod pa la 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma la yang khyad par yod pa nyid de 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum yod pa la 'jug pa yin te /
translated: If there is a difference in valid cognition, it is like this: inference engages when direct perception exists.

original: de gnod pa'am bsgrub pa la de'i skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnod pa'am bsgrub pa la de'i skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no occasion for it to establish or refute that.

original: mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pa yod pa dang med pa la mi ltos so snyam du dogs na rang gi yul la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pa yod pa dang med pa la mi ltos so snyam du dogs na rang gi yul la zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you suspect that direct perception does not depend on the existence or nonexistence of inference, then it is said, ‚Äúwith regard to its own object.‚Äù

original: mngon sum zhugs pa'i yul la ni /
analyzed: mngon sum zhugs pa'i yul la ni /
translated: With regard to the object engaged by direct perception,

original: rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: inference does not engage.

original: yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the domain of direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la ni mngon sum gyis gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la ni mngon sum gyis gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: The domain of inference is not contradicted by direct perception,

original: mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'i yul dbye bas gnyi ga rnam par gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'i yul dbye bas gnyi ga rnam par gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the two are distinguished by their domains, the manifest and the unmanifest.

original: mngon sum gyis gnod pa'i tha snyad kyi rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid ston pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gnod pa'i tha snyad kyi rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid ston pa yin no //
translated: He shows that the domain of inference is not contradicted by direct perception.

original: de'i phyir gnyi ga yang khyad par med pa yang tshad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyi ga yang khyad par med pa yang tshad ma nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, both are valid cognitions, without distinction.

original: gnyis med pa la ni rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa yod pa yin te /üîΩde nyid kyi @17a * //
analyzed: gnyis med pa la ni rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa yod pa yin te / de nyid kyi @17a * //
translated: In the absence of the two, there is inference, etc.

original: phyir gtso bo dang cig shos yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyir gtso bo dang cig shos yod pa ma yin no //
translated: For that very reason, there is no principal and secondary.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni de kho na ltar 'jig rten pa la grags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni de kho na ltar 'jig rten pa la grags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated: because it is known in the world in that way.

original: yang dag pa'i tha snyad la brten pas gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i tha snyad la brten pas gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is based on correct convention.

original: 'dir tshu rol mdzes pa pa'i dogs pa bsu ba de ci ste zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: 'dir tshu rol mdzes pa pa'i dogs pa bsu ba de ci ste zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: Here, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya raises an objection: ‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù

original: / de zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: / de zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to inference.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot so‚Äù is the refutation.

original: dbang po'i mngon sum tshad mar 'dod na rigs pa mtshungs pas na rjes su dpag pas tshad ma yin par nan gyis 'grub po zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po'i mngon sum tshad mar 'dod na rigs pa mtshungs pas na rjes su dpag pas tshad ma yin par nan gyis 'grub po zhes ston pa ni /
translated: If you assert that sense perception is valid knowledge, then it is the same for inference, so it is established by force that inference is valid knowledge.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: To show this, he says ‚Äúbecause of being similar‚Äù and so on.

original: mdor bsdu na brda sprod pa la yang lan 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na brda sprod pa la yang lan 'di nyid yin no //
translated: In brief, this is the same response for the grammarians.

original: tshu rol mdzes pa la kha cig ma mthong ba 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa'i yul can rjes su dpag pa ni 'gog la //üîΩmthong ba'i yul can du bla sogs pa la rjes su dpag pa 'dod la /
analyzed: tshu rol mdzes pa la kha cig ma mthong ba 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa'i yul can rjes su dpag pa ni 'gog la // mthong ba'i yul can du bla sogs pa la rjes su dpag pa 'dod la /
translated: For the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, some say that inference with an object such as the other world, which is not seen, is refuted.üîΩBut inference with a seen object, such as a ladle, is asserted.

original: de la yang mthong ba'i yul can gyi rjes su dpag pa dag 'jug pa mtshungs pa nyid yin yang zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la yang mthong ba'i yul can gyi rjes su dpag pa dag 'jug pa mtshungs pa nyid yin yang zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
translated: And there, inference with a seen object is similar to engagement and so on.

original: mthong ba'i yul can gyi rjes su dpag pa yang tshul gsum pa yongs su dag pa'i dbang nyid kyis 'jug par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: mthong ba'i yul can gyi rjes su dpag pa yang tshul gsum pa yongs su dag pa'i dbang nyid kyis 'jug par byed pa yin la /
translated: The inference which has the seen as its object is also engaged by the power of the pure trimodal condition.

original: de ni ma mthong ba'i yul la yang mtshungs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni ma mthong ba'i yul la yang mtshungs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And that is the same with regard to the unseen object.

original: 'dir mngon sum dang cig shos gnyi ga zhes bya ba mngon sum smos pa ni dper brjod pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir mngon sum dang cig shos gnyi ga zhes bya ba mngon sum smos pa ni dper brjod pa'i don to //
translated: Here, the statement ‚Äúdirect perception and the other‚Äù means that direct perception is the example.

original: de ni spang bar nus pa ma yin te mthong ba dang 'gal ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni spang bar nus pa ma yin te mthong ba dang 'gal ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That cannot be rejected, because it is in contradiction with what is seen.

original: de lta ma yin na mngon sum tshad mar ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mngon sum tshad mar ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: If it were not so, how could direct perception be a valid cognition?

original: 'o na te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: 'o na te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: But if, on the other hand, etc.

original: 'o na mthong ba'i rjes su dpag par yod kyang mngon sum nyid la 'jug par 'gyur ba des na 'jug pa la mtshungs pa zhes bya ba 'di ma grub par dogs pa bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na mthong ba'i rjes su dpag par yod kyang mngon sum nyid la 'jug par 'gyur ba des na 'jug pa la mtshungs pa zhes bya ba 'di ma grub par dogs pa bsdu ba'o //
translated: If, on the other hand, there is inference from the seen, and direct perception is engaged, then this ‚Äúsameness of engagement‚Äù is not established. This is the doubt.

original: mngon sum ma yin zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot direct perception‚Äù means inference.

original: de yang mi bden te zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mi bden te zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is not true‚Äù is the refutation.

original: rang gi phyogs la rjes su chags pas nyams su myong bas khyad par du bsad nas /
analyzed: rang gi phyogs la rjes su chags pas nyams su myong bas khyad par du bsad nas /
translated: Having disregarded the experience of one‚Äôs own position through attachment to one‚Äôs own position,

original: rang gi phyogs bsal ba yang rtsis khongs su mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: rang gi phyogs bsal ba yang rtsis khongs su mi 'jug ste /
translated: one does not include the refutation of one‚Äôs own position in the reckoning.

original: nyams su myong ba ni mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ni mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because experience is direct perception.

original: de nyid de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan par bya'o //
translated: That itself is taught by ‚Äúthat to that,‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i tshe ni gdon mi za bar dran pa'i rang bzhin gyi nges par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni gdon mi za bar dran pa'i rang bzhin gyi nges par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: At that time, there is certainly a determination that has the nature of memory,

original: de ni de tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is related to just that.

original: 'ga' yang zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: 'ga' yang zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: ‚ÄúNone‚Äù in this shows

original: 'jig rten dang 'gal ba yang @17b ston par byed pa yin no /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'gal ba yang @17b ston par byed pa yin no /
translated: that it contradicts the world.

original: de ltar rtogs pa'i 'gal bar bsams pas /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa'i 'gal bar bsams pas /
translated: Thinking that way, the contradiction is understood.

original: rnam pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni //
translated: Another aspect is stated:

original: mngon sum la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven in direct perception,‚Äù and so on.

original: bya ba zhes bya ba de'i chos gzhan gyi rang bzhin rjes su 'gro ldog dang bcas pa'i yod pa nyid yin par 'dod //
analyzed: bya ba zhes bya ba de'i chos gzhan gyi rang bzhin rjes su 'gro ldog dang bcas pa'i yod pa nyid yin par 'dod //
translated: An action is a real entity that is the nature of something else, and it is present when there is forward and reverse pervasion.

original: phyogs dang por ni mngon sum la yang med do //
analyzed: phyogs dang por ni mngon sum la yang med do //
translated: In the first case, it does not exist even in perception.

original: gnyis pa ni rgyu thams cad kyi thun mong ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i yang 'jug pa la yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rgyu thams cad kyi thun mong ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i yang 'jug pa la yod pa yin no //
translated: In the second case, the common cause of all is present in the engagement of inference.

original: de ltar rnam pa ci zhig ltar rjes su dpag par ma skyes pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa ci zhig ltar rjes su dpag par ma skyes pa ni /
translated: In that way, how could something unarisen be inferred?

original: don du gnyer yang rgyu la mi 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: don du gnyer yang rgyu la mi 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Even if one seeks it, it does not engage in a cause.

original: gal te yod pa las ma gtogs pa'i byed pa med na /
analyzed: gal te yod pa las ma gtogs pa'i byed pa med na /
translated: If there is no activity apart from existence,

original: 'o na rgyu 'bras bu la byed pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes ji ltar brjod snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na rgyu 'bras bu la byed pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes ji ltar brjod snyam na /
translated: then how can it be said that a cause has activity in relation to an effect?

original: 'di ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called dependent origination.

original: sna tshogs 'di na'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs 'di na'o //
translated: It is this variety.

original: sna tshogs la sogs pa'i tha snyad ni de tsam du zad pa yin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs la sogs pa'i tha snyad ni de tsam du zad pa yin no //
translated: The conventions of variety and so on are just that.

original: de ltar ni mi 'thad pa yang ci yang med do //
analyzed: de ltar ni mi 'thad pa yang ci yang med do //
translated: In that way, there is nothing at all that is untenable.

original: de lta ma yin na byed pa med pa'am /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na byed pa med pa'am /
translated: If it were not so, it would be without activity.

original: byed pa dang bcas pa las ji ltar byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: byed pa dang bcas pa las ji ltar byed par 'gyur /
translated: If it were not so, then how could it be a means of valid cognition, since it would be without an object or with an object that is not present?

original: mngon sum gyi byed pas rjes su dpag pa la bsnyon 'debs pa rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas bzlog pa'i don du gzhan yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi byed pas rjes su dpag pa la bsnyon 'debs pa rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas bzlog pa'i don du gzhan yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: In order to refute the idea that inference is contradicted by perception, he says, ‚ÄúMoreover,‚Äù in order to refute it from another point of view.

original: 'dir yang na 'jig rten gzhan khas blangs pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dir yang na 'jig rten gzhan khas blangs pa la yang ngo //
translated: Here, ‚Äúanother‚Äù means that it is accepted that there is another world.

original: 'brel pa'i spros pa ni go bar bla'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i spros pa ni go bar bla'o //
translated: The elaboration of the connection is easily understood.

original: 'o na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin pa ji ltar spong snyam na /üîΩrjes dpag tshad ma nyid min na //
analyzed: 'o na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin pa ji ltar spong snyam na / rjes dpag tshad ma nyid min na //
translated: But how can you refute the idea that inference is a means of valid cognition?

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIf inference were not a means of valid cognition . . . ‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa tshad mar mi sgrub par ci'i phyir snyam na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa tshad mar mi sgrub par ci'i phyir snyam na /
translated: Why do you not establish inference as a means of valid cognition?

original: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn this way . . . ‚Äù

original: gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa'o //üîΩgzhan mngon sum yin pa'i phyir gzhan la mngon sum yin par ni 'thad pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa'o // gzhan mngon sum yin pa'i phyir gzhan la mngon sum yin par ni 'thad pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to another world and so on.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúMoreover,‚Äù in order to say that it is not tenable that another is a means of valid cognition because another is a means of valid cognition.

original: ji ltar du ba mthong ba la tshad ma yin pa de bzhin du thams cad la yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar du ba mthong ba la tshad ma yin pa de bzhin du thams cad la yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as seeing smoke is a valid cognition, so too would everything else be.

original: des na gal te rtags kyi mngon sum gyis lkog tu gyur pa yang 'grub na yang de'i tshe lkog tu gyur pa thams cad grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gal te rtags kyi mngon sum gyis lkog tu gyur pa yang 'grub na yang de'i tshe lkog tu gyur pa thams cad grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if a valid cognition of inference establishes the hidden, then at that time all hidden phenomena would be established.

original: da lta yin na ci snyam na //
analyzed: da lta yin na ci snyam na //
translated: If you think that it is not so,

original: thams cad don kun rigs par 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad don kun rigs par 'gyur //
translated: then everything would be reasonable.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is what he says.

original: 'brel pa med phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis dogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa med phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis dogs pa ste /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs doubt is stated in the line ‚Äúbecause there is no relation.‚Äù

original: thams cad rigs par 'gyur ba min no //
analyzed: thams cad rigs par 'gyur ba min no //
translated: It is not the case that everything would be reasonable.

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'dis ni dran pa med pa yang nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'dis ni dran pa med pa yang nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: This passage, ‚Äúbecause there is no relation,‚Äù also illustrates the absence of memory.

original: lan ni'o na zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: lan ni'o na zhes bya ba'o//
translated: The response is ‚ÄúIf that is so.‚Äù

original: @18a * // de ltar rang rig pas yul rnam pa gnyis grub par dam bcas te /
analyzed: @18a * // de ltar rang rig pas yul rnam pa gnyis grub par dam bcas te /
translated: Thus, having asserted that the two kinds of objects are established by reflexive awareness,

original: rnam par rtog pa dang mi rtog pa gnyis tha dad par bsgrub pas 'ongs pa de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa la log par rtogs pa gzhan dag kyang bkag nas skabs su bab pa mjug sdud pa brjod pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang mi rtog pa gnyis tha dad par bsgrub pas 'ongs pa de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa la log par rtogs pa gzhan dag kyang bkag nas skabs su bab pa mjug sdud pa brjod pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya pa'o //
translated: Since the establishment of the difference between conceptual and non-conceptual is the import of that, having refuted other misconceptions regarding inference of the nature of that, the summary of the present context is stated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gal te yul gyi dbye ba brjod par bya ba yin la de ni rnam pa gcig gis kyang 'grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te yul gyi dbye ba brjod par bya ba yin la de ni rnam pa gcig gis kyang 'grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the division of the object is to be stated, is it not established by one aspect?üîΩTherefore, what is the point of positing the four types such as potentiality?

original: des na nus pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi nye bar bkod pas ci bya snyam du bsu nas re zhig brjod ma thag pa gsum ni gtan tshigs gsum la ltos nas yin no zhes ston pa ni 'dis ni zhes bya ba ste 'du ba'i rang bzhin nye
analyzed: des na nus pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi nye bar bkod pas ci bya snyam du bsu nas re zhig brjod ma thag pa gsum ni gtan tshigs gsum la ltos nas yin no zhes ston pa ni 'dis ni zhes bya ba ste 'du ba'i rang bzhin nye
translated: Having anticipated this with, ‚ÄúWhat is the point of positing‚Ä¶,‚Äù the three just mentioned are shown to be in reliance upon the three reasons, respectively, with ‚ÄúThis is because‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: bar bkod pas so //
analyzed: bar bkod pas so //
translated: The nature of the collection is posited.

original: gal te dpe dang 'dra ba nyid ces bya ba gtan tshigs gsum ga'i yang yul ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te dpe dang 'dra ba nyid ces bya ba gtan tshigs gsum ga'i yang yul ma yin nam /
translated: If similarity is not the object of all three reasons, ‚Äúlike the example‚Äù?

original: de ji ltar na 'dis ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi yul bstan to zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar na 'dis ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi yul bstan to zhes brjod ce na /
translated: How can it be said that this teaches the domain of the effect reason?

original: bden te 'dra ba ni gnyis te dngos po'i dang chos tsam gyi ste tha snyad las yin no //
analyzed: bden te 'dra ba ni gnyis te dngos po'i dang chos tsam gyi ste tha snyad las yin no //
translated: It is true, but similarity is twofold: of thing and of mere property, from the conventional.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs las ni me la sogs pa'i dngos po nyid dpe la mthong ba dang 'dra bar rtog pa'i phyir dngos po la brten pa brjod la /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs las ni me la sogs pa'i dngos po nyid dpe la mthong ba dang 'dra bar rtog pa'i phyir dngos po la brten pa brjod la /
