translated: From the effect reason, one infers the thing itself, such as fire, because one sees the similarity to the example.

original: rang bzhin nam mi dmigs pa la ni chos la brten pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin nam mi dmigs pa la ni chos la brten pa nyid do //
translated: In the case of the nature or nonobservation reason, one infers the mere property.

original: de la dang po ni chos can gyi rang bzhin las tha dad par rang gi ngo bo snang pa'i phyir na de la brten pa'i 'dra ba yang dngos su mthong bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de la dang po ni chos can gyi rang bzhin las tha dad par rang gi ngo bo snang pa'i phyir na de la brten pa'i 'dra ba yang dngos su mthong bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: In the first case, the similarity based on the thing is posited as actually seen because the nature of the subject appears as different from that.

original: chos tsam gyis ni de las bzlog pa'i phyir na btags pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: chos tsam gyis ni de las bzlog pa'i phyir na btags pa tsam yin no //
translated: In the case of mere property, it is the opposite of that and is merely imputed.

original: gal te yang de kho nar 'dra ba thams cad btags pa kho na yin pa de lta na yang rtogs pa dang dngos po la brten par rlom pa'i phyir na 'dra ba'i blos ni dngos po la brten pa'i 'dra ba nyid du yul du byed pa yin no
analyzed: gal te yang de kho nar 'dra ba thams cad btags pa kho na yin pa de lta na yang rtogs pa dang dngos po la brten par rlom pa'i phyir na 'dra ba'i blos ni dngos po la brten pa'i 'dra ba nyid du yul du byed pa yin no
translated: Even though similarity is only a conceptual imputation in reality, the mind that conceives similarity still takes as its object the similarity that is based on things.

original: // des na de tsam gyi 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi dbang du byas nas 'dra ba'i rnam par brjod par 'os pa yin no //
analyzed: // des na de tsam gyi 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi dbang du byas nas 'dra ba'i rnam par brjod par 'os pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, from the perspective of a reason based on effect, it is appropriate to speak of similarity.

original: de bzhin du sgra'i yul nyid kyang sgra las byung ba'i shes pas rtogs par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni shing la sogs pa'i tshig brjod pa las yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i don /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra'i yul nyid kyang sgra las byung ba'i shes pas rtogs par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni shing la sogs pa'i tshig brjod pa las yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i don /
translated: Similarly, the object of a word is understood by a consciousness that arises from a word. When one conceives of the meaning that possesses branches, etc., from the expression of the word tree, etc.,

original: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la rtog pa na de'i yul du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la rtog pa na de'i yul du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: it is posited as the object of a consciousness that arises from a word.

original: des na de'i yul nyid ni de'i rtogs pa la snang ba nyid de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yin pas na /
analyzed: des na de'i yul nyid ni de'i rtogs pa la snang ba nyid de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yin pas na /
translated: Therefore, the object of that consciousness is merely the appearance in that consciousness.

original: de'i khyab par byed pa dang go bar bya ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de'i khyab par byed pa dang go bar bya ba yang yin no //
translated: It is also the pervader and the object of understanding.

original: de la sgra las byung @18b ba'i shes pas rtogs par bya ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la sgra las byung @18b ba'i shes pas rtogs par bya ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: With regard to that, the object of understanding that arises from sound isüîΩthe object of understanding that arises from sound.

original: sgra las byung ba'i rtogs pa las sdang ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i rtogs pa las sdang ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the object of understanding that arises from sound.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni sgra las byung ba'i shes pa de nyid kyang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni sgra las byung ba'i shes pa de nyid kyang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That itself is stated: that very understanding that arises from sound.

original: chos can gyi chos snang ba bstan par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: chos can gyi chos snang ba bstan par blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be seen as the appearance of the property of the subject.

original: sgra las byung ba'i rtogs pa la snang ba ni snang ba can gyi don sgra'i rtogs pa'i yul nyid du rtogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i rtogs pa la snang ba ni snang ba can gyi don sgra'i rtogs pa'i yul nyid du rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: The appearance in the understanding that arises from sound is the object of the understanding that arises from sound.

original: don gang zhig shes pa gang la snang ba can de ni de'i yul yin te /
analyzed: don gang zhig shes pa gang la snang ba can de ni de'i yul yin te /
translated: The object of a certain cognition is that which appears to that cognition.

original: dper na dbang po'i shes pa la snang ba can gyi rang gi mtshan nyid de'i yul yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dbang po'i shes pa la snang ba can gyi rang gi mtshan nyid de'i yul yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the intrinsic identity that appears to a sense cognition is the object of that.

original: phyir mngon par 'dod pa la yang sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la snang ba can yin no zhes bya ba tha snyad sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mngon par 'dod pa la yang sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la snang ba can yin no zhes bya ba tha snyad sgrub pa'o //
translated: And in the case of the inference for others, the statement ‚ÄúIt is the object of a cognition that has sound as its object‚Äù is the establishment of the expression.

original: gal te me'i tshig gi don 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi yul ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te me'i tshig gi don 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi yul ma yin nam /
translated: If the meaning of the word fire is not the domain of a result-based inference,

original: gang gis na sgra'i yul nyid kyis rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kho na'i yul du brjod par khyad par yang ci zhig yod snyam na /
analyzed: gang gis na sgra'i yul nyid kyis rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kho na'i yul du brjod par khyad par yang ci zhig yod snyam na /
translated: then what is the difference between it and the domain of a sound-based inference that it is called the domain of only an essential-based inference?

original: de lta ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: gtan tshigs gzhan la ltos nas khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gtan tshigs gzhan la ltos nas khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because there is a difference in relation to another type of inference.

original: / dper na 'di na me yod do zhes bya ba 'dir du ba la sogs pa la ltos pa de bzhin du shing la sogs pa'i tshig thos pa na ni yal ga dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i spyi //
analyzed: / dper na 'di na me yod do zhes bya ba 'dir du ba la sogs pa la ltos pa de bzhin du shing la sogs pa'i tshig thos pa na ni yal ga dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i spyi //
translated: For example, in the statement ‚ÄúFire exists here,‚Äù it is dependent on smoke. In the same way, when one hears the word tree, one thinks of a general object that possesses branches and so on.

original: de'i yul can gyi tha snyad du bya ba la gtan tshigs gzhan la mi ltos te de'i rnam par snang ba tsam gyis de bzhin du rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi tha snyad du bya ba la gtan tshigs gzhan la mi ltos te de'i rnam par snang ba tsam gyis de bzhin du rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: The subject of that is not dependent on another reason, because it is posited as it appears, merely as it appears.

original: / ngag gi don la ni thams cad du sgrub pa dang rjes brjod pa yod pa'i phyir na rang bzhin khyad par can gyi rjes su dpag pa yang gzhan la ltos pa med do //
analyzed: / ngag gi don la ni thams cad du sgrub pa dang rjes brjod pa yod pa'i phyir na rang bzhin khyad par can gyi rjes su dpag pa yang gzhan la ltos pa med do //
translated: And in the case of the meaning of a sentence, since there is always a proof and a repetition, even an inference with a special nature is not dependent on another.

original: dper na ba lang 'di ni dkar po yin no //
analyzed: dper na ba lang 'di ni dkar po yin no //
translated: For example, in the sentence ‚ÄúThis cow is white,‚Äù

original: ba lang khyer la shog cig ces bya ba 'dir ba lang rjes su brjod nas dkar po'i tha snyad du yul du rung bar sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba lang khyer la shog cig ces bya ba 'dir ba lang rjes su brjod nas dkar po'i tha snyad du yul du rung bar sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the cow is repeated, and then it is proved to be a suitable object for the term ‚Äúwhite.‚Äù

original: rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is just like understanding.

original: kha cig du ni khyad par gzhan yang rtogs te /
analyzed: kha cig du ni khyad par gzhan yang rtogs te /
translated: In some cases, another distinction is understood.

original: dper na ba med ni ba lang dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba 'dir ming tsam gyis grub pa'i ba men la ba lang dang 'dra bar rtogs par byed de ba lang 'dra ba'i tha snyad kyi yul du rung bar bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na ba med ni ba lang dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba 'dir ming tsam gyis grub pa'i ba men la ba lang dang 'dra bar rtogs par byed de ba lang 'dra ba'i tha snyad kyi yul du rung bar bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, in the statement, ‚ÄúA gayal is like a cow,‚Äù the gayal, which is established by mere name, is understood to be like a cow, because it is established as a suitable object of the convention ‚Äúlike a cow.‚Äù

original: khyad par de nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par de nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúthus‚Äù indicates just that distinction.

original: hi zhes bya ba ni logs su gsal ba zhes bya ba'i don 'di la yin no //
analyzed: hi zhes bya ba ni logs su gsal ba zhes bya ba'i don 'di la yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúhi‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúin this way.‚Äù

original: nye bar 'jal ba zhes bya ba ni ji skad brjod pa nye bar 'jal ba dag gis so //
analyzed: nye bar 'jal ba zhes bya ba ni ji skad brjod pa nye bar 'jal ba dag gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy analogy‚Äù means by analogy as stated.

original: de ltar spyir nges pa na ba min mthong bas khyad par gyi mthar thug par brjod pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde la ba men gyi @19a * //
analyzed: de ltar spyir nges pa na ba min mthong bas khyad par gyi mthar thug par brjod pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'o // de la ba men gyi @19a * //
translated: When a general determination is made in this way, the statement of the final distinction is ‚ÄúThis is a gayal.‚ÄùüîΩIn that statement, the word ‚Äúthis‚Äù refers to the object of the analogy.

original: rang gi ngo bo la yang rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa dang 'dra ba la yang mngon sum 'jug par dogs pa bzlog pa'i don du de'i ngo bo mngon sum du zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la yang rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa dang 'dra ba la yang mngon sum 'jug par dogs pa bzlog pa'i don du de'i ngo bo mngon sum du zhes gsungs so //
translated: In order to eliminate the doubt that perception also engages with what is similar to the engagement of inference with the intrinsic reality of the gayal, the statement ‚Äúits intrinsic reality is perceived‚Äù is made.

original: 'di ni bram ze'i lugs kyis 'di de dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba mi 'dra ba'i khyad par can gyi ba men 'dzin par byed pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni bram ze'i lugs kyis 'di de dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba mi 'dra ba'i khyad par can gyi ba men 'dzin par byed pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid yin la /
translated: This is the Brahminical system, which is a conceptual cognition that apprehends a cow that has the distinguishing feature of being dissimilar, saying, ‚ÄúThis is like that.‚ÄùüîΩIt is a valid cognition of direct perception.

original: de 'di dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni nye bar 'jal ba yin te /
analyzed: de 'di dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni nye bar 'jal ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis is like that‚Äù is an inference,

original: de lkog tu gyur pa'i chos dang chos can rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lkog tu gyur pa'i chos dang chos can rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it comprehends a hidden phenomenon and a subject.üîΩTherefore, how can similarity be the object of a cognition that arises from a word?

original: des na ji ltar 'dra ba sgra las byung ba'i shes pa'i spyod yul yin snyam du dogs pa bsu nas 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na ji ltar 'dra ba sgra las byung ba'i shes pa'i spyod yul yin snyam du dogs pa bsu nas 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: Having anticipated this doubt with ‚ÄúIn this way,‚Äù he says,

original: don gcig pa nyid yin la zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka la brten pa'i 'dra ba ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gcig pa nyid yin la zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka la brten pa'i 'dra ba ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äúbecause of the identity of the object.‚Äù He says this in order to show that the similarity is based on both.

original: 'on kyang tshig tshul tsam zhig tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang tshig tshul tsam zhig tha dad pa yin te /
translated: However, there is a mere difference in the mode of expression.

original: dper na gcig gi spun zla nyid rtogs na gzhan gyi yang sbun zla nyid rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gcig gi spun zla nyid rtogs na gzhan gyi yang sbun zla nyid rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when one realizes that one is a brother, one also realizes that the other is a brother.

original: de la yang gzhan gyi spun zla nyid don gyis go bas rtogs pa yin no snyam na ma yin te /
analyzed: de la yang gzhan gyi spun zla nyid don gyis go bas rtogs pa yin no snyam na ma yin te /
translated: If you think that the meaning of ‚Äúbrother‚Äù is understood by implication, that is not so.

original: don tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meanings are different.

original: rtogs pa'i tshul tha dad pa tsam gyis don tha dad pa ni /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i tshul tha dad pa tsam gyis don tha dad pa ni /
translated: The difference in the mode of understanding does not make the meanings different.

original: au pa go'i bu dang au pa go las skyes pa zhes bya ba dang / chung ma dang btsun mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang de ltar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: au pa go'i bu dang au pa go las skyes pa zhes bya ba dang / chung ma dang btsun mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang de ltar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow, absurdly, that the son of Upagupta and one born to Upagupta would be different, that wife and queen would be different, and so on.üîΩIf you say that it is like this,

original: de la gal te 'di de dang 'dra ba yin no /
analyzed: de la gal te 'di de dang 'dra ba yin no /
translated: then it is just that.

original: zhes bya ba mngon sum nyid yin na de'i tshe yin la rag na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba mngon sum nyid yin na de'i tshe yin la rag na /
translated: If it is direct perception, then it is just that.

original: 'on kyang de 'di dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba'am don de nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de 'di dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba'am don de nyid yin te /
translated: But if you say that it is like this, or that it is that very object,

original: des na mngon sum gyis grub pa la nye bar 'jal bas brtags pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: des na mngon sum gyis grub pa la nye bar 'jal bas brtags pas ci zhig bya /
translated: then what is the point of analyzing with inference something that is established by direct perception?

original: grub pa'i mtha' ni mngon sum ni rtogs pa med pa kho na mngon sum yin pa'i phyir des ni ba lang dam pa men gyi rang bzhin ngo bo tsam zhig rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phyed snga ma'i don to //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ni mngon sum ni rtogs pa med pa kho na mngon sum yin pa'i phyir des ni ba lang dam pa men gyi rang bzhin ngo bo tsam zhig rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phyed snga ma'i don to //
translated: The conclusion is this: since perception is only non-conceptual, it is only the nature, the mere essence, of the cow or gayal that is perceived by it. This is the meaning of the first half of the verse.

original: phyed phyis ma 'chad pa ni de'i rjes su byed pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed phyis ma 'chad pa ni de'i rjes su byed pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second half of the verse is not explained, but it is this:

original: 'di ltar de'i rjes su byed pa zhes bya ba'i ming tsam gyi 'dra ba ni gnyi ga la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i rjes su byed pa zhes bya ba'i ming tsam gyi 'dra ba ni gnyi ga la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the similarity of the name only, which is based on that, is present in both,

original: gal te de lta na yang gang gis khyed kyang rjes su dpag pa don du gnyer ba mngon sum gyis ci ste mi 'dzin snyam na mngon sum gyis ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang gang gis khyed kyang rjes su dpag pa don du gnyer ba mngon sum gyis ci ste mi 'dzin snyam na mngon sum gyis ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: even though it is like that, why don't you who seek inference grasp it by perception? It is said: Perception does not grasp...

original: gcig gis snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig gis snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: It is thought that one [perception] does not [grasp it].

original: gal te yang mngon sum gnyis kyis gnyi ga'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa de lta na yang gnyi ga la gnas pa'i 'dra ba ni gcig gis kyang rtogs pa rmi nus te /
analyzed: gal te yang mngon sum gnyis kyis gnyi ga'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa de lta na yang gnyi ga la gnas pa'i 'dra ba ni gcig gis kyang rtogs pa rmi nus te /
translated: Even if both perceptions grasp the nature of both, still, since the similarity based on both is present in both, one cannot grasp it.

original: gnyis @19b pa mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis @19b pa mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second is not seen.

original: des na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kho nas rtogs pa yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: des na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kho nas rtogs pa yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the cognition is by means of the natural reason alone.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i rnam pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i rnam pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The expression of the form of inference is

original: de ni 'di dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni 'di dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is similar to this.‚Äù

original: gal te de'i rnam pa yod pa kho na 'dra ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te de'i rnam pa yod pa kho na 'dra ba ma yin nam /
translated: If the form of that is existent alone, is it not similar?

original: ji ltar rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos po yin snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos po yin snyam na /
translated: How is it the state of reason and the possession of the reason?

original: 'dra ba'i tha snyad tsam zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i tha snyad tsam zhes smos so //
translated: The expression ‚Äúmerely the convention of similarity‚Äù is stated.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rnam par 'dzin pa de ni de thams cad ni de dang 'dra ba'o zhes tha snyad du bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rnam par 'dzin pa de ni de thams cad ni de dang 'dra ba'o zhes tha snyad du bya ba yin te /
translated: The application is this: Whatever one apprehends in the form of that, that is all of that, is the convention.

original: dper na g-yas pa dang g-yon pa'i mdzub mo gnyis phan tshun bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na g-yas pa dang g-yon pa'i mdzub mo gnyis phan tshun bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the right and left index fingers.

original: ba lang dang ba men yang de bzhin du bya ba'o //
analyzed: ba lang dang ba men yang de bzhin du bya ba'o //
translated: The cow and the gayal are to be treated in the same way.

original: ma nges pa ni ma yin te 'dra ba'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa ni ma yin te 'dra ba'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not uncertain because the mere reason for the convention of similarity is just that.

original: sgra las byung ba'i rtogs pa la snang bas rnam pa 'dres par 'dzin pa'i phyir ma grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i rtogs pa la snang bas rnam pa 'dres par 'dzin pa'i phyir ma grub pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not unestablished because the realization that arises from words apprehends the aspect of the object as mixed.

original: phyi rol gyi tha snyad nyams pa yang ma yin te snang ba dang rnam par brtags pa ngag gcig tu byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi tha snyad nyams pa yang ma yin te snang ba dang rnam par brtags pa ngag gcig tu byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is there a loss of external conventions, because the appearance and the conceptualized are made into one.

original: 'o na de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa nyid kyi cho 'phul yin pa'i phyir dngos po mthong ba med pa na gang dang gcig tu byed pa las tha snyad byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa nyid kyi cho 'phul yin pa'i phyir dngos po mthong ba med pa na gang dang gcig tu byed pa las tha snyad byed ce na /
translated: Well, at that time, since it is the power of conceptualization itself, when there is no seeing of an entity, with what is it made one, and from that is the convention made?

original: de lta bu'i shes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i shes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The statement the cognition of that kind... and so on.

original: 'di de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: This is like that.

original: de 'di dang 'dra ba'i zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa gnyis kyi rgyu mtshan du gyur pa zhes bya ba drug pa'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de 'di dang 'dra ba'i zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa gnyis kyi rgyu mtshan du gyur pa zhes bya ba drug pa'i bsdu ba'o //
translated: That is like this. The sixth case is used for the reason of those two realizations.

original: gang gi phyir nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas de 'dra ba'i rnam par rtog ba skye bar 'gyur ba gong du gnyis la de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par yod pa ni rgyu'i khyad par gyi nus pa nyid las yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas de 'dra ba'i rnam par rtog ba skye bar 'gyur ba gong du gnyis la de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par yod pa ni rgyu'i khyad par gyi nus pa nyid las yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the difference in the nature of the two is due to the difference in the power of the cause, since a conception of that sort arises by way of experience.

original: 'o na 'dra ba'i tha snyad la nyams su myong ba nyid tshad mar 'gyur mong /
analyzed: 'o na 'dra ba'i tha snyad la nyams su myong ba nyid tshad mar 'gyur mong /
translated: Well, then, in the case of the convention of similarity, experience itself would be the valid cognition.

original: 'dra ba gnyis bdag gis mthong ngo snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi byed pa ni de nyid la sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'dra ba gnyis bdag gis mthong ngo snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi byed pa ni de nyid la sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
translated: The thought ‚ÄúI see two similarities‚Äù is a conception, and its function is to superimpose identity on them.

original: bden te gsal ba'i gnas skabs na ni de kho na yin no //
analyzed: bden te gsal ba'i gnas skabs na ni de kho na yin no //
translated: That is true, but in the case of the clear cognition, it is just that.

original: lkog shal la sogs pas ba lang nyid du tha snyad 'dogs pa yang rmongs pa kho na ma yin no //
analyzed: lkog shal la sogs pas ba lang nyid du tha snyad 'dogs pa yang rmongs pa kho na ma yin no //
translated: The convention of cowhood in the case of the hump and so on is not just a matter of confusion.

original: de'i phyir blo gsal ba ni mngon sum kho na 'dra ba 'grub la gzhan la ni rjes su dpag pa las tha snyad tsam sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir blo gsal ba ni mngon sum kho na 'dra ba 'grub la gzhan la ni rjes su dpag pa las tha snyad tsam sgrub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in the case of the clear cognition, it is just perception that establishes the similarity, but in the case of the other, it is just inference that establishes the mere convention.

original: des na nye bar 'jal ba ni ci yang byar med do //
analyzed: des na nye bar 'jal ba ni ci yang byar med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no need for an inference.

original: ming dang ming can gyi 'brel ba rtogs pas ni nye bar bstan pa'i ngag gis bskyed pa 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i 'dra ba las yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ming dang ming can gyi 'brel ba rtogs pas ni nye bar bstan pa'i ngag gis bskyed pa 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i 'dra ba las yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The relation between the name and the thing named is understood from the statement of the example, because it is similar to the relation of the statement of the example.

original: rjes su dpag par gsal ba yin no //üîΩdpe @20a * //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par gsal ba yin no // dpe @20a * //
translated: Thus, the inference is stated.

original: med pa'i phyir ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ma yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that it is not so because there is no example,

original: de lta ma yin te gang zhig ba lang dang 'dra ba de ni ba men gyi ming gi brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te gang zhig ba lang dang 'dra ba de ni ba men gyi ming gi brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: that is not so. Whatever is similar to a cow is the referent of the word ‚Äúox.‚Äù

original: dper na nye bar bstan pa'i ngag gi gnas skabs kyi rnam par rtog pa la snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nye bar bstan pa'i ngag gi gnas skabs kyi rnam par rtog pa la snang ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the appearance in the conceptual cognition that occurs in the context of the statement of the example.

original: 'di yang de dang 'dra ba min zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yang de dang 'dra ba min zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not like that, because it is not so.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yul thams cad 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par rung ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa'i gnod byed yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yul thams cad 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par rung ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa'i gnod byed yin no //
translated: The statement of the example is suitable to express all the objects of conceptual cognition, because it is the refutation of the application to the discordant class.

original: de bas na ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not uncertain.

original: gal te de lta na dpe'i dus bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid la sgra 'jug par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te de lta na dpe'i dus bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid la sgra 'jug par 'gyur la /
translated: If that is so, then the word would apply to the object of conceptualization just as it does in the case of the example.

original: snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba gcig tu byed pa las 'jug pa ni de lta bu'i yod pa ni mi slu ba dang ldan pa yang yin no //
analyzed: snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba gcig tu byed pa las 'jug pa ni de lta bu'i yod pa ni mi slu ba dang ldan pa yang yin no //
translated: And the application of the word would be based on the identification of the appearance with the conceptualized object, and that would be a non-mistaken existence.

original: des na sgra rnams phyi rol gyi yul can ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na sgra rnams phyi rol gyi yul can ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, words are not about external objects.

original: 'di ni de bzhin du yin no zhes mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin du yin no zhes mjug bsdu ba ste /
translated: This is the conclusion.

original: brjod pa ni de'i phyir sgra'i yul ni zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgal te gzhan don rjes dpag gang yin pa //üîΩspyi ni de yi spyi'i yul yin ;
analyzed: brjod pa ni de'i phyir sgra'i yul ni zhes bya ba'o // gal te gzhan don rjes dpag gang yin pa // spyi ni de yi spyi'i yul yin ;
translated: The statement ‚ÄúTherefore, the object of words . . .‚ÄùüîΩIsn‚Äôt it said that the object of inference for the sake of others

original: / zhes brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: / zhes brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: is the universal of that?

original: de ji ltar na sgra tsam gyi yul spyod ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar na sgra tsam gyi yul spyod ce na /
translated: How can it be the object of mere words?

original: de ni zhen pa'i yul la ltos nas brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni zhen pa'i yul la ltos nas brjod pa yin te /
translated: That is said in terms of the object of adherence.

original: sgra las byung ba'i rtog pa'i yul snang ba nyid ni rang gi rnam pa rang gi mtshan nyid du gyur pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i rtog pa'i yul snang ba nyid ni rang gi rnam pa rang gi mtshan nyid du gyur pa kho na yin no //
translated: The object of the conception that arises from words is the appearance itself, which is the universal of its own aspect.

original: de la tha snyad du bya ba'i spyi ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de la tha snyad du bya ba'i spyi ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: In that regard, there is no contradiction in the conventional usage of the universal, because it is the domain of inference for the sake of others.

original: rnam par rtog pa dngos po'i yul can yin pa nyid ni dngos su 'gog pa ma yin snyam du brgya la the tshom za'o snyam na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dngos po'i yul can yin pa nyid ni dngos su 'gog pa ma yin snyam du brgya la the tshom za'o snyam na /
translated: One might think, ‚ÄúThe object of conceptual thought is a real entity, and it is not directly refuted.‚Äù

original: sgra smos pas ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sgra smos pas ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: To that, [the root text] says, ‚ÄúBecause of the mention of sound . . .‚Äù

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan yang yod pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan yang yod pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThere is also another reason‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po med pa spyi'i chos ni mi dmigs pa'i yul yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po med pa spyi'i chos ni mi dmigs pa'i yul yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the property of the universal of nonexistence is the domain of nonapprehension.

original: gal te yod pa'i rnam par shes pas ni re zhig yod pa nyid du tha snyad du bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te yod pa'i rnam par shes pas ni re zhig yod pa nyid du tha snyad du bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúWell then, is it not the case that an existent consciousness is conventionally designated as existent?

original: med pa ni 'gar yang nus pa yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: med pa ni 'gar yang nus pa yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: And is it not the case that a nonexistent is never capable of anything?

original: des na gang la blo med pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na gang la blo med pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: So how can something be nonexistent when there is a mind?‚Äù

original: de la zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de la zhes gsungs te /
translated: To that, [the root text] says, ‚ÄúIn that case . . .‚Äù

original: blo med pa'i yul la'o //
analyzed: blo med pa'i yul la'o //
translated: [It is] with respect to the domain of a nonexistent mind.

original: ma yin 'jug pas zla ba'i shes pa la mi dmigs par bstan pas lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: ma yin 'jug pas zla ba'i shes pa la mi dmigs par bstan pas lan btab pa yin no //
translated: The reply is that the moon is not perceived by the consciousness of the eye, because it is not engaged in that.

original: sa phyogs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis nges pa'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa phyogs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis nges pa'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the form of the moon is ascertained as having the nature of the region of the sky, etc.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni des zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni des zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The same is expressed by ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: nges pa'i rnam pa can gyi don gyis bskyed pa'i shes pa ni bdag nyid nges pa'i rnam pa can kho nar @20b rang rig pas nyams su myong ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nges pa'i rnam pa can gyi don gyis bskyed pa'i shes pa ni bdag nyid nges pa'i rnam pa can kho nar @20b rang rig pas nyams su myong ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The consciousness produced by an object that has a definite form is experienced by reflexive awareness as having a definite form.

original: 'di tsam gyis 'di mi dmigs la gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis 'di mi dmigs la gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Because of that, the moon is not perceived by the eye consciousness, but something else is.

original: 'di la bdag zhugs kyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya bar sgrub pa dang 'gog pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis 'phangs pa yin no zhes rigs so //
analyzed: 'di la bdag zhugs kyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya bar sgrub pa dang 'gog pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis 'phangs pa yin no zhes rigs so //
translated: It is reasonable to say that the two concepts of affirmation and negation are projected: ‚ÄúIt is this, not something else,‚Äù and ‚ÄúIt is engaged in this, not something else.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu brjod pa ni des zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu brjod pa ni des zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The result is stated by ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: dngos po'i rtogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dngos po'i rtogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The realization of an object is twofold:

original: gcig gi rang bzhin sgrub pa dang / gzhan 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: gcig gi rang bzhin sgrub pa dang / gzhan 'gog pa'o //
translated: affirming the nature of one thing and negating another.

original: skabs su bab pa'i rnam pa gnyis la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa'i rnam pa gnyis la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The two aspects that are relevant here are also of two kinds.

original: yin no zhes bya ba rnam pa gzhan med par ston pa'i don du yin no //
analyzed: yin no zhes bya ba rnam pa gzhan med par ston pa'i don du yin no //
translated: The point is that they are taught in order to show that there is no other aspect.

original: 'di skad du rnam pa gzhan med par yang ston pa yin no zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du rnam pa gzhan med par yang ston pa yin no zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: It is as if he were to say that they are taught without any other aspect.

original: mngon sum nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mngon sum gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mngon sum gzhan ma yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúBy means of perception‚Äù means that there is no other perception of the conceptual thought that affirms.

original: dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang dngos po med pa'i tshad ma'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang dngos po med pa'i tshad ma'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: The conceptual thought that negates is also the result of the valid cognition that is the non-existence of a thing.

original: mngon sum gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not another perception.

original: ldan par 'gyur ba'i khyad par can gyi dngos po'i nye bas dngos po med pa'i gzhal bya 'dzin par byed pa zhes pa'i don te /üîΩtha dad par smra ba'i zhes bya ba ni phyi rol smra ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ldan par 'gyur ba'i khyad par can gyi dngos po'i nye bas dngos po med pa'i gzhal bya 'dzin par byed pa zhes pa'i don te / tha dad par smra ba'i zhes bya ba ni phyi rol smra ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it apprehends the object of comprehension that is the non-existence of a thing by the power of the thing that is associated with it.üîΩ‚ÄúThe proponents of difference‚Äù means the proponents of external objects.

original: phyi rol smra ba la tha dad par smra bar brjod pa ni /
analyzed: phyi rol smra ba la tha dad par smra bar brjod pa ni /
translated: The proponents of external objects are called ‚Äúproponents of difference‚Äù because

original: phyi rol du smra ba med na mi 'byung ba nyid du bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du smra ba med na mi 'byung ba nyid du bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: In order to show that it does not occur without the external object.

original: yang na blo la ltos nas tha dad pa'i phyir de ltar brjod de /
analyzed: yang na blo la ltos nas tha dad pa'i phyir de ltar brjod de /
translated: Or else, it is said in this way because of the difference in relation to the cognition.

original: blo'i rang bzhin la ni khyad par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: blo'i rang bzhin la ni khyad par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the difference should be stated in relation to the nature of the cognition.

original: rnam pa gnyis su rtogs pa'i gtan tshigs brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su rtogs pa'i gtan tshigs brjod pa ni /
translated: The reason for the understanding in two ways is stated:

original: rtog pa'i rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa'i rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because there is no other aspect of the cognition.

original: sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i rtogs pa spangs nas blo'i rnam pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i rtogs pa spangs nas blo'i rnam pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Apart from the understanding of affirmation and negation, there is no other aspect of the cognition.üîΩMoreover, this is stated as the reason:

original: yang mngon sum nyid kyis zhes bya ba 'di la gtan tshigs su brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: yang mngon sum nyid kyis zhes bya ba 'di la gtan tshigs su brjod pa yin te /
translated: because it is perception itself.

original: 'di 'dra ba'i yul rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba des pa'i thabs ni mngon las gzhan yod ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i yul rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba des pa'i thabs ni mngon las gzhan yod ma yin te /
translated: The means of understanding an object of this kind is not other than perception,

original: gzhan med pa'i phyir dang de nyid kyis nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan med pa'i phyir dang de nyid kyis nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other and because of its capacity.

original: de ltar gang la blo med pa de mi bltar rung ba'i khyad par can du gyur pa na dngos po med pa'i sgrub par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i yul yin la khyad par dang bral ba ni yod pa'i tha snyad dgag pa'i 'bras bu can yin no zhes
analyzed: de ltar gang la blo med pa de mi bltar rung ba'i khyad par can du gyur pa na dngos po med pa'i sgrub par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i yul yin la khyad par dang bral ba ni yod pa'i tha snyad dgag pa'i 'bras bu can yin no zhes
translated: Thus, when that which lacks awareness becomes a special object that is not seen, it is the object of non-apprehension, the proof of non-existence. But being free from the qualifier has the effect of negating the convention of existence.

original: bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is what is intended.

original: yang na sgra'i rtogs pa'i yul ni nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir na rnam pa thams cad du tha snyad du rung ba nyid @21a * //
analyzed: yang na sgra'i rtogs pa'i yul ni nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir na rnam pa thams cad du tha snyad du rung ba nyid @21a * //
translated: Or, the object of linguistic understanding is indicated, and in every way, it is suitable as a convention.

original: ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kho na las yin no //
analyzed: ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kho na las yin no //
translated: This is only due to the natural reason.

original: 'di skad brjod pa'i gtso bor gyur pa'i 'dra ba nyid ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kho na'i yul te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa'i gtso bor gyur pa'i 'dra ba nyid ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kho na'i yul te /
translated: The similarity that is the primary expression of this is only the object of the reason of effect.

original: des na yul nges pa rnam pa gsum brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na yul nges pa rnam pa gsum brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the ascertainment of the object is stated in three ways.

original: yang na rnam pa gsum pa 'di yang sgro 'dogs pa 'gog pa lhur byed pa'i gtan tshigs nyid kyi nges pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na rnam pa gsum pa 'di yang sgro 'dogs pa 'gog pa lhur byed pa'i gtan tshigs nyid kyi nges pa yin no //
translated: Or, this threefold ascertainment is also the ascertainment of the reason itself, which is focused on refuting superimposition.

original: 'di ltar 'dra ba nyid 'bras bu'i yul yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dra ba nyid 'bras bu'i yul yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, similarity is the object of the effect.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa mi 'dra ba dpog pa bkag pa'i phyir na dngos po la sgro 'dogs pa bkag pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa mi 'dra ba dpog pa bkag pa'i phyir na dngos po la sgro 'dogs pa bkag pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since the argument refutes the non-similarity of God, etc., it demonstrates the refutation of the superimposition of entities.

original: tha snyad nyid ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs las yin no zhes bya bas ni dngos po'i chos su sgro 'dogs pa 'gog pa bstan te //
analyzed: tha snyad nyid ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs las yin no zhes bya bas ni dngos po'i chos su sgro 'dogs pa 'gog pa bstan te //
translated: The statement ‚Äúconvention itself is from a reason of nature‚Äù demonstrates the refutation of the superimposition of the quality of entity.

original: gal te skad cig ma la sogs pa dngos su ma yin yang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir na tha snyad sgrub par byed par rnam par gzhag pa ma yin pa de lta na yang ri la me'i rnam pa spangs pa ltar /
analyzed: gal te skad cig ma la sogs pa dngos su ma yin yang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir na tha snyad sgrub par byed par rnam par gzhag pa ma yin pa de lta na yang ri la me'i rnam pa spangs pa ltar /
translated: Even though momentariness, etc., are not directly perceptible, if they are not posited as establishing conventions because they are non-conceptual, then, just as the aspect of fire on a mountain pass is abandoned,

original: de'i mngon sum ni skad cig ma'i rnam pa dang bral bar skye ba ma yin te ;
analyzed: de'i mngon sum ni skad cig ma'i rnam pa dang bral bar skye ba ma yin te ;
translated: its direct perception does not arise free from the aspect of momentariness.

original: des na de kho na skad cig ma la sogs pa sgrub par byed par tha snyad sgrub par byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na de kho na skad cig ma la sogs pa sgrub par byed par tha snyad sgrub par byed pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, that alone establishes momentariness, etc., and it is only the establishment of convention.

original: 'dis ni gang zhig mngon sum la snang ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin de nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir spyi la sogs pa'i gzung ba ni mi dmigs pas zin pa'i phyir mi snang ba dgag par brjod pa yin no //üîΩsnang ba nyid kyang nges zin par ma gyur cig ces /
analyzed: 'dis ni gang zhig mngon sum la snang ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin de nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir spyi la sogs pa'i gzung ba ni mi dmigs pas zin pa'i phyir mi snang ba dgag par brjod pa yin no // snang ba nyid kyang nges zin par ma gyur cig ces /
translated: And it is saying that the non-perception of the object of apprehension is not a perception of non-existence.

original: gang la blo med pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i yul yin no zhes brjod pa yin te des na skur pa 'debs pa bkag pa bstan to //
analyzed: gang la blo med pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i yul yin no zhes brjod pa yin te des na skur pa 'debs pa bkag pa bstan to //
translated: And it is saying that the object of non-perception is the very thing that has no cognition. Thus it teaches the refutation of the denial.

original: mi dmigs pa med par ni dgag pa 'grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa med par ni dgag pa 'grub pa ma yin no //
translated: But the establishment of the negation is not without non-perception.

original: gang la mngon sum gyi bkag pa de la ni gzhan mngon sum yin pa'i phyir de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la mngon sum gyi bkag pa de la ni gzhan mngon sum yin pa'i phyir de ni ma yin no //
translated: And in the case of negation by perception, it is not that because the other is perceived.

original: de la ni de nyid mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la ni de nyid mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: In that case, it is just the non-perception of that.

original: rmongs pa la ni de nyid rtags su nye bar bkod pa yin no //üîΩ'o na nus dang mi phyas phyir //
analyzed: rmongs pa la ni de nyid rtags su nye bar bkod pa yin no // 'o na nus dang mi phyas phyir //
translated: And in the case of delusion, it is just the non-perception of that.üîΩBut the non-perception of the object of apprehension is not a perception of non-existence.

original: zhes bya ba ci'i don du brjod ce na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ci'i don du brjod ce na /
translated: Now, what is the point of saying, ‚ÄúBecause of the capacity and the absence of contradiction‚Äù?

original: skabs su bab pa nyid dran par byed pa ni 'dra ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa nyid dran par byed pa ni 'dra ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: The expression ‚Äúsimilar‚Äù refers to the recollection of the past experience of the object.

original: 'dra ba nyid la sogs pa chos su bstan pa yin yang chos can nyid la rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid la sogs pa chos su bstan pa yin yang chos can nyid la rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Although similarity and so on are taught as universals, they are to be understood as particulars.

original: des na 'dra ba nyid ni lkog tu gyur pa'i rtogs pa rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin la /
analyzed: des na 'dra ba nyid ni lkog tu gyur pa'i rtogs pa rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin la /
translated: Thus, similarity is the object of inference, which is a cognition of a hidden object.

original: mi 'dra ba rang gi mtshan nyid ni cig shos mngon sum gyi yul yin no //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba rang gi mtshan nyid ni cig shos mngon sum gyi yul yin no //
translated: Dissimilarity, which is the particular characteristic, is the object of the other, which is perception.

original: de bzhin du sgra'i yul dang yul ma yin pa dang rgyu mtshan gzhan yod na gang la blo yod @21b pa dang med ces bya ba la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra'i yul dang yul ma yin pa dang rgyu mtshan gzhan yod na gang la blo yod @21b pa dang med ces bya ba la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the question ‚ÄúIs sound the object or nonobject of the intellect, if there is another reason?‚Äù should be applied to the question, ‚ÄúIs there an intellect or not?‚Äù

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What follows from this?

original: brjod pa de yang don byed par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod pa de yang don byed par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is ‚ÄúIt is also a productive object.‚Äù

original: dngos su nus pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin la brgyud pa'i nus pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dngos su nus pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin la brgyud pa'i nus pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Direct capability is a particular characteristic, and indirect capability is a universal characteristic.

original: shes pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni nus pa ma nges pa'i rgyu mtshan la bya'i skye ba la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni nus pa ma nges pa'i rgyu mtshan la bya'i skye ba la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This statement ‚Äúit is consciousness‚Äù means that the reason for the uncertainty of the potentiality is not the uncertainty of the arising.

original: 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba nyid ni nus pa las byung ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba nyid ni nus pa las byung ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang shes pa yin no //
translated: Similarity and dissimilarity do not arise from potentiality, but rather they are consciousness.

original: de yang mngon sum ma ma rjes su dpag pa de las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang mngon sum ma ma rjes su dpag pa de las skyes pa yin no //
translated: And that is direct perception or inference arising from that.

original: re zhig rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyang gzhan la mngon sum gyis dngos su skyed par byed pa'i yul min mod /
analyzed: re zhig rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyang gzhan la mngon sum gyis dngos su skyed par byed pa'i yul min mod /
translated: First, the reason of nature is not the direct producer of the object for another.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa la tha dad sgrub par byed pa de'i tshe tshul ji ltar yin /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa la tha dad sgrub par byed pa de'i tshe tshul ji ltar yin /
translated: But when it proves a difference in the aspect of conception, what is the method?

original: de'i tshe ni rang rig pa'i mngon sum nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni rang rig pa'i mngon sum nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: At that time, it is direct perception of reflexive awareness.

original: de'i tshe byed pa dang bcas pa nyid du rtogs pa nye bar gzung bas tshad ma dang 'bras bu la brten bas sam /
analyzed: de'i tshe byed pa dang bcas pa nyid du rtogs pa nye bar gzung bas tshad ma dang 'bras bu la brten bas sam /
translated: At that time, it is understood to be endowed with activity, and it is apprehended as the result of valid cognition.

original: rjes las skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa la ltos nas tha snyad byed pa la yin no //
analyzed: rjes las skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa la ltos nas tha snyad byed pa la yin no //
translated: It is in dependence on the conception that arises from the subsequent that the conventional is made.

original: de'i stobs kyis mngon sum nyid du rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir na de nyid la mngon sum du nye bar 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis mngon sum nyid du rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir na de nyid la mngon sum du nye bar 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: And because it is posited as direct perception by the power of that, it is designated as direct perception.

original: de'i dngos su skyed par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i dngos su skyed par byed pa yin la /
translated: It is the direct producer of that.

original: de'i de ma thag pa'i ni brgyud nas skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i de ma thag pa'i ni brgyud nas skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: The immediate antecedent of that is the indirect producer of that.

original: 'dis ni shes pa yang don bya bar nus pa nyid kyis yod pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni shes pa yang don bya bar nus pa nyid kyis yod pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that consciousness exists by virtue of its ability to perform a function.üîΩThus, the ability and inability to perform a function

original: des na nus dang ma nus dang // zhes bya ba 'di ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: des na nus dang ma nus dang // zhes bya ba 'di ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: are the general characteristics of direct perception and inference.

original: gzhan ma dag ni de'i dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ma dag ni de'i dbye ba yin no //
translated: The other characteristics are their specific characteristics.üîΩTherefore, when that is refuted, the establishment of valid knowledge is refuted.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de bsal na tshad ma'i rnam par gzhag nas de rtsod pa'i 'di ni gzhal bya gnyis kyis tshad ma gnyis grub pa la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de bsal na tshad ma'i rnam par gzhag nas de rtsod pa'i 'di ni gzhal bya gnyis kyis tshad ma gnyis grub pa la /
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs argument.

original: rgyas par rtsod pa gang yin pa spangs pa'i zhar la 'ongs pa yin te bar du gtan tshigs gsum gyi yul nges pa rnam par gzhag nas de rtsod pa'i lhag ma bsal bar rtsom pa ni de la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyas par rtsod pa gang yin pa spangs pa'i zhar la 'ongs pa yin te bar du gtan tshigs gsum gyi yul nges pa rnam par gzhag nas de rtsod pa'i lhag ma bsal bar rtsom pa ni de la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The extensive discussion is a digression, but it is set forth in order to avoid the following objection: ‚ÄúThe three reasons are not established as the objects of the three kinds of valid knowledge.‚Äù

original: gang la mngon sum ni med pa de zhes skabs las yin no //üîΩmngon sum las gzhan ni gzhal bya las te lkog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: gang la mngon sum ni med pa de zhes skabs las yin no // mngon sum las gzhan ni gzhal bya las te lkog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: The response to this objection is as follows: ‚ÄúWith regard to that, direct perception is not valid knowledge with regard to imperceptible objects.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúImperceptible‚Äù means ‚Äúconcealed,‚Äù that is, other than perceptible.

original: / mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i rnam pa brjod pa ni ngas gsal zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: / mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i rnam pa brjod pa ni ngas gsal zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to this objection is as follows: ‚ÄúI have stated that direct perception is a valid form of knowledge.‚Äù

original: myong ba'i bdag nyid mngon sum /
analyzed: myong ba'i bdag nyid mngon sum /
translated: Direct perception is the experience of the nature of an object.

original: de ltar bdag nyid rigs pa nyid ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid rigs pa nyid ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of an object‚Äù should be supplied.üîΩThe response to this objection is as follows: ‚ÄúIt is only this much.‚Äù

original: 'di tsam nyid kyi zhes bya bar 'di nyid kyi don brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di tsam nyid kyi zhes bya bar 'di nyid kyi don brjod pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúOnly this much‚Äù means ‚Äújust this.‚Äù

original: nges pa nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nges pa nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this objection is as follows: ‚ÄúIt is certain.‚Äù

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: The response to this objection is as follows: ‚ÄúIt is stated as follows.‚Äù

original: @22a * // lkag tu gyur pa zhes bya ba sha za dang 'dra bar rigs nges pa ni ci yang med kyi 'on kyang gang zhig gang gi tshe ma dmigs pa de'i tshe na lkog tu gyur par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: @22a * // lkag tu gyur pa zhes bya ba sha za dang 'dra bar rigs nges pa ni ci yang med kyi 'on kyang gang zhig gang gi tshe ma dmigs pa de'i tshe na lkog tu gyur par brjod pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúConcealed‚Äù means that, like a ghost, there is no certainty of its type. However, when something is not observed at a certain time, it is called ‚Äúconcealed.‚Äù

original: gcig la zhugs pa'i mngon sum 'di ni mi dmigs pa gzhan ni ma yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa skyed pa kho na mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'i yul rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig la zhugs pa'i mngon sum 'di ni mi dmigs pa gzhan ni ma yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa skyed pa kho na mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'i yul rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The arising of the conception ‚ÄúThis is direct perception; the other is not‚Äù is the basis for positing direct perception and concealed phenomena.

original: 'di ma dmigs so snyam pa ni res 'ga' mthong ba la yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ma dmigs so snyam pa ni res 'ga' mthong ba la yang 'gyur te /
translated: The thought ‚ÄúThis is not observed‚Äù sometimes occurs even when something is seen.

original: me la sogs pa la 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: me la sogs pa la 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the case of fire and so on.

original: de la ltos nas khyab pa 'dzin par 'thad pa'i phyir ji ltar rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: de la ltos nas khyab pa 'dzin par 'thad pa'i phyir ji ltar rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug pa yin /
translated: Since the pervasion is grasped in dependence on that, why would inference not be engaged?

original: des na mngon sum kho nas lkog tu gyur pa nyid rtogs so zhes par rigs so //
analyzed: des na mngon sum kho nas lkog tu gyur pa nyid rtogs so zhes par rigs so //
translated: Therefore it is correct to say that concealed phenomena are understood only through direct perception.

original: 'o na ji ltar na lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyi chos mngon sum gyis rtogs pa de bzhin du chos de dang ldan pa'i don yang yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa don gyi ngo bo ni lkog tu gyur pa nyidüîΩde zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar na lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyi chos mngon sum gyis rtogs pa de bzhin du chos de dang ldan pa'i don yang yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa don gyi ngo bo ni lkog tu gyur pa nyid de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To answer this question, Vasubandhu says, The nature of the object is imperceptible.üîΩThe word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na don de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na don de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Why? Because the object is imperceptible.

original: de 'jug na ni 'di ma dmigs so zhes bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //üîΩmngon sum mngon shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: de 'jug na ni 'di ma dmigs so zhes bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro // mngon sum mngon shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: If it were perceptible, it would not be imperceptible.

original: 'o na ji ltar de rig snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de rig snyam na /
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúIf the object is imperceptible, how can it be known?‚Äù

original: de rig na ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de rig na ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: Vasubandhu replies, If it were known.üîΩSome say that the property and the object possessing the property are different things.

original: kha cig gi ltar na chos dang chos can gyi dngos po tha dad pa nyid yin bas de'i dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni ngo bo nyid 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kha cig gi ltar na chos dang chos can gyi dngos po tha dad pa nyid yin bas de'i dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni ngo bo nyid 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To anticipate this objection, Vasubandhu says, ‚ÄúIf the nature of the object were different from the perception of the object.‚Äù

original: gang zhig gang las don gzhan yin pa de ni de'i chos ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang las don gzhan yin pa de ni de'i chos ma yin te /
translated: That which is different from something cannot be the property of that thing.

original: dper na gangs can las ma la ya bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gangs can las ma la ya bzhin no //
translated: For example, like Malaya in the Himalayas.üîΩAnd from the hidden, the hidden itself is different.

original: lkog tu gyur pa las kyang lkog nyid tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa las kyang lkog nyid tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the consequence of the apprehension of the contradictory of the pervader.

original: bzlog pa ni gang zhig gang gi chos yin pa de ni de'i rig gi ngo bo kho na yin te /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni gang zhig gang gi chos yin pa de ni de'i rig gi ngo bo kho na yin te /
translated: The opposite is: Whatever is the property of something, that is just the nature of that.

original: dper na spyi'i phyir rang bzhin nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na spyi'i phyir rang bzhin nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the nature of the general.üîΩAnd the hidden is the property of the hidden.

original: lkog nyid kyang lkog tu gyur pa'i chos yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: lkog nyid kyang lkog tu gyur pa'i chos yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is an autonomous reason.

original: chos dang chos can gyi dngos po la ni 'di 'di'i yin no zhes sbyor bas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: chos dang chos can gyi dngos po la ni 'di 'di'i yin no zhes sbyor bas khyab pa yin la /
translated: In the relation of property and possessor, the pervasion is by the application this is that of that.

original: de'i bdag nyid dang bral ba'i yul la ni rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir na sbyor ba log pa na rigs khyab bar bya ba'i chos can gyi dngos po ldog pa yin te //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang bral ba'i yul la ni rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir na sbyor ba log pa na rigs khyab bar bya ba'i chos can gyi dngos po ldog pa yin te //
translated: And when the application is reversed, the pervasion of the property to be pervaded is reversed, because there is no reason for the domain that lacks that nature.

original: des na de'i bdag nyid kyis khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i bdag nyid kyis khyab pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is pervaded by that nature.

original: des na ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not indefinite.

original: des na 'brel ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi @22b dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: des na 'brel ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi @22b dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúbecause of the connection‚Äù is a response to the opponent‚Äôs doubt.

original: tha dad kyang 'brel pa 'ga' zhig la brten nas sbyor bar 'gyur ba'i phyir na ldog pa la rgyu mtshan med pa ma grub pas na ldog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad kyang 'brel pa 'ga' zhig la brten nas sbyor bar 'gyur ba'i phyir na ldog pa la rgyu mtshan med pa ma grub pas na ldog pa ma yin te /
translated: Even though they are different, they are connected in dependence on some connection. Therefore, since the reason for the exclusion is not established, there is no exclusion.

original: des na de'i bdag nyid kyi khyab pa gal yod de de'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do snyam na /
analyzed: des na de'i bdag nyid kyi khyab pa gal yod de de'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do snyam na /
translated: Thus, since the pervasion by identity is necessary, it is indefinite.

original: 'di la lan du 'o na ni zhes bya ba'i chos can gyi rang bzhin can gyi rang bzhin las tha dad par zhes bya ba ni ngag gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'di la lan du 'o na ni zhes bya ba'i chos can gyi rang bzhin can gyi rang bzhin las tha dad par zhes bya ba ni ngag gi lhag ma'o //
translated: In response to this, the text says, ‚ÄúWell then, the nature of the subject . . .‚Äù The phrase ‚Äúdifferent from the nature‚Äù is an ellipsis.

original: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i 'brel ba pa gang ji snyed pa de thams cad ni 'brel pa can gyi rang bzhin gnyis mthong ba med par rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i 'brel ba pa gang ji snyed pa de thams cad ni 'brel pa can gyi rang bzhin gnyis mthong ba med par rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: All that is connected to that which is not of its nature is not able to be understood without seeing the two natures that are connected.

original: rnam par rtogs pas ni gcig rtogs par 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba bzlog pa'i mngon sum gyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par rtogs pas ni gcig rtogs par 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba bzlog pa'i mngon sum gyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy conceptual thought, one realizes the reversed object of a single cognition‚Äù means that one realizes the reversed object by direct perception.

original: mthong ba gnyis nyid la dngos po pa'i 'brel pa rtogs par nus kyi rnam par rtog pa ni bag chags tsam gyi dbang gis 'brel pa rtogs pa'i phyir 'ga' yang chos dang chos can gyi rang bzhin tha dad par rtog pa ma yin no zhes don gyis 'phangsüîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba gnyis nyid la dngos po pa'i 'brel pa rtogs par nus kyi rnam par rtog pa ni bag chags tsam gyi dbang gis 'brel pa rtogs pa'i phyir 'ga' yang chos dang chos can gyi rang bzhin tha dad par rtog pa ma yin no zhes don gyis 'phangs pa yin no //
translated: One can realize the relation between the two things that are seen, but conceptual thought does not realize the relation because it is merely the result of habitual tendencies. Therefore, it does not conceive the difference between the nature of the property and the property possessor. This is the meaning of the passage.

original: du ba yang rten dang brten par gyur pa'i dngos po rnam nyid la rtog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: du ba yang rten dang brten par gyur pa'i dngos po rnam nyid la rtog pa yin gyi /
translated: One conceives of smoke as a thing that is the support and the supported.

original: phan tshun rang bzhin dben bar rtogs pa med pa la ni 'di la'o snyam pa'i blo su la yang med do //
analyzed: phan tshun rang bzhin dben bar rtogs pa med pa la ni 'di la'o snyam pa'i blo su la yang med do //
translated: But when one does not conceive of the mutual difference in nature, no one thinks, ‚ÄúThis is that.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir 'grel pa gzhan mi srid pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'grel pa gzhan mi srid pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, it is impossible for there to be another interpretation.

original: des na bzlog pa la rgyu mtshan med pa grub bo //
analyzed: des na bzlog pa la rgyu mtshan med pa grub bo //
translated: Thus, it is established that the reversed object has no reason.

original: 'on te de'i bdag nyid la yang 'di ni chos 'di ni chos can no zhes rnam par dbye ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te de'i bdag nyid la yang 'di ni chos 'di ni chos can no zhes rnam par dbye ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: But if it is of the same nature, then the distinction ‚Äúthis is the property‚Äù and ‚Äúthis is the property-possessor‚Äù does not exist.

original: 'di'i nas sbyor ba mi 'thad pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i nas sbyor ba mi 'thad pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the application of the reason is not tenable.

original: ma yin te rtogs pas sbyar ba ni dag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te rtogs pas sbyar ba ni dag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because the application of the reason is not possible through understanding.

original: gcig yin yang ldog pa'i dbye ba yod pa'i skyon med do //
analyzed: gcig yin yang ldog pa'i dbye ba yod pa'i skyon med do //
translated: Even if it is one, there is no fault, since there is a distinction of exclusions.

original: yang 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang yin la /
analyzed: yang 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang yin la /
translated: Moreover, the so-called relation is dependent on another.

original: de yang re zhig skye bar ni ma yin te khas mi len pa'i phyir dang / mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa gsum mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang re zhig skye bar ni ma yin te khas mi len pa'i phyir dang / mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa gsum mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is not, to begin with, arising, because it is not accepted and because the three‚Äîperception, non-perception, and non-perception‚Äîdo not operate.

original: gnas pas kyang ma yin te ltung ba'i med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pas kyang ma yin te ltung ba'i med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it enduring, because there is no falling.

original: de med na ni ltos pa yang 'ga'i yang med do //
analyzed: de med na ni ltos pa yang 'ga'i yang med do //
translated: If that does not exist, then there is no dependence on anything at all.

original: de'i phyir gal te rtogs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang yang ma yin na 'di 'di'i zhes bya ba 'di zhes byas pa yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te rtogs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang yang ma yin na 'di 'di'i zhes bya ba 'di zhes byas pa yin /
translated: Therefore, if the other-dependence is not even that which is understood, then this is the application of ‚Äúthis is this.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'on ni mngon sum gyis zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'on ni mngon sum gyis zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúBut it is not by direct perception.üîΩ‚Äù

original: thams cad kyi tshe zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAt all times‚Äù is the remainder.

original: de med kyang res 'ga' mthong ba de'i rang bzhin gyi dbang du rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de med kyang res 'ga' mthong ba de'i rang bzhin gyi dbang du rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Even though it does not exist, how could one understand it to be the nature of the occasional perception?

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag la gcig tu bsgrubs pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag la gcig tu bsgrubs pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: Therefore, what is the use of establishing it as one for us?

original: tha dad kyang 'grub bya 'grub pa'i @23a * //
analyzed: tha dad kyang 'grub bya 'grub pa'i @23a * //
translated: Even though it is different, it is established as the object of establishment.

original: phyir ro zhes ston pa ni dngos po de dang 'brel pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyir ro zhes ston pa ni dngos po de dang 'brel pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, it says, ‚Äúthat which is related to that entity.üîΩ‚Äù

original: yang na gzhan dang 'brel pa nyid du rtogs na chos rtogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: yang na gzhan dang 'brel pa nyid du rtogs na chos rtogs par 'gyur la /
translated: Or, if one understands it to be related to another, then one understands the property.

original: gzhan dang 'brel bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: gzhan dang 'brel bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin ni //
translated: The nature of that which is related to another

original: gzhan rtogs pa med par mi rtogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gzhan rtogs pa med par mi rtogs pa kho na'o //
translated: is certainly not understood without understanding the other.

original: des ni chos mngon sum du gyur pas chos can yang mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des ni chos mngon sum du gyur pas chos can yang mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that because the property is directly perceived, the property-possessor is also directly perceived.

original: lhag ma ni rtogs par bla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs par bla'o //
translated: The remainder is easy to understand.

original: 'dir smras pas zhes bya ba'i grub pa'i mtha'i ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pas zhes bya ba'i grub pa'i mtha'i ni 'di yin te /
translated: The tenets of the one who says this are as follows.

original: chos dang chos can gyi dngos po 'di ni rtag pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: chos dang chos can gyi dngos po 'di ni rtag pa nyid yin la /
translated: This entity of the property and the property-possessor is permanent.

original: chos gcig nyid la yang rnam par rtog pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos gcig nyid la yang rnam par rtog pa nyid de /
translated: And with respect to a single property, there is conceptual thought.

original: dper na sngon po'i sngon po nyid do zhes rnam par rtog pa na tha dad pa lta bu dang gcig pa lta bur snang ngo //
analyzed: dper na sngon po'i sngon po nyid do zhes rnam par rtog pa na tha dad pa lta bu dang gcig pa lta bur snang ngo //
translated: For example, when one conceives of the blueness of blue, it appears as if it were different or as if it were the same.

original: de bzhin du rnam par dpyod pas na sngon po'i rang bzhin de nyid sngon po nyid yin no zhes rnam par rtog na tha dad pa med pa lta bu dang / du ma lta bur snang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par dpyod pas na sngon po'i rang bzhin de nyid sngon po nyid yin no zhes rnam par rtog na tha dad pa med pa lta bu dang / du ma lta bur snang ngo //
translated: In the same way, when one analyzes and conceives of the nature of blue as being blue, it appears as if it were not different and as if it were multiple.

original: de la gal te de ma thag pa'i rtogs pa la ltos nas brjod na ni /
analyzed: de la gal te de ma thag pa'i rtogs pa la ltos nas brjod na ni /
translated: If it is said that this is in reliance on the prior conception,

original: de'i tshe thams cad grub pa la sgrub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe thams cad grub pa la sgrub pa kho na'o //
translated: then at that time, it is only the establishment of what is already established.

original: rtogs pa dang po la ltos nas ni tha snyad du bya ba gcig gi rang bzhin med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa dang po la ltos nas ni tha snyad du bya ba gcig gi rang bzhin med pa kho na ste /
translated: In reliance on the first conception, it is only the nature of a single convention that does not exist.

original: ma rig pa'i dbang gis bsal ba la dngos po'i char lhag par zhen kyang dngos por rtogs pa la ltos pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i dbang gis bsal ba la dngos po'i char lhag par zhen kyang dngos por rtogs pa la ltos pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Although one is attached to the special thing by the power of ignorance, it is not dependent on the realization of the thing.

original: sngon po nyid du rtogs pa la yang sngon po'i dngos po nyid rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po nyid du rtogs pa la yang sngon po'i dngos po nyid rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Also, in the realization of blue, there is no realization of the thing that is blue.

original: 'on te sngon po nyid du rtogs pa na spyir rnam par rtog pa can 'phangs pa nyid yin no //üîΩ'o na ni de de bzhin du lkog tu gyur pa nyid rtogs pa la yang 'phangs pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on te sngon po nyid du rtogs pa na spyir rnam par rtog pa can 'phangs pa nyid yin no // 'o na ni de de bzhin du lkog tu gyur pa nyid rtogs pa la yang 'phangs pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: But if, in the realization of blue, the general idea of conceptualization is implied,üîΩthen in the realization of the hidden object, the general idea of conceptualization is also implied.

original: de bas na khyad par la sbyar ba'i don de nyid la gzhan du tshad ma gzhan 'jug par rigs pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na khyad par la sbyar ba'i don de nyid la gzhan du tshad ma gzhan 'jug par rigs pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that another valid cognition should be applied to that very object which is connected with a particular [cognition].

original: rang rig pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is shown by the words, ‚Äúself-awareness,‚Äù etc.

original: gzhan mi dmigs so zhes spyir rnam par rtog ces pa ni lkog gyur nyid rtogs pa yin par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan mi dmigs so zhes spyir rnam par rtog ces pa ni lkog gyur nyid rtogs pa yin par brjod pa yin no //
translated: The words ‚Äúin general, conceptualization‚Äù refer to the realization of the hidden object.

original: phyis ni ser po la sogs pa mthong ba ni sngon lkog tu gyur pa ni 'di yin no zhes khyad par spyod par byed do //
analyzed: phyis ni ser po la sogs pa mthong ba ni sngon lkog tu gyur pa ni 'di yin no zhes khyad par spyod par byed do //
translated: Later, when one sees yellow, etc., one discriminates it as being different from the previously seen blue, etc.

original: des na 'brel pa rtogs pa yang 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'brel pa rtogs pa yang 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the understanding of the relation is also tenable.

original: gal te de lta na yang gcig gis gnyis mi rtogs pa'i phyir ji ltar 'brel ba rtogs snyam na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang gcig gis gnyis mi rtogs pa'i phyir ji ltar 'brel ba rtogs snyam na /
translated: Even if that is so, since one does not understand two by means of one, how is the relation understood?

original: gnyis rtogs na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gnyis rtogs na zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúwhen two are understood.‚Äù

original: ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba la ltos pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù means ‚Äúnot necessarily.‚Äù

original: gzugs dang ro dag rtogs pa yang tha dad pa la 'brel pa 'dzin pa @23b med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang ro dag rtogs pa yang tha dad pa la 'brel pa 'dzin pa @23b med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The understanding of form and taste is also not the apprehension of a relation in the different.

original: de la zhes bya ba skabs la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba skabs la sbyor ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù is connected to the context.

original: ji ltar 'brel ba 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyi go skabs yod pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i yang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'brel ba 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyi go skabs yod pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i yang yin no //
translated: Just as there is an opportunity for the perception that apprehends the relation, so too there is for inference.

original: 'dis ni bsgrub pa'i rang bzhin nyid lkog nyid du nye bar bzung nas klan ka spangs pa yin no da ni mngon sum gyi rtogs pa bkag pa tsam la brten nas klan ka spang ba brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni bsgrub pa'i rang bzhin nyid lkog nyid du nye bar bzung nas klan ka spangs pa yin no da ni mngon sum gyi rtogs pa bkag pa tsam la brten nas klan ka spang ba brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, the reply to the objection based on the mere negation of the realization of direct perception is stated by ‚ÄúMoreover, etc.‚Äù

original: bzlog pa min zhes ya ba ni dgag pa tsam mngon sum gyi rtogs pa las dngos por rigs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa min zhes ya ba ni dgag pa tsam mngon sum gyi rtogs pa las dngos por rigs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot the opposite‚Äù means that mere negation is not suitable as the object of direct realization.

original: 'grel pa'i tha mi dad par zhes bya ba ni so sor snang ba yang rnam par rtog pa la zhib mor rtogs pa med pas na lhag par zhen pas tha dad pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmngon rtsol gyi rtogs pa dang bral ba tsam lkog tu gyur pa yin na chos can 'dzin pa ltos par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'grel pa'i tha mi dad par zhes bya ba ni so sor snang ba yang rnam par rtog pa la zhib mor rtogs pa med pas na lhag par zhen pas tha dad pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro // mngon rtsol gyi rtogs pa dang bral ba tsam lkog tu gyur pa yin na chos can 'dzin pa ltos par ga la 'gyur /
translated: ‚ÄúNot different‚Äù in the commentary means that even though they appear separately, because there is no subtle analysis in conceptual consciousness, they are not realized as different because of the adherence to the superimposition.üîΩIf mere freedom from the realization of exertion is hidden, how could the subject be dependent?

original: gal te dngos po med pa tsam rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyi yul du ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa tsam rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyi yul du ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: If mere non-entity is the object of reflexive awareness, how could it be?

original: rang rig pa ni dngos po'i chos yin pas de nyid yul du byed par 'gyur ro zhe na gzhan du yang mngon sum gyi dngos po med pa 'dzin pa ni zla'o rang bzhin nges pa nyams su myong ba las gzhan ma yin no //
