analyzed: rang rig pa ni dngos po'i chos yin pas de nyid yul du byed par 'gyur ro zhe na gzhan du yang mngon sum gyi dngos po med pa 'dzin pa ni zla'o rang bzhin nges pa nyams su myong ba las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: If you say that reflexive awareness is a real entity, and so it would be the object, we reply that the perception of a nonexistent entity is like the perception of a double moon.

original: 'dis ni gnyis med pa'i dngos po ni /
analyzed: 'dis ni gnyis med pa'i dngos po ni /
translated: This shows that the nondual entityüîΩis the characteristic of the emptiness of entities.

original: dngos po stong pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs par chos kyi dbyings dngos po med pa cam du bshad pa la mngon sum nyid nyams pa med par 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po stong pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs par chos kyi dbyings dngos po med pa cam du bshad pa la mngon sum nyid nyams pa med par 'gyur pa ste /
translated: In this way, the direct perception of the mere nonexistence of entities, which is explained as the realm of phenomena, is not lost.

original: tha snyad pa la ni gzhan med pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye bar nges pas de ltar rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad pa la ni gzhan med pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye bar nges pas de ltar rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: In conventional terms, the arising of a conception of something that does not exist is ascertained, and so it is presented in that way.

original: de ltar don med pa nyid spangs pa na 'brel pa 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag par mi nus par sngar brjod pa nyid dran par byed pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar don med pa nyid spangs pa na 'brel pa 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag par mi nus par sngar brjod pa nyid dran par byed pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In this way, when the absence of an object is rejected, since there is no apprehension of a relation, the impossibility of inference is stated. The following is a reminder of what was said earlier: ‚ÄúWhy is it not possible?‚Äù

original: 'di ni cung zad kyang zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //üîΩ'di la chos lkog nyid la 'brel ba 'dzin pa'i mngon sum 'jug gam /
analyzed: 'di ni cung zad kyang zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o // 'di la chos lkog nyid la 'brel ba 'dzin pa'i mngon sum 'jug gam /
translated: This is the conclusion.üîΩHere, does the perception operate in regard to the object as hidden, i.e., as imperceptible?üîΩOr does it operate in regard to the object as perceptible, i.e., as not hidden?

original: de ste de dang 'brel ba rung ba'i dngos po la 'jug ce na rnam par rtog pa gnyis so //üîΩre zhig dang po ni rjes su dpag pas lkog nyid sgrub par mi 'dod pa des na de la 'brel par rung ba'i dngos po la 'jug ce na rnam par rtog pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de ste de dang 'brel ba rung ba'i dngos po la 'jug ce na rnam par rtog pa gnyis so // re zhig dang po ni rjes su dpag pas lkog nyid sgrub par mi 'dod pa des na de la 'brel par rung ba'i dngos po la 'jug ce na rnam par rtog pa gnyis so //
translated: These are the two alternatives.üîΩFirst, since he does not maintain that the imperceptible is established by inference, what would perception do for him in regard to the imperceptible?üîΩBut if he maintains that the imperceptible is established by perception, then he has abandoned his position that the imperceptible is not established by perception.üîΩAnd if he maintains that the imperceptible is established by perception, then he has abandoned his position that the imperceptible is not established by perception.

original: re zhig dang po ni rjes su dpag pas lkog nyid sgrub par mi 'dod pa des na de la 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: re zhig dang po ni rjes su dpag pas lkog nyid sgrub par mi 'dod pa des na de la 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyis ci zhig bya /
translated: And if he maintains that the imperceptible is established by perception, then he has abandoned his position that the imperceptible is not established by perception.

original: dbang po las 'das pa nyid yin yang zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyogs gnyis pa ma grub par @24a * //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa nyid yin yang zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyogs gnyis pa ma grub par @24a * //
translated: And if he maintains that the imperceptible is established by perception, then he has abandoned his position that the imperceptible is not established by perception.üîΩAnd if he maintains analyzed: brjod pa yin mod /
translated: And if he maintains that the imperceptible is

original: gang gi tshe mngon sum nyid gyur pa yang zhes 'don pa de'i tshe ni lkog nyid ni rang rig pa yin na yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mngon sum nyid gyur pa yang zhes 'don pa de'i tshe ni lkog nyid ni rang rig pa yin na yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When the text reads ‚Äúeven though perception has occurred,‚Äù the meaning is that ‚Äúeven though there is autocognition.‚Äù

original: yang na snga ma bzhin la sogs pa'i chos can mngon sum du gyur pa gang yin pa de la'o //
analyzed: yang na snga ma bzhin la sogs pa'i chos can mngon sum du gyur pa gang yin pa de la'o //
translated: Or else, the meaning is that ‚Äúeven though the subject, such as ‚Äòthe previous moment,‚Äô has been perceived.‚Äù

original: chos can gyi rang bzhin yang rjes su dpag par ci'i phyir 'dod snyam na don gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: chos can gyi rang bzhin yang rjes su dpag par ci'i phyir 'dod snyam na don gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Why do you assert that the nature of the subject is to be inferred?

original: de bas na lkog nyid la sngar zhugs pa la ltos pas ni ci yang byar med do //
analyzed: de bas na lkog nyid la sngar zhugs pa la ltos pas ni ci yang byar med do //
translated: Therefore, there is nothing to be done with regard to the autocognition that is dependent on the prior engagement with the object.

original: yang de nyid kyang rnam pa gzhan gyis grub po zhes ston pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang de nyid kyang rnam pa gzhan gyis grub po zhes ston pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to show that this is established in another way as well, he says, ‚ÄúMoreover‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: shugs kyis rnam par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rang nyid tha dad kyi yul du 'gyur gyi tshad ma gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shugs kyis rnam par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rang nyid tha dad kyi yul du 'gyur gyi tshad ma gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúAbiding by force‚Äù means that it becomes the object of a different aspect of itself; it does not depend on another valid cognition.

original: de'i ngo bo la rjes su dpag pa mi nus pa nyid ces bya ba ni me la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba de'i rang gi ngo bo de la 'jug pa de ni zhugs pa ste /üîΩde yul du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo la rjes su dpag pa mi nus pa nyid ces bya ba ni me la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba de'i rang gi ngo bo de la 'jug pa de ni zhugs pa ste / de yul du byed pa'o //
translated: That is, it is not the object of that means of knowledge.

original: de la nus pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de la nus pa med pa'o //
translated: It is not the object of that means of knowledge.

original: med kyi bya ba ni chos tsam la 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: med kyi bya ba ni chos tsam la 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: The activity of a means of knowledge is not the result of a mere quality.

original: /'o na ji ltar de la ltos snyam na de ni 'dod kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: /'o na ji ltar de la ltos snyam na de ni 'dod kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúHow can it be dependent on that?‚Äù the root text responds, ‚ÄúEven though it is accepted that . . .‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa grub bo /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa grub bo /
translated: Inference is established.

original: tshad ma ni ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: tshad ma ni ma yin no snyam na /
translated: But it is not a means of knowledge.

original: 'dis ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: The root text responds to this with the phrase ‚Äúthis is . . .‚Äù

original: rjes su dpog pa las lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po grub mod tshad ma la ci 'byung snyam na /
analyzed: rjes su dpog pa las lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po grub mod tshad ma la ci 'byung snyam na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúEven though an object that is hidden from view is established by inference, what is the result of a means of knowledge?‚Äù

original: lkog gyur zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lkog gyur zhes gsungs so //
translated: The root text responds with the phrase ‚Äúan object that is hidden from view . . .‚Äù

original: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúof this‚Äù refers to inference.

original: de dang 'brel bar zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po dang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: de dang 'brel bar zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po dang 'brel ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin relation to that‚Äù means in relation to an object that is hidden from view.

original: dngos po dang 'brel ba las 'thob par byed pa'i shes pa ni tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po dang 'brel ba las 'thob par byed pa'i shes pa ni tshad ma yin no //
translated: The cognition that is obtained in connection with an entity is a means of valid cognition.

original: de yang dngos po dang 'brel ba'i rtags las skyes pa nyid kyi yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //üîΩde nyid 'chad pa ni dngos dang 'brel pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: de yang dngos po dang 'brel ba'i rtags las skyes pa nyid kyi yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o // de nyid 'chad pa ni dngos dang 'brel pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: And that is born from a reason that is in connection with an entity.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He explains just that:üîΩBy the mere connection with an entity,

original: de'i phyir gang zhig dngos po dang 'brel ba grub pa de nyid tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig dngos po dang 'brel ba grub pa de nyid tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which is established in connection with an entity is a means of valid cognition.

original: tshad ma yin pas na rtags las rig pa yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma yin pas na rtags las rig pa yin te /
translated: Because it is a means of valid cognition, it is knowledge from a reason.

original: tshad ma nyid du rnam par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid du rnam par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is established as a means of valid cognition.üîΩThe rest

original: lhag ma dag ces bya ba ni brgal ba dang ldan no //
analyzed: lhag ma dag ces bya ba ni brgal ba dang ldan no //
translated: are connected with a dispute.

original: sngar nyid zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngar nyid zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Previously

original: tha snyad las ni tshad ma nyid ces bya ba der bstan zin to //
analyzed: tha snyad las ni tshad ma nyid ces bya ba der bstan zin to //
translated: means that it was explained in the statement, ‚ÄúFrom convention, there is a means of valid cognition.‚Äù

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yang ma nges pa nyid brjod pa'i dngos po yin pa tsam gyis ni 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba'i dngos po rtsom par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yang ma nges pa nyid brjod pa'i dngos po yin pa tsam gyis ni 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba'i dngos po rtsom par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The point of the passage beginning with ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is that mere existence of a thing is not the cause of the composition of similar or dissimilar things.

original: grub pa'i mtha'i don ni 'di yin te rnam pa thams cad du @24b de ltar ma yin mod tshogs pa yod na 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha'i don ni 'di yin te rnam pa thams cad du @24b de ltar ma yin mod tshogs pa yod na 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The point of the philosophical position is this: although it is not so in every way, when the collection exists, it does occur.

original: rnam pa gnyis grub pa ste de tsam gyis kyang nyams pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis grub pa ste de tsam gyis kyang nyams pa med pa yin no //
translated: The two aspects are established, and by that much, there is no fault.

original: phyir bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyir bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúI will explain‚Äù means:

original: de bzhin brda la ltos med par /
analyzed: de bzhin brda la ltos med par /
translated: Likewise, without depending on a convention,

original: dngos nus nyid la mig blor 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos nus nyid la mig blor 'gyur //
translated: the eye consciousness would arise from the mere capacity of the thing.

original: zhes bya ba dang / 'brel pa can gyi chos la ni //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / 'brel pa can gyi chos la ni //
translated: And:

original: chos can bas ni rtogs skyes gang //
analyzed: chos can bas ni rtogs skyes gang //
translated: The cognition that arises from a related propertyüîΩis in regard to the property possessor.

original: zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar ro //
translated: This is what it says.

original: gzhan yang 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba dang nyams su myong ba'i rnam par gzhag pa ni tshad ma gnyis med par 'gyur ba mi 'ongs so zhes ston pa ni gzhal bya gnyis grub pas ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba dang nyams su myong ba'i rnam par gzhag pa ni tshad ma gnyis med par 'gyur ba mi 'ongs so zhes ston pa ni gzhal bya gnyis grub pas ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Moreover, the presentation of similarity, dissimilarity, and experience would not be possible without the two means of valid knowledge.üîΩThus, the establishment of the two objects is the establishment of the exclusion of non-connection, saying by the establishment of the two.

original: de ltar gnyi ga tshad ma yin no zhes ma 'brel ba rnam par bcad pa grub pa yin no zhes gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par bcad pa'i dbang du byas te bcad pa ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar gnyi ga tshad ma yin no zhes ma 'brel ba rnam par bcad pa grub pa yin no zhes gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par bcad pa'i dbang du byas te bcad pa ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In this way, both are means of valid knowledge. The exclusion of what is connected to something else is in terms of the power of exclusion, saying when.

original: gang yul dang mi ldan pa'i shes pa de ni tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yul dang mi ldan pa'i shes pa de ni tshad ma yin te /
translated: That cognition which does not possess an object is a means of valid knowledge.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the cognition of a rabbit's horns.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa las tha dad pa'i shes pa'i yul dang ldan pa ma yin do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa las tha dad pa'i shes pa'i yul dang ldan pa ma yin do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa med pa'o //
translated: The cognition that is different from perception and inference does not possess an object, is the absence of the pervader.

original: ma nges pa nyid spang ba'i don du khyab pa brjod pa ni gzhal bar bya ba dang bral ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid spang ba'i don du khyab pa brjod pa ni gzhal bar bya ba dang bral ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to eliminate the uncertainty, the pervasion is stated: ‚Äúfree from the object of apprehension,‚Äù and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang gi ngo bo 'am ste thun mong ma yin pa dang gzhan gyi ngo bo zhes bya ba de dang thun mong du gyur pa de bzhin du gzhal bya yang rnam pa gnyis kyis khyab pa yin no zhes brjod zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo 'am ste thun mong ma yin pa dang gzhan gyi ngo bo zhes bya ba de dang thun mong du gyur pa de bzhin du gzhal bya yang rnam pa gnyis kyis khyab pa yin no zhes brjod zin pa nyid do //
translated: The intrinsic nature, that is, the uncommon, and the extrinsic nature, that is, the common, are stated to be the two kinds of pervasion of the object of apprehension.

original: sgra las byung ba la sogs pa la ni 'brel ba med pa'i phyir na don 'ga' yang yongs su gcod par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba la sogs pa la ni 'brel ba med pa'i phyir na don 'ga' yang yongs su gcod par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Since there is no connection with what arises from sound, and so on, it does not ascertain any meaning at all.

original: des na the tshom la sogs pa dang / thun mong ba sems can tsam yod kyang 'dis shes par byed pa'i zhes bya ba'i shes pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na the tshom la sogs pa dang / thun mong ba sems can tsam yod kyang 'dis shes par byed pa'i zhes bya ba'i shes pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though there is a common mind, such as doubt, and so on, the mind that is the means of knowing that does not exist.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir na de'i khyad par ni tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir na de'i khyad par ni tshad ma yin no //
translated: The difference between that and the valid means of knowing is that the latter is free from apprehended object and apprehending subject, and so on.

original: des na shes pa med pa'i phyir na tshad ma'i tha snyad dag la yod /
analyzed: des na shes pa med pa'i phyir na tshad ma'i tha snyad dag la yod /
translated: Therefore, because there is no consciousness, the conventions of valid cognition do not exist.

original: 'dis ni tshad ma'i tha snyad la ni yongs su gcod pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i dam pa nyid kyis khyab la yongs su gcod pa yul yod pas khyab pa des na gzhal bya med na yongs su gcod par byed pa nyid med pas na khyab par bya ba
analyzed: 'dis ni tshad ma'i tha snyad la ni yongs su gcod pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i dam pa nyid kyis khyab la yongs su gcod pa yul yod pas khyab pa des na gzhal bya med na yongs su gcod par byed pa nyid med pas na khyab par bya ba
translated: This shows that the conventions of valid cognition are pervaded by the criterion of ascertainment, and ascertainment is pervaded by the existence of an object. Therefore, if there are no objects of comprehension, there is no ascertainment.üîΩThus, the pervasion is

original: tshad ma nyid kyang zlog par byed do //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid kyang zlog par byed do //
translated: established.

original: des khyab pa thug pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //üîΩma grub pa ni gnyis kyis khyab pa'i gzhal bya'i khyab par byed @25a * //
analyzed: des khyab pa thug pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no // ma grub pa ni gnyis kyis khyab pa'i gzhal bya'i khyab par byed @25a * //
translated: Since the pervasion is established, it is not the case that the reason is not established.

original: pa med pa nyid kyis spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: pa med pa nyid kyis spangs pa yin no //
translated: The nonestablishment of the reason is eliminated by the nonexistence of the pervasion of the object of comprehension by the two.üîΩAs it was said, ‚ÄúIf consciousness does not exist, what would be valid cognition?‚Äù

original: ji skad du shes pa nyid med pa'i phyir gang zhig tshad mar 'gyur zhes brjod pa de la shes pa yongs su gcod par byed pa med mod snyam du bsams nas gzhan dag brjod pa ni /
analyzed: ji skad du shes pa nyid med pa'i phyir gang zhig tshad mar 'gyur zhes brjod pa de la shes pa yongs su gcod par byed pa med mod snyam du bsams nas gzhan dag brjod pa ni /
translated: Thinking that there is no ascertainment by consciousness, others say,

original: bdag yod do zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag yod do zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe self exists.‚Äù

original: 'jal bar byed pa po de nyid tshad ma yang ma yin mod des na bzlog pa la tshad ma med pa nyid ma yin no snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: 'jal bar byed pa po de nyid tshad ma yang ma yin mod des na bzlog pa la tshad ma med pa nyid ma yin no snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: The one who is the measurer is not a valid cognition, and therefore, the opposite is not the absence of a valid cognition.

original: lan du de nyid ces bya ba ste bdag gi gal te de tshad ma'i rang bzhin nyid du 'dod na de'i tshe 'di ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan du de nyid ces bya ba ste bdag gi gal te de tshad ma'i rang bzhin nyid du 'dod na de'i tshe 'di ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: The response is ‚Äúthat itself,‚Äù that is, if the self is asserted to be the nature of a valid cognition, then this is the case.

original: 'on te rnam pa gzhan du yin na de'i tshe bzlog pa la tshad ma med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te rnam pa gzhan du yin na de'i tshe bzlog pa la tshad ma med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: But if it is otherwise, then the opposite is not the absence of a valid cognition.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi don nye bar sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi don nye bar sdud pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù is the summary of the topic.

original: rang gi ngo bos zhes bya bar thun mong ma yin gyis te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos zhes bya bar thun mong ma yin gyis te /
translated: ‚Äú By its own nature‚Äù is not shared.

original: gang la dngos su bskyed pa'i nus pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: gang la dngos su bskyed pa'i nus pa yod pa'o //
translated: It is that which has the ability to generate something directly.

original: de las gzhan du zhes bya ba ni thun mong nyid du ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan du zhes bya ba ni thun mong nyid du ste /
translated: ‚Äú Other than that‚Äù is shared.

original: gang la brgyud pas skyed pa'i nus pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: gang la brgyud pas skyed pa'i nus pa yod pa'o //
translated: It is that which has the ability to generate something indirectly.

original: dngos dang brgyud pas nus pa'i sgo nas yul rnam par gzhag pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: dngos dang brgyud pas nus pa'i sgo nas yul rnam par gzhag pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What is the use of positing objects in terms of the capacity of direct perception and inference?

original: 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba nyid kyis snang ba tsam gyi 'gyur la rag mod /
analyzed: 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba nyid kyis snang ba tsam gyi 'gyur la rag mod /
translated: It is quite possible that there is a mere change in appearance, whether similar or dissimilar.

original: de la yod pa'i yul can ni ma yin la /
analyzed: de la yod pa'i yul can ni ma yin la /
translated: But it is not a subject that has an existent object,

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i yul can ni tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir skabs nyams pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i yul can ni tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir skabs nyams pa yang ma yin no //
translated: and it is not the case that the non-existent object is not a valid cognition, so the context is not violated.

original: de lta na 'o na ci de nyid yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid yin nam zhe na ;
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ci de nyid yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid yin nam zhe na ;
translated: In that case, is that itself the characteristic of existence and non-existence?

original: khyed kyi mtshan nyid kyang ci zhig yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: khyed kyi mtshan nyid kyang ci zhig yin nam zhe na /
translated: What is your characteristic?

original: dogs pa bsu nas yod pa dang ldan pa la sogs pa gsal ba gsungs pa ni don dam don byed ces gsungs so //
analyzed: dogs pa bsu nas yod pa dang ldan pa la sogs pa gsal ba gsungs pa ni don dam don byed ces gsungs so //
translated: Anticipating this, he states the clarification of possession of existence and so on, saying ultimate and functioning.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention is this:

original: gang gi tshe shes pa la dgongs sam brgyud pas nus pa yod pa de'i tshe de tsam nyid kyis yod pa ma yin la don byed pa gzhan yod na ni nga 'jug par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes pa la dgongs sam brgyud pas nus pa yod pa de'i tshe de tsam nyid kyis yod pa ma yin la don byed pa gzhan yod na ni nga 'jug par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: When consciousness is intended, or when there is capacity through the continuum, at that time it is not just that, but when another functioning exists, it also engages.

original: gang zhig shes pa tsam gyi don byed par yang mi rung ba de ni med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig shes pa tsam gyi don byed par yang mi rung ba de ni med pa yin no //
translated: That which is not suitable to perform a function even by mere knowledge does not exist.

original: don dam pa'i sgra'i rnam par bcad pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: don dam pa'i sgra'i rnam par bcad pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The exclusion of the word ultimate is stated:

original: gzhan ni kun rdzob yod pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni kun rdzob yod pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The other is conventional existence.

original: 'dir gzhan gyi sgra ni zla bo brjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyi sgra ni zla bo brjod par byed pa'o //
translated: Here, the word other expresses an opposite.

original: des na ri bong gi rva dang skra shad la sogs pa yang kun rdzob tu brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na ri bong gi rva dang skra shad la sogs pa yang kun rdzob tu brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even rabbit horns, floating hair, and so on are not said to be conventional.

original: med pa ni yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: med pa ni yin pa kho na'o //
translated: They are indeed non-existent.

original: gzhan yang gang la 'jig rten rnam par dbye ba yod pa'i tha snyad du byed pa dang / don dam par ni shes pa yin gyi don byed par ni nus pa de ni kun rdzob tu yod pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang la 'jig rten rnam par dbye ba yod pa'i tha snyad du byed pa dang / don dam par ni shes pa yin gyi don byed par ni nus pa de ni kun rdzob tu yod pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, that which the world conventionally designates as having differentiation, and which is knowledge in the ultimate sense but is not able to perform a function, that is conventional existence.

original: de yang gang zag dang yan lag can dang spyi la @25b sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang gang zag dang yan lag can dang spyi la @25b sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And that refers to the person, wholes, universals, and so on.

original: 'dis ni zhar la tha shal gyi rnam par gzhag pa la ltos nas bden pa gnyis rnam par gnas pa yang sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhar la tha shal gyi rnam par gzhag pa la ltos nas bden pa gnyis rnam par gnas pa yang sbyar ba yin no //
translated: This also incidentally applies to the establishment of the two truths in dependence on the inferior mode of positing.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni bar skabs te skabs las spros ba'i tshigs su bcad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni bar skabs te skabs las spros ba'i tshigs su bcad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is an intermediate verse, a verse that is an expansion of the context.

original: de dag rang dang spyi mtshan bshad //
analyzed: de dag rang dang spyi mtshan bshad //
translated: Their own and general characteristics are explained.üîΩThis is

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: what is said.

original: skabs su bab pa rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid brjod pa gang yin pa de dag ni zhes 'di ni skabs yongs su rdzogs par bstan pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid brjod pa gang yin pa de dag ni zhes 'di ni skabs yongs su rdzogs par bstan pa tsam yin no //
translated: Those that are relevant are said to be the expression of their own and general characteristics. This is merely the complete teaching of the context.

original: mchog gi rnam par gzhag pa la rnam par gzhag pa bzlog par bsams nas /
analyzed: mchog gi rnam par gzhag pa la rnam par gzhag pa bzlog par bsams nas /
translated: Having reversed the positing in the supreme mode of positing,

original: ji skad brjod pa'i kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rnam par dbye ba mi bzod pa'i dbu ma'i rtsod pa blang ba brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad brjod pa'i kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rnam par dbye ba mi bzod pa'i dbu ma'i rtsod pa blang ba brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: the Madhyamaka argument that cannot bear the division of the expressed conventional and ultimate is stated: If, as you say, etc.

original: 'dis ni dngos su zhes bya ba la nye bar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni dngos su zhes bya ba la nye bar brjod pa'o //
translated: This is the direct expression.

original: de'i sgo nas tshad ma la yang shugs kyis nyes ba 'grub bo //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas tshad ma la yang shugs kyis nyes ba 'grub bo //
translated: And by that, the fault is also indirectly established with respect to the valid cognitions.

original: des na skabs su bab pa tshad ma'i mtshan nyid bstan pa la gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na skabs su bab pa tshad ma'i mtshan nyid bstan pa la gnod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is a refutation of the teaching of the definition of valid cognition in this context.

original: de nyid 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyas par bstan par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyas par bstan par byed do //
translated: He will explain this in detail, beginning with the words ‚ÄúThat very thing, etc.‚Äù

original: tshad ma dang gzhal bya smos pa ni de gnyis skabs su bab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma dang gzhal bya smos pa ni de gnyis skabs su bab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of valid cognition and the object of comprehension is because those two are the context.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The mention of permanent and impermanent is

original: bstan pa'am mi bstan pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: bstan pa'am mi bstan pa yang rung ste /
translated: because it is possible to teach or not to teach

original: nus pa srid pa pa yin no zhes chos kyi sgo nas ma lus par bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: nus pa srid pa pa yin no zhes chos kyi sgo nas ma lus par bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: all of them by way of the property.

original: shes pa dang shes bya smos pas ni dngos po'i sgo nas ma lus par rtogs par bya ba'i don de bems po dang bems po ma yin pa'i phur po brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya smos pas ni dngos po'i sgo nas ma lus par rtogs par bya ba'i don de bems po dang bems po ma yin pa'i phur po brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of cognition and the object of cognition is for the sake of understanding all of them by way of the entity, because he wishes to state the difference between the animate and inanimate.

original: tshad ma dang gzhal bya ni de'i khyad par yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma dang gzhal bya ni de'i khyad par yin te /
translated: Valid cognition and the object of comprehension are its distinctions.

original: ma lus pa nyid ma yin yang skabs su bab pa yin pa'i phyir brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ma lus pa nyid ma yin yang skabs su bab pa yin pa'i phyir brjod pa yin no //
translated: Although not all of them are relevant, they are mentioned because they are relevant in this context.

original: de ltar gnod par byed pa'i dam bcas pa byas nas sgrub par byed pa med pa yang brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar gnod par byed pa'i dam bcas pa byas nas sgrub par byed pa med pa yang brjod pa ni /
translated: Having thus stated the refutation, he now states the absence of proof:

original: don du bya ba nyid du yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don du bya ba nyid du yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven if it were so, it would not be tenable.‚ÄùüîΩFirst, taking up the concepts of permanence and impermanence, he shows that it is not tenable that the effect is in the assemblage of causes and conditions by saying ‚ÄúIf the effect were in the assemblage of causes and conditions, it would have to be observed there.‚Äù

original: re zhig rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i rnam par rtog pa nye bar bzung nas de nyid 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //üîΩrjes 'gro ldog pa dag gis ni //üîΩzhes bya ba'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par rab tu sbyor bar byed pa rgyu la gnas pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gang yin pa de dag gis khyab pa ni nus pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i rnam par rtog pa nye bar bzung nas de nyid 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do // rjes 'gro ldog pa dag gis ni // zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par rab tu sbyor bar byed pa rgyu la gnas pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gang yin pa de dag gis khyab pa ni nus pa yin no //
translated: He shows that it is not tenable that the effect is not in the assemblage of causes and conditions by saying ‚ÄúIf the effect were not in the assemblage of causes and conditions, how could it be produced by that assemblage?‚ÄùüîΩHe shows that it is not tenable that the effect is both in and not in the assemblage of causes and conditions by saying ‚ÄúIf the effect were both in and not in the assemblage of causes and conditions, it would have to be produced and not produced.‚ÄùüîΩHe shows that it is not tenable that the effect is neither in nor not in the assemblage of causes and conditions by saying ‚ÄúIf the effect were neither in nor not in the assemblage of causes and conditions, it would be produced without a cause.‚Äù

original: de la lhag pa'i sngar yang yod pa'i phyir na de med pas rab tu sbyar ba 'bras bu med pa rtogs par mi nus so //
analyzed: de la lhag pa'i sngar yang yod pa'i phyir na de med pas rab tu sbyar ba 'bras bu med pa rtogs par mi nus so //
translated: He shows that it is not tenable that the effect is in the individual members of the assemblage of causes and conditions by saying ‚ÄúIf the effect were in the individual members of the assemblage of causes and conditions, it would have to be observed in the individual members.‚ÄùüîΩHe shows that it is not tenable that the effect is not in the individual members of the assemblage of causes and conditions by saying ‚ÄúIf the effect were not in the individual members of the assemblage of causes and conditions, how could it be produced from the assemblage?‚ÄùüîΩHe shows that it is not tenable that the effect is both in and not in the individual members of the assemblage of causes and conditions by saying ‚ÄúIf the effect were both in and not in the individual members of the assemblage of causes and conditions, it would have to be produced and not produced.‚ÄùüîΩHe shows that it is not tenable that the effect is neither in nor not in the individual members of the assemblage of causes and conditions by saying ‚ÄúIf the effect were neither in nor not in the individual members of the assemblage of causes and conditions, it would be produced without a cause.‚Äù

original: de bas na rtag pa la ldog pa @26a * //üîΩmed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rtag pa la ldog pa @26a * // med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, if it is permanent, there is no reversal.üîΩIf it is impermanent, there is no reversal.

original: mi rtag pa la yang de med na 'bras bu med pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la yang de med na 'bras bu med pa yin mod kyi /
translated: If it is impermanent, there is no effect.

original: de yod kyang res 'ga' med pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de yod kyang res 'ga' med pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: Even if it exists, it is not concomitant because it sometimes does not exist.

original: 'dir ni ji ltar gang gi tshe rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ma rtogs pa'i phyir na nus par tha snyad bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul yin pa de'i tshe sgrub par byed pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir ni ji ltar gang gi tshe rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ma rtogs pa'i phyir na nus par tha snyad bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul yin pa de'i tshe sgrub par byed pa med pa yin la /
translated: Here, when one does not understand concomitance and reversal, it is not the method to say that it is not possible to use conventions. At that time, there is no proof.

original: gang gi tshe rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag med pa kho na yin te /
translated: When one says that there is only no concomitance and reversal,

original: dngos po'i chos ni rtag pa dang gzhan las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe ni gnod par byed pa nye bar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i chos ni rtag pa dang gzhan las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe ni gnod par byed pa nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: because the nature of things does not go beyond permanence and otherness, at that time, one is setting forth a refutation.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag tu yang ci rigs par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag tu yang ci rigs par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand what is appropriate in other contexts.

original: de lta yin yang gang zhig gang dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa de dag ni de dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin yang gang zhig gang dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa de dag ni de dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin no //
translated: But those things that are not invariably concomitant with each other cannot be in the relation of cause and effect.

original: dper na rnga mo dang bong bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rnga mo dang bong bu bzhin no //
translated: For example, a camel and a horse.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i chos dag la yang gang yang gang dang de dag yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i chos dag la yang gang yang gang dang de dag yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: And in the case of permanent and impermanent things, there is no invariable concomitance.üîΩThis is a non-apprehension of the pervasion.

original: yang gang gi tshe gang zhig gang dang rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa med pa de ni de dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rnam par mi gzhag ste /
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe gang zhig gang dang rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa med pa de ni de dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rnam par mi gzhag ste /
translated: Again, when there is no apprehension of the invariable concomitance of one thing with another, they cannot be posited as being in the relation of cause and effect.

original: dper na rnga mo dang bong bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rnga mo dang bong bu bzhin no //
translated: For example, a camel and a horse.üîΩAnd in the case of permanent and impermanent things, there is no apprehension of invariable concomitance.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i chos dag la yang gang yang gang dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes gang gi tshe sbyar bar byas pa de'i tshe ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i chos dag la yang gang yang gang dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes gang gi tshe sbyar bar byas pa de'i tshe ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: When this is applied, it is a non-apprehension of the cause.

original: gal te rgyu la bsnyon pa la rgyu mi dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te rgyu la bsnyon pa la rgyu mi dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: If you say that the non-apprehension of a cause is the non-apprehension of an effect, this is a fault.

original: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yang khyab par bya ba med par rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin na rtag pa nyid du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yang khyab par bya ba med par rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin na rtag pa nyid du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And if the non-apprehension of a pervader is the cause of the understanding of the absence of the pervaded, then it is permanent.

original: ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rnams la bsnyon par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rnams la bsnyon par 'gyur la /
translated: How can you deny the existence of causal entities?

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas khyab par mthong ba'i nus pa de yang gang zhig yin /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas khyab par mthong ba'i nus pa de yang gang zhig yin /
translated: And what is this capacity that you see as pervading through positive and negative concomitance?

original: de lta yin na ni rnam pa thams cad du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i 'jig pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni rnam pa thams cad du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i 'jig pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If that were so, then there would be no destruction of causal entities at all.

original: 'di ni mdun du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mdun du bshad par bya'o //
translated: This will be explained later.

original: ldog pa med par brjod pa gang yin pa de la gal te rtag pa las dus kyi khyad par gyis ldog pa med pa de lta na yang yul gyi khyad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ldog pa med par brjod pa gang yin pa de la gal te rtag pa las dus kyi khyad par gyis ldog pa med pa de lta na yang yul gyi khyad par 'gyur ro //
translated: As for the statement that there is no cessation, if there is no cessation due to time, then there would be a difference in place.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum gyis nges par byed la /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum gyis nges par byed la /
translated: The forward and reverse pervasions are ascertained by the three modes of direct perception and non-observation.

original: de ni ji ltar dus la ltos nas 'gyur ba de bzhin du yul la ltos nas kyang yin te /
analyzed: de ni ji ltar dus la ltos nas 'gyur ba de bzhin du yul la ltos nas kyang yin te /
translated: Just as it depends on time, so too it depends on place.

original: shing la sogs @26b pa'i tshogs ji snyed pa med pa gcig la mthong ba'i du ba gang gi tshe de nyid kyi tshe phyogs gzhan du me dang bral ba'i tshogs pa de snyed nyid la ma dmigs pa de'i tshe ji ltar yul la ltos nas ji ltar ldog
analyzed: shing la sogs @26b pa'i tshogs ji snyed pa med pa gcig la mthong ba'i du ba gang gi tshe de nyid kyi tshe phyogs gzhan du me dang bral ba'i tshogs pa de snyed nyid la ma dmigs pa de'i tshe ji ltar yul la ltos nas ji ltar ldog
translated: When one sees smoke in a place where there is no collection of wood and so on, and at that very time one does not observe a collection of that size in another place devoid of fire, then how could the reverse pervasion be established in dependence on place?

original: pa mi 'grub pa snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu nas rtag pa ni rgyu med pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: pa mi 'grub pa snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu nas rtag pa ni rgyu med pa nyid kyis te /
translated: Having anticipated the qualm, ‚ÄúHow could it be established?‚Äù he says, ‚ÄúBecause permanence is causeless.‚Äù

original: yul ma khyab par mi srid par ston pa ni rtag pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul ma khyab par mi srid par ston pa ni rtag pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is impossible for a permanent thing to pervade its object‚Äù shows that it is impossible for a permanent thing to pervade its object without pervading the place.

original: rgyu la rig pa ni so sor nges pa'i rgyus yul 'ga' zhig tu nges par byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rgyu la rig pa ni so sor nges pa'i rgyus yul 'ga' zhig tu nges par byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe cause is known‚Äù means that because the cause is ascertained, it is ascertained in some places.

original: de med pa'i phyir na gtan du thams cad na yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir res 'ga' yang gang du yang 'bras bu 'chad pa ma yin te lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir na gtan du thams cad na yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir res 'ga' yang gang du yang 'bras bu 'chad pa ma yin te lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist, the effect would never be interrupted anywhere, because it would always exist everywhere, and it would not depend on the assemblage of causes and conditions.

original: de nyid brjod pa la ni 'bras bu 'ga' la yang byed pa med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa la ni 'bras bu 'ga' la yang byed pa med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said: ‚ÄúNo effect whatsoever would ever be produced by anything.‚Äù

original: gzhan bsam pa ma rig na khyab pa dang rtag pa nyid sun phyung ba nyid kyis na btang snyoms su bzhag ste /
analyzed: gzhan bsam pa ma rig na khyab pa dang rtag pa nyid sun phyung ba nyid kyis na btang snyoms su bzhag ste /
translated: If you think otherwise, we will set it aside for the time being, since we have already refuted the idea of a permanent, unitary, and independent agent.

original: nyes pa gzhan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan brjod pa ni /
translated: Another fault is stated:

original: de'i yul khyab med ga las yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i yul khyab med ga las yin // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How can its object be nonpervasive?üîΩThe opponent says,

original: rtog med las yin zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi'o ;
analyzed: rtog med las yin zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi'o ;
translated: ‚ÄúIt is nonconceptual.‚Äù

original: /'di ltar snam bu la sogs pa'i yul nges pa nyid du yongs su bcad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: /'di ltar snam bu la sogs pa'i yul nges pa nyid du yongs su bcad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the object, such as a cloth, is ascertained as a single thing.

original: gal rtag ces bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: gal rtag ces bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
translated: The argument is this:

original: gal te yul gzhan ma khyab pa la ma rtogs pa lan yin na /
analyzed: gal te yul gzhan ma khyab pa la ma rtogs pa lan yin na /
translated: If the reason is that the object is not pervaded by the other,üîΩthen the response is that the object is not ascertained as a single thing.

original: de'i tshe dus gzhan du khyab par yang ji ltar brjod //
analyzed: de'i tshe dus gzhan du khyab par yang ji ltar brjod //
translated: How can you say that it pervades at another time?

original: de la yang mi rtogs pa ni yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang mi rtogs pa ni yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is not the case that it is not apprehended, because it exists.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ni skad cig ma yin pas na de'i dus na nye bar gnas pa'i dngos po nyid 'dzin pas na skad cig gzhan dang bral ba kho na 'dzin pa yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ni skad cig ma yin pas na de'i dus na nye bar gnas pa'i dngos po nyid 'dzin pas na skad cig gzhan dang bral ba kho na 'dzin pa yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the sense consciousnesses are momentary, they apprehend only the entity that is present at that time, and thus they apprehend only that which is devoid of another moment.

original: de brjod pa ni ji ltar khyab byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de brjod pa ni ji ltar khyab byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being shown.

original: da ltar rtag pa'i phyogs mi bzod par byas nas //
analyzed: da ltar rtag pa'i phyogs mi bzod par byas nas //
translated: Having thus refuted the position of permanence,

original: stobs dang ldan pa'i rtag pa'i phyogs la brten nas sun 'byin par rtsom pa ni skad cig yin phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa'i rtag pa'i phyogs la brten nas sun 'byin par rtsom pa ni skad cig yin phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he begins the refutation based on the position of powerful permanence with ‚Äúbecause of momentariness.‚Äù

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni skad cig ma kho na'i mthar thug pa yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni skad cig ma kho na'i mthar thug pa yin te /
translated: Impermanence is exhausted in momentariness alone.

original: de lta ma yin na mthar yang 'jig pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mthar yang 'jig pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be untenable for it to disintegrate in the end.

original: skad cig ma bya ba byed pa'i dus ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dig las she na /
analyzed: skad cig ma bya ba byed pa'i dus ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dig las she na /
translated: How do you know that it is not the case that the momentariness is not the time when the function is performed?

original: skad cag ma'i zhes bya ba'i dngos po tsam ni skye ba tsam ste skad cig ma rnam par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: skad cag ma'i zhes bya ba'i dngos po tsam ni skye ba tsam ste skad cig ma rnam par gnas pa yin te /
translated: The mere thing called ‚Äúmoment‚Äù is just the arising of the moment, the moment‚Äôs duration.

original: byed pa'i dus la reg pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa'i dus la reg pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not touch the time of activity.

original: gal te de skyes pa'i dus nyid byed pa'i dus ma yin nam ji ltar 'ga' zhig skye ba'i de ma thag par de skye ba de bzhin du de skye ba de ma thag tu gzhan skye zhes bya ba 'di nyid @27a * //
analyzed: gal te de skyes pa'i dus nyid byed pa'i dus ma yin nam ji ltar 'ga' zhig skye ba'i de ma thag par de skye ba de bzhin du de skye ba de ma thag tu gzhan skye zhes bya ba 'di nyid @27a * //
translated: If the time of its arising is not the time of its activity, then just as the arising of one thing immediately precedes the arising of another, so the arising of that immediately precedes the arising of yet another.

original: rjes su 'gro ba yin la /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba yin la /
translated: This is the positive concomitance.

original: gzhan gyi tshe ni ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe ni ldog pa yin no //
translated: The negative concomitance is at other times.üîΩThe capability is established by just that much.

original: nus pa yang de tsam gyis grub pa yin no zhes ston pa ni gal te de'i de ma thag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: nus pa yang de tsam gyis grub pa yin no zhes ston pa ni gal te de'i de ma thag ces bya ba'o //
translated: To show this, he says, ‚ÄúIf the arising of that is the cause of the arising of another, then the arising of that is the cause of the arising of another.

original: rgol bas brjod pa ni de ni gzhan gyi yang de ma thag pa yin phyir /
analyzed: rgol bas brjod pa ni de ni gzhan gyi yang de ma thag pa yin phyir /
translated: ‚Äù The opponent‚Äôs statement is, ‚ÄúBecause that is the immediate antecedent of another,

original: des na 'di ni bong bu la sogs pa gzhan de'i yang 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'di ni bong bu la sogs pa gzhan de'i yang 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
translated: then this would be the effect of that other, the donkey, and so on.

original: mngon par 'dod pas las gzhan yang rgyur thal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pas las gzhan yang rgyur thal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äù The meaning is that it would follow that another action would be the cause, as desired.

original: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni dngos po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni dngos po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word thing makes this clear.

original: gzhan gyis brjod pa bong bu la sogs pa'i skad cig de med par yang du ba la sogs pa de yod pa zhes dgongs pas skad cig la ji ltar zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: gzhan gyis brjod pa bong bu la sogs pa'i skad cig de med par yang du ba la sogs pa de yod pa zhes dgongs pas skad cig la ji ltar zhes gsungs so ;
translated: The opponent thinks, Even without the moment of the donkey, etc., that smoke exists. Thus, he says, How is it in the case of a moment?

original: /'grel pa ni go bla'o //
analyzed: /'grel pa ni go bla'o //
translated: The commentary is easy to understand.

original: ci ste zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi ma yin zhes bya ba ni de lta ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi ma yin zhes bya ba ni de lta ma yin pa'o //
translated: If one says what? it is not the opponent's position, which is it is not so.

original: de las tha dad pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, different from that.

original: yod par khas blangs nas kyang sun dbyung bar brjod pa ni yod na yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod par khas blangs nas kyang sun dbyung bar brjod pa ni yod na yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having accepted existence, he says, If it exists, etc.

original: rgyun de nyid kyi yin gyi skad cig rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyun de nyid kyi yin gyi skad cig rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: It belongs to that continuum, not to the moments.

original: de lta yin mod ci skyon snyam na skad cig rnams ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta yin mod ci skyon snyam na skad cig rnams ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: If that is so, what is the problem? He says, The moments, etc.

original: gzhan gyi de dang 'brel pa can zhes smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi de dang 'brel pa can zhes smras te /
translated: He says, connected with that of the other,

original: de dag gi yang zhes bya ba ni skad cig rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de dag gi yang zhes bya ba ni skad cig rnams kyi'o //
translated: and of those refers to the moments.

original: des na med pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na med pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Thus, he thinks, it is not nonexistent.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de lta ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de lta ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù means ‚Äúnot so.‚Äù

original: tha dad pa'i ni zhes bya ba ni skad cig dang gzhan dag la'o//
analyzed: tha dad pa'i ni zhes bya ba ni skad cig dang gzhan dag la'o//
translated: ‚Äú Of different‚Äù means of different moments and different things.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni rgyun la'o //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni rgyun la'o //
translated: ‚Äú In that‚Äù means in the continuum.

original: yang bshad pa zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi don sdud pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: yang bshad pa zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi don sdud pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Again‚Äù means in the verse that summarizes the topic.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni skad cig rnams las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni skad cig rnams las so //
translated: ‚Äú From that‚Äù means from the moments.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni /üîΩrgyun de nyid yin 'gyur na ste /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni / rgyun de nyid yin 'gyur na ste /
translated: ‚Äú That itself‚Äù means

original: skad cig rnams ni ma yin na'o //
analyzed: skad cig rnams ni ma yin na'o //
translated: the continuum, not the moments.

original: skad cig de dang 'brel pa rgyun gyis nus pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: skad cig de dang 'brel pa rgyun gyis nus pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because the continuum is capable of relation with the moment.

original: / gal te nus par rtog byed na //
analyzed: / gal te nus par rtog byed na //
translated: ‚Äú If you imagine it is capable‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi skad cig ma rnams so //üîΩ'on te yang rgyun rtag pa ni ldog pa med pa'i phyir don byed nus pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi skad cig ma rnams so // 'on te yang rgyun rtag pa ni ldog pa med pa'i phyir don byed nus pa ma yin gyi /
translated: refers to the moments of the topic.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi rgyun gzhan la ltos nas nus par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi rgyun gzhan la ltos nas nus par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if you think that a permanent continuum is not capable of effective action because it does not cease, and that an impermanent continuum is capable of effective action in dependence on another continuum,

original: gal te rgyun gzhan dag tu ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: gal te rgyun gzhan dag tu ni zhes smos so //
translated: then ‚Äúif it is in another continuum‚Äù is stated.

original: skad cig ma nyid kyi phyogs la ni rgyun la yang gzhan khas blangs la de bzhin du de la yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir thug pa med do //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid kyi phyogs la ni rgyun la yang gzhan khas blangs la de bzhin du de la yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir thug pa med do //
translated: But in the case of momentariness, the continuum itself is accepted as other, and so too that which is based on it, so there is no infinite regress.

original: des na nus pa nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na nus pa nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the power is not ascertained.

original: 'bras bu nyid du yang nges par mi zin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid du yang nges par mi zin te /
translated: Nor is it ascertained as the effect itself,

original: thug pa med pa'i nyes pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: thug pa med pa'i nyes pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: because of the fault of infinite regress.

original: rgyun ni 'bras bu nyid ces bya ba'o//
analyzed: rgyun ni 'bras bu nyid ces bya ba'o//
translated: The continuum is called the effect itself.

original: @27b rgyun gzhan 'bras bu nyid du khas len na /
analyzed: @27b rgyun gzhan 'bras bu nyid du khas len na /
translated: If the other continuum is accepted as the effect itself,

original: skad cig ma zhes bya ba skad cig nyid kyi phyogs la ni snga ma bzhin 'bras bu nyid med do //
analyzed: skad cig ma zhes bya ba skad cig nyid kyi phyogs la ni snga ma bzhin 'bras bu nyid med do //
translated: in the case of momentariness, the effect itself does not exist as before.

original: de lta na yang thug pa med par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na yang thug pa med par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: Even so, how can there be an infinite regress?

original: gang gi phyir rgyun 'di yang rgyun gzhan gyi 'bras bu nyid byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyun 'di yang rgyun gzhan gyi 'bras bu nyid byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Because this continuum would also be the effect of another continuum,

original: rten yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rten yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be the basis.

original: de ltar rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i rnam par rtog pa bkag pa na shes pa dang shes bya'i rnam par rtog pa'i skabs su bab po //
analyzed: de ltar rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i rnam par rtog pa bkag pa na shes pa dang shes bya'i rnam par rtog pa'i skabs su bab po //
translated: Thus, when the conceptualization of permanence and impermanence is refuted, the conceptualization of cognition and the cognized is appropriate.

original: de la shes pa gnyis rgyu dang 'bras bur 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de la shes pa gnyis rgyu dang 'bras bur 'gyur ram /
translated: Therein, is there a duality of cognition in the relation of cause and effect?

original: shes bya gnyis sam shes pa dang shes bya gnyis yin zhes rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya gnyis sam shes pa dang shes bya gnyis yin zhes rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Or, is there a duality of the cognized? Or, is there a duality of cognition and the cognized?

original: de la shes bya'i rnam par rtog pa la ni /
analyzed: de la shes bya'i rnam par rtog pa la ni /
translated: Therein, as regards the conceptualization of the cognized,

original: nyes pa'i tshogs snga ma nyid yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa'i tshogs snga ma nyid yin te /
translated: the previous set of faults is applicable,

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i rnam par rtog pa las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i rnam par rtog pa las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one has not transcended the conceptualization of permanence and impermanence.

original: nyes pa gzhan brjod pas shes pa dang shes bya'i rnam par rtog pa la 'jug pa ni gzhan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan brjod pas shes pa dang shes bya'i rnam par rtog pa la 'jug pa ni gzhan zhes bya'o //
translated: The other faults are stated in the expression ‚Äúand so on.‚Äù The engagement in the conceptualization of cognition and the cognized is called ‚Äúand so on.‚Äù

original: 'di la sa bon gyi yod pa'i tha snyad ni myu gu'i 'bras bus byas pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di la sa bon gyi yod pa'i tha snyad ni myu gu'i 'bras bus byas pa yin la /
translated: Here, the conventional expression of the existence of the seed is made on the basis of the effect of the sprout,

original: myu gu'i yang ljang pas yin te /
analyzed: myu gu'i yang ljang pas yin te /
translated: and that of the sprout on the basis of the greenness.

original: de bzhin du snga ma snga ma'i yod pa phyi ma phyi ma'i 'bras bu byed par nus pas yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du snga ma snga ma'i yod pa phyi ma phyi ma'i 'bras bu byed par nus pas yin no //
translated: In the same way, the existence of the prior is on the basis of the ability to produce the effect of the subsequent.

original: de la re zhig ljang pa med pa'i myu gu tsam mo //
analyzed: de la re zhig ljang pa med pa'i myu gu tsam mo //
translated: First, the sprout is just that, without the greenness.

original: de srid du ni de med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de srid du ni de med pa kho na'o //
translated: As long as that does not exist, it is only nonexistent.

original: de med na ni snga ma yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de med na ni snga ma yang med par 'gyur te /
translated: If that does not exist, the previous state also does not exist,

original: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the effect does not exist.

original: gal te skad cig so so la 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba skye ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir na ji ltar 'ga' zhig 'bras bu dang 'bral bar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: gal te skad cig so so la 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba skye ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir na ji ltar 'ga' zhig 'bras bu dang 'bral bar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If you think that because the arising of the similar and the dissimilar is uninterrupted in each moment, how could anything be separated from its effect?

original: bden te 'on kyang rgyun te de la gnas pa'i 'bras bu thams cad ni skad cig la mthar phyin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bden te 'on kyang rgyun te de la gnas pa'i 'bras bu thams cad ni skad cig la mthar phyin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: That is true, but still, all effects that exist in the continuum are not perfected in a moment,

original: de nyid kyi tshig gang la 'bras bu smin pa longs spyod par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshig gang la 'bras bu smin pa longs spyod par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the effect would be enjoyed in that very moment.

original: des gang la sngon gyi 'bras bu med pa de kho na med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: des gang la sngon gyi 'bras bu med pa de kho na med par 'gyur la /
translated: If the previous effect does not exist in that very moment, it would be nonexistent.

original: de med na ni de'i snga ma yang med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na ni de'i snga ma yang med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If that does not exist, the previous state also would not exist.

original: de bzhin du snga ma snga ma med par na thams cad ji srid pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du snga ma snga ma med par na thams cad ji srid pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, if the previous state does not exist, everything would not exist as long as it does.

original: 'on te yang 'bras bu ni 'bras bu gzhan ma mthong bar yang 'bras bu nyid las mi nyams te de las 'byung bar mthong ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: 'on te yang 'bras bu ni 'bras bu gzhan ma mthong bar yang 'bras bu nyid las mi nyams te de las 'byung bar mthong ba'i phyir ro//
translated: But if the effect does not see another effect, it does not cease to be an effect, because it is seen to arise from that.

original: des na don bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa ma nges kyang ma byung ba las byung ba nyid du grub pa kho na snga ma nus par rnam par 'jug par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na don bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa ma nges kyang ma byung ba las byung ba nyid du grub pa kho na snga ma nus par rnam par 'jug par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, although the existence characterized by the performance of a function is not ascertained, it is established that it arises from what has not yet arisen, and it is only that which is able to perform a function that is said to exist.

original: ma yin te don gyi nus pa ma nges na 'bras bu nyid du nges pa nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te don gyi nus pa ma nges na 'bras bu nyid du nges pa nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because if the capacity for a purpose is not ascertained, it is not possible to ascertain it as an effect.

original: ma byung ba las byung ba zhes 'byung ba'i sgras ni nus pa nyid brjod pa yin no//
analyzed: ma byung ba las byung ba zhes 'byung ba'i sgras ni nus pa nyid brjod pa yin no//
translated: The word ‚Äúarises‚Äù in ‚Äúarises from what has not yet arisen‚Äù expresses capacity.

original: @28a * // skyes pa tsam yin no zhe na /
analyzed: @28a * // skyes pa tsam yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say it is merely arisen,

original: skyes pa yang sngar med pa yod pa ma thob pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: skyes pa yang sngar med pa yod pa ma thob pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: is not the arisen also just the non-acquisition of what was previously non-existent?

original: yod pa'ang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir lhag par smras pas ci bya /
analyzed: yod pa'ang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir lhag par smras pas ci bya /
translated: Since what exists does not exist, what is the point of the addition?

original: rang gi ngo bo thob pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo thob pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say it is the acquisition of its own nature,

original: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba yang nus pa nyid ma yin nam rang gi ngo bo ni sngon po la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba yang nus pa nyid ma yin nam rang gi ngo bo ni sngon po la sogs pa yin la /
translated: And is not the so-called ‚Äúown nature of an entity‚Äù just potentiality? The own nature is blue, etc.,

original: nus pa ni ldog pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nus pa ni ldog pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and potentiality is the exclusion.

original: skra shad la sogs pa yang rang gi ngo bo thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa yang rang gi ngo bo thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even such things as floating hairs would have own nature.

original: nus pa la mi 'khrul pa'i sngon po la sogs pa ni rang gi ngo bo yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nus pa la mi 'khrul pa'i sngon po la sogs pa ni rang gi ngo bo yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that blue, etc., which is not mistaken with respect to potentiality, is own nature,

original: 'o na ni nus pa ma nges na rang gi ngo bo ma nges pa'i phyir sgra la sogs pa ltar 'bras bu nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni nus pa ma nges na rang gi ngo bo ma nges pa'i phyir sgra la sogs pa ltar 'bras bu nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then, since potentiality is not ascertained, own nature is not ascertained. Therefore, like sound, etc., it is not a result.

original: des na snga ma la nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa nyid ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na snga ma la nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa nyid ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: So how can there be existence characterized by potentiality in the former case?

original: 'on te mtha' dag pa'i phyir na snga ma thams cad phyi ma phyi ma la nus pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on te mtha' dag pa'i phyir na snga ma thams cad phyi ma phyi ma la nus pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: But if it is because of the totality, then all of the former is present in the latter as potentiality.

original: 'on kyang 'bras bu ma mthong bar nges pa tsam mi 'jug par zad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'bras bu ma mthong bar nges pa tsam mi 'jug par zad pa yin no //
translated: However, it is just that, since the result is not seen, ascertainment does not operate.

original: nges pa med pa nyid ni dngos po med pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: nges pa med pa nyid ni dngos po med pa yang ma yin la /
translated: The absence of certainty is not a nonentity.

original: de yang mthong ba ji lta ba bzhin 'jug pa yin no //üîΩtha ma'i nus pa 'bras bu ma mthong bas ni /
analyzed: de yang mthong ba ji lta ba bzhin 'jug pa yin no // tha ma'i nus pa 'bras bu ma mthong bas ni /
translated: And that is engaged in just as it is seen.üîΩThe final capacity is not able to destroy the entire continuum of the prior collection of seeing the effect, because the effect is not seen.

original: 'bras bu mthong ba snga ma'i tshogs mtha' dag rgyud nyid las nyams par byed nus pa yang ma yin gyi 'on kyang phyir la de'i dbang gis phyi ma la yang nus pa nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu mthong ba snga ma'i tshogs mtha' dag rgyud nyid las nyams par byed nus pa yang ma yin gyi 'on kyang phyir la de'i dbang gis phyi ma la yang nus pa nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: But rather, by the power of that, it is understood that there is capacity for the future.

original: yang na goms pa'i gnas skabs 'thob pa'i mngon sum gsal bas ni 'bras bu ma mthong yang nus pa min no zhe na /
analyzed: yang na goms pa'i gnas skabs 'thob pa'i mngon sum gsal bas ni 'bras bu ma mthong yang nus pa min no zhe na /
translated: Or, by the clear direct perception that obtains the state of cultivation, even though the effect is not seen, there is no capacity.

original: 'di mtha' dag ni gsog yin te /
analyzed: 'di mtha' dag ni gsog yin te /
translated: This entire collection is a heap.

original: 'di ltar mtha' dag pa zhes bya ba 'di ni phyis nges pa'i 'bras bu yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtha' dag pa zhes bya ba 'di ni phyis nges pa'i 'bras bu yin na /
translated: Thus, this so-called entire collection is the effect of certainty later.

original: phyi ma phyi ma la ltos nas ni nges pa'i go skabs yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma la ltos nas ni nges pa'i go skabs yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In dependence on the later and later, there is no opportunity for certainty.

original: nges pa yang med la yod par tha snyad kyang byed do zhes bya ba 'di ni gzu lums yin no //
analyzed: nges pa yang med la yod par tha snyad kyang byed do zhes bya ba 'di ni gzu lums yin no //
translated: It is a mere whim to say that it is not ascertained, but it is also designated as existent.

original: des na the tshom bskyed pa nyid la gnod pa yin te /
analyzed: des na the tshom bskyed pa nyid la gnod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is faulty to generate doubt,

original: nges pa med pa kho nar brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa med pa kho nar brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is asserted that it is not ascertained.

original: nges pa yang 'ga' zhig tu 'jug par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nges pa yang 'ga' zhig tu 'jug par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not possible to ascertain anything,

original: phyi ma phyi ma la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it depends on the subsequent.

original: tha ma'i nus pa mthong na ni /
analyzed: tha ma'i nus pa mthong na ni /
translated: If the capacity of the final is seen,

original: snga ma thams cad nus pa med par 'gyur bas phyi ma'i nus pa bsgrub par ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: snga ma thams cad nus pa med par 'gyur bas phyi ma'i nus pa bsgrub par ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: then all the previous would be without capacity, so how could the capacity of the final be established?

original: 'dis ni goms pa'i gnas skabs la brten pa yang bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni goms pa'i gnas skabs la brten pa yang bsal ba yin te /
translated: This also eliminates the basis of habituation,

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe mngon sum gyis bzung ba yang nas yang du bzung na goms pa zhes brjod pa yin na de yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe mngon sum gyis bzung ba yang nas yang du bzung na goms pa zhes brjod pa yin na de yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: because if what is apprehended by direct perception is apprehended again and again at some time, it is called habituated, but that does not exist.

original: snga ma yod pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma yod pa yin no //
translated: The previous exists.

original: @28b des na the tshom 'di yang ngo shes pa la sogs pa ltar rtogs pa tsam yin no zhes rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: @28b des na the tshom 'di yang ngo shes pa la sogs pa ltar rtogs pa tsam yin no zhes rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this doubt is just a realization, like the recognition of something.

original: gnyi ga la nus pa mtshungs par 'grub pa yin na 'di rigs pas log par rtogs pa med par 'gyur ba yin no //üîΩde'i phyir shes pa las gzhan pa'i 'bras bus ni /
analyzed: gnyi ga la nus pa mtshungs par 'grub pa yin na 'di rigs pas log par rtogs pa med par 'gyur ba yin no // de'i phyir shes pa las gzhan pa'i 'bras bus ni /
translated: If it were established that both are equally able, then this would not be a case of a mistaken realization.

original: snga ma yod par mi 'grub bo zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: snga ma yod par mi 'grub bo zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, the existence of the prior cognition is not established by a result that is different from the cognition.üîΩThis is the point.

original: 'o na shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gyur ro //
translated: Well, then, it is the characteristic of consciousness.

original: de yod pa ni 'bras bu gzhan la nges par ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yod pa ni 'bras bu gzhan la nges par ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: Its existence does not definitely depend on another result.

original: phyi rol gyi skra la sogs pa snang ba ltar gsal ba 'ba' zhig gi rang bzhin can shes pa'i gsal ba ni yod pa la 'khrul ba mi srid do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi skra la sogs pa snang ba ltar gsal ba 'ba' zhig gi rang bzhin can shes pa'i gsal ba ni yod pa la 'khrul ba mi srid do //
translated: The clarity that is the nature of consciousness, which is like the appearance of external hair and so on, is not mistaken with respect to existence.

original: gal te de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa tsam skyes pa yin pa'i phyir na 'di ni phyi rol gyi skra la sogs pa snang ba nyid ma yin pas de ji ltar skrar snang ba yod pa las 'khrul par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa tsam skyes pa yin pa'i phyir na 'di ni phyi rol gyi skra la sogs pa snang ba nyid ma yin pas de ji ltar skrar snang ba yod pa las 'khrul par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it is merely a consciousness that arises having the aspect of that, then it is not the external hairs and so on that appear. So how could the appearance of hairs be an error due to the existence of hairs?

original: des na gal te snang ba de yod pa la 'khrul na /
analyzed: des na gal te snang ba de yod pa la 'khrul na /
translated: If you say that if the appearance is an error due to the existence of hairs,

original: de'i tshe shes pa'i yod pa nyid la 'khrul par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe shes pa'i yod pa nyid la 'khrul par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then it follows that the existence of consciousness is an error,

original: brjod pa skrar snang ba'i shes pa gzhan dang thun mong pa nyid yin yang /
analyzed: brjod pa skrar snang ba'i shes pa gzhan dang thun mong pa nyid yin yang /
translated: we reply that although the consciousness that appears as hairs is common to all,

original: 'di skrar snang ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar rtogs par bya nus pa med pa nyid las so //
analyzed: 'di skrar snang ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar rtogs par bya nus pa med pa nyid las so //
translated: how can it be known that this is not the appearance of hairs? It is because it is nonexistent.

original: des na lhag par zhen pas byas nas /
analyzed: des na lhag par zhen pas byas nas /
translated: Therefore, due to the force of attachment,

original: skra snang ba'i tha snyad dang / yod pa'i tha snyad du gyur pa de'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: skra snang ba'i tha snyad dang / yod pa'i tha snyad du gyur pa de'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: the convention of the appearance of hairs and the convention of existence arise. Therefore there is no error.

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid brtags nas ni gsal ba kho na yod pa yin te des na nus pa ma nges pas kyang yod pa la 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid brtags nas ni gsal ba kho na yod pa yin te des na nus pa ma nges pas kyang yod pa la 'khrul pa med do //
translated: Having examined the nature of consciousness itself, only the clarity exists. Therefore, even though the potency is indeterminate, there is no error in asserting its existence.

original: gal te de'i yod pa yang nus pa kho na yin pa de lta na yang shes pa'i gsal ba nyid de la 'khrul pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te de'i yod pa yang nus pa kho na yin pa de lta na yang shes pa'i gsal ba nyid de la 'khrul pa med pa yin te /
translated: Even if its existence is only potency, still there is no error in asserting the clarity of consciousness.

original: des na phyi rol bzhin du 'bras bu mthong ba la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na phyi rol bzhin du 'bras bu mthong ba la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not necessary to rely on seeing an effect, as in the case of external objects.

original: de'i phyir snga ma'i yod pa shes pa'i 'bras bu yin pa la thug pa med pa'i nyes pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir snga ma'i yod pa shes pa'i 'bras bu yin pa la thug pa med pa'i nyes pa med do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, there is no fault of infinite regress in asserting that the existence of the prior moment is the effect of consciousness.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni shes pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni shes pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, we reply: What is called the effect of consciousness?

original: thams cad du bsal ba'i don dang / lhan cig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir rmi lam la sogs par mthong ba yang yod par thal bar 'gyur na 'ga' zhig kho na la yang 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad du bsal ba'i don dang / lhan cig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir rmi lam la sogs par mthong ba yang yod par thal bar 'gyur na 'ga' zhig kho na la yang 'dod pa yin te /
translated: Because it is the object of clarity and is the simultaneous cause and effect, it follows that even what is seen in dreams and so on would exist, but this is not asserted in any case.

original: 'on te 'khrul pa'i shes pa la snang ba'i don dang shes pa la bzung ba nyid med do snyam na 'di la'ang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on te 'khrul pa'i shes pa la snang ba'i don dang shes pa la bzung ba nyid med do snyam na 'di la'ang zhes gsungs so //
translated: But if you think that the object that appears to a mistaken consciousness and the consciousness itself do not exist, then Candrakƒ´rti says, ‚ÄúIn this case too . . .‚Äù

original: ma 'khrul pa'i shes pa'i skye ba'i dus na'o //
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa'i shes pa'i skye ba'i dus na'o //
translated: The time when a nonmistaken consciousness arises.

original: shes pa'i 'bras bu de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: shes pa'i 'bras bu de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The effect of consciousness is said to be the possession of that.
