original: rgyu ldan par ji ltar rig par 'gyur /üîΩgal te rmi lam la @29a * //
analyzed: rgyu ldan par ji ltar rig par 'gyur / gal te rmi lam la @29a * //
translated: How can you know that the cause exists?

original: sogs pa don med pa nyid kyi phyir 'brel pa rig pa ma yin no zhes rigs kyi don yod par go ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sogs pa don med pa nyid kyi phyir 'brel pa rig pa ma yin no zhes rigs kyi don yod par go ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you say that because dreams and so on are meaningless, the connection is not known, then why do you not understand that the object exists?

original: shes bya gnyis ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shes bya gnyis ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: Candrakƒ´rti says, ‚ÄúThe two objects of knowledge . . .‚Äù

original: 'di snyam du gnyi ga snang ba zhes bya ba 'brel pa rtogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gnyi ga snang ba zhes bya ba 'brel pa rtogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa yin la /
translated: You might think that the proof of the understanding of the connection is the statement ‚ÄúBoth appear,‚Äù

original: de ni shes pa dang shes bya dag la yang yod pas ji ltar de mi rtogs snyam na /
analyzed: de ni shes pa dang shes bya dag la yang yod pas ji ltar de mi rtogs snyam na /
translated: but since that is also present in the case of consciousness and the object of consciousness, why do you not understand that?

original: mdun na gnas pa nyid du ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mdun na gnas pa nyid du ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Candrakƒ´rti says, ‚ÄúThe object that is present in front of one . . .‚Äù

original: lhur bya ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: lhur bya ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is this.

original: shes pa thams cad ni bdag rig pa yin yang dngos su bdag la shes pa skyed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa thams cad ni bdag rig pa yin yang dngos su bdag la shes pa skyed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Although all cognitions are self-aware, they do not actually generate awareness of themselves,

original: zhen pa thams cad ni kha phyir ba ltas pas 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhen pa thams cad ni kha phyir ba ltas pas 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all attachments are engaged in looking outward.

original: des na gal te mthong ba myong ba med par 'di mthong bar 'gyur te zhes khyad par dang bcas pa'i zhen par mi 'gyur ba de lta na yang /
analyzed: des na gal te mthong ba myong ba med par 'di mthong bar 'gyur te zhes khyad par dang bcas pa'i zhen par mi 'gyur ba de lta na yang /
translated: Therefore, if seeing were not experienced, it would not be remembered with the specification ‚ÄúI saw this,‚Äù and even though it is not remembered with attachment,

original: sngon po 'di mthong ngo zhes gtsor phyi rol nyid la gnas par byed do //
analyzed: sngon po 'di mthong ngo zhes gtsor phyi rol nyid la gnas par byed do //
translated: still, the emphasis is placed on the external object when one says, ‚ÄúI see blue.‚Äù

original: de ltar ni gnyis la brten pa'i 'brel pa 'grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni gnyis la brten pa'i 'brel pa 'grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the relation based on the two is not established.

original: phyi rol gyi gnyis rtog pa la ni /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gnyis rtog pa la ni /
translated: If the external two were to be the object of the concept,

original: go skabs su yang 'gyur ba yin na shes pa dang shes bya dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid du dpyod pa la ni de srid kyi tshul yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: go skabs su yang 'gyur ba yin na shes pa dang shes bya dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid du dpyod pa la ni de srid kyi tshul yod pa ma yin no //
translated: then it would be possible, but it is not possible that cognition and the cognized are the relation of cause and effect.

original: gal te re zhig rtogs pa la ni yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gal te re zhig rtogs pa la ni yod pa kho na'o //
translated: If it is possible in the case of the concept,üîΩthen it is certainly possible in the case of the object.

original: de yan lag gi dngos po yin pa dang don gtsor 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya bas gang du nye bar mkho //
analyzed: de yan lag gi dngos po yin pa dang don gtsor 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya bas gang du nye bar mkho //
translated: It is a part of the object and is the principal object.

original: des na de'i 'bras bu nyid du mi rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: des na de'i 'bras bu nyid du mi rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: Therefore, how could it not be understood as the effect of consciousness?

original: shes pa 'bras bu nyid du ni zhes bya ba ni skabs skabs kyi don la ltos nas so //
analyzed: shes pa 'bras bu nyid du ni zhes bya ba ni skabs skabs kyi don la ltos nas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúconsciousness is the effect‚Äù is used in some contexts.

original: de nyid kyis ni de rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni de rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: But that does not mean that consciousness is the effect of itself.

original: rgyu nyid kyis dus mi mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu nyid kyis dus mi mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause and effect are not simultaneous.

original: gzhan gyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the effect of something else,

original: 'bras bu shes pa nyid shes pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'bras bu shes pa nyid shes pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because the effect, consciousness, does not exist when the cause exists.

original: / gal te phyi rol gyi gnyis kyang gcig gis mi rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: / gal te phyi rol gyi gnyis kyang gcig gis mi rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that the external object is not perceived by the other consciousness,

original: mi rtogs mod de yang rtogs pa med pa kho na'o zhes mang du bshad zin /
analyzed: mi rtogs mod de yang rtogs pa med pa kho na'o zhes mang du bshad zin /
translated: we reply that it is not perceived, but it is not the case that it is not perceived.üîΩWe have already explained this at length.

original: gal te de lta na yang 'dra ba dang bcas pa'i shes pas bskyed pa nyid gzung ba yin pa'i phyir du tha mi dad pa mi rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang 'dra ba dang bcas pa'i shes pas bskyed pa nyid gzung ba yin pa'i phyir du tha mi dad pa mi rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you say that even though this is so, the object is not perceived as different from the consciousness that is similar to it because it is produced by that consciousness,üîΩwe reply:

original: bden te 'di ni lugs gzhan dpyad pa yin no //
analyzed: bden te 'di ni lugs gzhan dpyad pa yin no //
translated: True, but this is an analysis of another system.

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la ni phyi rol gyis stong pa'i phyir shes pa rnams nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur na de yang 'chad par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la ni phyi rol gyis stong pa'i phyir shes pa rnams nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur na de yang 'chad par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In the system that has aspects, consciousnesses are the cause and effect because they are not empty of external things. But that will be explained later.

original: ji skad du /üîΩshes pa 'bras bu nyid du ni //
analyzed: ji skad du / shes pa 'bras bu nyid du ni //
translated: As it was said:üîΩConsciousness is not known

original: de'am gzhan gyis rtogs pa med //
analyzed: de'am gzhan gyis rtogs pa med //
translated: As the effect of itself or another.

original: ces brjod ba de la de'am @29b zhes bya ba'i phyogs bsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: ces brjod ba de la de'am @29b zhes bya ba'i phyogs bsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: In that, the position of ‚Äúthat‚Äù is refuted:

original: mngon sum de nyid la min te //
analyzed: mngon sum de nyid la min te //
translated: It is not in the direct perception itself.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: 'jug par khas len na gnod byed brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'jug par khas len na gnod byed brjod pa ni /
translated: If one accepts that it engages, the fault is stated:

original: 'jug na khyod kyi 'bras mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jug na khyod kyi 'bras mi 'gyur //
translated: If it engages, it is not your effect.

original: zhes bya ba ste sngar med par 'byung ba'i don mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste sngar med par 'byung ba'i don mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that a meaning that did not exist previously arises.

original: 'o na de las sngar med pa'i 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na de las sngar med pa'i 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that it is the effect of that,

original: gal te de lta na ji ltar sngar med pa de bzhin du de las sngar yang yod pa'i rgyu ma gtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ji ltar sngar med pa de bzhin du de las sngar yang yod pa'i rgyu ma gtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then just as it did not exist previously, so it would not exist previously, except for the cause.

original: des na yang nas yang du 'jug pa na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na yang nas yang du 'jug pa na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if it engages again and again, there would be an infinite regress.

original: yang na 'jug na de'i 'bras bu nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: yang na 'jug na de'i 'bras bu nyid ces bya ste /
translated: Or, if it engages, it is called the effect.üîΩThe engagement of direct perception does not realize itself to be the effect.

original: mngon sum 'jug pa des bdag nyid 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pa ma yin zhes bya ba rjes su 'jug pa ste don gyi sngar yod pa nyid ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩdon sngar yod pa'i bzung ba'i don du sngar yang 'jug na ni thug pa med do zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum 'jug pa des bdag nyid 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pa ma yin zhes bya ba rjes su 'jug pa ste don gyi sngar yod pa nyid ma bzung ba'i phyir ro // don sngar yod pa'i bzung ba'i don du sngar yang 'jug na ni thug pa med do zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Because the prior existence of the object is not apprehended, if the object of prior existence is apprehended, it is said that there is an infinite regress.

original: snga ma yang ni 'jug 'gyur te //üîΩgsungs so // 'o na mdun du gsal bzhin pa dus mtshungs pa'i don nyid rgyur gyur to zhe na gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma yang ni 'jug 'gyur te // gsungs so // 'o na mdun du gsal bzhin pa dus mtshungs pa'i don nyid rgyur gyur to zhe na gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The prior also engages.

original: ha cang khyab ches ba'i dogs pa 'de bsu nas bzlog pa ni gzhan du 'gyur ba na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ha cang khyab ches ba'i dogs pa 'de bsu nas bzlog pa ni gzhan du 'gyur ba na zhes bya ste /
translated: If the object that is clearly present in front is the cause of the simultaneous object, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then it is said that if it is the cause, then

original: mthong ba'i ka ba dang bum pa dag gcig med par gzhan yod na de rgyu dang 'bras bu ma grub na de lta na 'o na shes pa dang / shes bya zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mthong ba'i ka ba dang bum pa dag gcig med par gzhan yod na de rgyu dang 'bras bu ma grub na de lta na 'o na shes pa dang / shes bya zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In that case, the so-called knower and the known

original: rnam pa nyid kyang 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam pa nyid kyang 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: would not be established as different.

original: zhes gnyi gar yang 'brel par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes gnyi gar yang 'brel par bya'o //
translated: Both should be connected.

original: 'di ni dogs pa dang bcas te bsal bar byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dogs pa dang bcas te bsal bar byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is a doubtful point that needs to be clarified. The text says if and so on.

original: 'di ni gzhan du gyur pa ma grub po zhes bya ba bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan du gyur pa ma grub po zhes bya ba bsal bar bya'o //
translated: This should be clarified by saying non-establishment of transformation.

original: skabs su bab pa la yang ma grub po zhes bya bar ston pa ni shes pa'i mthong ba gang yin yang don med par 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa la yang ma grub po zhes bya bar ston pa ni shes pa'i mthong ba gang yin yang don med par 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: To show that it is also not established in the present context, it says the seeing of consciousness would not engage without an object.

original: ci shes pa yang don med kyang mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci shes pa yang don med kyang mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that even though the object is non-existent, there is seeing.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: If indicates a dispute.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gzhan yin pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gzhan yin pas na'o //
translated: Then means because of being different.

original: lan ni ka ba'ang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni ka ba'ang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is the pillar too.

original: ngo shes skye ba mtshungs pa yin //
analyzed: ngo shes skye ba mtshungs pa yin //
translated: The example is similar to the case of a pot, which is mistaken for a pot on the basis of its being established as a single class.

original: zhes bya ba ni dper na bum pa bum pa zhes rigs gcig tu grub pa la brten nas 'khrul ba de bzhin du shes pa shes pa zhes bya bar yang 'gyur ba'i phyir mtshungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dper na bum pa bum pa zhes rigs gcig tu grub pa la brten nas 'khrul ba de bzhin du shes pa shes pa zhes bya bar yang 'gyur ba'i phyir mtshungs so //
translated: In the same way, consciousness is also called consciousness.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe bum pa de nyid gzhan dag tu mthong bas 'khrul pa smra ba de'i tshe ji ltar mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe bum pa de nyid gzhan dag tu mthong bas 'khrul pa smra ba de'i tshe ji ltar mtshungs te /
translated: If it is argued that when a pot is seen as another pot, it is not similar,

original: shes pa ni rgyu gcig la gnas kyang ka ba la sogs pa bzhin du gsal ba'i ngo shes pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa ni rgyu gcig la gnas kyang ka ba la sogs pa bzhin du gsal ba'i ngo shes pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: because although consciousness is based on a single cause, it is not like a pillar, etc., which is clear.

original: shes pa @30a * //
analyzed: shes pa @30a * //
translated: Consciousness is not clear.

original: shes pa zhes rigs ngo shes pa ni 'dir nye bar mkho ba ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa zhes rigs ngo shes pa ni 'dir nye bar mkho ba ma yin no //
translated: The class of consciousness is not needed here.

original: rigs ni gzhan gyis 'dogs pa'am btags pa yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: rigs ni gzhan gyis 'dogs pa'am btags pa yin yang rung ste /
translated: The class is either designated by another or is designated.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang shes pa gcig ni gsal ba rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang shes pa gcig ni gsal ba rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: In both cases, a single consciousness is not clear by nature.

original: des na bum pa bzhin 'khrul pa ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na bum pa bzhin 'khrul pa ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how can there be error like a pot?

original: des na gsal ba ngo shes pa'i phyogs la lan gang zhig yin snyam na /
analyzed: des na gsal ba ngo shes pa'i phyogs la lan gang zhig yin snyam na /
translated: So, what is the reply to the position that recognizes the clarity?

original: der yang ka bas skyed pas bum pa nyid gzhan du mthong ba mi 'gal te rdza mkhan gyis skyed pa de med par mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: der yang ka bas skyed pas bum pa nyid gzhan du mthong ba mi 'gal te rdza mkhan gyis skyed pa de med par mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: Also, in that case, it is not contradictory that a pot is seen as different from that which is produced by a pillar, just as it is seen as different from that which is produced by a potter.

original: des na lhan cig dmigs pa dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur ba mi spongs so //üîΩgzhon nu ma len gyis lugs la brten te /
analyzed: des na lhan cig dmigs pa dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur ba mi spongs so // gzhon nu ma len gyis lugs la brten te /
translated: Therefore, it is not denied that things that are observed simultaneously are the entities of cause and effect.

original: ring nyid la sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: ring nyid la sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod pa ni /
translated: Kumarila, relying on the system of the followers of Jaimini, states another refutation of the claim of simultaneity:

original: de lta na ni rag 'gyur na //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta na ni rag 'gyur na // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If it is like that, then it followsüîΩThat the object is the cause of the consciousness.

original: shes pa dang dngos po dag ces bya ba ni skabs kyis so //
analyzed: shes pa dang dngos po dag ces bya ba ni skabs kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúConsciousness and things‚Äù is stated according to the context.

original: de ni bdag sems kyi rang bzhin du 'dod pas /
analyzed: de ni bdag sems kyi rang bzhin du 'dod pas /
translated: Since he asserts that it is the nature of the mind,

original: shes pa'i gsal ba ngo shes pa la ma brten par gzhag par mi nus so //
analyzed: shes pa'i gsal ba ngo shes pa la ma brten par gzhag par mi nus so //
translated: it cannot be posited without depending on the recognition of the clarity of consciousness.

original: des na shes pa rnams snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin gyis gcig nyid du 'thad pa'i phyir na rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na shes pa rnams snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin gyis gcig nyid du 'thad pa'i phyir na rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since it is tenable that consciousnesses are the same nature in terms of earlier and later, they would be permanent.

original: des na shes pa la ltos nas 'ga' zhig rgyu dang 'bras bur ji ltar 'gyur blo zhes brjod pa de'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa de la ltos nas ni yul rgyu nyid yin no zhes bya ba yang mi 'thad
analyzed: des na shes pa la ltos nas 'ga' zhig rgyu dang 'bras bur ji ltar 'gyur blo zhes brjod pa de'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa de la ltos nas ni yul rgyu nyid yin no zhes bya ba yang mi 'thad
translated: It is not tenable to say that the object is the cause in dependence on that which has the attributes of arising and disintegrating, the specific condition of that expression.

original: de sems kyi rang bzhin du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de sems kyi rang bzhin du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you accept that to be the nature of mind.

original: phyogs 'di ni tha dad pa dang mi 'thad pa'i rtogs pas yang gnod pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs 'di ni tha dad pa dang mi 'thad pa'i rtogs pas yang gnod pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This position is not harmed by the realization of difference and non-tenability.

original: phyogs gzhan ni brjod par bya ba mang ba'i phyir btang snyoms su dor ba yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gzhan ni brjod par bya ba mang ba'i phyir btang snyoms su dor ba yin no //
translated: The other position is set aside as irrelevant because it involves much to be said.

original: gal te 'o na ngo shes kyi stobs kyis de'i rang bzhin gyis bdag grub na ni grub la rag go zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na ngo shes kyi stobs kyis de'i rang bzhin gyis bdag grub na ni grub la rag go zhe na /
translated: But if the self is established by the power of recognition, then it is established.

original: dgag pa brjod pa ni ngo shes tshad ma nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dgag pa brjod pa ni ngo shes tshad ma nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The expression of negation is ‚ÄúRecognition is not a valid cognition.‚Äù

original: 'ga' zhig tu yang zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu yang zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: The thought is that it is not a valid cognition in any case.

original: ci'i phyir snyam na snga ma zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam na snga ma zhes gsungs so //
translated: Why? Because of the former.

original: gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de ni /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de ni /
translated: That which is the nature of something,

original: de rtogs na nges par rtogs pa dang ldan pa yin te sngon po la zlum po bzhin no ;
analyzed: de rtogs na nges par rtogs pa dang ldan pa yin te sngon po la zlum po bzhin no ;
translated: if it is ascertained when that is realized, it is like a blue color in a circle.

original: / snga ma dang phyi ma nyid kyang dngos po'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: / snga ma dang phyi ma nyid kyang dngos po'i rang bzhin no //
translated: And former and later are the nature of things.

original: thal bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshig so //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshig so //
translated: The consequence is the reason.

original: bzlog pa ni gang zhig gang rtogs pa na ma rtogs pa med pa de ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni gang zhig gang rtogs pa na ma rtogs pa med pa de ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: The reversal is: That which, when realized, is not realized is not its nature,

original: dper na auptala'i dkar po nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na auptala'i dkar po nyid bzhin no //
translated: like the whiteness of a shell.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma nyid kyang dngos po mngon sum du gyur pa na /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma nyid kyang dngos po mngon sum du gyur pa na /
translated: And former and later are realized when the thing becomes manifest.

original: @30b rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni par byed pa med pa'o //
analyzed: @30b rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni par byed pa med pa'o //
translated: There is no activity.

original: de lta ma yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur bzhi bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur bzhi bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa yin no //
translated: Otherwise, there would be the fault of an overextension of the reversal.

original: snga ma'i shes pa la ni phyi ma la yang snga ma nyid /
analyzed: snga ma'i shes pa la ni phyi ma la yang snga ma nyid /
translated: In the former cognition, the later is the former.

original: snang pa ma yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga grub pas na ma grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snang pa ma yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga grub pas na ma grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not an appearance, it is not unestablished, since both are established.

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid na ni sngon po bzhin du de gnyi ga snang ba na skad cig tsam mthong bas gnas skabs mtha' dag mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid na ni sngon po bzhin du de gnyi ga snang ba na skad cig tsam mthong bas gnas skabs mtha' dag mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were its nature, then like blue, both would appear, and it would follow that the entire state would be seen in a mere instant.

original: des na snga ma la ni snga ma'i rang bzhin nyid snang la phyi ma la yang phyi ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na snga ma la ni snga ma'i rang bzhin nyid snang la phyi ma la yang phyi ma nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, in the former, the nature of the former appears, and in the latter, the latter itself.

original: des na so so'i mngon sum dag gis ni snga ma dang phyi ma nyid rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na so so'i mngon sum dag gis ni snga ma dang phyi ma nyid rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, individual direct perceptions do not comprehend the former and the latter,

original: rang bzhin re re tsam gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin re re tsam gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they apprehend only individual natures.

original: dran pa tsam ni snga ma dang phyi mar yang gcig kho na gzung ba yin no zhes dran pa tsam zhig 'jug pa yin na da ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dran pa tsam ni snga ma dang phyi mar yang gcig kho na gzung ba yin no zhes dran pa tsam zhig 'jug pa yin na da ni ma yin no //
translated: Mere memory comprehends only one former and one latter, and it engages mere memory.

original: de ni rang rgyud du tshad mar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de ni rang rgyud du tshad mar 'gyur ram /
translated: Is that a valid cognition in its own continuum?

original: mthong ngam rjes su 'brang bas yin grang na /
analyzed: mthong ngam rjes su 'brang bas yin grang na /
translated: Or is it through seeing or following?

original: phyogs dang po la ni dran pa zhes kho nar zad kyi 'di don dang 'brel par go ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: phyogs dang po la ni dran pa zhes kho nar zad kyi 'di don dang 'brel par go ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: In the first case, it is just memory, but how can it be understood to be related to the object?

original: yang na rnam par rtog pa thams cad tshad mar ci ste mi thal /
analyzed: yang na rnam par rtog pa thams cad tshad mar ci ste mi thal /
translated: Or else, why does not every discursive thought become a valid cognition?üîΩIn the other case, it must be only the subsequent cognition that follows the perception.

original: phyogs gzhan la ni de mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba kho nar 'gyur dgos so zhes ston pa ni //
analyzed: phyogs gzhan la ni de mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba kho nar 'gyur dgos so zhes ston pa ni //
translated: This is what is shown by the words,

original: rtog pa snga ma phyi ma dag / ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa snga ma phyi ma dag / ces bya ba'o //
translated: The former thought does not cognize the object of the latter.

original: rtog pa snga mas ni rang gi yul gzhan gyi yul dang mi bsrel /
analyzed: rtog pa snga mas ni rang gi yul gzhan gyi yul dang mi bsrel /
translated: The former thought does not mix the object of itself with the object of another,

original: phyi mas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi mas kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor does the latter.

original: de dag gi yul ma 'dres pa med pa na ste /
analyzed: de dag gi yul ma 'dres pa med pa na ste /
translated: When their objects are not mixed,

original: tha dad par bzung na dran pa gcig nyid shes par byed pa ma yin par rigs so zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: tha dad par bzung na dran pa gcig nyid shes par byed pa ma yin par rigs so zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: if they are apprehended as different, it is not reasonable that a single memory should be produced. This is the remainder of the argument.

original: med pa gcig gi lhag par zhen par byed pa'i mngon sum de ji ltar mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid du ma bzod de 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: med pa gcig gi lhag par zhen par byed pa'i mngon sum de ji ltar mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid du ma bzod de 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: How can that perception which is the cause of the adherence to a single non-existent be the definition of perception? Because it is erroneous. This is the idea.

original: yang na rtag par smra ba la nga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin snga ma 'am phyi ma'i shes pa la snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na rtag par smra ba la nga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin snga ma 'am phyi ma'i shes pa la snang ba ma yin te /
translated: Or else, if you maintain that the self is permanent, the nature of the self in the prior and subsequent lives does not appear to the prior or subsequent consciousnesses,

original: gcig nyid kyis phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gnyis mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gcig nyid kyis phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gnyis mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because it is not tenable that a single entity has two mutually contradictory natures.

original: snga ma phyi ma'i ngo bo dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: snga ma phyi ma'i ngo bo dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'i don yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúThe prior and subsequent natures . . . ‚Äù

original: tha dad 'di ni bya ba dang dus la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis byas pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad 'di ni bya ba dang dus la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis byas pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the difference is due to the difference in action and time, etc.,

original: de lta na lhan cig skyes pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de lta na lhan cig skyes pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: then they are not produced simultaneously.

original: khyad par de dang ldan la tha dad pa dang mi dad par dpyad bzod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par de dang ldan la tha dad pa dang mi dad par dpyad bzod pa ma yin te /
translated: And that which possesses that difference cannot be analyzed as either different or non-different.

original: des na snga ma dang phyi ma nyid ni rnam par rtog pas sprul pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni gnyis la dan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na snga ma dang phyi ma nyid ni rnam par rtog pas sprul pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni gnyis la dan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, we say that the prior and subsequent are fabrications of conceptualization. This is called ‚Äúthe argument of the two truths.‚Äù

original: dran pa ni rnam par rtog pa tsam zhig lo phyir smras pa yin no //
analyzed: dran pa ni rnam par rtog pa tsam zhig lo phyir smras pa yin no //
translated: We have stated that memory is mere conceptualization.

original: @31a * // de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni tshad ma nyid ma yin zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: @31a * // de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni tshad ma nyid ma yin zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not a valid cognition.

original: yang na dran par 'dod pa'i ngo shes pa 'di ni 'di yin no zhes snga ma dang phyi ma dag la 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na dran par 'dod pa'i ngo shes pa 'di ni 'di yin no zhes snga ma dang phyi ma dag la 'jug pa yin la /
translated: Or, the recognition that is the desire to remember is engaged in the former and latter, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is it.‚Äù

original: des na mngon sum gyis bsal ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir 'di ni tshad ma nyid ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na mngon sum gyis bsal ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir 'di ni tshad ma nyid ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is not a valid cognition because it is a subjective consciousness that is refuted by direct perception. This is the meaning.

original: 'di snyam du snga ma dang phyi ma'i mngon sum dag gis so sor snga ma phyi ma nyid ma rtogs mod /
analyzed: 'di snyam du snga ma dang phyi ma'i mngon sum dag gis so sor snga ma phyi ma nyid ma rtogs mod /
translated: One might think, ‚ÄúThe former and latter direct perceptions do not individually realize the former and latter.

original: snga mas ni snga ma'i rang bzhin 'dzin la phyi mas ni phyi ma yin te /
analyzed: snga mas ni snga ma'i rang bzhin 'dzin la phyi mas ni phyi ma yin te /
translated: However, the former apprehends the nature of the former, and the latter apprehends the latter.

original: des na de ltar rjes su bya ba'i ngo shes pa ji ltar 'khrul pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: des na de ltar rjes su bya ba'i ngo shes pa ji ltar 'khrul pa yin snyam na /
translated: Therefore, how can the recognition that is engaged in that way be mistaken?‚Äù

original: gal te de lta na shes pa snga mas ni phyi ma mi 'dzin la /
analyzed: gal te de lta na shes pa snga mas ni phyi ma mi 'dzin la /
translated: If that is so, the former consciousness does not apprehend the latter,

original: phyi mas kyang snga ma 'dzin no zhes brjod pa ni rtogs pa snga ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi mas kyang snga ma 'dzin no zhes brjod pa ni rtogs pa snga ma zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and the latter also does not apprehend the former.

original: de las ni myong ba gnyis las so //
analyzed: de las ni myong ba gnyis las so //
translated: And from that, the two experiences.

original: nyams su myong ba gnyis stobs las ni byung bar 'dod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba gnyis stobs las ni byung bar 'dod pa kho na ste /
translated: The two experiences arise from the power of the two, as is accepted.

original: 'on kyang de dag gis ma bzung ba'i gcig nyid nges par go ji ltar 'gyur ba de nyid tshad ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag gis ma bzung ba'i gcig nyid nges par go ji ltar 'gyur ba de nyid tshad ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But how can one understand that the single [object] that is not apprehended by them is ascertained? That is the valid cognition.

original: 'o na slob ma'i rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs kyang tshad mar thal te /
analyzed: 'o na slob ma'i rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs kyang tshad mar thal te /
translated: Well then, it follows that the collection of thoughts of the student is also valid cognition,

original: slob dpon gyi nga ro lta ba la sogs pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi nga ro lta ba la sogs pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises from the sound of the master, the view, and so on.

original: gal te yang rnam par rtog pa de'i gzhal bya la mngon sum 'jug par mi srid par brjod na /
analyzed: gal te yang rnam par rtog pa de'i gzhal bya la mngon sum 'jug par mi srid par brjod na /
translated: If it is said that it is impossible for that thought to engage in direct perception of its object of comprehension,

original: 'dir gang gis zlog par byed /
analyzed: 'dir gang gis zlog par byed /
translated: then what prevents it from engaging in inference?

original: mig gnyis phye ba tsam ni gnyi gar yang mtshungs pa yin no //üîΩ'on te gnod pa dang mi gnod pa dag gi khyad par yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don /
analyzed: mig gnyis phye ba tsam ni gnyi gar yang mtshungs pa yin no // 'on te gnod pa dang mi gnod pa dag gi khyad par yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don /
translated: The mere opening of the two eyes is the same in both cases.üîΩBut if there is a difference between the one that is harmed and the one that is not harmed, then how can the student's thought, which is the object of arising,

original: slob mas rnam par brtag pa gang gis bsal bar nus /
analyzed: slob mas rnam par brtag pa gang gis bsal bar nus /
translated: be dispelled?

original: de lta ma yin na mtho ris kyi sgrub byed me'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i ngag kyang gnod pa'i don can nyid du thal lo //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mtho ris kyi sgrub byed me'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i ngag kyang gnod pa'i don can nyid du thal lo //
translated: Otherwise, the Vedic injunctions to perform the fire sacrifice, etc. would be meaningless.

original: bskul ba'i gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ni slob ma'i rnam par rtog pa ni yul ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bskul ba'i gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ni slob ma'i rnam par rtog pa ni yul ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is not possible to incite a person to do something that is impossible.

original: rnam par dbye ba 'di dag las yin te /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba 'di dag las yin te /
translated: This is the distinction.

original: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin par ni brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin par ni brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not possible to say that it is valid or invalid.

original: ji ltar gcig la sgra las byung ba tshad ma yin pa de bzhin du mngon sum thams cad kyi gtso bo yin te ngo shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gcig la sgra las byung ba tshad ma yin pa de bzhin du mngon sum thams cad kyi gtso bo yin te ngo shes pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as one sound is valid, so is all perception, like the recognition of something.

original: 'on te mngon sum gnyis kyis rang bzhin re re bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum gnyis kyis rang bzhin re re bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But two perceptions grasp each of the two natures.

original: 'o na te snga ma nyid 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyis ni de la 'brel ba rnam par gcod pa tsam byas kyi phyi ma'i nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na te snga ma nyid 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyis ni de la 'brel ba rnam par gcod pa tsam byas kyi phyi ma'i nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: If the first perception, which grasps the object, merely eliminates the connection with another object, it does not grasp the second object.

original: de bzhin du gzhan du yang brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan du yang brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: So it should be said in other cases as well.

original: 'o na phyi ma nyid de sngar yod dam med /
analyzed: 'o na phyi ma nyid de sngar yod dam med /
translated: But is the latter already existent or not?

original: gal te yod na ni gdon mi za bar yongs su gcad par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yod na ni gdon mi za bar yongs su gcad par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is, then it must be determined.

original: @31b de lta ma yin na ni snga ma nyid kyang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @31b de lta ma yin na ni snga ma nyid kyang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not, then the former is not either.

original: med pa nyid ma yin ni na rnam par gcad par grub po //
analyzed: med pa nyid ma yin ni na rnam par gcad par grub po //
translated: If it is not nonexistent, then the exclusion is established.

original: de bzhin du phyi ma nyid la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi ma nyid la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the latter.

original: 'on te rang bzhin gnyi ga yang rtags nye bar gnas pa nyid yin zhing mngon sum gnyi gas mngon sum du byas pa nyid yin na de lta na yang dran pa tsam gyis rang bzhin can ngo shes pa nye bar dgod pas ci zhig bya zhes dran pa'i
analyzed: 'on te rang bzhin gnyi ga yang rtags nye bar gnas pa nyid yin zhing mngon sum gnyi gas mngon sum du byas pa nyid yin na de lta na yang dran pa tsam gyis rang bzhin can ngo shes pa nye bar dgod pas ci zhig bya zhes dran pa'i
translated: But if both natures are present in the evidence and both are perceived by perception, then what is the use of positing recognition, which is merely memory?

original: sgras ston par byed do //üîΩde'i phyir / ma shes cha la rang bzhin dang // dbang pos mthong ba dran pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sgras ston par byed do // de'i phyir / ma shes cha la rang bzhin dang // dbang pos mthong ba dran pa'i phyir //
translated: This is what is indicated by the word ‚Äúmemory.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore:

original: rtags kyi ma skyes rnam rtog rnams //
analyzed: rtags kyi ma skyes rnam rtog rnams //
translated: Because of the memory of the seeing by the sense faculty of the part that was not known,üîΩThe nonarising of the concepts in regard to the evidence

original: rnam pa kun du tshad med nyid //
analyzed: rnam pa kun du tshad med nyid //
translated: Is in every way valid cognition.

original: gal te gzugs kyi shes pa'i de ma thag pa'i reg pa'i shes pa rang rgyud yin yang mi blu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gal te gzugs kyi shes pa'i de ma thag pa'i reg pa'i shes pa rang rgyud yin yang mi blu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: If the consciousness of contact that is the antecedent of the consciousness of form is not deceptive, even though it is of the same continuum, it is valid knowledge.

original: ngo shes pa yang yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo shes pa yang yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, recognition would also be valid knowledge.

original: skye ba'i tshogs pa gzhan du gyur pa nyid kyang /üîΩthun mong ba kho na'o zhes bya ba yang brtsad par mi bya ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i tshogs pa gzhan du gyur pa nyid kyang / thun mong ba kho na'o zhes bya ba yang brtsad par mi bya ste /
translated: The transformation of the collection of causes of birth is alsoüîΩonly common to all.

original: mi slu ba la nyid med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi slu ba la nyid med pa'i phyir te /
translated: This should not be disputed, because it is not deceptive.

original: 'ga' zhig tu gcig pa nyid ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu gcig pa nyid ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not understood to be the same in some cases.

original: thams cad du snga ma'i dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gnyis 'byung ba phyis ni mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par rtog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du snga ma'i dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gnyis 'byung ba phyis ni mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par rtog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is understood that way, that is, that in all cases two direct perceptions arise, one with the nature of the prior and one with the nature of the subsequent, and later on there is a conceptual cognition that connects them.

original: gcig nyid mngon sum gyis ma bzung ba'i phyir na de dang 'brel ba'i rtags las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: gcig nyid mngon sum gyis ma bzung ba'i phyir na de dang 'brel ba'i rtags las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang yod pa ma yin te //
translated: Because oneness is not apprehended by direct perception, inference arising from a reason that is related to that is also not possible.

original: gcig nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i don bya ba 'ga' zhig kyang dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: gcig nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i don bya ba 'ga' zhig kyang dmigs pa med do //
translated: Nor is there any object to be accomplished by the one.

original: ji ltar shing tha dad pa skyes ba de bzhin du phyis 'byung ba'i grib ma yang tha dad pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar shing tha dad pa skyes ba de bzhin du phyis 'byung ba'i grib ma yang tha dad pa kho na yin la /
translated: Just as the different trees produce different shadows,

original: ji ltar grib ma rigs mthun pa de ltar ni shing yang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar grib ma rigs mthun pa de ltar ni shing yang yin no //
translated: so the shadow is of the same kind as the tree.

original: de bas na thams cad du don bya ba ni de dang 'dra bas bsgrub par bya bas yin gyi de nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin no //üîΩgtams pa phyir len pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na thams cad du don bya ba ni de dang 'dra bas bsgrub par bya bas yin gyi de nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin no // gtams pa phyir len pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the object to be accomplished is like that, not the same as that which accomplishes it.üîΩAs for the objection that memory is not possible,

original: gzhan gyis dran dang longs spyod sogs //
analyzed: gzhan gyis dran dang longs spyod sogs //
translated: because the self is not permanent,

original: thal pa gnod byed ma yin te //
analyzed: thal pa gnod byed ma yin te //
translated: that is not a refutation,

original: des 'ga' dran pa med pa'i phyir //üîΩnyams su myong ba las ni dran pa 'byung //
analyzed: des 'ga' dran pa med pa'i phyir // nyams su myong ba las ni dran pa 'byung //
translated: because it is not the case that memory is of something not remembered.

original: zhes bya ba der bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba der bshad zin to //
translated: It has been explained that memory arises from experience.

original: ro la sogs pa'i shes pa la ni don bya ba'i khyad par gyis byas pa'i mi slu ba bsnyon par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ro la sogs pa'i shes pa la ni don bya ba'i khyad par gyis byas pa'i mi slu ba bsnyon par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to deny the nondeceptiveness that is produced by the particular object to be accomplished in the case of the cognition of taste, etc.

original: gzhan yang gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams ni bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin dbang po'i rnam par shes pa la dngos su gsal ba yin yang gal te log pa nyid du dogs na ni /üîΩsrid pa rang bzhin med pa kho @32a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams ni bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin dbang po'i rnam par shes pa la dngos su gsal ba yin yang gal te log pa nyid du dogs na ni / srid pa rang bzhin med pa kho @32a * //
translated: If you doubt that they are unreal,

original: nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nar 'gyur ro //
translated: then existence would be just essenceless.

original: de'i tshe ni ngo shes pa'i gtam yang ga la yod /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni ngo shes pa'i gtam yang ga la yod /
translated: At that time, how could there be any talk of recognition?

original: ngo ma shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: ngo ma shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa yin la /
translated: Non-recognition is conceptual.

original: rnam par rtog pa yang don du lhag par zhen pa tsam gyis dngos su myong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang don du lhag par zhen pa tsam gyis dngos su myong ba ni ma yin te /
translated: And conceptual cognition is not directly experienced by mere adherence to an object.

original: des de'i yul bkag kyang dngos po'i rang bzhin nyams pa med do //
analyzed: des de'i yul bkag kyang dngos po'i rang bzhin nyams pa med do //
translated: Even though it refutes the object of that conceptual cognition, the nature of things is not undermined.

original: dngos po snang ba la dngos po nyid du rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po snang ba la dngos po nyid du rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because things are posited as things on the basis of appearance.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa yang rtags kyis bskyed pa yin na ni de'i che des grub pa spangs na thams cad spangs par 'gyur ba kho na ste /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa yang rtags kyis bskyed pa yin na ni de'i che des grub pa spangs na thams cad spangs par 'gyur ba kho na ste /
translated: If conceptual cognition is produced by a sign, then if that sign is refuted, all of it would be refuted.

original: mngon sum sun ma phyung ba ni /
analyzed: mngon sum sun ma phyung ba ni /
translated: The non-refutation of perception

original: des grub pa'i tshul gsum gyis mtshon pa'i rtags las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa sun dbyung bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des grub pa'i tshul gsum gyis mtshon pa'i rtags las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa sun dbyung bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is because it is impossible to refute the inference produced from the reason that indicates the three modes that are established by that [perception].

original: des na de'i skyes bu byed pa ni mngon sum gyi mthar thug pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na de'i skyes bu byed pa ni mngon sum gyi mthar thug pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the human action of that [perception] is only the final stage of perception.

original: des ni rjes su dpag pas nges par byas pas ni dngos su bsal ba'i don dang / grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des ni rjes su dpag pas nges par byas pas ni dngos su bsal ba'i don dang / grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa kho na'o //
translated: Since it is ascertained by inference, the object that is directly refuted is only the same as that which is established and that which is happiness.

original: rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyis zhen par byas pas na dngos su snang ba ma yin pa ;
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyis zhen par byas pas na dngos su snang ba ma yin pa ;
translated: Since it is adhered to by another conception, it does not directly appear.

original: dngos su bsal ba dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos su bsal ba dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not the same as that which is directly refuted and that which is established and that which is happiness.

original: rjes su dpag pa ltar nus pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ltar nus pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not have the capacity to be like inference.

original: des na yid kyi rgyal srid du rtogs pas brtags pa bzhin du de bkag kyang gnod pa ci yod /
analyzed: des na yid kyi rgyal srid du rtogs pas brtags pa bzhin du de bkag kyang gnod pa ci yod /
translated: Therefore, what harm is there in refuting that which is imagined by the imagination of the mental kingdom, just as it is imagined?

original: khyod kyis mngon sum gyi ming byas kyang don mngon sum bsal bar ni bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: khyod kyis mngon sum gyi ming byas kyang don mngon sum bsal bar ni bya bar mi nus te /
translated: You may call it ‚Äúperception,‚Äù but you cannot clear up the meaning of perception.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa gzhan las 'di lhag par zhen pa tsam yin par khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa gzhan las 'di lhag par zhen pa tsam yin par khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is merely a conception that is more tenacious than the others, but it is not different in kind.

original: de'i phyir skyon med pa'i dbang pos bskyed pa'i sems la dngos su snang ba'i don dang / brtags pa tsam mtshungs pa ci yod /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyon med pa'i dbang pos bskyed pa'i sems la dngos su snang ba'i don dang / brtags pa tsam mtshungs pa ci yod /
translated: So what is the similarity between the object that appears directly to the mind that is produced by a faultless sense faculty and the object that is merely imagined?

original: yang snang ba dang lhag par zhen pa dag gi khyad par gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang snang ba dang lhag par zhen pa dag gi khyad par gang zhe na /
translated: What is the difference between appearance and conception?

original: rnam par rtog pa tsam gyis spyod yul mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po stong pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa tsam gyis spyod yul mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po stong pa'am /
translated: The object that is the domain of mere conception is empty,

original: dngos su nyams su myong bzhin pa la srog chags thams cad kyi so so rang gis rig pa ni bsnyon par mi nus so //
analyzed: dngos su nyams su myong bzhin pa la srog chags thams cad kyi so so rang gis rig pa ni bsnyon par mi nus so //
translated: or it is directly experienced, and it is impossible to deny that it is the individual reflexive awareness of all living beings.

original: ngo shes pa la yang nyams su myong ba'i don nyid yod pa min gyi lhag par zhen pa tsam ni ma yin no zhes ni brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: ngo shes pa la yang nyams su myong ba'i don nyid yod pa min gyi lhag par zhen pa tsam ni ma yin no zhes ni brjod par mi nus te /
translated: And it cannot be said that in recognition there is no actual experience of the object, but only a conception.

original: byams pa la sogs pa res 'gas ngo shes par gyur pa tsam la dus thams cad khyab pa'i rang bzhin gyis nges pa dang rjes su mthun par 'jug pa la sogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa res 'gas ngo shes par gyur pa tsam la dus thams cad khyab pa'i rang bzhin gyis nges pa dang rjes su mthun par 'jug pa la sogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that the nature of the object of cognition would be ascertained and engaged in accordance with the nature of the object of cognition at all times, merely by the recognition of Maitreya and so on at some time.

original: rnam par rtog pa nyid kyis nges pa'i rang bzhin ni de snang bar yang khas @32b blang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyid kyis nges pa'i rang bzhin ni de snang bar yang khas @32b blang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: The nature of the object of cognition that is ascertained by conceptualization must be accepted as appearing.

original: de lta ma yin na ngo shes pa'i tha snyad nyams par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ngo shes pa'i tha snyad nyams par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it follows that the convention of recognition would be undermined.

original: gal te bsal ba'i rang bzhin yang yin la rnam par rtog pa yang yin par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bsal ba'i rang bzhin yang yin la rnam par rtog pa yang yin par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is asked how it can be both the nature of the object and conceptualization,

original: 'di yang 'di nyid kyi nyes pa gzhan yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang 'di nyid kyi nyes pa gzhan yin no //
translated: this is another fault of that position.

original: 'on te gnas skabs tsam dus gsum pa nyid yin par nges kyi /
analyzed: 'on te gnas skabs tsam dus gsum pa nyid yin par nges kyi /
translated: If it is said that the three times are ascertained as mere states,

original: gnas skabs ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas skabs ni ma yin te /
translated: but not as states,

original: des na 'jug pa dang ldog pa gnas skabs dang 'brel ba yod pa ma yin no zhe na gnas skabs can de'ang don bya bar 'ga' zhig la nye bar mkho ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: des na 'jug pa dang ldog pa gnas skabs dang 'brel ba yod pa ma yin no zhe na gnas skabs can de'ang don bya bar 'ga' zhig la nye bar mkho ba'ang ma yin /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the state of engaging and disengaging are related to the occasion.

original: re zhig ma mkho ba yin na ni /
analyzed: re zhig ma mkho ba yin na ni /
translated: If it is not needed for some purpose,

original: gal te gnas skabs dag las tha dad par mi snang ba'i shes pa tsam la brjod na /
analyzed: gal te gnas skabs dag las tha dad par mi snang ba'i shes pa tsam la brjod na /
translated: then if it is said that it is merely consciousness that does not appear to be different from the states,

original: pa'i rva'i shas pa nyes pa ci byas /
analyzed: pa'i rva'i shas pa nyes pa ci byas /
translated: what is the fault of the rabbit‚Äôs horns?

original: 'on te 'ga' zhig tu nye bar mkho bar khas len na /
analyzed: 'on te 'ga' zhig tu nye bar mkho bar khas len na /
translated: But if it is accepted that it is needed for some purpose,

original: de yang mi 'thad de gnas las tha dad pa'i rang bzhin du mi snang ba ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa'i sgrub par byed pa can gyi nye bar mkho ba can du ji ltar brjod par nus /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de gnas las tha dad pa'i rang bzhin du mi snang ba ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa'i sgrub par byed pa can gyi nye bar mkho ba can du ji ltar brjod par nus /
translated: that also is not tenable. How could it be said that that which does not appear to be a nature different from the states is needed for the proof that is the means of valid knowledge of direct perception and nonobservation?

original: de lta na ni mtha' yas pa'i dngos po rtag par yang thal lo //
analyzed: de lta na ni mtha' yas pa'i dngos po rtag par yang thal lo //
translated: If that were the case, it would follow that an infinite number of things would be permanent.

original: de'i phyir gnas skabs las tha dad pa ni snang ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas skabs las tha dad pa ni snang ba ma yin la /
translated: Therefore that which is different from the states does not appear,

original: don bya ba dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: don bya ba dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: and it also does not possess a purpose.

original: des na rus sbal gyi spu dang khyad par med do //
analyzed: des na rus sbal gyi spu dang khyad par med do //
translated: Therefore, it is no different from the hair of a tortoise.

original: de'i phyir rnam par 'chad pa'i rang bzhin can gnas skabs nyid du shes pas gcig tu byed pa yin pa'i phyir de tsam gyis 'khrul pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par 'chad pa'i rang bzhin can gnas skabs nyid du shes pas gcig tu byed pa yin pa'i phyir de tsam gyis 'khrul pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is known to be momentary by nature, it is mistaken merely by that, because it is a single activity.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa de dag nges par bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la ni lan gyi skad tsam yang ga la yod /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa de dag nges par bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la ni lan gyi skad tsam yang ga la yod /
translated: How can there be even a moment's reply to the statement that the past and future are ascertained?

original: 'dis ni gang rtags las ma skyes pa'i rnam par brten pa'i shes pa de thams cad ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni gang rtags las ma skyes pa'i rnam par brten pa'i shes pa de thams cad ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: This shows that all cognitions of representations that are not produced from a reason are not valid cognitions,

original: dper na yid kyir gyal srid kyi rnam par rtog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na yid kyir gyal srid kyi rnam par rtog pa bzhin no //
translated: like, for example, all conceptual thoughts of the mind.

original: ngo shes pa yang rtags las ma skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: ngo shes pa yang rtags las ma skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa'o //
translated: The observation of the pervasion by contradiction is that recognition is also a conceptual thought that is not produced from a reason.

original: bzlog pa tshad ma la ni khyab par byed pa /
analyzed: bzlog pa tshad ma la ni khyab par byed pa /
translated: In the valid cognition of the opposite, the pervasion is

original: dran pa rang rgyud pa'i mtshan nyid med pas na gtan tshigs rtags las ma skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa la gnod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir rtags las ma skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid tshad ma ma yin pa nyid la gnas pas de khyab pa
analyzed: dran pa rang rgyud pa'i mtshan nyid med pas na gtan tshigs rtags las ma skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa la gnod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir rtags las ma skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid tshad ma ma yin pa nyid la gnas pas de khyab pa
translated: Therefore, since a conception that does not arise from a logical reason is not a valid cognition, it is pervaded by that.

original: yin no // de'i phyir ngo shes pa ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: yin no // de'i phyir ngo shes pa ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it is established that recognition is not a valid cognition.

original: gal te mngon sum gnyis kyi snga ma dang phyi ma gcig nyid ma bzung ba de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gnyis kyi snga ma dang phyi ma gcig nyid ma bzung ba de lta na yang /
translated: If you say that even though the former and latter of the two direct perceptions are not apprehended as being the same,

original: 'dzin par byed pa dag yod do zhe na gal te zhes gsungs @33a * //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa dag yod do zhe na gal te zhes gsungs @33a * //
translated: still, there is an apprehender, then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúIf so,‚Äù

original: so ; / gcig ces bya ba ni sngar dang phyis kyi dus dag tu'o //
analyzed: so ; / gcig ces bya ba ni sngar dang phyis kyi dus dag tu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe same‚Äù means in terms of the former and latter times.

original: shes pa bzhin du dus gzhan ma khyab pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa bzhin du dus gzhan ma khyab pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not the case that, like consciousness, it does not pervade other times.

original: des kyang zhes bya ba ni bdag gis so //
analyzed: des kyang zhes bya ba ni bdag gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means by me.

original: re zhig gang gi ltar na bdag med bems po yin pa de'i ltar na ni /
analyzed: re zhig gang gi ltar na bdag med bems po yin pa de'i ltar na ni /
translated: First, for those who say that the self is inanimate,

original: ji ltar blo dang du ba las rtogs pa yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar blo dang du ba las rtogs pa yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as it is understood from the mind and smoke,

original: mngon sum la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa la ma rtogs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa la ma rtogs pa yang yin no //
translated: so it is not understood in the case of non-objects of perception, etc.

original: des na rigs brjod pa ni de yang /
analyzed: des na rigs brjod pa ni de yang /
translated: Therefore, the statement of the reason is:

original: mngon sum la sogs pa yi dang // zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa yi dang // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúbecause of the nature of perception, etc.‚Äù

original: sems kyi rang bzhin nyid la ni //
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin nyid la ni //
translated: The nature of the mind itself

original: mngon sum la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin yang /
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin yang /
translated: is the nature of perception, etc.

original: ji zhig ltar tha dad par yang khas blangs pa'i phyir na mi rigs par brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji zhig ltar tha dad par yang khas blangs pa'i phyir na mi rigs par brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: But since it is accepted as somehow different, it is not said to be unreasonable.

original: mngon sum la sogs pa'i 'jug pa yang dpyad zin to //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa'i 'jug pa yang dpyad zin to //
translated: The operation of perception, etc. has already been examined.

original: des bdag nye bar bkod pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: des bdag nye bar bkod pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of positing the self by that?

original: 'on te yang 'ga' zhig la brten pa'i shes pa ni byed pa nyid du gyur pas tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te yang 'ga' zhig la brten pa'i shes pa ni byed pa nyid du gyur pas tshad ma yin te /
translated: But if a cognition is based on something, it is valid because it is an operation.

original: byed pa po rten gyi gzhan gyi dbang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po rten gyi gzhan gyi dbang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the operation is dependent on another, the basis.

original: de med na de gang gi byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de med na de gang gi byed pa yin te /
translated: If that does not exist, what is the operation of that?

original: de ni ngo bo zhes bya ba'i ngo bo shes pa yal bar dor na ni bdag yod pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni ngo bo zhes bya ba'i ngo bo shes pa yal bar dor na ni bdag yod pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one were to abandon the cognition called ‚Äúessence,‚Äù then the self would not exist.üîΩTherefore, how could one ever disparage recognition?

original: des na rnam pa thams cad du ngo shes pa la brnyas par ji ltar byed snyam du dogs pa bsu nas bdag la brten pa nyid du tshad ma rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa med par ston par byed pa ni bdag la brten pa tsam gyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na rnam pa thams cad du ngo shes pa la brnyas par ji ltar byed snyam du dogs pa bsu nas bdag la brten pa nyid du tshad ma rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa med par ston par byed pa ni bdag la brten pa tsam gyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Anticipating this doubt, he demonstrates that the existence of the self is not established by the presence or absence of a valid cognition that is based on the self:

original: bdag la brten par shes pa tsam gyis zhes bya bar lta'o //
analyzed: bdag la brten par shes pa tsam gyis zhes bya bar lta'o //
translated: The mere fact that it is known to be based on the self.

original: de lta na yang shes pa bdag la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang shes pa bdag la brten pa yin no //
translated: Even so, cognition is based on the self.

original: tshad ma go ga las nges na tshad ma'i tha snyad ni mi slu ba la ltos pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshad ma go ga las nges na tshad ma'i tha snyad ni mi slu ba la ltos pa nyid do //
translated: How is this known? The convention of valid cognition depends on nondeception.

original: shes pa mi slu ba yin par grub kyang gal te 'di bdag la brten na tshad mar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: shes pa mi slu ba yin par grub kyang gal te 'di bdag la brten na tshad mar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Even if it is established that cognition is nondeceptive, if it is based on the self, it is valid cognition.

original: de lta ma yin na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni rtogs pa dang ldan pa sum kyang bzod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni rtogs pa dang ldan pa sum kyang bzod pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not acceptable to any of the three who have understanding.

original: de nyid ston par byed pa ni mthong bas phyis nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ston par byed pa ni mthong bas phyis nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, ‚Äúafter seeing . . .

original: byed pa po dang las su brjod par 'dod pa tsam ni bdag gis sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byed pa po dang las su brjod par 'dod pa tsam ni bdag gis sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The mere desire to express the self as the agent and the object of action is not established by me,

original: des ni dngos po ji lta ba bzhin yin par ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des ni dngos po ji lta ba bzhin yin par ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not ascertained as it is.

original: phung po'i tshogs byed pa por brjod pa dang / de'i phyogs gcig shes par byed par brjod pas 'dod pa yod pa'i phyir na gzhan gyis ci bya /
analyzed: phung po'i tshogs byed pa por brjod pa dang / de'i phyogs gcig shes par byed par brjod pas 'dod pa yod pa'i phyir na gzhan gyis ci bya /
translated: Since the desire exists to express the collection of aggregates as the agent and one part of it as the object of action, what is the use of another?

original: shes pa nyid ni byed pa po yin la /
analyzed: shes pa nyid ni byed pa po yin la /
translated: Consciousness itself is the agent.

original: 'dra ba ni byed pa yin no zhes kyang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba ni byed pa yin no zhes kyang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is also explained that similarity is the action.

original: bdag med pa ni zhes @33b bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa ni zhes @33b bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSelflessness‚Äù is the other‚Äôs.

original: bdag ni yid dang sbyor bar byed la yid la yid kyang dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs par dus la ldog pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po shes pa ni bdag rtag pa med par mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: bdag ni yid dang sbyor bar byed la yid la yid kyang dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs par dus la ldog pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po shes pa ni bdag rtag pa med par mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o zhes bya ba ni
translated: The self is connected with the mind, and the mind is called the sense faculty, etc. The cognition of things that are dependent on time is not absent in the permanent self.

original: the tshom dang phyin ci log tshogs so //
analyzed: the tshom dang phyin ci log tshogs so //
translated: This is the collection of doubts and errors.

original: 'di ni sngar bstan pa da ltar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sngar bstan pa da ltar bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what was taught earlier and is now being explained.

original: mi slu ba la ltos na bdag la brten pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: mi slu ba la ltos na bdag la brten pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What is the use of positing a self in relation to the nondeceptive?

original: shes pa mi rtag pa yang mi slu ba dang ldan par de ma thag pa la sogs pa'i stobs kyis skyes pa mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa mi rtag pa yang mi slu ba dang ldan par de ma thag pa la sogs pa'i stobs kyis skyes pa mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not contradictory that impermanent cognition, possessing nondeceptiveness, arises by the power of the immediately preceding condition, etc.

original: des na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag kho na bdag yod pa der yang mi slu ba dang ldan pa'i tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag kho na bdag yod pa der yang mi slu ba dang ldan pa'i tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, perception and inference are not valid cognitions that possess nondeceptiveness in regard to the existence of the self.

original: de ni srid par yang mi 'thad do zhes gsungs pa ni snga ma phyi ma'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni srid par yang mi 'thad do zhes gsungs pa ni snga ma phyi ma'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not tenable that it exists in the continuum, as stated in the line ‚ÄúThe former and the later . . .‚Äù

original: 'di gang gi zhar las 'phros pa de nyid mjug sdud pa ni /
analyzed: 'di gang gi zhar las 'phros pa de nyid mjug sdud pa ni /
translated: The conclusion of this discussion is:

original: des na shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúconsciousness.‚Äù

original: shes pa ni rgyu don gyi 'bras bu yin no zhes bya bar mi rtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩgal te re zhig 'ga' zhig rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: shes pa ni rgyu don gyi 'bras bu yin no zhes bya bar mi rtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to // gal te re zhig 'ga' zhig rtogs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning is that consciousness is not understood to be the effect of the object that is the cause.

original: des na 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pas kyang nyes pa ci zhig byas she na /
analyzed: des na 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pas kyang nyes pa ci zhig byas she na /
translated: If it is understood that consciousness is the effect of the object, then what is the problem with that?

original: shes pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shes pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúconsciousness.‚Äù

original: bdag dang de'i rig par bya ba bdun du snang ba rig pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang de'i rig par bya ba bdun du snang ba rig pa yin no //
translated: The seven appearances of the self and its cognition are the cognition.

original: de kho na rig pa yin zhes rnam par bcad par bya bar brjod pa ni snga phyi'i bdag nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de kho na rig pa yin zhes rnam par bcad par bya bar brjod pa ni snga phyi'i bdag nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is the cognition of reality‚Äù is the exclusion. He says, ‚Äúthe prior and subsequent nature.‚Äù

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid la ni mngon sum 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid la ni mngon sum 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Direct perception does not engage the prior and subsequent nature, which is cause and effect.

original: mngon sum can 'jug pa 'gog pa la glags yod par mthong nas gzhan dag smra ba ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum can 'jug pa 'gog pa la glags yod par mthong nas gzhan dag smra ba ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Seeing that there is an opportunity to refute the engagement of direct perception, others say, ‚ÄúWell then . . .‚Äù

original: 'bras bu ni mngon sum gyis rtogs la /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni mngon sum gyis rtogs la /
translated: The effect is understood by direct perception.

original: de las sngar rgyu nyid par ni rjes su dpag pas dpog pa yin te /
analyzed: de las sngar rgyu nyid par ni rjes su dpag pas dpog pa yin te /
translated: And prior to that, the cause itself is inferred by inference.

original: des na snga ma dang phyi ma rig par med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na snga ma dang phyi ma rig par med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that there is no knowledge of the prior and the subsequent.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa las so //üîΩlan ni rjes su dpag pa de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa las so // lan ni rjes su dpag pa de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: From that means from the understanding by inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa de yang 'jug pa yod pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de yang 'jug pa yod pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: The answer is that inference also does not engage.

original: gang la zhe na bsgrub par bya ba mngon sum gyis rab tu rtogs pa med pa'i dngos po la'o //
analyzed: gang la zhe na bsgrub par bya ba mngon sum gyis rab tu rtogs pa med pa'i dngos po la'o //
translated: What does it not engage? It does not engage the object of affirmation that is not understood by direct perception.

original: khyab pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyab pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the pervasion is not established.

original: rjes su dpag pa gzhan gyi khyab pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa gzhan gyi khyab pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that another inference would apprehend the pervasion,

original: sngon rol mngon sum zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sngon rol mngon sum zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said that direct perception precedes.

original: mngon sum 'di ni bdag gi 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa dang / lhan cig gsal ba mdun na gnas pa'i don 'dzin par byed @34a * //
analyzed: mngon sum 'di ni bdag gi 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa dang / lhan cig gsal ba mdun na gnas pa'i don 'dzin par byed @34a * //
translated: This direct perception is asserted to be the effect of the self, and it apprehends the object that is manifest and present in front.

original: la ; rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po snga ma la ni mngon sum snga ma tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: la ; rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po snga ma la ni mngon sum snga ma tshad ma yin no //
translated: The former entity, which is asserted to be the cause, is the valid cognition of the former direct perception.

original: gang gi tshe snga ma dang phyi ma nyid la mngon sum tshad ma ma yin pa de'i tshe ni rjes su dpag pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe snga ma dang phyi ma nyid la mngon sum tshad ma ma yin pa de'i tshe ni rjes su dpag pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: When the former and latter are not the valid cognitions of direct perception, at that time there is no other inference.

original: de ni khyab pa 'dzin pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni khyab pa 'dzin pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that depends on the apprehension of the pervasion.

original: 'di la yang sngar rjes su dpag pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes rtogs par byed na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la yang sngar rjes su dpag pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes rtogs par byed na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if it is understood that there is no other inference here previously, then there would be an infinite regress.

original: de ltar shes pa dang shes bya dag rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyogs bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar shes pa dang shes bya dag rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyogs bsal ba yin no //
translated: Thus the position that consciousness and the object of consciousness are cause and effect is refuted.

original: shes bya nyid shas pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyogs la ni /
analyzed: shes bya nyid shas pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyogs la ni /
translated: In the position that the object of consciousness is the effect of consciousness,

original: gal te shes pa'i 'bras bus yod pa min na ni de'i tshe nyes pa 'di nyid yin no//
analyzed: gal te shes pa'i 'bras bus yod pa min na ni de'i tshe nyes pa 'di nyid yin no//
translated: if it is not the case that existence is the effect of consciousness, then at that time this fault would exist.

original: 'on te don gzhan gyis yin na de'i tshe yang /
analyzed: 'on te don gzhan gyis yin na de'i tshe yang /
translated: But if it is by another object, then at that time,

original: 'bras bu gzhan skyes med par ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan skyes med par ni //
translated: the effect would arise without a cause.

original: 'bras bu'ang yod pan yid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu'ang yod pan yid mi 'gyur //
translated: The result also exists, but the mind does not change.

original: zhes bya ba nyid rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid rigs pa yin no //
translated: This is the correct reasoning.

original: phal cher de ltar smra ba ni med de des na phyogs 'di ni dngos su ma bstan par yang rnam par rtog pa de nyid la thabs cig gis bsal bar 'dod nas 'bras bu sogs gzhal bya zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phal cher de ltar smra ba ni med de des na phyogs 'di ni dngos su ma bstan par yang rnam par rtog pa de nyid la thabs cig gis bsal bar 'dod nas 'bras bu sogs gzhal bya zhes gsungs so //
translated: Most of them do not speak in this way. Therefore, even though this position is not directly taught, desiring to refute that very conception together with the means, he says, ‚ÄúThe object of knowledge is the result, etc.‚Äù

original: phal cher 'jig rten gyi grags pas phyi rol gyi dngos po'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos sems pa yin no //
analyzed: phal cher 'jig rten gyi grags pas phyi rol gyi dngos po'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos sems pa yin no //
translated: For the most part, external things are directly cognized by the world‚Äôs renown as causes and results.

original: de ni sgrub pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //üîΩ'bras sogs zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni sgrub pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o // 'bras sogs zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: This is not a proof, he thinks.üîΩ‚ÄúThe result, etc.‚Äù refers to the nature of phenomena.

original: phyi rol gyi chos can gang la 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa'i gzhal bya de yod pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi chos can gang la 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa'i gzhal bya de yod pa'o //
translated: The external subject has the object of knowledge, such as the result, etc.

original: phyi rol de ni rtogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol de ni rtogs pa med pa'o //
translated: That external [subject] is not cognized.

original: de ni ma rtogs mod de lta na yang 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa'i gzhal bya la chad pa ci yod snyam na gzhi med ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni ma rtogs mod de lta na yang 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa'i gzhal bya la chad pa ci yod snyam na gzhi med ces gsungs so //
translated: Even though that is not cognized, what is the harm in the object of knowledge, such as the result, etc.? He says, ‚ÄúIt is groundless.‚Äù

original: chos kyi gzhi ni phyi rol gyi dngos po nyid yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi gzhi ni phyi rol gyi dngos po nyid yin te /
translated: The basis of the dharma is external things.

original: de med pa'i phyir de yang 'bang mi dgos par med par grub bo //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir de yang 'bang mi dgos par med par grub bo //
translated: Since they do not exist, it is established that the dharma does not exist, without any need for further argument.

original: chos can ma rtogs par ni chos rtogs par mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos can ma rtogs par ni chos rtogs par mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
