translated: The meaning is that it is not tenable to understand the dharma without understanding the basis of the dharma.

original: ji ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po ma grub snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po ma grub snyam na /
translated: How is it that external things are not established?

original: shes pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: shes pa zhes smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúconsciousness.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: When is the reason.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa la ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar lta'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa la ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar lta'o //
translated: It is seen that it is not the case that it is associated with an object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du ji ltar ma grub ce na zhes dris pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du ji ltar ma grub ce na zhes dris pa yin no //
translated: For that very reason, he asks, ‚ÄúHow is it that it is not established as associated with an object?‚Äù

original: der 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be is associated with an object.

original: mig la sogs pa'i blo dmigs pa rgyu nyid yin na thal ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i blo dmigs pa rgyu nyid yin na thal ba ci yod ce na /
translated: If the cognition of the eye and so on is the cause of the object, what follows?

original: gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThat which . . .‚Äù

original: dmigs pa med par gnas par 'gyur ba yang yin no zhes bzlog pa rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med par gnas par 'gyur ba yang yin no zhes bzlog pa rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It would also be without an object. The opposite should be understood.

original: @34b yang gang gis bzlog pa rtogs par bya ba yang 'grub par 'gyur ba mig la sogs pa'i blo dmigs pa med pa gang du mthong zhe na //
analyzed: @34b yang gang gis bzlog pa rtogs par bya ba yang 'grub par 'gyur ba mig la sogs pa'i blo dmigs pa med pa gang du mthong zhe na //
translated: Moreover, how could one ever perceive the non-apprehending cognition of the eye, etc., by means of which one could understand the reversal of the apprehension of the eye, etc.?

original: zla gnyis rnam can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zla gnyis rnam can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The verse states, ‚ÄúThe cognition of two moons, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi skyed pas 'di dmigs par 'gyur ba zla ba gnyis zhes bya ba'i dngos po 'di 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi skyed pas 'di dmigs par 'gyur ba zla ba gnyis zhes bya ba'i dngos po 'di 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no such thing as the entity called ‚Äútwo moons,‚Äù by the arising of which this cognition would have an object.

original: re zhig zla ba gcig ni yod ce na des cir 'gyur /
analyzed: re zhig zla ba gcig ni yod ce na des cir 'gyur /
translated: If one says that one moon exists, what then?

original: zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa 'di ni de la dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa 'di ni de la dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: This cognition of two moons does not have that as its object.

original: ci'i phyir de la dmigs par mi 'gyur zhe na de ltar lhag par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de la dmigs par mi 'gyur zhe na de ltar lhag par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why would it not have that as its object? Because there is no such adherence to that.

original: lhag par zhen pa nyid kyi nyes pa yin no zhes bya ba yang lan ma yin te /
analyzed: lhag par zhen pa nyid kyi nyes pa yin no zhes bya ba yang lan ma yin te /
translated: The response that the fault lies in the adherence itself is also not correct.

original: de'i rnam pa can ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it does not have that aspect.

original: gal te rnam pa 'di nyid ni zla ba brgya'i yang yin la zla ba gnyis kyi lta ci smos she na /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa 'di nyid ni zla ba brgya'i yang yin la zla ba gnyis kyi lta ci smos she na /
translated: If one says that this very aspect is that of a hundred moons, let alone two moons,

original: zla ba du ma yang rnam pa mtshungs pa yin mod /
analyzed: zla ba du ma yang rnam pa mtshungs pa yin mod /
translated: Even though many months are similar,

original: 'on kyang gcig po de la du ma'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa 'dzin par byed pa ji ltar yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gcig po de la du ma'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa 'dzin par byed pa ji ltar yin te /
translated: how is it that a single thing is apprehended by a consciousness that has many aspects?

original: rang bzhin 'dra bam yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'dra bam yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod do //
translated: Because it does not have a similar nature.

original: de lta ma yin na 'di yang dag pa'i shes pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'di yang dag pa'i shes pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be a correct consciousness.

original: gal te zla ba nyid skye bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te zla ba nyid skye bar byed pa yin la /
translated: If the moon itself is what is produced,

original: zla ba nyid du snang ba yang yin pa'i phyi rji ltar mi 'dra lhag par mi 'dzin pas mi 'khrul par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: zla ba nyid du snang ba yang yin pa'i phyi rji ltar mi 'dra lhag par mi 'dzin pas mi 'khrul par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: and the moon itself is what appears, then it is not the case that it is not mistaken because it does not apprehend a difference or a superimposition.

original: dngos po gzhan dang ldan pa'i dngos po rang gi rang bzhin du rtogs pa yin na ni lhag par 'dzin pas 'khrul bar mi 'gyur te dbyig pa can no zhes bya bar rigs kyi /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan dang ldan pa'i dngos po rang gi rang bzhin du rtogs pa yin na ni lhag par 'dzin pas 'khrul bar mi 'gyur te dbyig pa can no zhes bya bar rigs kyi /
translated: If it is the case that a thing is understood to be the nature of another thing that possesses it, then it is not mistaken because it apprehends a superimposition. It is like the statement, ‚ÄúHe has a stick.‚Äù

original: med pa'i rang bzhin gyis dngos po 'ga' zhig bzung na ni ma bzung ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa'i rang bzhin gyis dngos po 'ga' zhig bzung na ni ma bzung ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if something is apprehended as having a nature that does not exist, then it is not apprehended at all.

original: des na shes pa de ni don dang ldan par sus kyang sgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: des na shes pa de ni don dang ldan par sus kyang sgrub par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, no one can prove that consciousness has an object.

original: rta la rva can du 'dzin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rta la rva can du 'dzin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the apprehension of a horse as having horns.

original: ldan pa can gyi rva tha dad par bzung na ni khyad par nges par ma bzung na ni khyad bar nges par ma zin yang rta mthong ba 'khrul par mi gzhag go //
analyzed: ldan pa can gyi rva tha dad par bzung na ni khyad par nges par ma bzung na ni khyad bar nges par ma zin yang rta mthong ba 'khrul par mi gzhag go //
translated: If one apprehends the horns of the possessor as different, then if one does not apprehend the difference, the seeing of the horse is not mistaken.

original: de bzhin du yal ga dang lo ma la sogs pa'i dbyibs rtog pa la rdul tha dad pa rtogs pa na rang bzhin gyis khyad par nges par ma rtogs kyang 'khrul pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du yal ga dang lo ma la sogs pa'i dbyibs rtog pa la rdul tha dad pa rtogs pa na rang bzhin gyis khyad par nges par ma rtogs kyang 'khrul pa ma yin gyi /
translated: In the same way, when one apprehends the shape of the branches, leaves, etc., as a single thing, even though one does not apprehend the atoms as different, it is not a mistake.

original: rgyud ring por gong bu'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'khrul pa kho na yin no //üîΩde bzhin du med pa tha dad par zla ba rtogs pa ni dmigs pa med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: rgyud ring por gong bu'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'khrul pa kho na yin no // de bzhin du med pa tha dad par zla ba rtogs pa ni dmigs pa med pa kho na ste /
translated: But the conception of a long continuum as a single thing is a mistake.üîΩIn the same way, the apprehension of a single moon as double is a mistake, because it is not an object.

original: gcig dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir dang gnyis ni med pas skyed byed ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir dang gnyis ni med pas skyed byed ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not like the apprehension of one moon as one, because it is not different from that, and because the two moons do not exist and so cannot be the cause of the mistake.

original: 'dir gzhan dag gi dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste rgyu nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgal te rgyu nyid kyis dmigs par brjod na de'i tshe de lta bu'i rgyu med par yang 'bras bu'i shes pa ni @35a * //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan dag gi dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste rgyu nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o // gal te rgyu nyid kyis dmigs par brjod na de'i tshe de lta bu'i rgyu med par yang 'bras bu'i shes pa ni @35a * //
translated: Here, anticipating the objections of others, he says, ‚ÄúIf it is said that the object is perceived because of the cause, etc.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa med par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dmigs pa med par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it is said that the object is perceived because of the cause, then, in that case, the cognition of the effect would be without an object, because of the absence of such a cause.

original: 'on kyang phyi rol gyi dngos po ni bzung ba nyid kyis dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyi rol gyi dngos po ni bzung ba nyid kyis dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: However, the external object is perceived because it is apprehended.

original: lam gyi don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: lam gyi don ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning of the passage.

original: des skyed pa nyid 'phangs pa'i bzung ba'i don snang ba tsam min nam /
analyzed: des skyed pa nyid 'phangs pa'i bzung ba'i don snang ba tsam min nam /
translated: Is it not the mere appearance of the apprehended object that is implied by the cause?

original: mdun du gsal bar snang ba yin te /
analyzed: mdun du gsal bar snang ba yin te /
translated: It is a clear appearance in front.

original: gnyi ga ni 'khrul pa kha yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga ni 'khrul pa kha yang yod pa yin no //
translated: Both are mistaken.

original: don zhes bya ba la sogs pa la don bya ba sngon po la sogs pa myong ba las gzhan don gyi bdag nyid du 'dod dam zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa gcig go //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba la sogs pa la don bya ba sngon po la sogs pa myong ba las gzhan don gyi bdag nyid du 'dod dam zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa gcig go //
translated: In the phrase ‚Äúthe object, etc.,‚Äù the question is whether the object is the experience of the object, such as a patch of blue, or something else, having the nature of the object. This is the first alternative.

original: 'on te myong ba zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gnyis su byed de rigs mtshungs pa'i myong ba de nyid dam min zhes bya bar rigs mi mthun pa gzhan yin /
analyzed: 'on te myong ba zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gnyis su byed de rigs mtshungs pa'i myong ba de nyid dam min zhes bya bar rigs mi mthun pa gzhan yin /
translated: Or does the experience itself have two aspects, one that is similar to the type of experience and one that is not?

original: phyogs dang po la sun 'byen pa ni med pas de don gzhan du gyur pa'i khyab pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs dang po la sun 'byen pa ni med pas de don gzhan du gyur pa'i khyab pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The first position is refuted because it is not pervaded by the otherness of the object.

original: don med par 'gyur bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: don med par 'gyur bar mi rigs so //
translated: It is not tenable that it is meaningless.

original: de med pas na de med min //
analyzed: de med pas na de med min //
translated: Because it does not exist, it is not nonexistent.

original: zhes ji ltar brjod do //
analyzed: zhes ji ltar brjod do //
translated: How could it be said?üîΩIf you ask, ‚ÄúWhy is it not tenable that it is meaningless?‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bu med par ni rgyu zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na da ltar yang phyogs gnyis te /üîΩ'bras bu med na rgyur 'dod pa'i rang bzhin nyams pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bu med par ni rgyu zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na da ltar yang phyogs gnyis te / 'bras bu med na rgyur 'dod pa'i rang bzhin nyams pa'am /
translated: If the effect does not exist, the cause would not be a cause.üîΩThere are two positions:üîΩThe nature that is asserted to be the cause would be impaired if the effect does not exist.

original: rgyu'i tha snyad gnyis pa'i rgyu de byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba yin /
analyzed: rgyu'i tha snyad gnyis pa'i rgyu de byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba yin /
translated: Or, the cause would be devoid of the capacity to produce the effect.

original: de la phyogs dang po la brten nas bshad pa ni 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po la brten nas bshad pa ni 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation based on the first position is as follows:

original: rang gi ngo bos grub cing rtogs 'gyur ba ni gzhan med pas med pa zhes bya ba ni bab col yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos grub cing rtogs 'gyur ba ni gzhan med pas med pa zhes bya ba ni bab col yin no //
translated: Since there is no other way to be established and to be perceived, it is absurd to say that it is nonexistent.

original: gzhan med na ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan med na ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: If there is no other, it is the effect.

original: gzhan med par ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: gzhan med par ni rgyu'o //
translated: If there is no other, it is the cause.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bum pa med par yang snam bu med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bum pa med par yang snam bu med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Because of the absurd consequence that even without a pot, a cloth would exist.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i dbang du byas te grub pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i dbang du byas te grub pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: The establishment of the second alternative is stated.

original: gal te 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: If it is called an effect,

original: /'on gal te nus pa med kyang rang gi ngo bo med pa ma yin na /
analyzed: /'on gal te nus pa med kyang rang gi ngo bo med pa ma yin na /
translated: then if it does not exist without a cause,

original: nus pa nyid don gyi rang bzhin du ji ltar brjod de /
analyzed: nus pa nyid don gyi rang bzhin du ji ltar brjod de /
translated: how can you say that the cause is the essence of the effect?

original: des na 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: des na 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: Therefore, there is a contradiction.

original: mi 'gal te de nyid ci tsam gyi mthar thug pa yin zhes bya dpyod par rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'gal te de nyid ci tsam gyi mthar thug pa yin zhes bya dpyod par rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no contradiction, because we are just beginning to analyze what the limit of reality is.

original: de yang phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained later.

original: yang na phyi rol du smra ba la nus pa nyid yod pa yin te zhes rnam par 'jog pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na phyi rol du smra ba la nus pa nyid yod pa yin te zhes rnam par 'jog pa yin te /
translated: Or else, it is only the external object that is said to have the capacity.

original: bems po mngon par rlon pa tsam du yod pa ni bsal ba med pas na /
analyzed: bems po mngon par rlon pa tsam du yod pa ni bsal ba med pas na /
translated: Since the mere presence of an insentient object is not refuted,

original: gal te don bya bar nus pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te don bya bar nus pa med pa yin na /
translated: if it is not capable of performing a function,

original: skra la sogs par snang ba dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skra la sogs par snang ba dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it is no different from the appearance of hair and so on.

original: gang du phyi rol gnas par 'gyur //
analyzed: gang du phyi rol gnas par 'gyur //
translated: Where could the external object exist?

original: de'i phyir phyi rol la ltos nas ni nus pa @35b yod par brjod pa yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol la ltos nas ni nus pa @35b yod par brjod pa yin /
translated: Therefore, in dependence on the external object, the capacity is said to exist.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa la yang yod pas kho bo cag gi rnyed pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa la yang yod pas kho bo cag gi rnyed pa kho na yin no //
translated: Since that also exists for consciousness, it is only our position that is tenable.

original: des na gal te shes pa ni bsal ba nyid las yod par bsnyon du med pa yin mod kyi //
analyzed: des na gal te shes pa ni bsal ba nyid las yod par bsnyon du med pa yin mod kyi //
translated: Thus, if consciousness is not refuted as existing due to the object,

original: de lta na yang don gyis nus pa yang yod pa yin te des khyab par na skad cig ma dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs par grub pas yon tan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang don gyis nus pa yang yod pa yin te des khyab par na skad cig ma dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs par grub pas yon tan nyid yin no //
translated: then the capacity of the object also exists, and since it is pervaded by that, it is established as momentary, suffering, and so on, and it is a quality.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po gsal ba la skad cig ma nying ji ltar 'grub pa de ni phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po gsal ba la skad cig ma nying ji ltar 'grub pa de ni phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: How the momentariness of manifest entities, which are causes and effects, is established will be explained later.

original: 'dis ni phyogs dang po bsal nas gnyis pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis slong ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyogs dang po bsal nas gnyis pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis slong ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having refuted the first position, he raises the second alternative: ‚ÄúIf you say that the cognition is not real, then why is it that the cognition of a person with diseased vision does not occur in regard to the object that is seen?‚Äù

original: rab rib la sogs pa'i shes pa ni de rab tu ma zhi ba'i bar du rgyun du 'jug pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rab rib la sogs pa'i shes pa ni de rab tu ma zhi ba'i bar du rgyun du 'jug pa kho na'o //
translated: The cognition of a person with diseased vision occurs continuously as long as the disease is not cured.

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa rgyun cung zad 'jug pa yin gyi skad cig gcig nyid 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa rgyun cung zad 'jug pa yin gyi skad cig gcig nyid 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The cognition in a dream occurs for a short time, but it does not occur for a single moment.

original: rgyun cung zad 'jug pa ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes kyang nges par bya mi nus te /
analyzed: rgyun cung zad 'jug pa ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes kyang nges par bya mi nus te /
translated: Nor can it be ascertained that it does not occur for a short time.

original: glog gi shes pa bden pa'i yul can du 'dod pa yang /
analyzed: glog gi shes pa bden pa'i yul can du 'dod pa yang /
translated: The cognition of lightning is accepted as having a real object.

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa'i dus su rjes su 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa'i dus su rjes su 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not related to the time of the cognition in a dream.

original: glog gi thun mong yin no zhe na /
analyzed: glog gi thun mong yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the cognition of lightning is common to all,

original: rab rib can gyi tshogs la zla ba gnyis kyang thun mong kho na'o //
analyzed: rab rib can gyi tshogs la zla ba gnyis kyang thun mong kho na'o //
translated: then the two moons are also common to all those who have diseased vision.

original: der ni thun mong lhag par zhen pa tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: der ni thun mong lhag par zhen pa tsam yin gyi /
translated: There, it is merely the common and uncommon adherence.

original: shes pa'i rnam par dngos po ni thun mong ma yin pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam par dngos po ni thun mong ma yin pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: But the form of consciousness is only uncommon.

original: gzhan du de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba la ni rtag tu dngos po la reg pa tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba la ni rtag tu dngos po la reg pa tshad ma yin no //
translated: In other cases, it is not so. That which always touches the object is valid knowledge.

original: de'i phyir de'i rigs can gyi shes pa skye ba don dam pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rigs can gyi shes pa skye ba don dam pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the arising of a consciousness of that type is not ultimate.

original: rnam par rtog pa tha ma brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa tha ma brjod pa ni /
translated: The final conceptualization is stated:üîΩIf it is said that it is the consciousness of contact, etc.,

original: ci ste reg pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ste don bya zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: ci ste reg pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ste don bya zhes 'brel to //
translated: then the object is to be done.

original: de yang mi bden te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sun 'byin pa ste go bar sla'o //
analyzed: de yang mi bden te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sun 'byin pa ste go bar sla'o //
translated: That is also not true, etc. The refutation is easy to understand.

original: de 'di snyam du rang nyid 'ol ma se'i phung por the tshom za ba'i me ni du ba gzhan mthong bas yod par ji ltar mi 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du rang nyid 'ol ma se'i phung por the tshom za ba'i me ni du ba gzhan mthong bas yod par ji ltar mi 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If one thinks this: ‚ÄúThe fire that is doubted in the smoky range is seen elsewhere in the smoke. How could it not exist?‚Äù

original: gzugs rang nyid myong ba yang ngo gzhan myong ba la ni reg bya myong ba la'o //
analyzed: gzugs rang nyid myong ba yang ngo gzhan myong ba la ni reg bya myong ba la'o //
translated: The form itself is experienced, but the experience of the other is experienced by the tactile faculty.

original: mi la ni phyis the tshom za na mngon sum nyid de des na de'i du ba la ltos par rigs kyi the tshom med na ni gal te rang myong ba yang yid ches pa med na gzhan myong ba la smos su ci yod de /
analyzed: mi la ni phyis the tshom za na mngon sum nyid de des na de'i du ba la ltos par rigs kyi the tshom med na ni gal te rang myong ba yang yid ches pa med na gzhan myong ba la smos su ci yod de /
translated: If one doubts the fire, then it is not direct perception. Therefore, it is reasonable to rely on the smoke, but if there is no doubt, then if one does not trust one‚Äôs own experience, what can be said of the experience of others?

original: du ba brgya myong yang ngo //
analyzed: du ba brgya myong yang ngo //
translated: Even if one experiences a hundred fires, one may doubt smoke.

original: de myong ba khyab pa 'dzin pa la mos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de myong ba khyab pa 'dzin pa la mos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is not convinced of the pervasion that the experience of smoke entails.

original: yang na gal te mngon sum gyi me la yang yid mi ches na du ba yang mngon sum kho na yin pas yid ches pa kho na'o //
analyzed: yang na gal te mngon sum gyi me la yang yid mi ches na du ba yang mngon sum kho na yin pas yid ches pa kho na'o //
translated: Or, if one does not trust the fire that is directly perceived, then smoke is also just direct perception and therefore is trustworthy.

original: de'i phyir rigs pa mtshungs pa nyid kyis rang myong ba @36a * //üîΩla yang yid ches na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs pa mtshungs pa nyid kyis rang myong ba @36a * // la yang yid ches na /
translated: Therefore, by the same reasoning, if one trusts one‚Äôs own experience,

original: gzhan gyi myong ba la yang ste shes pa la smos su ci yod /
analyzed: gzhan gyi myong ba la yang ste shes pa la smos su ci yod /
translated: then one should also trust the experience of others. What can be said of consciousness?

original: gzugs snang ba la the tshom mi za ste grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs snang ba la the tshom mi za ste grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One does not doubt the appearance of form, because it is established.

original: gzhan ni ma dmigs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on te gzugs kyi phyi mthong ba las reg pa dang lhan cig rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba the tshom gyi yul yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma dmigs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro // 'on te gzugs kyi phyi mthong ba las reg pa dang lhan cig rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba the tshom gyi yul yin zhe na /
translated: The other is not perceived, because it is excluded.üîΩIf you say that the future form is the object of doubt, because it is perceived after the contact,

original: de lta na yang khyad par rnam par gzhag pa reg pa las yin gyi gzugs de nyid yod par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang khyad par rnam par gzhag pa reg pa las yin gyi gzugs de nyid yod par ni ma yin no //
translated: then the distinction of the object of doubt is established on the basis of contact, not on the basis of the existence of form.

original: reg bya dang lhan cig yod pa'i gzugs 'di la gzugs su brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: reg bya dang lhan cig yod pa'i gzugs 'di la gzugs su brjod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the form that exists with the tangible is called form,

original: re zhig snang ba ni bsnyon par mi nus so //
analyzed: re zhig snang ba ni bsnyon par mi nus so //
translated: then the appearance of form cannot be denied.

original: gal te gzugs so zhes bya ba mi brjod pa de tsam gyis de de nyid la nyams par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gal te gzugs so zhes bya ba mi brjod pa de tsam gyis de de nyid la nyams par 'gyur ram /
translated: If you say that the form is not called form, then it is not form.

original: de lta ma yin na shes pa'i rnam pa nyid la gzugs su brjod do zhes smra bar nus so //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na shes pa'i rnam pa nyid la gzugs su brjod do zhes smra bar nus so //
translated: If you do not accept that, then you can say that the aspect of consciousness is called form.

original: de'i phyir reg pa'i shes pa med kyang gzugs las nyams pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir reg pa'i shes pa med kyang gzugs las nyams pa med do //
translated: Therefore, even without the consciousness of contact, form is not lost.

original: de lhan cig spyod pa'i spyi yod pa ni reg pa'i shes pa las 'grub pa'am /
analyzed: de lhan cig spyod pa'i spyi yod pa ni reg pa'i shes pa las 'grub pa'am /
translated: The existence of the universal that accompanies form is established from the consciousness of contact.

original: yang na de las de yang yod par mi 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: yang na de las de yang yod par mi 'grub pa'o //
translated: Or, that is not established as existing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de myong la yang ste reg pa myong ba la yang mi bden par te /
analyzed: de myong la yang ste reg pa myong ba la yang mi bden par te /
translated: Even in the experience of that, i.e., in the experience of contact, form is not true.

original: mi bden pa'i yul can nyid du dogs par ji ltar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi bden pa'i yul can nyid du dogs par ji ltar mi 'gyur te /
translated: How could there not be doubt that the object is not true?

original: reg pa yod pas rang dang lhan cig spyod pa'i gzugs bden par rtogs par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: reg pa yod pas rang dang lhan cig spyod pa'i gzugs bden par rtogs par bya ba yin na /
translated: If form is to be understood as true because of the existence of contact,

original: reg pa de yang yod par da rung ma grub pa'i phyir gzhan gyi sgrub par byed par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: reg pa de yang yod par da rung ma grub pa'i phyir gzhan gyi sgrub par byed par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could that contact, which has not yet been established as existing, be the proof of that?

original: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni lus kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni lus kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The clarification of that is ‚Äúthe body, etc.‚Äù

original: yang na reg pa de myong ba la yang gzugs mi bden par dogs par ji ltar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na reg pa de myong ba la yang gzugs mi bden par dogs par ji ltar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Or, how could there not be doubt that form is not true even in the experience of that contact?

original: dogs par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: dogs par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: There would certainly be doubt.

original: reg pa myong ba bden na yul can du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg pa myong ba bden na yul can du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the experience of contact is not established as the subject.

original: mig gi yul la dogs pa 'dir 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mig gi yul la dogs pa 'dir 'gyur gyi /
translated: This doubt would occur regarding the object of the eye,

original: reg pa la ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: reg pa la ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but not regarding contact.

original: lus kyi myong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi myong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBodily experience.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa /
translated: The opponent says:

original: gal te reg pa myong bar 'gyur ba der ni de don yin no zhes tshim pa'am yang dogs pa ste des byas pas tshim pa ste /
analyzed: gal te reg pa myong bar 'gyur ba der ni de don yin no zhes tshim pa'am yang dogs pa ste des byas pas tshim pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIf the experience of contact is the purpose of the body, then the body is satisfied by that. ‚Äù

original: des na khyad par yod do zhe na /
analyzed: des na khyad par yod do zhe na /
translated: The opponent says: ‚ÄúThere is a difference. ‚Äù

original: rgol bas smras pa ni yongs su tshim pa de ga las zhes bya ba ste ;
analyzed: rgol bas smras pa ni yongs su tshim pa de ga las zhes bya ba ste ;
translated: The opponent says: ‚ÄúWhere does this satisfaction come from? ‚Äù

original: gcig tu 'gyur ba gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba las yin te /
analyzed: gcig tu 'gyur ba gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba las yin te /
translated: The opponent says: ‚ÄúIt comes from the contact that produces satisfaction, not from the other kinds of contact. ‚Äù

original: ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: The opponent says: ‚ÄúNo, it does not. ‚Äù

original: byis pa bzhin du ma dpyad par yongs su tshim pa ni 'dir brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: byis pa bzhin du ma dpyad par yongs su tshim pa ni 'dir brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The satisfaction that is not analyzed, like the satisfaction of a child, is not what is being discussed here.

original: rnam par brjod pa la ni gnyi ga yang don du snang bar mtshungs so //
analyzed: rnam par brjod pa la ni gnyi ga yang don du snang bar mtshungs so //
translated: In the case of verbal expression, both the body and the contact appear to be the same in being the object.

original: dgos pa'i phyogs la ni yang ji ltar mthong ba 'ga' @36b zhig la reg pa'i 'bras bu'i mthar thug pa med pa de bzhin du reg pa 'ga' zhig la yang mthong ba yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir mtshungs so //
analyzed: dgos pa'i phyogs la ni yang ji ltar mthong ba 'ga' @36b zhig la reg pa'i 'bras bu'i mthar thug pa med pa de bzhin du reg pa 'ga' zhig la yang mthong ba yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir mtshungs so //
translated: In the case of the purpose, the contact that is the cause of satisfaction is not seen to be the ultimate result of the body, just as the body is not seen to be the ultimate result of some contact. Therefore, they are the same.

original: dbang po'i sgo nas khyad par yod pa yin no zhes rnam par 'grel pa bshad pa ni ji ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i sgo nas khyad par yod pa yin no zhes rnam par 'grel pa bshad pa ni ji ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The commentary explains that there is a difference in terms of the sense faculty.

original: gal te mig la rab rib la sogs pa yod pa ltar reg par byed pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te mig la rab rib la sogs pa yod pa ltar reg par byed pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: Just as the eye is affected by cataracts, etc., the tactile faculty is not.

original: des na mtshungs pa ji ltar rtogs snyam na /
analyzed: des na mtshungs pa ji ltar rtogs snyam na /
translated: So how can they be similar?

original: rab rib la sogs pas zhes sogs pa'i sgras bsdus pa nyid 'chad pa ni mkhris pa'i rims kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab rib la sogs pas zhes sogs pa'i sgras bsdus pa nyid 'chad pa ni mkhris pa'i rims kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The commentary explains the phrase ‚Äúby cataracts, etc.‚Äù

original: des na mig dang lus kyi myong ba gnyis la khyad par ci yang med do //
analyzed: des na mig dang lus kyi myong ba gnyis la khyad par ci yang med do //
translated: Thus there is no difference at all between the two experiences of the eye and the body.

original: gal te don der tshim zhe na zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni yongs su tshim pa'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te don der tshim zhe na zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni yongs su tshim pa'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The commentary explains the phrase ‚Äúif you claim that the object satisfies‚Äù as ‚Äúif you claim that it satisfies completely.‚Äù

original: khyad par yod do zhes bya ba bsams ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par yod do zhes bya ba bsams ba'o //
translated: The point is that there is a difference.

original: lam gyi grang ba'i dus su zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lam gyi grang ba'i dus su zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúat the time of the cold wind‚Äù is clear.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni nyes pa gzhan sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni nyes pa gzhan sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúanother problem‚Äù refers to another fault.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par rtog pa dang po la ni don med pa nyid bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par rtog pa dang po la ni don med pa nyid bshad pa'o //
translated: The first alternative is explained by ‚ÄúIf‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa la ni phyed phyi mas bstan pa'i nus pa med pa nyid myong bas grub pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas bcad do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa la ni phyed phyi mas bstan pa'i nus pa med pa nyid myong bas grub pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas bcad do //
translated: The second alternative is explained by the second half of the verse, beginning ‚ÄúThat which is established by experience.‚Äù

original: 'dir yang gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel pa ni myong ba las tha dad yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel pa ni myong ba las tha dad yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the commentary on ‚Äúother‚Äù and so on is ‚Äúbecause it is different from experience‚Äù and so on.

original: yongs su tshab myong ba'i bdag nyid yin na ni lhag par cung zad kyang ma brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su tshab myong ba'i bdag nyid yin na ni lhag par cung zad kyang ma brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were the nature of the experience, then nothing would be added by the statement.

original: des na gzhan gyis yongs su tshim par de las gzhan kho nar khas blangs dgos so //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyis yongs su tshim par de las gzhan kho nar khas blangs dgos so //
translated: Therefore, it must be accepted that the other is completely satisfied by that other.

original: de yang ci dgos dris pa na gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed do zhes smras te dgos so zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de yang ci dgos dris pa na gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed do zhes smras te dgos so zhes 'brel to //
translated: When asked what is the use of that, it is said that it is for the sake of accomplishing the aims of others.

original: lam du ji ltar gzhan gyis gzhan 'grub ces gsungs so //
analyzed: lam du ji ltar gzhan gyis gzhan 'grub ces gsungs so //
translated: How can one thing be established by another?

original: ji ltar yongs su tshim pa gzhan don gzhan gyi grub pa'i rang bzhin nam grub pa'i rang bzhin ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su tshim pa gzhan don gzhan gyi grub pa'i rang bzhin nam grub pa'i rang bzhin ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How can the nature of satisfaction be established by something else?

original: rigs pa ni rang nyid grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na tshad ma'i 'bras bu rnam par gnas pa'i sgrub par byed pa yang yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa ni rang nyid grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na tshad ma'i 'bras bu rnam par gnas pa'i sgrub par byed pa yang yin no //
translated: If a reason is established by its own nature, then it is a valid means of knowledge, and the result of a valid means of knowledge is the establishment of something that was not previously established.

original: tha dad pa med par smra ba la ni gzhal bya yang de nyid yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa med par smra ba la ni gzhal bya yang de nyid yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intended meaning is that for those who assert that there is no difference between the object of comprehension and the means of comprehension, the object of comprehension is also that.

original: 'o na yongs su tshim pa yang dngos po med na mi 'byung bas de'i grub par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na yongs su tshim pa yang dngos po med na mi 'byung bas de'i grub par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If satisfaction does not occur without a thing, then it would be the establishment of that.

original: 'di ltar rigs pa yang dngos po dang med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyis de ltar 'gyur ba yin no snyam du dogs pa ni 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rigs pa yang dngos po dang med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyis de ltar 'gyur ba yin no snyam du dogs pa ni 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The doubt is that a reason would be like that because of the non-difference of the thing and the reason.

original: lan ni @37a * //
analyzed: lan ni @37a * //
translated: The answer is:

original: 'brel pa gang gis 'grub ces bya ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa gang gis 'grub ces bya ste /
translated: By what connection is it established?

original: yongs su tshim pa'am rigs pa las yin zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su tshim pa'am rigs pa las yin zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: Or is it from the satisfaction of the reason?

original: phyogs dang po'i dogs pa bsu nas yongs su tshim pa de'i 'brel pa gang yongs su tshim pa gzhan las yin no zhes thug pa med pa nyid gsal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs dang po'i dogs pa bsu nas yongs su tshim pa de'i 'brel pa gang yongs su tshim pa gzhan las yin no zhes thug pa med pa nyid gsal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: The connection of that satisfaction is from another satisfaction. Thus, he shows that there is an infinite regress.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la yongs su tshim pa med par myong ba nyid don dang 'brel pa'i grub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la yongs su tshim pa med par myong ba nyid don dang 'brel pa'i grub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In the second case, since the establishment of the connection of the object with the experience is not satisfied,

original: myong ba'i nus pa la gegs byed pa su byed //
analyzed: myong ba'i nus pa la gegs byed pa su byed //
translated: who is the one who obstructs the potency of the experience?

original: des na yongs su tshim pa dang po la don med do //
analyzed: des na yongs su tshim pa dang po la don med do //
translated: Therefore, the first satisfaction is meaningless.

original: de lta yin mong snyam na /
analyzed: de lta yin mong snyam na /
translated: If you think that is so,

original: de la yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: de la yang zhes smos so //
translated: then he says, ‚ÄúIn that case, too . . .‚Äù

original: de gang yang yin snyam na gal te nyams su myong ba las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de gang yang yin snyam na gal te nyams su myong ba las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that is also not so, then he says, ‚ÄúIf it is from experience . . .‚Äù

original: sngar nyams su myong ba las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngar nyams su myong ba las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom previous experience‚Äù means

original: gzugs rig pa las so //
analyzed: gzugs rig pa las so //
translated: from the awareness of form.

original: des na 'khrul pa dang / ma 'khrul pa khyad par med do zhes bya bar 'grub po //
analyzed: des na 'khrul pa dang / ma 'khrul pa khyad par med do zhes bya bar 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that there is no difference between error and nonerror.

original: gal te 'khrul pa la yang yod pa'i phyir yongs su tshim pa nyid de sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //üîΩyongs su tshim pa ma yin pa'i rgyu sprul la sogs pa dngos po med pa yang ma yin mod kyi /üîΩ'on kyang don sgrub par byed pa ni lhag par mos pa yin no //üîΩji srid du 'di ni don nyid do snyam du lhag par zhen ba brtan pa de thams cad ni don nyid yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'khrul pa la yang yod pa'i phyir yongs su tshim pa nyid de sgrub par byed pa ma yin no // yongs su tshim pa ma yin pa'i rgyu sprul la sogs pa dngos po med pa yang ma yin mod kyi / 'on kyang don sgrub par byed pa ni lhag par mos pa yin no // ji srid du 'di ni don nyid do snyam du lhag par zhen ba brtan pa de thams cad ni don nyid yin la /
translated: If it is not established by the existence of error, then it is not established by satisfaction.üîΩThe cause of non-satisfaction is not a non-entity such as a magical creation, etc.üîΩHowever, the establishment of the object is due to the conviction.üîΩAs long as there is a firm conviction that this is the object, it is the object.üîΩ

original: de ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par la ltos nas phan pa dang gnod pa dang / gnyi ga ma yin par sgrub par byed pa thams cad la mthong ba yin no //üîΩdes na 'di la yongs su tshim pa'am /üîΩdon myong bas ci zhig bya snyam na 'di ni zhes gsungs so //üîΩmos par myong ba las gzhan nam gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtogs par sla'o //üîΩ'on te myong ba ni spyi yin la /
analyzed: de ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par la ltos nas phan pa dang gnod pa dang / gnyi ga ma yin par sgrub par byed pa thams cad la mthong ba yin no //üîΩdes na 'di la yongs su tshim pa'am /üîΩdon myong bas ci zhig bya snyam na 'di ni zhes gsungs so //üîΩmos par myong ba las gzhan nam gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtogs par sla'o //üîΩ'on te myong ba ni spyi yin la /

original: lhag par zhen pa brtan pa'i mos pa ni khyad par gyi rang bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: lhag par zhen pa brtan pa'i mos pa ni khyad par gyi rang bzhin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the nature of stability is the special kind of conviction that is firm adherence,

original: rang gi rang bzhin myong ba las ma gtogs pa'i brtan pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig g-yo ba med pa'o zhe na g-yo ba yang rang gi ngo bo rig pa las gzhan ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin myong ba las ma gtogs pa'i brtan pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig g-yo ba med pa'o zhe na g-yo ba yang rang gi ngo bo rig pa las gzhan ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: what is this so-called stability apart from the experience of its own nature? If you say that it is immobility, is not mobility itself the awareness of its own nature?

original: de yang re zhig snga ma'i ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang re zhig snga ma'i ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not the former,

original: de la ni rang gi ngo bo'i rig pa las rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ni rang gi ngo bo'i rig pa las rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no aspect of it other than the awareness of its own nature.

original: phyi ma'i yang de yang rang gi yul 'dzin pa las nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi ma'i yang de yang rang gi yul 'dzin pa las nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it the latter, because it does not deviate from the apprehension of its own object.

original: 'di g-yos kyang snga ma las cis yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di g-yos kyang snga ma las cis yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if it moves, it is not different from the former.

original: phyis gzhan du rig pa na de la g-yo ba nyid du 'jog na /
analyzed: phyis gzhan du rig pa na de la g-yo ba nyid du 'jog na /
translated: If you posit mobility in it when it is aware of something else later,

original: snga mas gzhan du rig pas phyi ma yang de ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: snga mas gzhan du rig pas phyi ma yang de ltar 'gyur /
translated: then the former would be the same as the latter, because it is aware of something else.

original: 'khrul @37b ba dang ma 'khrul pa dag rim gyis 'byung ba'i nges pa yang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khrul @37b ba dang ma 'khrul pa dag rim gyis 'byung ba'i nges pa yang med pa'i phyir /
translated: And there is no certainty that the confused and the unconfused occur in sequence.

original: phyis rab rib can du gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: phyis rab rib can du gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: like one who later becomes myopic.

original: 'dis ni gnod par bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa'i dngos po skabs su byed pa yang gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni gnod par bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa'i dngos po skabs su byed pa yang gsal ba yin no //
translated: This also clarifies the point that the object of harm and the agent of harm are not tenable.

original: rgyas par ni le'u dang por bshad zin pa'i phyir na re zhig gzhag go //
analyzed: rgyas par ni le'u dang por bshad zin pa'i phyir na re zhig gzhag go //
translated: Since this has already been explained extensively in the first chapter, we will leave it for now.

original: des rnam pa 'di lta bu dag la ni lhag par mos pa la brten /
analyzed: des rnam pa 'di lta bu dag la ni lhag par mos pa la brten /
translated: In this way, one should rely on imagination with regard to such things.

original: gzhan mad kyang des yang dpyad pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan mad kyang des yang dpyad pa yin no //
translated: Even if others disagree, one should still investigate.

original: gzhan yang rang gi ngo bo mngon sum du byed pa'i myong ba ni g-yo ba yin la don gyis stong pa'i rnam par rtog pa lhag par mos pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la su zhig dad par byed de ;
analyzed: gzhan yang rang gi ngo bo mngon sum du byed pa'i myong ba ni g-yo ba yin la don gyis stong pa'i rnam par rtog pa lhag par mos pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la su zhig dad par byed de ;
translated: Moreover, who would believe that the experience of making one‚Äôs own nature manifest is movement, but that the imagination of conceptual thought that is empty of an object is not expressed by the word?

original: tshad mas bsal ba'i bdag la sogs pa la yang lhag par mos pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mas bsal ba'i bdag la sogs pa la yang lhag par mos pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible that one could imagine the existence of a self, etc., even though it has been refuted by a valid cognition.

original: de'i phyir mos pa nyid don thams cad kyis sgrub par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir mos pa nyid don thams cad kyis sgrub par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, imagination itself establishes all objects.

original: yongs su tshim pa la sogs pa gzhan gyi ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rig par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su tshim pa la sogs pa gzhan gyi ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rig par brjod pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the rest of the passage is self-evident.

original: yang na myong ba kun don gyis sgrub par byed pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: yang na myong ba kun don gyis sgrub par byed pa kho na yin te /
translated: Or else, the meaning is that the experience of the object is the only thing that is established,

original: gzhan 'gas kyang gnod pa 'am phan 'dogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan 'gas kyang gnod pa 'am phan 'dogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and that neither the object nor the experience of the object is established by anything else.

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'khrul pa dang ma 'khrul pa'i thun mong du gyur pa rnam par rtog pa'i khyad par gyi bdag nyid kyang ma 'khrul par sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'khrul pa dang ma 'khrul pa'i thun mong du gyur pa rnam par rtog pa'i khyad par gyi bdag nyid kyang ma 'khrul par sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: As for the passage beginning ‚ÄúAnd even the specific conceptualization,‚Äù it shows that even the specific conceptualization, which is common to both error and non-error, is not a means of establishing non-error.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the passage beginning ‚ÄúMoreover, if the object . . .‚Äù is as follows.

original: gang gis de dag nyid don rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin la myong ba ni bya ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis de dag nyid don rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin la myong ba ni bya ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the object is not different from the experience of the object, the experience of the object is not established.

original: don myong ba la sngar ni 'dod pa la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no /
analyzed: don myong ba la sngar ni 'dod pa la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no /
translated: Desire and so on do not exist prior to the experience of the object.

original: 'on kyang myong bas don gnas par byas la de dag skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang myong bas don gnas par byas la de dag skye ba yin no //
translated: But the object is made to endure by the experience, and then they arise.

original: gang yang slob dpon chos mchog gis phyi rol gyi don yod par grub par rgyun gyis 'jug pa'i don byed par ma 'khrul pa'i grub byed du bstan pa de yang 'di nyid kyis gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: gang yang slob dpon chos mchog gis phyi rol gyi don yod par grub par rgyun gyis 'jug pa'i don byed par ma 'khrul pa'i grub byed du bstan pa de yang 'di nyid kyis gsal ba yin te /
translated: Also, this very argument clarifies what the master Dharmottara taught as the proof that external objects exist, namely, that they are not mistaken with regard to the performance of a function that is continuous.

original: don bya ba ci don gyi bdag nyid yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gsum bsal bas na don byed pa lhag par mos pa tsam du gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don bya ba ci don gyi bdag nyid yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gsum bsal bas na don byed pa lhag par mos pa tsam du gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the three alternatives, ‚ÄúIs the object of the action the nature of the object itself?‚Äù and so on, are eliminated, the performance of a function remains as mere belief.

original: de ltar dmigs pa med pa'i shes pa dang khyad par byed pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa med pa'i shes pa dang khyad par byed pa kho na yin no //
translated: Thus, it is the very thing that distinguishes it from non-objective consciousness.

original: med med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'ga' zhig dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: med med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'ga' zhig dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs bzlog pa yin no //
translated: Because of the nonexistence of nonexistence, the position that some consciousnesses have objects is refuted.

original: da ni gzhan dag rnam par shes pa thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes smras pa ni @38a * //
analyzed: da ni gzhan dag rnam par shes pa thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes smras pa ni @38a * //
translated: Now, others say that all consciousnesses have objects.

original: ci ste yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ste yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù means ‚Äúeven if.‚Äù

original: de nyid rgol ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni tshad ma dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid rgol ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni tshad ma dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The objection is anticipated: ‚ÄúValidity is . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe reply is: ‚ÄúThe world . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe objection: ‚ÄúHow is this distinction known?‚ÄùüîΩThe reply: ‚ÄúBecause the world . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe objection: ‚ÄúHow can it be that all cognitions have objects, and yet the distinction is made that some are valid cognitions and some are not?‚Äù

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The reply: ‚ÄúBecause the world . . . ‚Äù

original: rnam par dbye ba 'di ni ci ltar shes zhes bya ba'i rgol ba'i'o //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba 'di ni ci ltar shes zhes bya ba'i rgol ba'i'o //
translated: The objection: ‚ÄúHow can it be that all cognitions have objects, and yet the distinction is made that some are valid cognitions and some are not?‚ÄùüîΩThe reply: ‚ÄúBecause the world . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe objection: ‚ÄúHow can it be that all cognitions have objects, and yet the distinction is made that some are valid cognitions and some are not?‚Äù

original: gang las 'jig rten pa'i don gyi yul can ni tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: gang las 'jig rten pa'i don gyi yul can ni tshad ma yin la /
translated: The reply: ‚ÄúBecause the world . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe objection: ‚ÄúHow can it be that all cognitions have objects, and yet the distinction is made that some are valid cognitions and some are not?‚Äù

original: gzhan ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes nges par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gzhan ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes nges par 'gyur ba /
translated: The reply: ‚ÄúBecause the world . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe objection: ‚ÄúHow can it be that all cognitions have objects, and yet the distinction is made that some are valid cognitions and some are not?‚ÄùüîΩThe reply: ‚ÄúBecause the world . . . ‚Äù

original: thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid la 'di ni 'jig rten pa la yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba 'di ji ltar 'gyur /üîΩgzhan gyi gnod byed cig shos dang bcas 'brel phyir zhes smras so //

translated: The reply: ‚ÄúBecause the world . . . ‚Äù

original: smig rgyu'i tshogs thob pa'i mtshan nyid chur sgro 'dogs pa la gnod par byed pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de nyid gnod par byed pa ga las yin na de bzhin du gcig shes pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: smig rgyu'i tshogs thob pa'i mtshan nyid chur sgro 'dogs pa la gnod par byed pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de nyid gnod par byed pa ga las yin na de bzhin du gcig shes pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Just as the cognition that invalidates the superimposition of water in the characteristics of a mirage is itself the invalidator, so it is in the case of the cognition of one.

original: de la gal te gnod byed cig shos yod pa las so zhe na de'i tshe thug pa med do //
analyzed: de la gal te gnod byed cig shos yod pa las so zhe na de'i tshe thug pa med do //
translated: If you say that it is because of the existence of another invalidator, then there is an infinite regress.

original: ji ltar sgrub par byed par rigs mthun pa 'am mi mthun pa'i sgrub par byed pa gzhan la ltos nas sgrub par byed pa nyid du nges par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar sgrub par byed par rigs mthun pa 'am mi mthun pa'i sgrub par byed pa gzhan la ltos nas sgrub par byed pa nyid du nges par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a proof is ascertained as a proof in dependence on another proof that is either of the same type or of a different type,

original: gnod par byed pa yang rigs mthun pa'am mi mthun pa'i gnod par byed pa gzhan la ltos nas gnod par byed pa yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa yang rigs mthun pa'am mi mthun pa'i gnod par byed pa gzhan la ltos nas gnod par byed pa yin par 'gyur la /
translated: so too, an invalidation is an invalidation in dependence on another invalidation that is either of the same type or of a different type.

original: de yang de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa dang gnod par byed pa gzhan la ltos nas de 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa dang gnod par byed pa gzhan la ltos nas de 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And that is also like that in dependence on another proof and invalidation.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dang gzhan la ltos pa na mthar thug pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dang gzhan la ltos pa na mthar thug pa med do //
translated: Likewise, in dependence on other and other, there is no final end.

original: don bya ba snang bas kyang mthar thug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don bya ba snang bas kyang mthar thug pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there a final end due to the appearance of objects,üîΩbecause there is the appearance of objects not of the world.

original: de la yang 'jig rten pa ma yin pa'i don snang ba mthong ba'i phyir ji ltar the tshom ldog / des na gal te lhag par mos pa tsam la mi brten na de'i tshe sgrub par byed pa dang / gnod par byed pa gzhan tshol bas thug pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de la yang 'jig rten pa ma yin pa'i don snang ba mthong ba'i phyir ji ltar the tshom ldog / des na gal te lhag par mos pa tsam la mi brten na de'i tshe sgrub par byed pa dang / gnod par byed pa gzhan tshol bas thug pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus, if one does not rely on mere conviction, then, in seeking other proofs and refutations, there is an infinite regress.

original: da ni thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis 'jig rten dang cig shos gnas par byed pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: da ni thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis 'jig rten dang cig shos gnas par byed pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Now, in order to dispel the doubt that the world and the one beyond the world are established by the common and uncommon, he says:

original: gal te thun mong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te thun mong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is common, it is not a means of valid cognition.

original: sun 'byin par ni thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa dag rig pa ste /
analyzed: sun 'byin par ni thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa dag rig pa ste /
translated: Refutation is by means of the common and uncommon.
